Hebrew: <big>אָ</big>דָ֥ם שֵׁ֖ת אֱנֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated: Adam, Seth, Enosh;
Transliteration: <big>a</big>dam shet envosh

Hebrew: קֵינָ֥ן מַהֲלַלְאֵ֖ל יָֽרֶד׃
Translated: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared;
Transliteration: keynan mahalaleel yared

Hebrew: חֲנ֥וֹךְ מְתוּשֶׁ֖לַח לָֽמֶךְ׃
Translated: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech;
Transliteration: chanvokhe metushelach lamekhe

Hebrew: נֹ֥חַ שֵׁ֖ם חָ֥ם וָיָֽפֶת׃ {ס}
Translated: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
Transliteration: nocha shem cham vayafet {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י יֶ֔פֶת גֹּ֣מֶר וּמָג֔וֹג וּמָדַ֖י וְיָוָ֣ן וְתֻבָ֑ל וּמֶ֖שֶׁךְ וְתִירָֽס׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
Transliteration: veney yefet gomer umagvog umaday veyavan vetuval umeshekhe vetiyras {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י גֹּ֑מֶר אַשְׁכְּנַ֥ז וְדִיפַ֖ת וְתוֹגַרְמָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Diphath, and Togarmah.
Transliteration: uveney gomer ashekhenaz vediyfat vetvogaremah {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י יָוָ֖ן אֱלִישָׁ֣ה וְתַרְשִׁ֑ישָׁה כִּתִּ֖ים וְרוֹדָנִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.
Transliteration: uveney yavan eliyshah vetareshiyshah khitiym vervodaniym {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י חָ֑ם כּ֥וּשׁ וּמִצְרַ֖יִם פּ֥וּט וּכְנָֽעַן׃
Translated: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
Transliteration: veney cham khush umitserayiim fut ukhenaan

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י כ֔וּשׁ סְבָא֙ וַֽחֲוִילָ֔ה וְסַבְתָּ֥א וְרַעְמָ֖א וְסַבְתְּכָ֑א וּבְנֵ֥י רַעְמָ֖א שְׁבָ֥א וּדְדָֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raama, and Sabteca. The sons of Raama: Sheba and Dedan.
Transliteration: uveney khush seva vachaviylah vesaveta veraema vesavetekha uveney raema sheva udedan {s}

Hebrew: וְכ֖וּשׁ יָלַ֣ד אֶת־נִמְר֑וֹד ה֣וּא הֵחֵ֔ל לִֽהְי֥וֹת גִּבּ֖וֹר בָּאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated: Cush begot Nimrod; he was the first mighty one on earth.
Transliteration: vekhush yalad et-nimervod hu hechel liheyvot givvor vaarets {s}

Hebrew: וּמִצְרַ֡יִם יָלַ֞ד אֶת־[לוּדִ֧ים] (לודיים) וְאֶת־עֲנָמִ֛ים וְאֶת־לְהָבִ֖ים וְאֶת־נַפְתֻּחִֽים׃
Translated: Mizraim begot the Ludim, the Anamim, the Lehabim, the Naphtuhim,
Transliteration: umitserayiim yalad et-[ludiym] (lvdyym) veet-anamiym veet-lehaviym veet-nafetuchiym

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־פַּתְרֻסִ֞ים וְאֶת־כַּסְלֻחִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצְא֥וּ מִשָּׁ֛ם פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים וְאֶת־כַּפְתֹּרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: the Pathrusim, the Casluhim (whence the Philistines came forth), and the Caphtorim.
Transliteration: veet-faterusiym veet-khaseluchiym asher yatseu misham felishetiym veet-khafetoriym {s}

Hebrew: וּכְנַ֗עַן יָלַ֛ד אֶת־צִיד֥וֹן בְּכֹר֖וֹ וְאֶת־חֵֽת׃
Translated: Canaan begot Sidon his first-born, and Heth,
Transliteration: ukhenaan yalad et-tsiydvon vekhorvo veet-chet

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַיְבוּסִי֙ וְאֶת־הָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י וְאֵ֖ת הַגִּרְגָּשִֽׁי׃
Translated: and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
Transliteration: veet-hayevusiy veet-haemoriy veet hagiregashiy

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַחִוִּ֥י וְאֶת־הַעַרְקִ֖י וְאֶת־הַסִּינִֽי׃
Translated: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
Transliteration: veet-hachiviy veet-haarekiy veet-hasiyniy

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאַרְוָדִ֥י וְאֶת־הַצְּמָרִ֖י וְאֶת־הַחֲמָתִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.
Transliteration: veet-haarevadiy veet-hatsemariy veet-hachamatiy {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י שֵׁ֔ם עֵילָ֣ם וְאַשּׁ֔וּר וְאַרְפַּכְשַׁ֖ד וְל֣וּד וַאֲרָ֑ם וְע֥וּץ וְח֖וּל וְגֶ֥תֶר וָמֶֽשֶׁךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, Aram, Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshech.
Transliteration: veney shem eylam veashur vearefakheshad velud vaaram veuts vechul vegeter vameshekhe {s}

Hebrew: וְאַרְפַּכְשַׁ֖ד יָלַ֣ד אֶת־שָׁ֑לַח וְשֶׁ֖לַח יָלַ֥ד אֶת־עֵֽבֶר׃
Translated: Arpachshad begot Shelah; and Shelah begot Eber.
Transliteration: vearefakheshad yalad et-shalach veshelach yalad et-ever

Hebrew: וּלְעֵ֥בֶר יֻלַּ֖ד שְׁנֵ֣י בָנִ֑ים שֵׁ֣ם הָאֶחָ֞ד פֶּ֗לֶג כִּ֤י בְיָמָיו֙ נִפְלְגָ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ וְשֵׁ֥ם אָחִ֖יו יׇקְטָֽן׃
Translated: Two sons were born to Eber: the name of the one was Peleg (for in his days the earth was divided), and the name of his brother Joktan.
Transliteration: uleever yulad sheney vaniym shem haechad feleg khiy veyamayv nifelegah haarets veshem achiyv yׇketan

Hebrew: וְיׇקְטָ֣ן יָלַ֔ד אֶת־אַלְמוֹדָ֖ד וְאֶת־שָׁ֑לֶף וְאֶת־חֲצַרְמָ֖וֶת וְאֶת־יָֽרַח׃
Translated: Joktan begot Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
Transliteration: veyׇketan yalad et-alemvodad veet-shalef veet-chatsaremavet veet-yarach

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הֲדוֹרָ֥ם וְאֶת־אוּזָ֖ל וְאֶת־דִּקְלָֽה׃
Translated: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
Transliteration: veet-hadvoram veet-uzal veet-dikelah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עֵיבָ֥ל וְאֶת־אֲבִֽימָאֵ֖ל וְאֶת־שְׁבָֽא׃
Translated: Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
Transliteration: veet-eyval veet-aviymael veet-sheva

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אוֹפִ֥יר וְאֶת־חֲוִילָ֖ה וְאֶת־יוֹבָ֑ב כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י יׇקְטָֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab; all these were the sons of Joktan.
Transliteration: veet-vofiyr veet-chaviylah veet-yvovav khׇl-eleh veney yׇketan {s}

Hebrew: שֵׁ֥ם <small>׀</small> אַרְפַּכְשַׁ֖ד שָֽׁלַח׃
Translated: Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah;
Transliteration: shem <small></small> arefakheshad shalach

Hebrew: עֵ֥בֶר פֶּ֖לֶג רְעֽוּ׃
Translated: Eber, Peleg, Reu;
Transliteration: ever feleg reu

Hebrew: שְׂר֥וּג נָח֖וֹר תָּֽרַח׃
Translated: Serug, Nahor, Terah;
Transliteration: sherug nachvor tarach

Hebrew: אַבְרָ֖ם ה֥וּא אַבְרָהָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Abram, that is, Abraham.
Transliteration: averam hu averaham {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי֙ אַבְרָהָ֔ם יִצְחָ֖ק וְיִשְׁמָעֵֽאל׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.
Transliteration: veney averaham yitsechak veyishemael {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה תֹּלְדוֹתָ֑ם בְּכ֤וֹר יִשְׁמָעֵאל֙ נְבָי֔וֹת וְקֵדָ֥ר וְאַדְבְּאֵ֖ל וּמִבְשָֽׂם׃
Translated: This is their line: The first-born of Ishmael, Nebaioth; and Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
Transliteration: eleh toledvotam vekhvor yishemael nevayvot vekedar veadeveel umivesham

Hebrew: מִשְׁמָ֣ע וְדוּמָ֔ה מַשָּׂ֖א חֲדַ֥ד וְתֵימָֽא׃
Translated: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
Transliteration: mishema vedumah masha chadad veteyma

Hebrew: יְט֥וּר נָפִ֖ישׁ וָקֵ֑דְמָה אֵ֥לֶּה הֵ֖ם בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׁמָעֵֽאל׃ {ס}
Translated: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedmah. These are the sons of Ishmael.
Transliteration: yetur nafiysh vakedemah eleh hem veney yishemael {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֨י קְטוּרָ֜ה פִּילֶ֣גֶשׁ אַבְרָהָ֗ם יָלְדָ֞ה אֶת־זִמְרָ֧ן וְיׇקְשָׁ֛ן וּמְדָ֥ן וּמִדְיָ֖ן וְיִשְׁבָּ֣ק וְשׁ֑וּחַ וּבְנֵ֥י יׇקְשָׁ֖ן שְׁבָ֥א וּדְדָֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: she bore Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah. The sons of Jokshan: Sheba and Dedan.
Transliteration: uveney keturah fiylegesh averaham yaledah et-zimeran veyׇkeshan umedan umideyan veyishevak veshucha uveney yׇkeshan sheva udedan {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י מִדְיָ֗ן עֵיפָ֤ה וָעֵ֙פֶר֙ וַחֲנ֔וֹךְ וַאֲבִידָ֖ע וְאֶלְדָּעָ֑ה כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י קְטוּרָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Midian: Ephah, Epher, Enoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the descendants of Keturah.
Transliteration: uveney mideyan eyfah vaefer vachanvokhe vaaviyda veeledaah khׇl-eleh veney keturah {s}

Hebrew: וַיּ֥וֹלֶד אַבְרָהָ֖ם אֶת־יִצְחָ֑ק בְּנֵ֣י יִצְחָ֔ק עֵשָׂ֖ו וְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Abraham begot Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau and Israel.
Transliteration: vayyvoled averaham et-yitsechak veney yitsechak eshav veyisherael {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י עֵשָׂ֑ו אֱלִיפַ֛ז רְעוּאֵ֥ל וִיע֖וּשׁ וְיַעְלָ֥ם וְקֹֽרַח׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
Transliteration: veney eshav eliyfaz reuel viyush veyaelam vekorach {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י אֱלִיפָ֑ז תֵּימָ֤ן וְאוֹמָר֙ צְפִ֣י וְגַעְתָּ֔ם קְנַ֖ז וְתִמְנָ֥ע וַעֲמָלֵֽק׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.
Transliteration: veney eliyfaz teyman vevomar tsefiy vegaetam kenaz vetimena vaamalek {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י רְעוּאֵ֑ל נַ֥חַת זֶ֖רַח שַׁמָּ֥ה וּמִזָּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
Transliteration: veney reuel nachat zerach shamah umizah {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י שֵׂעִ֔יר לוֹטָ֥ן וְשׁוֹבָ֖ל וְצִבְע֣וֹן וַעֲנָ֑ה וְדִישֹׁ֥ן וְאֵ֖צֶר וְדִישָֽׁן׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Seir: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
Transliteration: uveney sheiyr lvotan veshvoval vetsivevon vaanah vediyshon veetser vediyshan {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י לוֹטָ֖ן חֹרִ֣י וְהוֹמָ֑ם וַאֲח֥וֹת לוֹטָ֖ן תִּמְנָֽע׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Lotan: Hori and Homam; and Lotan’s sister was Timna.
Transliteration: uveney lvotan choriy vehvomam vaachvot lvotan timena {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י שׁוֹבָ֔ל עַלְיָ֧ן וּמָנַ֛חַת וְעֵיבָ֖ל שְׁפִ֣י וְאוֹנָ֑ם וּבְנֵ֥י צִבְע֖וֹן אַיָּ֥ה וַעֲנָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Shobal: Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. The sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah.
Transliteration: veney shvoval aleyan umanachat veeyval shefiy vevonam uveney tsivevon ayah vaanah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י עֲנָ֖ה דִּישׁ֑וֹן וּבְנֵ֣י דִישׁ֔וֹן חַמְרָ֥ן וְאֶשְׁבָּ֖ן וְיִתְרָ֥ן וּכְרָֽן׃
Translated: The sons of Anah: Dishon. The sons of Dishon: Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
Transliteration: veney anah diyshvon uveney diyshvon chameran veeshevan veyiteran ukheran

Hebrew: בְּֽנֵי־אֵ֔צֶר בִּלְהָ֥ן וְזַעֲוָ֖ן יַעֲקָ֑ן בְּנֵ֥י דִישׁ֖וֹן ע֥וּץ וַאֲרָֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan. The sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
Transliteration: veney-etser vilehan vezaavan yaakan veney diyshvon uts vaaran {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣לֶּה הַמְּלָכִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר מָֽלְכוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֱד֔וֹם לִפְנֵ֥י מְלׇךְ־מֶ֖לֶךְ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בֶּ֚לַע בֶּן־בְּע֔וֹר וְשֵׁ֥ם עִיר֖וֹ דִּנְהָֽבָה׃
Translated: These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites: Bela son of Beor, and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
Transliteration: veeleh hamelakhiym asher malekhu veerets edvom lifeney melׇkhe-melekhe liveney yisherael vela ven-vevor veshem iyrvo dinehavah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת בָּ֑לַע וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו יוֹבָ֥ב בֶּן־זֶ֖רַח מִבׇּצְרָֽה׃
Translated: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayamׇt vala vayimelokhe tachetayv yvovav ven-zerach mivׇtserah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת יוֹבָ֑ב וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו חוּשָׁ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ הַתֵּימָנִֽי׃
Translated: When Jobab died, Husham of the land of the Temanites succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayamׇt yvovav vayimelokhe tachetayv chusham meerets hateymaniy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת חוּשָׁ֑ם וַיִּמְלֹ֨ךְ תַּחְתָּ֜יו הֲדַ֣ד בֶּן־בְּדַ֗ד הַמַּכֶּ֤ה אֶת־מִדְיָן֙ בִּשְׂדֵ֣ה מוֹאָ֔ב וְשֵׁ֥ם עִיר֖וֹ (עיות) [עֲוִֽית]׃
Translated: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated the Midianites in the country of Moab, succeeded him as king, and the name of his city was Avith.
Transliteration: vayamׇt chusham vayimelokhe tachetayv hadad ven-vedad hamakheh et-mideyan vishedeh mvoav veshem iyrvo (yvt) [aviyt]

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת הֲדָ֑ד וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו שַׂמְלָ֖ה מִמַּשְׂרֵקָֽה׃
Translated: When Hadad died, Samlah of Masrekah succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayamׇt hadad vayimelokhe tachetayv shamelah mimasherekah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת שַׂמְלָ֑ה וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו שָׁא֖וּל מֵרְחֹב֥וֹת הַנָּהָֽר׃
Translated: When Samlah died, Saul of Rehoboth-on-the-River succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayamׇt shamelah vayimelokhe tachetayv shaul merechovvot hanahar

Hebrew: וַיָּ֖מׇת שָׁא֑וּל וַיִּמְלֹ֣ךְ תַּחְתָּ֔יו בַּ֥עַל חָנָ֖ן בֶּן־עַכְבּֽוֹר׃
Translated: When Saul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayamׇt shaul vayimelokhe tachetayv vaal chanan ven-akhevvor

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙מׇת֙ בַּ֣עַל חָנָ֔ן וַיִּמְלֹ֤ךְ תַּחְתָּיו֙ הֲדַ֔ד וְשֵׁ֥ם עִיר֖וֹ פָּ֑עִי וְשֵׁ֨ם אִשְׁתּ֤וֹ מְהֵֽיטַבְאֵל֙ בַּת־מַטְרֵ֔ד בַּ֖ת מֵ֥י זָהָֽב׃
Translated: When Baal-hanan died, Hadad succeeded him as king; and the name of his city was Pai, and his wife’s name Mehetabel daughter of Matred daughter of Me-zahab.
Transliteration: vayamׇt vaal chanan vayimelokhe tachetayv hadad veshem iyrvo faiy veshem ishetvo meheytaveel vat-matered vat mey zahav

Hebrew:
וַיָּ֖מׇת הֲדָ֑ד {פ}
וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ אַלּוּפֵ֣י אֱד֔וֹם אַלּ֥וּף תִּמְנָ֛ע אַלּ֥וּף (עליה) [עַֽלְוָ֖ה] אַלּ֥וּף יְתֵֽת׃
Translated:
And Hadad died.
The clans of Edom were the clans of Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
Transliteration:
vayamׇt hadad {f}
vayiheyu alufey edvom aluf timena aluf (lyh) [alevah] aluf yetet

Hebrew: אַלּ֧וּף אׇהֳלִיבָמָ֛ה אַלּ֥וּף אֵלָ֖ה אַלּ֥וּף פִּינֹֽן׃
Translated: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
Transliteration: aluf ׇholiyvamah aluf elah aluf fiynon

Hebrew: אַלּ֥וּף קְנַ֛ז אַלּ֥וּף תֵּימָ֖ן אַלּ֥וּף מִבְצָֽר׃
Translated: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
Transliteration: aluf kenaz aluf teyman aluf mivetsar

Hebrew: אַלּ֥וּף מַגְדִּיאֵ֖ל אַלּ֣וּף עִירָ֑ם אֵ֖לֶּה אַלּוּפֵ֥י אֱדֽוֹם׃ {פ}
Translated: Magdiel, and Iram; these are the clans of Edom.
Transliteration: aluf magediyel aluf iyram eleh alufey edvom {f}

Hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל רְאוּבֵ֤ן שִׁמְעוֹן֙ לֵוִ֣י וִיהוּדָ֔ה יִשָּׂשכָ֖ר וּזְבֻלֽוּן׃
Translated: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
Transliteration: eleh veney yisherael reuven shimevon leviy viyhudah yishashkhar uzevulun

Hebrew: דָּ֚ן יוֹסֵ֣ף וּבִנְיָמִ֔ן נַפְתָּלִ֖י גָּ֥ד וְאָשֵֽׁר׃ {פ}
Translated: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
Transliteration: dan yvosef uvineyamin nafetaliy gad veasher {f}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֗ה עֵ֤ר וְאוֹנָן֙ וְשֵׁלָ֔ה שְׁלוֹשָׁה֙ נ֣וֹלַד ל֔וֹ מִבַּת־שׁ֖וּעַ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֑ית וַיְהִ֞י עֵ֣ר ׀ בְּכ֣וֹר יְהוּדָ֗ה רַ֛ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיְמִיתֵֽהוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, and Shelah; these three, Bath-shua the Canaanite woman bore to him. But Er, Judah’s first-born, was displeasing to the L<small>ORD</small>, and He took his life.
Transliteration: veney yehudah er vevonan veshelah shelvoshah nvolad lvo mivat-shua hakhenaaniyt vayehiy er vekhvor yehudah ra veeyney yehovah vayemiytehu {s}

Hebrew: וְתָמָר֙ כַּלָּת֔וֹ יָ֥לְדָה לּ֖וֹ אֶת־פֶּ֣רֶץ וְאֶת־זָ֑רַח כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה חֲמִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: His daughter-in-law Tamar also bore him Perez and Zerah. Judah’s sons were five in all.
Transliteration: vetamar khalatvo yaledah lvo et-ferets veet-zarach khׇl-veney yehudah chamishah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־פֶ֖רֶץ חֶצְר֥וֹן וְחָמֽוּל׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.
Transliteration: veney-ferets chetservon vechamul {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י זֶ֗רַח זִ֠מְרִ֠י וְאֵיתָ֧ן וְהֵימָ֛ן וְכַלְכֹּ֥ל וָדָ֖רַע כֻּלָּ֥ם חֲמִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara, five in all.
Transliteration: uveney zerach zimeriy veeytan veheyman vekhalekhol vadara khulam chamishah {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י כַּרְמִ֑י עָכָר֙ עוֹכֵ֣ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר מָעַ֖ל בַּחֵֽרֶם׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Carmi: Achar, the troubler of Israel, who committed a trespass against the proscribed thing;
Transliteration: uveney kharemiy akhar vokher yisherael asher maal vacherem {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י אֵיתָ֖ן עֲזַרְיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: and Ethan’s son was Azariah.
Transliteration: uveney eytan azareyah {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י חֶצְר֖וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר נֽוֹלַד־ל֑וֹ אֶת־יְרַחְמְאֵ֥ל וְאֶת־רָ֖ם וְאֶת־כְּלוּבָֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Hezron that were born to him: Jerahmeel, Ram, and Chelubai.
Transliteration: uveney chetservon asher nvolad-lvo et-yerachemeel veet-ram veet-kheluvay

Hebrew: וְרָ֖ם הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־עַמִּֽינָדָ֑ב וְעַמִּֽינָדָב֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־נַחְשׁ֔וֹן נְשִׂ֖יא בְּנֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Ram begot Amminadab, and Amminadab begot Nahshon, prince of the sons of Judah.
Transliteration: veram hvoliyd et-amiynadav veamiynadav hvoliyd et-nacheshvon neshiy veney yehudah

Hebrew: וְנַחְשׁוֹן֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־שַׂלְמָ֔א וְשַׂלְמָ֖א הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־בֹּֽעַז׃
Translated: Nahshon was the father of Salma, Salma of Boaz,
Transliteration: venacheshvon hvoliyd et-shalema veshalema hvoliyd et-voaz

Hebrew: וּבֹ֙עַז֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־עוֹבֵ֔ד וְעוֹבֵ֖ד הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־יִשָֽׁי׃
Translated: Boaz of Obed, Obed of Jesse.
Transliteration: uvoaz hvoliyd et-voved vevoved hvoliyd et-yishay

Hebrew: וְאִישַׁ֛י הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־בְּכֹר֖וֹ אֶת־אֱלִיאָ֑ב וַאֲבִֽינָדָב֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י וְשִׁמְעָ֖א הַשְּׁלִשִֽׁי׃
Translated: Jesse begot Eliab his first-born, Abinadab the second, Shimea the third,
Transliteration: veiyshay hvoliyd et-vekhorvo et-eliyav vaaviynadav hasheniy veshimea hashelishiy

Hebrew: נְתַנְאֵל֙ הָרְבִיעִ֔י רַדַּ֖י הַחֲמִישִֽׁי׃
Translated: Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
Transliteration: netaneel hareviyiy raday hachamiyshiy

Hebrew: אֹ֚צֶם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֔י דָּוִ֖יד הַשְּׁבִעִֽי׃
Translated: Ozem the sixth, David the seventh;
Transliteration: otsem hashishiy daviyd hasheviiy

Hebrew: וְאַחְיֹתֵיהֶ֖ם צְרוּיָ֣ה וַאֲבִיגָ֑יִל וּבְנֵ֣י צְרוּיָ֗ה אַבְשַׁ֛י וְיוֹאָ֥ב וַעֲשָׂהאֵ֖ל שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translated: their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, Joab, and Asahel, three.
Transliteration: veacheyoteyhem tseruyah vaaviygayiil uveney tseruyah aveshay veyvoav vaashahel sheloshah

Hebrew: וַאֲבִיגַ֕יִל יָלְדָ֖ה אֶת־עֲמָשָׂ֑א וַאֲבִ֣י עֲמָשָׂ֔א יֶ֖תֶר הַיִּשְׁמְעֵאלִֽי׃
Translated: Abigail bore Amasa, and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
Transliteration: vaaviygayiil yaledah et-amasha vaaviy amasha yeter hayishemeeliy

Hebrew: וְכָלֵ֣ב בֶּן־חֶצְר֗וֹן הוֹלִ֛יד אֶת־עֲזוּבָ֥ה אִשָּׁ֖ה וְאֶת־יְרִיע֑וֹת וְאֵ֣לֶּה בָנֶ֔יהָ יֵ֥שֶׁר וְשׁוֹבָ֖ב וְאַרְדּֽוֹן׃
Translated: Caleb son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah, and by Jerioth; these were her sons: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
Transliteration: vekhalev ven-chetservon hvoliyd et-azuvah ishah veet-yeriyvot veeleh vaneyha eisher veshvovav vearedvon

Hebrew: וַתָּ֖מׇת עֲזוּבָ֑ה וַיִּֽקַּֽח־ל֤וֹ כָלֵב֙ אֶת־אֶפְרָ֔ת וַתֵּ֥לֶד ל֖וֹ אֶת־חֽוּר׃
Translated: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore him Hur.
Transliteration: vatamׇt azuvah vayikach-lvo khalev et-eferat vateled lvo et-chur

Hebrew: וְחוּר֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־אוּרִ֔י וְאוּרִ֖י הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־בְּצַלְאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Hur begot Uri, and Uri begot Bezalel.
Transliteration: vechur hvoliyd et-uriy veuriy hvoliyd et-vetsaleel {s}

Hebrew: וְאַחַ֗ר בָּ֤א חֶצְרוֹן֙ אֶל־בַּת־מָכִיר֙ אֲבִ֣י גִלְעָ֔ד וְה֣וּא לְקָחָ֔הּ וְה֖וּא בֶּן־שִׁשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַתֵּ֥לֶד ל֖וֹ אֶת־שְׂגֽוּב׃
Translated: Afterward Hezron had relations with the daughter of Machir father of Gilead—he had married her when he was sixty years old—and she bore him Segub;
Transliteration: veachar va chetservon el-vat-makhiyr aviy gilead vehu lekachah vehu ven-shishiym shanah vateled lvo et-sheguv

Hebrew: וּשְׂג֖וּב הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־יָאִ֑יר וַֽיְהִי־ל֗וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֤ים וְשָׁלוֹשׁ֙ עָרִ֔ים בְּאֶ֖רֶץ הַגִּלְעָֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: and Segub begot Jair; he had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
Transliteration: usheguv hvoliyd et-yaiyr vayehiy-lvo esheriym veshalvosh ariym veerets hagilead {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח גְּשֽׁוּר־וַ֠אֲרָ֠ם אֶת־חַוֺּ֨ת יָאִ֧יר מֵאִתָּ֛ם אֶת־קְנָ֥ת וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֶ֖יהָ שִׁשִּׁ֣ים עִ֑יר כׇּל־אֵ֕לֶּה בְּנֵ֖י מָכִ֥יר אֲבִֽי־גִלְעָֽד׃
Translated: But Geshur and Aram took from them Havvoth-jair, Kenath and its dependencies, sixty towns. All these were the sons of Machir, the father of Gilead.
Transliteration: vayikach geshur-vaaram et-chavot yaiyr meitam et-kenat veet-venoteyha shishiym iyr khׇl-eleh veney makhiyr aviy-gilead

Hebrew: וְאַחַ֥ר מוֹת־חֶצְר֖וֹן בְּכָלֵ֣ב אֶפְרָ֑תָה וְאֵ֤שֶׁת חֶצְרוֹן֙ אֲבִיָּ֔ה וַתֵּ֣לֶד ל֔וֹ אֶת־אַשְׁח֖וּר אֲבִ֥י תְקֽוֹעַ׃ {ס}
Translated: After the death of Hezron, in Caleb-ephrathah, Abijah, wife of Hezron, bore Ashhur, the father of Tekoa.
Transliteration: veachar mvot-chetservon vekhalev eferatah veeshet chetservon aviyah vateled lvo et-ashechur aviy tekvoa {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֧וּ בְנֵי־יְרַחְמְאֵ֛ל בְּכ֥וֹר חֶצְר֖וֹן הַבְּכ֣וֹר <small>׀</small> רָ֑ם וּבוּנָ֥ה וָאֹ֛רֶן וָאֹ֖צֶם אֲחִיָּֽה׃
Translated: The sons of Jerahmeel the first-born of Hezron: Ram his first-born, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney-yerachemeel vekhvor chetservon havekhvor <small></small> ram uvunah vaoren vaotsem achiyah

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֨י אִשָּׁ֥ה אַחֶ֛רֶת לִֽירַחְמְאֵ֖ל וּשְׁמָ֣הּ עֲטָרָ֑ה הִ֖יא אֵ֥ם אוֹנָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
Transliteration: vatehiy ishah acheret liyrachemeel ushemah atarah hiy em vonam {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ בְנֵי־רָ֖ם בְּכ֣וֹר יְרַחְמְאֵ֑ל מַ֥עַץ וְיָמִ֖ין וָעֵֽקֶר׃
Translated: The sons of Ram the first-born of Jerahmeel: Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney-ram vekhvor yerachemeel maats veyamiyn vaeker

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ בְנֵי־אוֹנָ֖ם שַׁמַּ֣י וְיָדָ֑ע וּבְנֵ֣י שַׁמַּ֔י נָדָ֖ב וַאֲבִישֽׁוּר׃
Translated: The sons of Onam: Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney-vonam shamay veyada uveney shamay nadav vaaviyshur

Hebrew: וְשֵׁ֛ם אֵ֥שֶׁת אֲבִישׁ֖וּר אֲבִיהָ֑יִל וַתֵּ֣לֶד ל֔וֹ אֶת־אַחְבָּ֖ן וְאֶת־מוֹלִֽיד׃
Translated: The name of Abishur’s wife was Abihail, and she bore him Ahban and Molid.
Transliteration: veshem eshet aviyshur aviyhayiil vateled lvo et-achevan veet-mvoliyd

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י נָדָ֖ב סֶ֣לֶד וְאַפָּ֑יִם וַיָּ֥מׇת סֶ֖לֶד לֹ֥א בָנִֽים׃
Translated: The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim; Seled died childless.
Transliteration: uveney nadav seled veafayiim vayamׇt seled lo vaniym

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י אַפַּ֖יִם יִשְׁעִ֑י וּבְנֵ֤י יִשְׁעִי֙ שֵׁשָׁ֔ן וּבְנֵ֥י שֵׁשָׁ֖ן אַחְלָֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Appaim: Ishi. The sons of Ishi: Sheshan. The sons of Sheshan: Ahlai.
Transliteration: uveney afayiim yisheiy uveney yisheiy sheshan uveney sheshan achelay

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֤י יָדָע֙ אֲחִ֣י שַׁמַּ֔י יֶ֖תֶר וְיוֹנָתָ֑ן וַיָּ֥מׇת יֶ֖תֶר לֹ֥א בָנִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Jada, Shammai’s brother: Jether and Jonathan; Jether died childless.
Transliteration: uveney yada achiy shamay yeter veyvonatan vayamׇt yeter lo vaniym {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י יוֹנָתָ֖ן פֶּ֣לֶת וְזָזָ֑א אֵ֥לֶּה הָי֖וּ בְּנֵ֥י יְרַחְמְאֵֽל׃
Translated: The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.
Transliteration: uveney yvonatan felet vezaza eleh hayu veney yerachemeel

Hebrew: וְלֹא־הָיָ֧ה לְשֵׁשָׁ֛ן בָּנִ֖ים כִּ֣י אִם־בָּנ֑וֹת וּלְשֵׁשָׁ֛ן עֶ֥בֶד מִצְרִ֖י וּשְׁמ֥וֹ יַרְחָֽע׃
Translated: Sheshan had no sons, only daughters; Sheshan had an Egyptian slave, whose name was Jarha.
Transliteration: velo-hayah lesheshan vaniym khiy im-vanvot ulesheshan eved mitseriy ushemvo yarecha

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן שֵׁשָׁ֧ן אֶת־בִּתּ֛וֹ לְיַרְחָ֥ע עַבְדּ֖וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וַתֵּ֥לֶד ל֖וֹ אֶת־עַתָּֽי׃
Translated: So Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to Jarha his slave; and she bore him Attai.
Transliteration: vayiten sheshan et-vitvo leyarecha avedvo leishah vateled lvo et-atay

Hebrew: וְעַתַּי֙ הֹלִ֣יד אֶת־נָתָ֔ן וְנָתָ֖ן הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־זָבָֽד׃
Translated: Attai begot Nathan, and Nathan begot Zabad.
Transliteration: veatay holiyd et-natan venatan hvoliyd et-zavad

Hebrew: וְזָבָד֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־אֶפְלָ֔ל וְאֶפְלָ֖ל הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־עוֹבֵֽד׃
Translated: Zabad begot Ephlal, and Ephlal begot Obed.
Transliteration: vezavad hvoliyd et-efelal veefelal hvoliyd et-voved

Hebrew: וְעוֹבֵד֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־יֵה֔וּא וְיֵה֖וּא הֹלִ֥יד אֶת־עֲזַרְיָֽה׃
Translated: Obed begot Jehu, and Jehu begot Azariah.
Transliteration: vevoved hvoliyd et-eihu veeihu holiyd et-azareyah

Hebrew: וַֽעֲזַרְיָה֙ הֹלִ֣יד אֶת־חָ֔לֶץ וְחֶ֖לֶץ הֹלִ֥יד אֶת־אֶלְעָשָֽׂה׃
Translated: Azariah begot Helez, and Helez begot Eleasah.
Transliteration: vaazareyah holiyd et-chalets vechelets holiyd et-eleashah

Hebrew: וְאֶלְעָשָׂה֙ הֹלִ֣יד אֶת־סִֽסְמָ֔י וְסִסְמַ֖י הֹלִ֥יד אֶת־שַׁלּֽוּם׃
Translated: Eleasah begot Sisamai, and Sisamai begot Shallum.
Transliteration: veeleashah holiyd et-sisemay vesisemay holiyd et-shalum

Hebrew: וְשַׁלּוּם֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־יְקַמְיָ֔ה וִיקַמְיָ֖ה הֹלִ֥יד אֶת־אֱלִישָׁמָֽע׃ {ס}
Translated: Shallum begot Jekamiah, and Jekamiah begot Elishama.
Transliteration: veshalum hvoliyd et-yekameyah viykameyah holiyd et-eliyshama {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֤י כָלֵב֙ אֲחִ֣י יְרַחְמְאֵ֔ל מֵישָׁ֥ע בְּכֹר֖וֹ ה֣וּא אֲבִי־זִ֑יף וּבְנֵ֥י מָרֵשָׁ֖ה אֲבִ֥י חֶבְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: The sons of Caleb brother of Jerahmeel: Meshah his first-born, who was the father of Ziph. The sons of Mareshah father of Hebron.
Transliteration: uveney khalev achiy yerachemeel meysha vekhorvo hu aviy-ziyf uveney mareshah aviy chevervon

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י חֶבְר֑וֹן קֹ֥רַח וְתַפֻּ֖חַ וְרֶ֥קֶם וָשָֽׁמַע׃
Translated: The sons of Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
Transliteration: uveney chevervon korach vetafucha verekem vashama

Hebrew: וְשֶׁ֣מַע הוֹלִ֔יד אֶת־רַ֖חַם אֲבִ֣י יׇרְקְעָ֑ם וְרֶ֖קֶם הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־שַׁמָּֽי׃
Translated: Shema begot Raham the father of Jorkeam, and Rekem begot Shammai.
Transliteration: veshema hvoliyd et-racham aviy yׇrekeam verekem hvoliyd et-shamay

Hebrew: וּבֶן־שַׁמַּ֖י מָע֑וֹן וּמָע֖וֹן אֲבִ֥י בֵֽית־צֽוּר׃
Translated: The son of Shammai: Maon, and Maon begot Bethzur.
Transliteration: uven-shamay mavon umavon aviy veyt-tsur

Hebrew: וְעֵיפָה֙ פִּילֶ֣גֶשׁ כָּלֵ֔ב יָ֥לְדָ֛ה אֶת־חָרָ֥ן וְאֶת־מוֹצָ֖א וְאֶת־גָּזֵ֑ז וְחָרָ֖ן הֹלִ֥יד אֶת־גָּזֵֽז׃ {ס}
Translated: Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez; Haran begot Gazez.
Transliteration: veeyfah fiylegesh khalev yaledah et-charan veet-mvotsa veet-gazez vecharan holiyd et-gazez {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י יׇהְדָּ֑י רֶ֧גֶם וְיוֹתָ֛ם וְגֵישָׁ֥ן וָפֶ֖לֶט וְעֵיפָ֥ה וָשָֽׁעַף׃
Translated: The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
Transliteration: uveney yׇheday regem veyvotam vegeyshan vafelet veeyfah vashaaf

Hebrew: פִּילֶ֤גֶשׁ כָּלֵב֙ מַֽעֲכָ֔ה יָ֥לַד שֶׁ֖בֶר וְאֶֽת־תִּרְחֲנָֽה׃
Translated: Maacah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
Transliteration: fiylegesh khalev maakhah yalad shever veet-tirechanah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֗לֶד שַׁ֚עַף אֲבִ֣י מַדְמַנָּ֔ה אֶת־שְׁוָ֛א אֲבִ֥י מַכְבֵּנָ֖ה וַאֲבִ֣י גִבְעָ֑א וּבַת־כָּלֵ֖ב עַכְסָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: She also bore Shaaph father of Madmannah, Sheva father of Machbenah and father of Gibea; the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
Transliteration: vateled shaaf aviy mademanah et-sheva aviy makhevenah vaaviy givea uvat-khalev akhesah {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֤לֶּה הָיוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י כָלֵ֔ב בֶּן־ח֖וּר בְּכ֣וֹר אֶפְרָ֑תָה שׁוֹבָ֕ל אֲבִ֖י קִרְיַ֥ת יְעָרִֽים׃
Translated:
These were the descendants of Caleb.
The sons of Hur the first-born of Ephrathah: Shobal father of Kiriath-jearim,
Transliteration: eleh hayu veney khalev ven-chur vekhvor eferatah shvoval aviy kireyat yeariym

Hebrew: שַׂלְמָא֙ אֲבִ֣י בֵֽית־לָ֔חֶם חָרֵ֖ף אֲבִ֥י בֵית־גָּדֵֽר׃
Translated: Salma father of Bethlehem, Hareph father of Beth-gader.
Transliteration: shalema aviy veyt-lachem charef aviy veyt-gader

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֤וּ בָנִים֙ לְשׁוֹבָ֔ל אֲבִ֖י קִרְיַ֣ת יְעָרִ֑ים הָרֹאֶ֖ה חֲצִ֥י הַמְּנֻחֽוֹת׃
Translated: Shobal father of Kiriath-jearim had sons: Haroeh, half of the Menuhoth.
Transliteration: vayiheyu vaniym leshvoval aviy kireyat yeariym haroeh chatsiy hamenuchvot

Hebrew: וּמִשְׁפְּחוֹת֙ קִרְיַ֣ת יְעָרִ֔ים הַיִּתְרִי֙ וְהַפּוּתִ֔י וְהַשֻּׁמָתִ֖י וְהַמִּשְׁרָעִ֑י מֵאֵ֗לֶּה יָֽצְאוּ֙ הַצָּ֣רְעָתִ֔י וְהָאֶשְׁתָּ֖אֻֽלִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: And the families of Kiriath-jearim: the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; from these came the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.
Transliteration: umishefechvot kireyat yeariym hayiteriy vehafutiy vehashumatiy vehamisheraiy meeleh yatseu hatsareatiy vehaeshetauliy {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י שַׂלְמָ֗א בֵּ֥ית לֶ֙חֶם֙ וּנְט֣וֹפָתִ֔י עַטְר֖וֹת בֵּ֣ית יוֹאָ֑ב וַחֲצִ֥י הַמָּנַחְתִּ֖י הַצׇּרְעִֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.
Transliteration: veney shalema veyt lechem unetvofatiy atervot veyt yvoav vachatsiy hamanachetiy hatsׇreiy

Hebrew: וּמִשְׁפְּח֤וֹת סֹֽפְרִים֙ (ישבו) [יֹשְׁבֵ֣י] יַעְבֵּ֔ץ תִּרְעָתִ֥ים שִׁמְעָתִ֖ים שׂוּכָתִ֑ים הֵ֚מָּה הַקִּינִ֣ים הַבָּאִ֔ים מֵחַמַּ֖ת אֲבִ֥י בֵית־רֵכָֽב׃ {ס}
Translated: The families of the scribes that dwelt at Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, the Sucathites; these are the Kenites who came from Hammath, father of the house of Rechab.
Transliteration: umishefechvot soferiym (yshvv) [yoshevey] yaevets tireatiym shimeatiym shukhatiym hemah hakiyniym havaiym mechamat aviy veyt-rekhav {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֤לֶּה הָיוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י דָוִ֔יד אֲשֶׁ֥ר נוֹלַד־ל֖וֹ בְּחֶבְר֑וֹן הַבְּכ֣וֹר ׀ אַמְנֹ֗ן לַאֲחִינֹ֙עַם֙ הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִ֔ית שֵׁנִי֙ דָּנִיֵּ֔אל לַאֲבִיגַ֖יִל הַֽכַּרְמְלִֽית׃
Translated: These are the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: the first-born Amnon, by Ahinoam the Jezreelite; the second Daniel, by Abigail the Carmelite;
Transliteration: veeleh hayu veney daviyd asher nvolad-lvo vechevervon havekhvor amenon laachiynoam hayizereeliyt sheniy daniyel laaviygayiil hakharemeliyt

Hebrew: הַשְּׁלִשִׁי֙ לְאַבְשָׁל֣וֹם בֶּֽן־מַעֲכָ֔ה בַּת־תַּלְמַ֖י מֶ֣לֶךְ גְּשׁ֑וּר הָרְבִיעִ֖י אֲדֹנִיָּ֥ה בֶן־חַגִּֽית׃
Translated: the third Absalom, son of Maacah daughter of King Talmai of Geshur; the fourth Adonijah, son of Haggith;
Transliteration: hashelishiy leaveshalvom ven-maakhah vat-talemay melekhe geshur hareviyiy adoniyah ven-chagiyt

Hebrew: הַחֲמִישִׁ֥י שְׁפַטְיָ֖ה לַאֲבִיטָ֑ל הַשִּׁשִּׁ֥י יִתְרְעָ֖ם לְעֶגְלָ֥ה אִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: the fifth Shephatiah, by Abital; the sixth Ithream, by his wife Eglah;
Transliteration: hachamiyshiy shefateyah laaviytal hashishiy yiteream leegelah ishetvo

Hebrew: שִׁשָּׁה֙ נוֹלַד־ל֣וֹ בְחֶבְר֔וֹן וַיִּ֨מְלׇךְ־שָׁ֔ם שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים וְשִׁשָּׁ֣ה חֳדָשִׁ֑ים וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וְשָׁלוֹשׁ֙ שָׁנָ֔ה מָלַ֖ךְ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: six were born to him in Hebron. He reigned there seven years and six months, and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years.
Transliteration: shishah nvolad-lvo vechevervon vayimelׇkhe-sham sheva shaniym veshishah chodashiym usheloshiym veshalvosh shanah malakhe viyrushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֥לֶּה נוּלְּדוּ־ל֖וֹ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑יִם שִׁ֠מְעָ֠א וְשׁוֹבָ֞ב וְנָתָ֤ן וּשְׁלֹמֹה֙ אַרְבָּעָ֔ה לְבַת־שׁ֖וּעַ בַּת־עַמִּיאֵֽל׃
Translated: These were born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon, four by Bath-shua daughter of Ammiel;
Transliteration: veeleh nuledu-lvo viyrushalayiim shimea veshvovav venatan ushelomoh arevaah levat-shua vat-amiyel

Hebrew: וְיִבְחָ֥ר וֶאֱלִישָׁמָ֖ע וֶאֱלִיפָֽלֶט׃
Translated: then Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet,
Transliteration: veyivechar veeliyshama veeliyfalet

Hebrew: וְנֹ֥גַהּ וְנֶ֖פֶג וְיָפִֽיעַ׃
Translated: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
Transliteration: venogah venefeg veyafiya

Hebrew: וֶאֱלִישָׁמָ֧ע וְאֶלְיָדָ֛ע וֶאֱלִיפֶ֖לֶט תִּשְׁעָֽה׃
Translated: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet—nine.
Transliteration: veeliyshama veeleyada veeliyfelet tisheah

Hebrew: כֹּ֖ל בְּנֵ֣י דָוִ֑יד מִלְּבַ֥ד בְּֽנֵי־פִֽילַגְשִׁ֖ים וְתָמָ֥ר אֲחוֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: All were David’s sons, besides the sons of the concubines; and Tamar was their sister.
Transliteration: khol veney daviyd milevad veney-fiylageshiym vetamar achvotam {f}

Hebrew: וּבֶן־שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה רְחַבְעָ֑ם אֲבִיָּ֥ה בְנ֛וֹ אָסָ֥א בְנ֖וֹ יְהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: The son of Solomon: Rehoboam; his son Abijah, his son Asa, his son Jehoshaphat,
Transliteration: uven-shelomoh rechaveam aviyah venvo asa venvo yehvoshafat venvo

Hebrew: יוֹרָ֥ם בְּנ֛וֹ אֲחַזְיָ֥הוּ בְנ֖וֹ יוֹאָ֥שׁ בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Joram, his son Ahaziah, his son Joash,
Transliteration: yvoram venvo achazeyahu venvo yvoash venvo

Hebrew: אֲמַצְיָ֧הוּ בְנ֛וֹ עֲזַרְיָ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ יוֹתָ֥ם בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Amaziah, his son Azariah, his son Jotham,
Transliteration: amatseyahu venvo azareyah venvo yvotam venvo

Hebrew: אָחָ֥ז בְּנ֛וֹ חִזְקִיָּ֥הוּ בְנ֖וֹ מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה בְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Ahaz, his son Hezekiah, his son Manasseh,
Transliteration: achaz venvo chizekiyahu venvo menasheh venvo

Hebrew: אָמ֥וֹן בְּנ֖וֹ יֹאשִׁיָּ֥הוּ בְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Amon, and his son Josiah.
Transliteration: amvon venvo yoshiyahu venvo

Hebrew: וּבְנֵי֙ יֹֽאשִׁיָּ֔הוּ הַבְּכוֹר֙ יֽוֹחָנָ֔ן הַשֵּׁנִ֖י יְהוֹיָקִ֑ים הַשְּׁלִשִׁי֙ צִדְקִיָּ֔הוּ הָרְבִיעִ֖י שַׁלּֽוּם׃
Translated: The sons of Josiah: Johanan the first-born, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.
Transliteration: uveney yoshiyahu havekhvor yvochanan hasheniy yehvoyakiym hashelishiy tsidekiyahu hareviyiy shalum

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י יְהוֹיָקִ֑ים יְכׇנְיָ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ צִדְקִיָּ֥ה בְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: The descendants of Jehoiakim: his son Jeconiah, his son Zedekiah;
Transliteration: uveney yehvoyakiym yekhׇneyah venvo tsidekiyah venvo

Hebrew: וּבְנֵי֙ יְכׇנְיָ֣ה אַסִּ֔ר שְׁאַלְתִּיאֵ֖ל בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: and the sons of Jeconiah, the captive: Shealtiel his son,
Transliteration: uveney yekhׇneyah asir shealetiyel venvo

Hebrew: וּמַלְכִירָ֥ם וּפְדָיָ֖ה וְשֶׁנְאַצַּ֑ר יְקַמְיָ֥ה הוֹשָׁמָ֖ע וּנְדַבְיָֽה׃
Translated: Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah;
Transliteration: umalekhiyram ufedayah vesheneatsar yekameyah hvoshama unedaveyah

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י פְדָיָ֔ה זְרֻבָּבֶ֖ל וְשִׁמְעִ֑י וּבֶן־זְרֻבָּבֶל֙ מְשֻׁלָּ֣ם וַחֲנַנְיָ֔ה וּשְׁלֹמִ֖ית אֲחוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: the sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel and Shimei; the sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam and Hananiah, and Shelomith was their sister;
Transliteration: uveney fedayah zeruvavel veshimeiy uven-zeruvavel meshulam vachananeyah ushelomiyt achvotam

Hebrew: וַחֲשֻׁבָ֡ה וָ֠אֹ֠הֶל וּבֶרֶכְיָ֧ה וַחֲסַדְיָ֛ה י֥וּשַׁב חֶ֖סֶד חָמֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed—five.
Transliteration: vachashuvah vaohel uverekheyah vachasadeyah yushav chesed chamesh

Hebrew: וּבֶן־חֲנַנְיָ֖ה פְּלַטְיָ֣ה וִישַֽׁעְיָ֑ה בְּנֵ֤י רְפָיָה֙ בְּנֵ֣י אַרְנָ֔ן בְּנֵ֥י עֹבַדְיָ֖ה בְּנֵ֥י שְׁכַנְיָֽה׃
Translated: And the sons of Hananiah: Pelatiah and Jeshaiah; the sons of [Jeshaiah]: Rephaiah; the sons of [Rephaiah]: Arnan; the sons of [Arnan]: Obadiah; the sons of [Obadiah]: Shecaniah.
Transliteration: uven-chananeyah felateyah viyshaeyah veney refayah veney arenan veney ovadeyah veney shekhaneyah

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י שְׁכַנְיָ֖ה שְׁמַֽעְיָ֑ה וּבְנֵ֣י שְׁמַֽעְיָ֗ה חַטּ֡וּשׁ וְ֠יִגְאָ֠ל וּבָרִ֧יחַ וּנְעַרְיָ֛ה וְשָׁפָ֖ט שִׁשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: And the sons of Shecaniah: Shemaiah; and the sons of Shemaiah: Hattush, and Igal, and Bariah, and Neariah, and Shaphat—six.
Transliteration: uveney shekhaneyah shemaeyah uveney shemaeyah chatush veyiigeal uvariycha uneareyah veshafat shishah

Hebrew: וּבֶן־נְעַרְיָ֗ה אֶלְיוֹעֵינַ֧י וְחִזְקִיָּ֛ה וְעַזְרִיקָ֖ם שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: And the sons of Neariah: Elioenai, and Hizkiah, and Azrikam—three.
Transliteration: uven-neareyah eleyvoeynay vechizekiyah veazeriykam sheloshah {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י אֶלְיוֹעֵינַ֗י (הודיוהו) [הוֹדַוְיָ֡הוּ] וְאֶלְיָשִׁ֡יב וּפְלָיָ֡ה וְ֠עַקּ֠וּב וְיוֹחָנָ֧ן וּדְלָיָ֛ה וַעֲנָ֖נִי שִׁבְעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And the sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, and Eliashib, and Pelaiah, and Akkub, and Johanan, and Delaiah, and Anani—seven.
Transliteration: uveney eleyvoeynay (hvdyvhv) [hvodaveyahu] veeleyashiyv ufelayah veakuv veyvochanan udelayah vaananiy shiveah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י יְהוּדָ֑ה פֶּ֧רֶץ חֶצְר֛וֹן וְכַרְמִ֖י וְח֥וּר וְשׁוֹבָֽל׃
Translated: The sons of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.
Transliteration: veney yehudah ferets chetservon vekharemiy vechur veshvoval

Hebrew: וּרְאָיָ֤ה בֶן־שׁוֹבָל֙ הֹלִ֣יד אֶת־יַ֔חַת וְיַ֣חַת הֹלִ֔יד אֶת־אֲחוּמַ֖י וְאֶת־לָ֑הַד אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּח֥וֹת הַצָּֽרְעָתִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Reaiah son of Shobal begot Jahath, and Jahath begot Ahumai and Lahad. These were the families of the Zorathites.
Transliteration: ureayah ven-shvoval holiyd et-yachat veyachat holiyd et-achumay veet-lahad eleh mishefechvot hatsareatiy {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ אֲבִ֣י עֵיטָ֔ם יִזְרְעֶ֥אל וְיִשְׁמָ֖א וְיִדְבָּ֑שׁ וְשֵׁ֥ם אֲחוֹתָ֖ם הַצְלֶלְפּֽוֹנִי׃
Translated: These were [the sons of] the father of Etam: Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash; and the name of their sister was Hazlelponi,
Transliteration: veeleh aviy eytam yizereel veyishema veyidevash veshem achvotam hatselelefvoniy

Hebrew: וּפְנוּאֵל֙ אֲבִ֣י גְדֹ֔ר וְעֵ֖זֶר אֲבִ֣י חוּשָׁ֑ה אֵ֤לֶּה בְנֵי־חוּר֙ בְּכ֣וֹר אֶפְרָ֔תָה אֲבִ֖י בֵּ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: and Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These were the sons of Hur, the first-born of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.
Transliteration: ufenuel aviy gedor veezer aviy chushah eleh veney-chur vekhvor eferatah aviy veyt lachem

Hebrew: וּלְאַשְׁחוּר֙ אֲבִ֣י תְק֔וֹעַ הָי֖וּ שְׁתֵּ֣י נָשִׁ֑ים חֶלְאָ֖ה וְנַעֲרָֽה׃
Translated: Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah;
Transliteration: uleashechur aviy tekvoa hayu shetey nashiym cheleah venaarah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֨לֶד ל֤וֹ נַֽעֲרָה֙ אֶת־אֲחֻזָּ֣ם וְאֶת־חֵ֔פֶר וְאֶת־תֵּֽימְנִ֖י וְאֶת־הָאֲחַשְׁתָּרִ֑י אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י נַעֲרָֽה׃
Translated: Naarah bore him Ahuzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Ahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.
Transliteration: vateled lvo naarah et-achuzam veet-chefer veet-teymeniy veet-haachashetariy eleh veney naarah

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י חֶלְאָ֑ה צֶ֥רֶת (יצחר) [וְצֹ֖חַר] וְאֶתְנָֽן׃
Translated: The sons of Helah: Zereth, Zohar, and Ethnan.
Transliteration: uveney cheleah tseret (ytschr) [vetsochar] veetenan

Hebrew: וְק֣וֹץ הוֹלִ֔יד אֶת־עָנ֖וּב וְאֶת־הַצֹּבֵבָ֑ה וּמִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת אֲחַרְחֵ֖ל בֶּן־הָרֽוּם׃
Translated: Koz was the father of Anub, Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel son of Harum.
Transliteration: vekvots hvoliyd et-anuv veet-hatsovevah umishefechot acharechel ven-harum

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י יַעְבֵּ֔ץ נִכְבָּ֖ד מֵאֶחָ֑יו וְאִמּ֗וֹ קָרְאָ֨ה שְׁמ֤וֹ יַעְבֵּץ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כִּ֥י יָלַ֖דְתִּי בְּעֹֽצֶב׃
Translated: Jabez was more esteemed than his brothers; and his mother named him Jabez, “Because,” she said, “I bore him in pain.”
Transliteration: vayehiy yaevets nikhevad meechayv veimvo kareah shemvo yaevets lemor khiy yaladetiy veotsev

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א יַ֠עְבֵּ֠ץ לֵאלֹהֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל לֵאמֹ֗ר אִם־בָּרֵ֨ךְ תְּבָרְכֵ֜נִי וְהִרְבִּ֤יתָ אֶת־גְּבוּלִי֙ וְהָיְתָ֤ה יָדְךָ֙ עִמִּ֔י וְעָשִׂ֥יתָ מֵּרָעָ֖ה לְבִלְתִּ֣י עׇצְבִּ֑י וַיָּבֵ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־שָׁאָֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Jabez invoked the God of Israel, saying, “Oh, bless me, enlarge my territory, stand by me, and make me not suffer pain from misfortune!” And God granted what he asked.
Transliteration: vayikera yaevets lelohey yisherael lemor im-varekhe tevarekheniy vehireviyta et-gevuliy vehayetah yadekha imiy veashiyta meraah leviletiy ׇtseviy vayave Elohim et asher-shaal {s}

Hebrew: וּכְל֥וּב אֲחִי־שׁוּחָ֖ה הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־מְחִ֑יר ה֖וּא אֲבִ֥י אֶשְׁתּֽוֹן׃
Translated: Chelub the brother of Shuhah begot Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
Transliteration: ukheluv achiy-shuchah hvoliyd et-mechiyr hu aviy eshetvon

Hebrew: וְאֶשְׁתּ֗וֹן הוֹלִ֞יד אֶת־בֵּ֤ית רָפָא֙ וְאֶת־פָּסֵ֔חַ וְאֶת־תְּחִנָּ֖ה אֲבִ֣י עִ֣יר נָחָ֑שׁ אֵ֖לֶּה אַנְשֵׁ֥י רֵכָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Eshton begot Bethrapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah father of Ir-nahash. These were the men of Recah.
Transliteration: veeshetvon hvoliyd et-veyt rafa veet-fasecha veet-techinah aviy iyr nachash eleh aneshey rekhah {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י קְנַ֔ז עׇתְנִיאֵ֖ל וּשְׂרָיָ֑ה וּבְנֵ֥י עׇתְנִיאֵ֖ל חֲתַֽת׃
Translated: The sons of Kenaz: Othniel and Seraiah; and the sons of Othniel: Hathath
Transliteration: uveney kenaz ׇteniyel usherayah uveney ׇteniyel chatat

Hebrew: וּמְעוֹנֹתַ֖י הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־עׇפְרָ֑ה וּשְׂרָיָ֗ה הוֹלִ֤יד אֶת־יוֹאָב֙ אֲבִי֙ גֵּ֣יא חֲרָשִׁ֔ים כִּ֥י חֲרָשִׁ֖ים הָיֽוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: and Meonothai. He begot Ophrah. Seraiah begot Joab father of Ge-harashim, so-called because they were craftsmen.
Transliteration: umevonotay hvoliyd et-ׇferah usherayah hvoliyd et-yvoav aviy gey charashiym khiy charashiym hayu {f}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵי֙ כָּלֵ֣ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֔ה עִ֥ירוּ אֵלָ֖ה וָנָ֑עַם וּבְנֵ֥י אֵלָ֖ה וּקְנַֽז׃
Translated: The sons of Caleb son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam; and the sons of Elah: Kenaz.
Transliteration: uveney khalev ven-yefuneh iyru elah vanaam uveney elah ukenaz

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י יְהַלֶּלְאֵ֑ל זִ֣יף וְזִיפָ֔ה תִּירְיָ֖א וַאֲשַׂרְאֵֽל׃
Translated: The sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.
Transliteration: uveney yehaleleel ziyf veziyfah tiyreya vaashareel

Hebrew: וּבֶ֨ן־עֶזְרָ֔ה יֶ֥תֶר וּמֶ֖רֶד וְעֵ֣פֶר וְיָל֑וֹן וַתַּ֙הַר֙ אֶת־מִרְיָ֣ם וְאֶת־שַׁמַּ֔י וְאֶת־יִשְׁבָּ֖ח אֲבִ֥י אֶשְׁתְּמֹֽעַ׃
Translated: The sons of Ezrah: Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon. She conceived and bore Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah father of Eshtemoa.
Transliteration: uven-ezerah yeter umered veefer veyalvon vatahar et-mireyam veet-shamay veet-yishevach aviy eshetemoa

Hebrew: וְאִשְׁתּ֣וֹ הַיְהֻֽדִיָּ֗ה יָלְדָ֞ה אֶת־יֶ֨רֶד אֲבִ֤י גְדוֹר֙ וְאֶת־חֶ֙בֶר֙ אֲבִ֣י שׂוֹכ֔וֹ וְאֶת־יְקוּתִיאֵ֖ל אֲבִ֣י זָנ֑וֹחַ וְאֵ֗לֶּה בְּנֵי֙ בִּתְיָ֣ה בַת־פַּרְעֹ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָקַ֖ח מָֽרֶד׃ {ס}
Translated: And his Judahite wife bore Jered father of Gedor, Heber father of Soco, and Jekuthiel father of Zanoah. These were the sons of Bithiah daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered married.
Transliteration: veishetvo hayehudiyah yaledah et-yered aviy gedvor veet-chever aviy shvokhvo veet-yekutiyel aviy zanvocha veeleh veney viteyah vat-fareoh asher lakach mared {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵי֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת הֽוֹדִיָּ֔ה אֲח֣וֹת נַ֔חַם אֲבִ֥י קְעִילָ֖ה הַגַּרְמִ֑י וְאֶשְׁתְּמֹ֖עַ הַמַּעֲכָתִֽי׃
Translated: The sons of the wife of Hodiah sister of Naham were the fathers of Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Maacathite.
Transliteration: uveney eshet hvodiyah achvot nacham aviy keiylah hagaremiy veeshetemoa hamaakhatiy

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י שִׁימ֔וֹן אַמְנ֣וֹן וְרִנָּ֔ה בֶּן־חָנָ֖ן (ותולון) [וְתִיל֑וֹן] וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׁעִ֔י זוֹחֵ֖ת וּבֶן־זוֹחֵֽת׃
Translated: The sons of Shimon: Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-hanan, and Tilon. The sons of Ishi: Zoheth and Ben-zoheth.
Transliteration: uveney shiymvon amenvon verinah ven-chanan (vtvlvn) [vetiylvon] uveney yisheiy zvochet uven-zvochet

Hebrew: בְּנֵי֙ שֵׁלָ֣ה בֶן־יְהוּדָ֔ה עֵ֚ר אֲבִ֣י לֵכָ֔ה וְלַעְדָּ֖ה אֲבִ֣י מָרֵשָׁ֑ה וּמִשְׁפְּח֛וֹת בֵּית־עֲבֹדַ֥ת הַבֻּ֖ץ לְבֵ֥ית אַשְׁבֵּֽעַ׃
Translated: The sons of Shelah son of Judah: Er father of Lecah, Laadah father of Mareshah, and the families of the linen factory at Beth-ashbea;
Transliteration: veney shelah ven-yehudah er aviy lekhah velaedah aviy mareshah umishefechvot veyt-avodat havuts leveyt ashevea

Hebrew: וְיוֹקִ֞ים וְאַנְשֵׁ֣י כֹזֵבָ֗א וְיוֹאָ֧שׁ וְשָׂרָ֛ף אֲשֶׁר־בָּעֲל֥וּ לְמוֹאָ֖ב וְיָשֻׁ֣בִי לָ֑חֶם וְהַדְּבָרִ֖ים עַתִּיקִֽים׃
Translated: and Jokim, and the men of Cozeba and Joash, and Saraph, who married into Moab and Jashubi Lehem (the records are ancient).
Transliteration: veyvokiym veaneshey khozeva veyvoash vesharaf asher-vaalu lemvoav veyashuviy lachem vehadevariym atiykiym

Hebrew: הֵ֚מָּה הַיּ֣וֹצְרִ֔ים וְיֹשְׁבֵ֥י נְטָעִ֖ים וּגְדֵרָ֑ה עִם־הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ בִּמְלַאכְתּ֖וֹ יָ֥שְׁבוּ שָֽׁם׃ {ס}
Translated: These were the potters who dwelt at Netaim and Gederah; they dwelt there in the king’s service.
Transliteration: hemah hayyvotseriym veyoshevey netaiym ugederah im-hamelekhe vimelakhetvo yashevu sham {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י שִׁמְע֑וֹן נְמוּאֵ֣ל וְיָמִ֔ין יָרִ֖יב זֶ֥רַח שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: The sons of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul;
Transliteration: veney shimevon nemuel veyamiyn yariyv zerach shaul

Hebrew: שַׁלֻּ֥ם בְּנ֛וֹ מִבְשָׂ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ מִשְׁמָ֥ע בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Shallum, his son Mibsam, his son Mishma.
Transliteration: shalum venvo mivesham venvo mishema venvo

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י מִשְׁמָ֑ע חַמּוּאֵ֥ל בְּנ֛וֹ זַכּ֥וּר בְּנ֖וֹ שִׁמְעִ֥י בְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: The sons of Mishma: his son Hammuel, his son Zaccur, his son Shimei.
Transliteration: uveney mishema chamuel venvo zakhur venvo shimeiy venvo

Hebrew: וּלְשִׁמְעִ֞י בָּנִ֨ים שִׁשָּׁ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ וּבָנ֣וֹת שֵׁ֔שׁ וּלְאֶחָ֕יו אֵ֖ין בָּנִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וְכֹל֙ מִשְׁפַּחְתָּ֔ם לֹ֥א הִרְבּ֖וּ עַד־בְּנֵ֥י יְהוּדָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brothers had not many children; in all, their families were not as prolific as the Judahites.
Transliteration: uleshimeiy vaniym shishah ashar uvanvot shesh uleechayv eyn vaniym raviym vekhol mishefachetam lo hirevu ad-veney yehudah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥שְׁב֛וּ בִּבְאֵֽר־שֶׁ֥בַע וּמוֹלָדָ֖ה וַחֲצַ֥ר שׁוּעָֽל׃
Translated: They dwelt in Beersheba, Moladah, Hazar-shual,
Transliteration: vayeshevu viveer-sheva umvoladah vachatsar shual

Hebrew: וּבְבִלְהָ֥ה וּבְעֶ֖צֶם וּבְתוֹלָֽד׃
Translated: Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
Transliteration: uvevilehah uveetsem uvetvolad

Hebrew: וּבִבְתוּאֵ֥ל וּבְחׇרְמָ֖ה וּבְצִֽיקְלָֽג׃
Translated: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
Transliteration: uvivetuel uvechׇremah uvetsiykelag

Hebrew: וּבְבֵ֤ית מַרְכָּבוֹת֙ וּבַחֲצַ֣ר סוּסִ֔ים וּבְבֵ֥ית בִּרְאִ֖י וּֽבְשַׁעֲרָ֑יִם אֵ֥לֶּה עָרֵיהֶ֖ם עַד־מְלֹ֥ךְ דָּוִֽיד׃
Translated: Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susim, Beth-biri, and Shaaraim. These were their towns until David became king,
Transliteration: uveveyt marekhavvot uvachatsar susiym uveveyt vireiy uveshaarayiim eleh areyhem ad-melokhe daviyd

Hebrew: וְחַצְרֵיהֶם֙ עֵיטָ֣ם וָעַ֔יִן רִמּ֥וֹן וְתֹ֖כֶן וְעָשָׁ֑ן עָרִ֖ים חָמֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: together with their villages, Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Tochen, and Ashan—five towns,
Transliteration: vechatsereyhem eytam vaayiin rimvon vetokhen veashan ariym chamesh

Hebrew: וְכׇל־חַצְרֵיהֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֧ר סְבִיב֛וֹת הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה עַד־בָּ֑עַל {ס} זֹ֚את מֽוֹשְׁבֹתָ֔ם וְהִתְיַחְשָׂ֖ם לָהֶֽם׃
Translated:
along with all their villages that were around these towns as far as Baal; such were their settlements.
Registered in their genealogy were:
Transliteration: vekhׇl-chatsereyhem asher seviyvvot heariym haeleh ad-vaal {s} zot mvoshevotam vehiteyachesham lahem

Hebrew: וּמְשׁוֹבָ֣ב וְיַמְלֵ֔ךְ וְיוֹשָׁ֖ה בֶּן־אֲמַצְיָֽה׃
Translated: Meshobab, Jamlech, Joshah son of Amaziah,
Transliteration: umeshvovav veyamelekhe veyvoshah ven-amatseyah

Hebrew: וְיוֹאֵ֑ל וְיֵהוּא֙ בֶּן־י֣וֹשִׁבְיָ֔ה בֶּן־שְׂרָיָ֖ה בֶּן־עֲשִׂיאֵֽל׃
Translated: Joel, Jehu son of Joshibiah son of Seraiah son of Asiel.
Transliteration: veyvoel veeihu ven-yvoshiveyah ven-sherayah ven-ashiyel

Hebrew: וְאֶלְיוֹעֵינַ֡י וְֽיַעֲקֹ֡בָה וִ֠ישׁוֹחָיָ֠ה וַעֲשָׂיָ֧ה וַעֲדִיאֵ֛ל וִישִׂימִאֵ֖ל וּבְנָיָֽה׃
Translated: Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah,
Transliteration: veeleyvoeynay veyaakovah viyshvochayah vaashayah vaadiyel viyshiymiel uvenayah

Hebrew: וְזִיזָ֨א בֶן־שִׁפְעִ֧י בֶן־אַלּ֛וֹן בֶּן־יְדָיָ֥ה בֶן־שִׁמְרִ֖י בֶּן־שְׁמַֽעְיָֽה׃
Translated: Ziza son of Shiphi son of Allon son of Jedaiah son of Shimri son of Shemaiah—
Transliteration: veziyza ven-shifeiy ven-alvon ven-yedayah ven-shimeriy ven-shemaeyah

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה הַבָּאִ֣ים בְּשֵׁמ֔וֹת נְשִׂיאִ֖ים בְּמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָ֑ם וּבֵית֙ אֲב֣וֹתֵיהֶ֔ם פָּרְצ֖וּ לָרֽוֹב׃
Translated: these mentioned by name were chiefs in their families, and their clans increased greatly.
Transliteration: eleh havaiym veshemvot neshiyiym vemishefechvotam uveyt avvoteyhem faretsu larvov

Hebrew: וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ לִמְב֣וֹא גְדֹ֔ר עַ֖ד לְמִזְרַ֣ח הַגָּ֑יְא לְבַקֵּ֥שׁ מִרְעֶ֖ה לְצֹאנָֽם׃
Translated: They went to the approaches to Gedor, to the eastern side of the valley, in search of pasture for their flocks.
Transliteration: vayelekhu limevvo gedor ad lemizerach hagaye levakesh mireeh letsonam

Hebrew: וַֽיִּמְצְא֤וּ מִרְעֶה֙ שָׁמֵ֣ן וָט֔וֹב וְהָאָ֙רֶץ֙ רַחֲבַ֣ת יָדַ֔יִם וְשֹׁקֶ֖טֶת וּשְׁלֵוָ֑ה כִּ֣י מִן־חָ֔ם הַיֹּשְׁבִ֥ים שָׁ֖ם לְפָנִֽים׃
Translated: They found rich, good pasture, and the land was ample, quiet, and peaceful. The former inhabitants were of Ham;
Transliteration: vayimetseu mireeh shamen vatvov vehaarets rachavat yadayiim veshoketet ushelevah khiy min-cham hayosheviym sham lefaniym

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֡אוּ אֵ֩לֶּה֩ הַכְּתוּבִ֨ים בְּשֵׁמ֜וֹת בִּימֵ֣י ׀ יְחִזְקִיָּ֣הוּ מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֗ה וַיַּכּ֨וּ אֶת־אׇהֳלֵיהֶ֜ם וְאֶת־[הַמְּעוּנִ֨ים] (המעינים) אֲשֶׁ֤ר נִמְצְאֽוּ־שָׁ֙מָּה֙ וַיַּֽחֲרִימֻם֙ עַד־הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ תַּחְתֵּיהֶ֑ם כִּי־מִרְעֶ֥ה לְצֹאנָ֖ם שָֽׁם׃
Translated: those recorded by name came in the days of King Hezekiah of Judah, and attacked their encampments and the Meunim who were found there, and wiped them out forever, and settled in their place, because there was pasture there for their flocks.
Transliteration: vayavou eleh hakhetuviym veshemvot viymey yechizekiyahu melekhe-yehudah vayakhu et-ׇholeyhem veet-[hameuniym] (hmynym) asher nimetseu-shamah vayachariymum ad-hayyvom hazeh vayeshevu tacheteyhem khiy-mireeh letsonam sham

Hebrew: וּמֵהֶ֣ם ׀ מִן־בְּנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֗וֹן הָֽלְכוּ֙ לְהַ֣ר שֵׂעִ֔יר אֲנָשִׁ֖ים חֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֑וֹת וּפְלַטְיָ֡ה וּ֠נְעַרְיָ֠ה וּרְפָיָ֧ה וְעֻזִּיאֵ֛ל בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׁעִ֖י בְּרֹאשָֽׁם׃
Translated: And some of them, five hundred of the Simeonites, went to Mount Seir, with Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, sons of Ishi, at their head,
Transliteration: umehem min-veney shimevon halekhu lehar sheiyr anashiym chamesh mevot ufelateyah uneareyah urefayah veuziyel veney yisheiy verosham

Hebrew: וַיַּכּ֕וּ אֶת־שְׁאֵרִ֥ית הַפְּלֵטָ֖ה לַעֲמָלֵ֑ק וַיֵּ֣שְׁבוּ שָׁ֔ם עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: and they destroyed the last surviving Amalekites, and they live there to this day.
Transliteration: vayakhu et-sheeriyt hafeletah laamalek vayeshevu sham ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֨י רְאוּבֵ֥ן בְּכֽוֹר־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ כִּ֣י ה֣וּא הַבְּכוֹר֒ וּֽבְחַלְּלוֹ֙ יְצוּעֵ֣י אָבִ֔יו נִתְּנָה֙ בְּכֹ֣רָת֔וֹ לִבְנֵ֥י יוֹסֵ֖ף בֶּן־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹ֥א לְהִתְיַחֵ֖שׂ לַבְּכֹרָֽה׃
Translated: The sons of Reuben the first-born of Israel. (He was the first-born; but when he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph son of Israel, so he is not reckoned as first-born in the genealogy;
Transliteration: uveney reuven vekhvor-yisherael khiy hu havekhvor uvechalelvo yetsuey aviyv nitenah vekhoratvo liveney yvosef ven-yisherael velo lehiteyachesh lavekhorah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יְהוּדָה֙ גָּבַ֣ר בְּאֶחָ֔יו וּלְנָגִ֖יד מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וְהַבְּכֹרָ֖ה לְיוֹסֵֽף׃ {ס}
Translated: though Judah became more powerful than his brothers and a leader came from him, yet the birthright belonged to Joseph.)
Transliteration: khiy yehudah gavar veechayv ulenagiyd mimenu vehavekhorah leyvosef {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י רְאוּבֵ֖ן בְּכ֣וֹר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל חֲנ֥וֹךְ וּפַלּ֖וּא חֶצְר֥וֹן וְכַרְמִֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Reuben, the first-born of Israel: Enoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
Transliteration: veney reuven vekhvor yisherael chanvokhe ufalu chetservon vekharemiy

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י יוֹאֵ֑ל שְׁמַֽעְיָ֥ה בְנ֛וֹ גּ֥וֹג בְּנ֖וֹ שִׁמְעִ֥י בְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: The sons of Joel: his son Shemaiah, his son Gog, his son Shimei,
Transliteration: veney yvoel shemaeyah venvo gvog venvo shimeiy venvo

Hebrew: מִיכָ֥ה בְנ֛וֹ רְאָיָ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ בַּ֥עַל בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Micah, his son Reaiah, his son Baal,
Transliteration: miykhah venvo reayah venvo vaal venvo

Hebrew: בְּאֵרָ֣ה בְנ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶגְלָ֔ה תִּלְּגַ֥ת פִּלְנְאֶ֖סֶר מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשֻּׁ֑ר ה֥וּא נָשִׂ֖יא לָרֽאוּבֵנִֽי׃
Translated: his son Beerah—whom King Tillegath-pilneser of Assyria exiled—was chieftain of the Reubenites.
Transliteration: veerah venvo asher hegelah tilegat fileneeser melekhe ashur hu nashiy laruveniy

Hebrew: וְאֶחָיו֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔יו בְּהִתְיַחֵ֖שׂ לְתֹלְדוֹתָ֑ם הָרֹ֥אשׁ יְעִיאֵ֖ל וּזְכַרְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: And his kinsmen, by their families, according to their lines in the genealogy: the head, Jeiel, and Zechariah,
Transliteration: veechayv lemishefechotayv vehiteyachesh letoledvotam harosh yeiyel uzekhareyahu

Hebrew: וּבֶ֙לַע֙ בֶּן־עָזָ֔ז בֶּן־שֶׁ֖מַע בֶּן־יוֹאֵ֑ל ה֚וּא יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בַּעֲרֹעֵ֔ר וְעַד־נְב֖וֹ וּבַ֥עַל מְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: and Bela son of Azaz son of Shema son of Joel; he dwelt in Aroer as far as Nebo and Baal-meon.
Transliteration: uvela ven-azaz ven-shema ven-yvoel hu yvoshev vaaroer vead-nevvo uvaal mevon

Hebrew: וְלַמִּזְרָ֗ח יָשַׁב֙ עַד־לְב֣וֹא מִדְבָּ֔רָה לְמִן־הַנָּהָ֖ר פְּרָ֑ת כִּ֧י מִקְנֵיהֶ֛ם רָב֖וּ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ גִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: He also dwelt to the east as far as the fringe of the wilderness this side of the Euphrates, because their cattle had increased in the land of Gilead.
Transliteration: velamizerach yashav ad-levvo midevarah lemin-hanahar ferat khiy mikeneyhem ravu veerets gilead

Hebrew: וּבִימֵ֣י שָׁא֗וּל עָשׂ֤וּ מִלְחָמָה֙ עִם־הַֽהַגְרִאִ֔ים וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ בְּיָדָ֑ם וַיֵּֽשְׁבוּ֙ בְּאׇ֣הֳלֵיהֶ֔ם עַֽל־כׇּל־פְּנֵ֖י מִזְרָ֥ח לַגִּלְעָֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: And in the days of Saul they made war on the Hagrites, who fell by their hand; and they occupied their tents throughout all the region east of Gilead.
Transliteration: uviymey shaul ashu milechamah im-hahageriiym vayifelu veyadam vayeshevu veׇholeyhem al-khׇl-feney mizerach lagilead {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵי־גָ֣ד לְנֶגְדָּ֗ם יָ֥שְׁב֛וּ בְּאֶ֥רֶץ הַבָּשָׁ֖ן עַד־סַלְכָֽה׃
Translated: The sons of Gad dwelt facing them in the land of Bashan as far as Salcah:
Transliteration: uveney-gad lenegedam yashevu veerets havashan ad-salekhah

Hebrew: יוֹאֵ֣ל הָרֹ֔אשׁ וְשָׁפָ֖ם הַמִּשְׁנֶ֑ה וְיַעְנַ֥י וְשָׁפָ֖ט בַּבָּשָֽׁן׃
Translated: Joel the chief, Shapham the second, Janai, and Shaphat in Bashan.
Transliteration: yvoel harosh veshafam hamisheneh veyaenay veshafat vavashan

Hebrew: וַאֲחֵיהֶ֞ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם מִיכָאֵ֡ל וּמְשֻׁלָּ֡ם וְ֠שֶׁ֠בַע וְיוֹרַ֧י וְיַעְכָּ֛ן וְזִ֥יעַ וָעֵ֖בֶר שִׁבְעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And by clans: Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jacan, Zia, and Eber—seven.
Transliteration: vaacheyhem leveyt avvoteyhem miykhael umeshulam vesheva veyvoray veyaekhan veziya vaever shiveah {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה ׀ בְּנֵ֣י אֲבִיחַ֗יִל בֶּן־חוּרִ֡י בֶּן־יָ֠ר֠וֹחַ בֶּן־גִּלְעָ֧ד בֶּן־מִיכָאֵ֛ל בֶּן־יְשִׁישַׁ֥י בֶּן־יַחְדּ֖וֹ בֶּן־בּֽוּז׃
Translated: These were the sons of Abihail son of Huri son of Jaroah son of Gilead son of Michael son of Jeshishai son of Jahdo son of Buz;
Transliteration: eleh veney aviychayiil ven-churiy ven-yarvocha ven-gilead ven-miykhael ven-yeshiyshay ven-yachedvo ven-vuz

Hebrew: אֲחִי֙ בֶּן־עַבְדִּיאֵ֣ל בֶּן־גּוּנִ֔י רֹ֖אשׁ לְבֵ֥ית אֲבוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Ahi son of Abdiel son of Guni was chief of their clan,
Transliteration: achiy ven-avediyel ven-guniy rosh leveyt avvotam

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥שְׁב֛וּ בַּגִּלְעָ֥ד בַּבָּשָׁ֖ן וּבִבְנֹתֶ֑יהָ וּבְכׇֽל־מִגְרְשֵׁ֥י שָׁר֖וֹן עַל־תּוֹצְאוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: and they dwelt in Gilead, in Bashan, and in its dependencies, and in all the pasturelands of Sharon, to their limits.
Transliteration: vayeshevu vagilead vavashan uvivenoteyha uvekhׇl-migereshey sharvon al-tvotsevotam

Hebrew: כֻּלָּם֙ הִתְיַחְשׂ֔וּ בִּימֵ֖י יוֹתָ֣ם מֶֽלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֑ה וּבִימֵ֖י יָרׇבְעָ֥ם מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: All of them were registered by genealogies in the days of King Jotham of Judah, and in the days of King Jeroboam of Israel.
Transliteration: khulam hiteyacheshu viymey yvotam melekhe-yehudah uviymey yarׇveam melekhe-yisherael {f}

Hebrew: בְּנֵי־רְאוּבֵ֨ן וְגָדִ֜י וַחֲצִ֥י שֵֽׁבֶט־מְנַשֶּׁה֮ מִן־בְּנֵי־חַ֒יִל֒ אֲ֠נָשִׁ֠ים נֹשְׂאֵ֨י מָגֵ֤ן וְחֶ֙רֶב֙ וְדֹ֣רְכֵי קֶ֔שֶׁת וּלְמוּדֵ֖י מִלְחָמָ֑ה אַרְבָּעִ֨ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֥ה אֶ֛לֶף וּשְׁבַע־מֵא֥וֹת וְשִׁשִּׁ֖ים יֹצְאֵ֥י צָבָֽא׃
Translated: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh had warriors who carried shield and sword, drew the bow, and were experienced at war—44,760, ready for service.
Transliteration: veney-reuven vegadiy vachatsiy shevet-menasheh min-veney-chayiil anashiym nosheey magen vecherev vedorekhey keshet ulemudey milechamah arevaiym vearevaah elef usheva-mevot veshishiym yotseey tsava

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֥וּ מִלְחָמָ֖ה עִם־הַהַגְרִיאִ֑ים וִיט֥וּר וְנָפִ֖ישׁ וְנוֹדָֽב׃
Translated: They made war on the Hagrites—Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.
Transliteration: vayaashu milechamah im-hahageriyiym viytur venafiysh venvodav

Hebrew: וַיֵּעָזְר֣וּ עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּנָּתְנ֤וּ בְיָדָם֙ הַֽהַגְרִיאִ֔ים וְכֹ֖ל שֶׁ֣עִמָּהֶ֑ם כִּ֠י לֵאלֹהִ֤ים זָעֲקוּ֙ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְנַעְתּ֥וֹר לָהֶ֖ם כִּי־בָ֥טְחוּ בֽוֹ׃
Translated: They prevailed against them; the Hagrites and all who were with them were delivered into their hands, for they cried to God in the battle, and He responded to their entreaty because they trusted in Him.
Transliteration: vayeazeru aleyhem vayinatenu veyadam hahageriyiym vekhol sheimahem khiy lelohiym zaaku vamilechamah venaetvor lahem khiy-vatechu vvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁבּ֣וּ מִקְנֵיהֶ֗ם גְּֽמַלֵּיהֶ֞ם חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אֶ֙לֶף֙ וְצֹ֗אן מָאתַ֤יִם וַחֲמִשִּׁים֙ אֶ֔לֶף וַחֲמוֹרִ֖ים אַלְפָּ֑יִם וְנֶ֥פֶשׁ אָדָ֖ם מֵ֥אָה אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: They carried off their livestock: 50,000 of their camels, 250,000 sheep, 2,000 asses, and 100,000 people.
Transliteration: vayishevu mikeneyhem gemaleyhem chamishiym elef vetson matayiim vachamishiym elef vachamvoriym alefayiim venefesh adam meah alef

Hebrew: כִּֽי־חֲלָלִ֤ים רַבִּים֙ נָפָ֔לוּ כִּ֥י מֵהָאֱלֹהִ֖ים הַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וַיֵּשְׁב֥וּ תַחְתֵּיהֶ֖ם עַד־הַגֹּלָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: For many fell slain, because it was God’s battle. And they dwelt in their place until the exile.
Transliteration: khiy-chalaliym raviym nafalu khiy mehaElohim hamilechamah vayeshevu tacheteyhem ad-hagolah {f}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֗י חֲצִי֙ שֵׁ֣בֶט מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה יָשְׁב֖וּ בָּאָ֑רֶץ מִבָּשָׁ֞ן עַד־בַּ֧עַל חֶרְמ֛וֹן וּשְׂנִ֥יר וְהַר־חֶרְמ֖וֹן הֵ֥מָּה רָבֽוּ׃
Translated: The members of the half-tribe of Manasseh dwelt in the land; they were very numerous from Bashan to Baal-hermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon.
Transliteration: uveney chatsiy shevet menasheh yashevu vaarets mivashan ad-vaal cheremvon usheniyr vehar-cheremvon hemah ravu

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה רָאשֵׁ֣י בֵית־אֲבוֹתָ֑ם וְעֵ֡פֶר וְיִשְׁעִ֡י וֶאֱלִיאֵ֡ל וְ֠עַזְרִיאֵ֠ל וְיִרְמְיָ֨ה וְהוֹדַוְיָ֜ה וְיַחְדִּיאֵ֗ל אֲנָשִׁים֙ גִּבּ֣וֹרֵי חַ֔יִל אַנְשֵׁ֣י שֵׁמ֔וֹת רָאשִׁ֖ים לְבֵ֥ית אֲבוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: These were the chiefs of their clans: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, men of substance, famous men, chiefs of their clans.
Transliteration: veeleh rashey veyt-avvotam veefer veyisheiy veeliyel veazeriyel veyiremeyah vehvodaveyah veyachediyel anashiym givvorey chayiil aneshey shemvot rashiym leveyt avvotam

Hebrew: וַיִּֽמְעֲל֔וּ בֵּאלֹהֵ֖י אֲבֹתֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּזְנ֗וּ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י עַמֵּֽי־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־הִשְׁמִ֥יד אֱלֹהִ֖ים מִפְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: But they trespassed against the God of their fathers by going astray after the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had destroyed before them.
Transliteration: vayimealu velohey avoteyhem vayizenu acharey elohey amey-haarets asher-hishemiyd Elohim mifeneyhem

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩עַר֩ אֱלֹהֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־ר֣וּחַ ׀ פּ֣וּל מֶלֶךְ־אַשּׁ֗וּר וְאֶת־ר֙וּחַ֙ תִּלְּגַ֤ת פִּלְנֶ֙סֶר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ אַשּׁ֔וּר וַיַּגְלֵם֙ לָראוּבֵנִ֣י וְלַגָּדִ֔י וְלַחֲצִ֖י שֵׁ֣בֶט מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וַ֠יְבִיאֵ֠ם לַחְלַ֨ח וְחָב֤וֹר וְהָרָא֙ וּנְהַ֣ר גּוֹזָ֔ן עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: So the God of Israel roused the spirit of King Pul of Assyria—the spirit of King Tillegath-pilneser of Assyria—and he carried them away, namely, the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, and brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and the river Gozan, to this day.
Transliteration: vayaar elohey yisherael et-rucha ful melekhe-ashur veet-rucha tilegat fileneser melekhe ashur vayagelem laruveniy velagadiy velachatsiy shevet menasheh vayeviyem lachelach vechavvor vehara unehar gvozan ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י לֵוִ֑י גֵּרְשׁ֕וֹן קְהָ֖ת וּמְרָרִֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
Transliteration: veney leviy gereshvon kehat umerariy

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י קְהָ֑ת עַמְרָ֣ם יִצְהָ֔ר וְחֶבְר֖וֹן וְעֻזִּיאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
Transliteration: uveney kehat ameram yitsehar vechevervon veuziyel {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י עַמְרָ֔ם אַהֲרֹ֥ן וּמֹשֶׁ֖ה וּמִרְיָ֑ם {ס} וּבְנֵ֣י אַֽהֲרֹ֔ן נָדָב֙ וַאֲבִיה֔וּא אֶלְעָזָ֖ר וְאִיתָמָֽר׃
Translated: The children of Amram: Aaron, Moses, and Miriam. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
Transliteration: uveney ameram aharon umosheh umireyam {s} uveney aharon nadav vaaviyhu eleazar veiytamar

Hebrew: אֶלְעָזָר֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־פִּֽינְחָ֔ס פִּֽינְחָ֖ס הֹלִ֥יד אֶת־אֲבִישֽׁוּעַ׃
Translated: Eleazar begot Phinehas, Phinehas begot Abishua,
Transliteration: eleazar hvoliyd et-fiynechas fiynechas holiyd et-aviyshua

Hebrew: וַאֲבִישׁ֙וּעַ֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־בֻּקִּ֔י וּבֻקִּ֖י הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־עֻזִּֽי׃
Translated: Abishua begot Bukki, Bukki begot Uzzi,
Transliteration: vaaviyshua hvoliyd et-vukiy uvukiy hvoliyd et-uziy

Hebrew: וְעֻזִּי֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־זְרַֽחְיָ֔ה וּֽזְרַֽחְיָ֖ה הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־מְרָיֽוֹת׃
Translated: Uzzi begot Zerahiah, Zerahiah begot Meraioth,
Transliteration: veuziy hvoliyd et-zeracheyah uzeracheyah hvoliyd et-merayvot

Hebrew: מְרָיוֹת֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־אֲמַרְיָ֔ה וַאֲמַרְיָ֖ה הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־אֲחִיטֽוּב׃
Translated: Meraioth begot Amariah, Amariah begot Ahitub,
Transliteration: merayvot hvoliyd et-amareyah vaamareyah hvoliyd et-achiytuv

Hebrew: וַֽאֲחִיטוּב֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־צָד֔וֹק וְצָד֖וֹק הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־אֲחִימָֽעַץ׃
Translated: Ahitub begot Zadok, Zadok begot Ahimaaz,
Transliteration: vaachiytuv hvoliyd et-tsadvok vetsadvok hvoliyd et-achiymaats

Hebrew: וַאֲחִימַ֙עַץ֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־עֲזַרְיָ֔ה וַעֲזַרְיָ֖ה הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־יוֹחָנָֽן׃
Translated: Ahimaaz begot Azariah, Azariah begot Johanan,
Transliteration: vaachiymaats hvoliyd et-azareyah vaazareyah hvoliyd et-yvochanan

Hebrew: וְיוֹחָנָ֖ן הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־עֲזַרְיָ֑ה ה֚וּא אֲשֶׁ֣ר כִּהֵ֔ן בַּבַּ֕יִת אֲשֶׁר־בָּנָ֥ה שְׁלֹמֹ֖ה בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: and Johanan begot Azariah (it was he who served as priest in the House that Solomon built in Jerusalem).
Transliteration: veyvochanan hvoliyd et-azareyah hu asher khihen vavayiit asher-vanah shelomoh viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיּ֥וֹלֶד עֲזַרְיָ֖ה אֶת־אֲמַרְיָ֑ה וַאֲמַרְיָ֖ה הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־אֲחִיטֽוּב׃
Translated: Azariah begot Amariah, Amariah begot Ahitub,
Transliteration: vayyvoled azareyah et-amareyah vaamareyah hvoliyd et-achiytuv

Hebrew: וַֽאֲחִיטוּב֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־צָד֔וֹק וְצָד֖וֹק הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־שַׁלּֽוּם׃
Translated: Ahitub begot Zadok, Zadok begot Shallum,
Transliteration: vaachiytuv hvoliyd et-tsadvok vetsadvok hvoliyd et-shalum

Hebrew: וְשַׁלּוּם֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־חִלְקִיָּ֔ה וְחִלְקִיָּ֖ה הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־עֲזַרְיָֽה׃
Translated: Shallum begot Hilkiah, Hilkiah begot Azariah,
Transliteration: veshalum hvoliyd et-chilekiyah vechilekiyah hvoliyd et-azareyah

Hebrew: וַעֲזַרְיָה֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־שְׂרָיָ֔ה וּשְׂרָיָ֖ה הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־יְהוֹצָדָֽק׃
Translated: Azariah begot Seraiah, Seraiah begot Jehozadak;
Transliteration: vaazareyah hvoliyd et-sherayah usherayah hvoliyd et-yehvotsadak

Hebrew: וִיהוֹצָדָ֣ק הָלַ֔ךְ בְּהַגְל֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶת־יְהוּדָ֖ה וִירֽוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם בְּיַ֖ד נְבֻכַדְנֶאצַּֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: and Jehozadak went into exile when the L<small>ORD</small> exiled Judah and Jerusalem by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
Transliteration: viyhvotsadak halakhe vehagelvot yehovah et-yehudah viyrushala͏im veyad nevukhadenetsar {f}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י לֵוִ֑י גֵּרְשֹׁ֕ם קְהָ֖ת וּמְרָרִֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
Transliteration: veney leviy gereshom kehat umerariy

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה שְׁמ֥וֹת בְּֽנֵי־גֵרְשׁ֖וֹם לִבְנִ֥י וְשִׁמְעִֽי׃
Translated: And these are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot veney-gereshvom liveniy veshimeiy

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י קְהָ֑ת עַמְרָ֣ם וְיִצְהָ֔ר וְחֶבְר֖וֹן וְעֻזִּיאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
Transliteration: uveney kehat ameram veyitsehar vechevervon veuziyel {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י מְרָרִ֖י מַחְלִ֣י וּמֻשִׁ֑י וְאֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּח֥וֹת הַלֵּוִ֖י לַאֲבֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. These were the families of the Levites according to their clans.
Transliteration: veney merariy macheliy umushiy veeleh mishefechvot haleviy laavoteyhem

Hebrew: לְֽגֵרְשׁ֑וֹם לִבְנִ֥י בְנ֛וֹ יַ֥חַת בְּנ֖וֹ זִמָּ֥ה בְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: Of Gershom: his son Libni, his son Jahath, his son Zimmah,
Transliteration: legereshvom liveniy venvo yachat venvo zimah venvo

Hebrew: יוֹאָ֤ח בְּנוֹ֙ עִדּ֣וֹ בְנ֔וֹ זֶ֥רַח בְּנ֖וֹ יְאׇתְרַ֥י בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Joah, his son Iddo, his son Zerah, his son Jeatherai.
Transliteration: yvoach venvo idvo venvo zerach venvo yeׇteray venvo

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י קְהָ֑ת עַמִּינָדָ֣ב בְּנ֔וֹ קֹ֥רַח בְּנ֖וֹ אַסִּ֥יר בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: The sons of Kohath: his son Amminadab, his son Korah, his son Assir,
Transliteration: veney kehat amiynadav venvo korach venvo asiyr venvo

Hebrew: אֶלְקָנָ֥ה בְנ֛וֹ וְאֶבְיָסָ֥ף בְּנ֖וֹ וְאַסִּ֥יר בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Elkanah, his son Ebiasaph, his son Assir,
Transliteration: elekanah venvo veeveyasaf venvo veasiyr venvo

Hebrew: תַּ֤חַת בְּנוֹ֙ אוּרִיאֵ֣ל בְּנ֔וֹ עֻזִּיָּ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ וְשָׁא֥וּל בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Tahath, his son Uriel, his son Uzziah, and his son Shaul.
Transliteration: tachat venvo uriyel venvo uziyah venvo veshaul venvo

Hebrew: וּבְנֵי֙ אֶלְקָנָ֔ה עֲמָשַׂ֖י וַאֲחִימֽוֹת׃
Translated: The sons of Elkanah: Amasai and Ahimoth,
Transliteration: uveney elekanah amashay vaachiymvot

Hebrew: אֶלְקָנָ֑ה (בנו) [בְּנֵי֙] אֶלְקָנָ֔ה צוֹפַ֥י בְּנ֖וֹ וְנַ֥חַת בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Elkanah, his son Zophai, his son Nahath,
Transliteration: elekanah (vnv) [veney] elekanah tsvofay venvo venachat venvo

Hebrew: אֱלִיאָ֥ב בְּנ֛וֹ יְרֹחָ֥ם בְּנ֖וֹ אֶלְקָנָ֥ה בְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Eliab, his son Jeroham, his son Elkanah.
Transliteration: eliyav venvo yerocham venvo elekanah venvo

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֧י שְׁמוּאֵ֛ל הַבְּכֹ֥ר וַשְׁנִ֖י וַאֲבִיָּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Samuel: his first-born Vashni, and Abijah.
Transliteration: uveney shemuel havekhor vasheniy vaaviyah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י מְרָרִ֖י מַחְלִ֑י לִבְנִ֥י בְנ֛וֹ שִׁמְעִ֥י בְנ֖וֹ עֻזָּ֥ה בְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: The sons of Merari: Mahli, his son Libni, his son Shimei, his son Uzzah,
Transliteration: veney merariy macheliy liveniy venvo shimeiy venvo uzah venvo

Hebrew: שִׁמְעָ֥א בְנ֛וֹ חַגִּיָּ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ עֲשָׂיָ֥ה בְנֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: his son Shimea, his son Haggiah, and his son Asaiah.
Transliteration: shimea venvo chagiyah venvo ashayah venvo {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶעֱמִ֥יד דָּוִ֛יד עַל־יְדֵי־שִׁ֖יר בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה מִמְּנ֖וֹחַ הָאָרֽוֹן׃
Translated: These were appointed by David to be in charge of song in the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, from the time the Ark came to rest.
Transliteration: veeleh asher heemiyd daviyd al-yedey-shiyr veyt yehovah mimenvocha haarvon

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֨וּ מְשָֽׁרְתִ֜ים לִפְנֵ֨י מִשְׁכַּ֤ן אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵד֙ בַּשִּׁ֔יר עַד־בְּנ֧וֹת שְׁלֹמֹ֛ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָ֖ה בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיַּעַמְד֥וּ כְמִשְׁפָּטָ֖ם עַל־עֲבוֹדָתָֽם׃
Translated: They served at the Tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting with song until Solomon built the House of the L<small>ORD</small> in Jerusalem; and they carried out their duties as prescribed for them.
Transliteration: vayiheyu mesharetiym lifeney mishekhan ohel-mvoed vashiyr ad-venvot shelomoh et-veyt yehovah viyrushala͏im vayaamedu khemishefatam al-avvodatam

Hebrew: וְאֵ֥לֶּה הָעֹמְדִ֖ים וּבְנֵיהֶ֑ם מִבְּנֵי֙ הַקְּהָתִ֔י הֵימָן֙ הַמְשׁוֹרֵ֔ר בֶּן־יוֹאֵ֖ל בֶּן־שְׁמוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: Those were the appointed men; and their sons were: the Kohathites: Heman the singer, son of Joel son of Samuel
Transliteration: veeleh haomediym uveneyhem miveney hakehatiy heyman hameshvorer ven-yvoel ven-shemuel

Hebrew: בֶּן־אֶלְקָנָה֙ בֶּן־יְרֹחָ֔ם בֶּן־אֱלִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־תּֽוֹחַ׃
Translated: son of Elkanah son of Jeroham son of Eliel son of Toah
Transliteration: ven-elekanah ven-yerocham ven-eliyel ven-tvocha

Hebrew: בֶּן־[צוּף֙] (ציף) בֶּן־אֶלְקָנָ֔ה בֶּן־מַ֖חַת בֶּן־עֲמָשָֽׂי׃
Translated: son of Zuph son of Elkanah son of Mahath son of Amasai
Transliteration: ven-[tsuf] (tsyf) ven-elekanah ven-machat ven-amashay

Hebrew: בֶּן־אֶלְקָנָה֙ בֶּן־יוֹאֵ֔ל בֶּן־עֲזַרְיָ֖ה בֶּן־צְפַנְיָֽה׃
Translated: son of Elkanah son of Joel son of Azariah son of Zephaniah
Transliteration: ven-elekanah ven-yvoel ven-azareyah ven-tsefaneyah

Hebrew: בֶּן־תַּ֙חַת֙ בֶּן־אַסִּ֔יר בֶּן־אֶבְיָסָ֖ף בֶּן־קֹֽרַח׃
Translated: son of Tahath son of Assir son of Ebiasaph son of Korah
Transliteration: ven-tachat ven-asiyr ven-eveyasaf ven-korach

Hebrew: בֶּן־יִצְהָ֣ר בֶּן־קְהָ֔ת בֶּן־לֵוִ֖י בֶּן־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: son of Izhar son of Kohath son of Levi son of Israel;
Transliteration: ven-yitsehar ven-kehat ven-leviy ven-yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וְאָחִ֣יו אָסָ֔ף הָעֹמֵ֖ד עַל־יְמִינ֑וֹ אָסָ֥ף בֶּן־בֶּרֶכְיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־שִׁמְעָֽא׃
Translated: and his kinsman Asaph, who stood on his right, namely, Asaph son of Berechiah son of Shimea
Transliteration: veachiyv asaf haomed al-yemiynvo asaf ven-verekheyahu ven-shimea

Hebrew: בֶּן־מִיכָאֵ֥ל בֶּן־בַּעֲשֵׂיָ֖ה בֶּן־מַלְכִּיָּֽה׃
Translated: son of Michael son of Baaseiah son of Malchijah
Transliteration: ven-miykhael ven-vaasheyah ven-malekhiyah

Hebrew: בֶּן־אֶתְנִ֥י בֶן־זֶ֖רַח בֶּן־עֲדָיָֽה׃
Translated: son of Ethni son of Zerah son of Adaiah
Transliteration: ven-eteniy ven-zerach ven-adayah

Hebrew: בֶּן־אֵיתָ֥ן בֶּן־זִמָּ֖ה בֶּן־שִׁמְעִֽי׃
Translated: son of Ethan son of Zimmah son of Shimei
Transliteration: ven-eytan ven-zimah ven-shimeiy

Hebrew: בֶּן־יַ֥חַת בֶּן־גֵּרְשֹׁ֖ם בֶּן־לֵוִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: son of Jahath son of Gershom son of Levi.
Transliteration: ven-yachat ven-gereshom ven-leviy {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֧י מְרָרִ֛י אֲחֵיהֶ֖ם עַֽל־הַשְּׂמֹ֑אול אֵיתָן֙ בֶּן־קִישִׁ֔י בֶּן־עַבְדִּ֖י בֶּן־מַלּֽוּךְ׃
Translated: On the left were their kinsmen: the sons of Merari: Ethan son of Kishi son of Abdi son of Malluch
Transliteration: uveney merariy acheyhem al-hashemovl eytan ven-kiyshiy ven-avediy ven-malukhe

Hebrew: בֶּן־חֲשַׁבְיָ֥ה בֶן־אֲמַצְיָ֖ה בֶּן־חִלְקִיָּֽה׃
Translated: son of Hashabiah son of Amaziah son of Hilkiah
Transliteration: ven-chashaveyah ven-amatseyah ven-chilekiyah

Hebrew: בֶּן־אַמְצִ֥י בֶן־בָּנִ֖י בֶּן־שָֽׁמֶר׃
Translated: son of Amzi son of Bani son of Shemer
Transliteration: ven-ametsiy ven-vaniy ven-shamer

Hebrew: בֶּן־מַחְלִי֙ בֶּן־מוּשִׁ֔י בֶּן־מְרָרִ֖י בֶּן־לֵוִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: son of Mahli son of Mushi son of Merari son of Levi;
Transliteration: ven-macheliy ven-mushiy ven-merariy ven-leviy {s}

Hebrew: וַאֲחֵיהֶ֖ם הַלְוִיִּ֑ם נְתוּנִ֕ים לְכׇ֨ל־עֲבוֹדַ֔ת מִשְׁכַּ֖ן בֵּ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: and their kinsmen the Levites were appointed for all the service of the Tabernacle of the House of God.
Transliteration: vaacheyhem haleviyim netuniym lekhׇl-avvodat mishekhan veyt haElohim

Hebrew: וְֽאַהֲרֹ֨ן וּבָנָ֜יו מַקְטִירִ֨ים עַל־מִזְבַּ֤ח הָעוֹלָה֙ וְעַל־מִזְבַּ֣ח הַקְּטֹ֔רֶת לְכֹ֕ל מְלֶ֖אכֶת קֹ֣דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֑ים וּלְכַפֵּר֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כְּכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֔ה מֹשֶׁ֖ה עֶ֥בֶד הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: But Aaron and his sons made offerings upon the altar of burnt offering and upon the altar of incense, performing all the tasks of the most holy place, to make atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
Transliteration: veaharon uvanayv maketiyriym al-mizevach havolah veal-mizevach haketoret lekhol melekhet kodesh hakodashiym ulekhafer al-yisherael khekhol asher tsivah mosheh eved haElohim {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֑ן אֶלְעָזָ֥ר בְּנ֛וֹ פִּֽינְחָ֥ס בְּנ֖וֹ אֲבִישׁ֥וּעַ בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: These are the sons of Aaron: his son Eleazar, his son Phinehas, his son Abishua,
Transliteration: veeleh veney aharon eleazar venvo fiynechas venvo aviyshua venvo

Hebrew: בֻּקִּ֥י בְנ֛וֹ עֻזִּ֥י בְנ֖וֹ זְרַֽחְיָ֥ה בְנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Bukki, his son Uzzi, his son Zerahiah,
Transliteration: vukiy venvo uziy venvo zeracheyah venvo

Hebrew: מְרָי֥וֹת בְּנ֛וֹ אֲמַרְיָ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ אֲחִיט֥וּב בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Meraioth, his son Amariah, his son Ahitub,
Transliteration: merayvot venvo amareyah venvo achiytuv venvo

Hebrew: צָד֥וֹק בְּנ֖וֹ אֲחִימַ֥עַץ בְּנֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: his son Zadok, his son Ahimaaz.
Transliteration: tsadvok venvo achiymaats venvo {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ מֽוֹשְׁבוֹתָ֔ם לְטִירוֹתָ֖ם בִּגְבוּלָ֑ם לִבְנֵ֤י אַֽהֲרֹן֙ לְמִשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַקְּהָתִ֔י כִּ֥י לָהֶ֖ם הָיָ֥ה הַגּוֹרָֽל׃
Translated: These are their dwelling-places according to their settlements within their borders: to the sons of Aaron of the families of Kohathites, for theirs was the [first] lot;
Transliteration: veeleh mvoshevvotam letiyrvotam vigevulam liveney aharon lemishefachat hakehatiy khiy lahem hayah hagvoral

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנ֥וּ לָהֶ֛ם אֶת־חֶבְר֖וֹן בְּאֶ֣רֶץ יְהוּדָ֑ה וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֖יהָ סְבִיבֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: they gave them Hebron in the land of Judah and its surrounding pasturelands,
Transliteration: vayitenu lahem et-chevervon veerets yehudah veet-migerasheyha seviyvoteyha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־שְׂדֵ֥ה הָעִ֖יר וְאֶת־חֲצֵרֶ֑יהָ נָתְנ֖וּ לְכָלֵ֥ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: but the fields of the city and its villages they gave to Caleb son of Jephunneh.
Transliteration: veet-shedeh haiyr veet-chatsereyha natenu lekhalev ven-yefuneh {s}

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֗ן נָֽתְנוּ֙ אֶת־עָרֵ֣י הַמִּקְלָ֔ט אֶת־חֶבְר֥וֹן וְאֶת־לִבְנָ֖ה וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑יהָ וְאֶת־יַתִּ֥ר וְאֶֽת־אֶשְׁתְּמֹ֖עַ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
Translated: To the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of refuge: Hebron and Libnah with its pasturelands, Jattir and Eshtemoa with its pasturelands,
Transliteration: veliveney aharon natenu et-arey hamikelat et-chevervon veet-livenah veet-migerasheyha veet-yatir veet-eshetemoa veet-migerasheyha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־חִילֵז֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔יהָ אֶת־דְּבִ֖יר וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
Translated: Hilen with its pasturelands, Debir with its pasturelands,
Transliteration: veet-chiylez veet-migerasheyha et-deviyr veet-migerasheyha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עָשָׁן֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔יהָ וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית שֶׁ֖מֶשׁ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Ashan with its pasturelands, and Beth-shemesh with its pasturelands.
Transliteration: veet-ashan veet-migerasheyha veet-veyt shemesh veet-migerasheyha {s}

Hebrew: וּמִמַּטֵּ֣ה בִנְיָמִ֗ן אֶת־גֶּ֤בַע וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֙יהָ֙ וְאֶת־עָלֶ֣מֶת וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔יהָ וְאֶת־עֲנָת֖וֹת וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑יהָ כׇּל־עָרֵיהֶ֛ם שְׁלֹשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה עִ֖יר בְּמִשְׁפְּחוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: From the tribe of Benjamin, Geba with its pasturelands, Alemeth with its pasturelands, and Anathoth with its pasturelands. All their cities throughout their families were thirteen.
Transliteration: umimateh vineyamin et-geva veet-migerasheyha veet-alemet veet-migerasheyha veet-anatvot veet-migerasheyha khׇl-areyhem shelosh-eshereh iyr vemishefechvoteyhem {s}

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֨י קְהָ֜ת הַנּֽוֹתָרִ֗ים מִמִּשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַמַּטֶּ֡ה מִֽ֠מַּחֲצִ֠ית מַטֵּ֨ה חֲצִ֧י מְנַשֶּׁ֛ה בַּגּוֹרָ֖ל עָרִ֥ים עָֽשֶׂר׃ {פ}
Translated: To the remaining Kohathites were given by lot out of the family of the tribe, out of the half-tribe, the half of Manasseh, ten cities.
Transliteration: veliveney kehat hanvotariym mimishefachat hamateh mimachatsiyt mateh chatsiy menasheh vagvoral ariym asher {f}

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֨י גֵרְשׁ֜וֹם לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָ֗ם מִמַּטֵּ֣ה יִ֠שָּׂשכָ֠ר וּמִמַּטֵּ֨ה אָשֵׁ֜ר וּמִמַּטֵּ֣ה נַפְתָּלִ֗י וּמִמַּטֵּ֤ה מְנַשֶּׁה֙ בַּבָּשָׁ֔ן עָרִ֖ים שְׁלֹ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: To the Gershomites according to their families were allotted thirteen cities out of the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali, and Manasseh in Bashan.
Transliteration: veliveney gereshvom lemishefechvotam mimateh yishashkhar umimateh asher umimateh nafetaliy umimateh menasheh vavashan ariym shelosh eshereh {s}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֨י מְרָרִ֜י לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָ֗ם מִמַּטֵּ֣ה רְ֠אוּבֵ֠ן וּֽמִמַּטֵּה־גָ֞ד וּמִמַּטֵּ֤ה זְבֻלוּן֙ בַּגּוֹרָ֔ל עָרִ֖ים שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: To the Merarites according to their families were allotted twelve cities out of the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and Zebulun.
Transliteration: liveney merariy lemishefechvotam mimateh reuven umimateh-gad umimateh zevulun vagvoral ariym sheteym eshereh {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לַלְוִיִּ֑ם אֶת־הֶעָרִ֖ים וְאֶת־מִגְרְשֵׁיהֶֽם׃
Translated: So the people of Israel gave the Levites the cities with their pasturelands.
Transliteration: vayitenu veney-yisherael laleviyim et-heariym veet-migeresheyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֣וּ בַגּוֹרָ֗ל מִמַּטֵּ֤ה בְנֵֽי־יְהוּדָה֙ וּמִמַּטֵּ֣ה בְנֵֽי־שִׁמְע֔וֹן וּמִמַּטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ן אֵ֚ת הֶעָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁר־יִקְרְא֥וּ אֶתְהֶ֖ם בְּשֵׁמֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: They gave them by lot out of the tribe of the Judahites these cities that are mentioned by name, and out of the tribe of the Simeonites, and out of the tribe of the Benjaminites.
Transliteration: vayitenu vagvoral mimateh veney-yehudah umimateh veney-shimevon umimateh veney vineyamin et heariym haeleh asher-yikereu etehem veshemvot {s}

Hebrew: וּמִֽמִּשְׁפְּח֖וֹת בְּנֵ֣י קְהָ֑ת וַֽיְהִי֙ עָרֵ֣י גְבוּלָ֔ם מִמַּטֵּ֖ה אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: And some of the families of the sons of Kohath had cities of their territory out of the tribe of Ephraim.
Transliteration: umimishefechvot veney kehat vayehiy arey gevulam mimateh eferayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֨וּ לָהֶ֜ם אֶת־עָרֵ֧י הַמִּקְלָ֛ט אֶת־שְׁכֶ֥ם וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֖יהָ בְּהַ֣ר אֶפְרָ֑יִם וְאֶת־גֶּ֖זֶר וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
Translated: They gave them the cities of refuge: Shechem with its pasturelands in the hill country of Ephraim, Gezer with its pasturelands,
Transliteration: vayitenu lahem et-arey hamikelat et-shekhem veet-migerasheyha vehar eferayiim veet-gezer veet-migerasheyha

Hebrew: וְאֶֽת־יׇקְמְעָם֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔יהָ וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית חוֹר֖וֹן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
Translated: Jokmeam with its pasturelands, Beth-horon with its pasturelands,
Transliteration: veet-yׇkemeam veet-migerasheyha veet-veyt chvorvon veet-migerasheyha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אַיָּלוֹן֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔יהָ וְאֶת־גַּת־רִמּ֖וֹן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
Translated: Aijalon with its pasturelands, Gath-rimmon with its pasturelands;
Transliteration: veet-ayalvon veet-migerasheyha veet-gat-rimvon veet-migerasheyha

Hebrew: וּמִֽמַּחֲצִית֙ מַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה אֶת־עָנֵר֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔יהָ וְאֶת־בִּלְעָ֖ם וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑יהָ לְמִשְׁפַּ֥חַת לִבְנֵֽי־קְהָ֖ת הַנּוֹתָרִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: and out of the half-tribe of Manasseh: Aner with its pasturelands, and Bileam with its pasturelands, for the rest of the families of the Kohathites.
Transliteration: umimachatsiyt mateh menasheh et-aner veet-migerasheyha veet-vileam veet-migerasheyha lemishefachat liveney-kehat hanvotariym {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵי֮ גֵּרְשׁוֹם֒ מִמִּשְׁפַּ֗חַת חֲצִי֙ מַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה אֶת־גּוֹלָ֥ן בַּבָּשָׁ֖ן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑יהָ וְאֶת־עַשְׁתָּר֖וֹת וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
Translated: To the Gershomites; out of the half-tribe of Manasseh: Golan in Bashan with its pasturelands and Ashtaroth with its pasturelands;
Transliteration: liveney gereshvom mimishefachat chatsiy mateh menasheh et-gvolan vavashan veet-migerasheyha veet-ashetarvot veet-migerasheyha

Hebrew: וּמִמַּטֵּ֣ה יִשָּׂשכָ֔ר אֶת־קֶ֖דֶשׁ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑יהָ אֶת־דָּבְרַ֖ת וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
Translated: and out of the tribe of Issachar: Kedesh with its pasturelands, Dobrath with its pasturelands,
Transliteration: umimateh yishashkhar et-kedesh veet-migerasheyha et-daverat veet-migerasheyha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־רָאמוֹת֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔יהָ וְאֶת־עָנֵ֖ם וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Ramoth with its pasturelands, and Anem with its pasturelands;
Transliteration: veet-ramvot veet-migerasheyha veet-anem veet-migerasheyha {s}

Hebrew: וּמִמַּטֵּ֣ה אָשֵׁ֔ר אֶת־מָשָׁ֖ל וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑יהָ וְאֶת־עַבְדּ֖וֹן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
Translated: out of the tribe of Asher: Mashal with its pasturelands, Abdon with its pasturelands,
Transliteration: umimateh asher et-mashal veet-migerasheyha veet-avedvon veet-migerasheyha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־חוּקֹק֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔יהָ וְאֶת־רְחֹ֖ב וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Hukok with its pasturelands, and Rehob with its pasturelands;
Transliteration: veet-chukok veet-migerasheyha veet-rechov veet-migerasheyha {s}

Hebrew: וּמִמַּטֵּ֣ה נַפְתָּלִ֗י אֶת־קֶ֤דֶשׁ בַּגָּלִיל֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔יהָ וְאֶת־חַמּ֖וֹן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑יהָ וְאֶת־קִרְיָתַ֖יִם וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃ {ס}
Translated: and out of the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee with its pasturelands; Hammon with its pasturelands, and Kiriathaim with its pasturelands.
Transliteration: umimateh nafetaliy et-kedesh vagaliyl veet-migerasheyha veet-chamvon veet-migerasheyha veet-kireyatayiim veet-migerasheyha {s}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י מְרָרִי֮ הַנּוֹתָרִים֒ מִמַּטֵּ֣ה זְבֻל֔וּן אֶת־רִמּוֹנ֖וֹ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑יהָ אֶת־תָּב֖וֹר וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
Translated: To the rest of the Merarites, out of the tribe of Zebulun: Rimmono with its pasturelands, Tabor with its pasturelands;
Transliteration: liveney merariy hanvotariym mimateh zevulun et-rimvonvo veet-migerasheyha et-tavvor veet-migerasheyha

Hebrew: וּמֵעֵ֜בֶר לְיַרְדֵּ֣ן יְרֵחוֹ֮ לְמִזְרַ֣ח הַיַּרְדֵּן֒ מִמַּטֵּ֣ה רְאוּבֵ֔ן אֶת־בֶּ֥צֶר בַּמִּדְבָּ֖ר וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑יהָ וְאֶת־יַ֖הְצָה וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
