Translated: and beyond the Jordan at Jericho, on the east side of the Jordan, out of the tribe of Reuben: Bezer in the wilderness with its pasturelands, Jahaz with its pasturelands,
Transliteration: umeever leyareden yerechvo lemizerach hayareden mimateh reuven et-vetser vamidevar veet-migerasheyha veet-yahetsah veet-migerasheyha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־קְדֵמוֹת֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔יהָ וְאֶת־מֵיפַ֖עַת וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
Translated: Kedemoth with its pasturelands, and Mephaath with its pasturelands;
Transliteration: veet-kedemvot veet-migerasheyha veet-meyfaat veet-migerasheyha

Hebrew: וּמִ֨מַּטֵּה־גָ֔ד אֶת־רָאמ֥וֹת בַּגִּלְעָ֖ד וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑יהָ וְאֶֽת־מַחֲנַ֖יִם וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃
Translated: and out of the tribe of Gad: Ramoth in Gilead with its pasturelands, Mahanaim with its pasturelands,
Transliteration: umimateh-gad et-ramvot vagilead veet-migerasheyha veet-machanayiim veet-migerasheyha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־חֶשְׁבּוֹן֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔יהָ וְאֶת־יַעְזֵ֖יר וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁיהָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Heshbon with its pasturelands, and Jazer with its pasturelands.
Transliteration: veet-cheshevvon veet-migerasheyha veet-yaezeyr veet-migerasheyha {s}

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֣י יִשָּׂשכָ֗ר תּוֹלָ֧ע וּפוּאָ֛ה (ישיב) [יָשׁ֥וּב] וְשִׁמְר֖וֹן אַרְבָּעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Issachar: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron—four.
Transliteration: veliveney yishashkhar tvola ufuah (yshyv) [yashuv] veshimervon arevaah {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י תוֹלָ֗ע עֻזִּ֡י וּרְפָיָ֡ה וִ֠ירִיאֵ֠ל וְיַחְמַ֨י וְיִבְשָׂ֜ם וּשְׁמוּאֵ֗ל רָאשִׁ֤ים לְבֵית־אֲבוֹתָם֙ לְתוֹלָ֔ע גִּבּ֥וֹרֵי חַ֖יִל לְתֹלְדוֹתָ֑ם מִסְפָּרָם֙ בִּימֵ֣י דָוִ֔יד עֶשְׂרִֽים־וּשְׁנַ֥יִם אֶ֖לֶף וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Tola: Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, Shemuel, chiefs of their clans, men of substance according to their lines; their number in the days of David was 22,600.
Transliteration: uveney tvola uziy urefayah viyriyel veyachemay veyivesham ushemuel rashiym leveyt-avvotam letvola givvorey chayiil letoledvotam misefaram viymey daviyd esheriym-ushenayiim elef veshesh mevot {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י עֻזִּ֖י יִֽזְרַֽחְיָ֑ה וּבְנֵ֣י יִֽזְרַֽחְיָ֗ה מִיכָאֵ֡ל וְ֠עֹבַדְיָ֠ה וְיוֹאֵ֧ל יִשִּׁיָּ֛ה חֲמִשָּׁ֖ה רָאשִׁ֥ים כֻּלָּֽם׃
Translated: The sons of Uzzi: Izrahiah. And the sons of Izrahiah: Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Isshiah—five. All of them were chiefs.
Transliteration: uveney uziy yizeracheyah uveney yizeracheyah miykhael veovadeyah veyvoel yishiyah chamishah rashiym khulam

Hebrew: וַעֲלֵיהֶ֨ם לְתֹלְדוֹתָ֜ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבוֹתָ֗ם גְּדוּדֵי֙ צְבָ֣א מִלְחָמָ֔ה שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וְשִׁשָּׁ֖ה אָ֑לֶף כִּי־הִרְבּ֥וּ נָשִׁ֖ים וּבָנִֽים׃
Translated: And together with them, by their lines, according to their clans, were units of the fighting force, 36,000, for they had many wives and sons.
Transliteration: vaaleyhem letoledvotam leveyt avvotam gedudey tseva milechamah sheloshiym veshishah alef khiy-hirevu nashiym uvaniym

Hebrew: וַאֲחֵיהֶ֗ם לְכֹל֙ מִשְׁפְּח֣וֹת יִשָּׂשכָ֔ר גִּבּוֹרֵ֖י חֲיָלִ֑ים שְׁמוֹנִ֤ים וְשִׁבְעָה֙ אֶ֔לֶף הִתְיַחְשָׂ֖ם לַכֹּֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Their kinsmen belonging to all the families of Issachar were in all 87,000 men of substance; they were all registered by genealogy.
Transliteration: vaacheyhem lekhol mishefechvot yishashkhar givvorey chayaliym shemvoniym veshiveah elef hiteyachesham lakhol {s}

Hebrew: בִּנְיָמִ֗ן בֶּ֧לַע וָבֶ֛כֶר וִידִֽיעֲאֵ֖ל שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translated: [The sons of] Benjamin: Bela, Becher, and Jediael—three.
Transliteration: vineyamin vela vavekher viydiyael sheloshah

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י בֶ֗לַע אֶצְבּ֡וֹן וְעֻזִּ֡י וְ֠עֻזִּיאֵ֠ל וִירִימ֨וֹת וְעִירִ֜י חֲמִשָּׁ֗ה רָאשֵׁי֙ בֵּ֣ית אָב֔וֹת גִּבּוֹרֵ֖י חֲיָלִ֑ים וְהִתְיַחְשָׂ֗ם עֶשְׂרִ֤ים וּשְׁנַ֙יִם֙ אֶ֔לֶף וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים וְאַרְבָּעָֽה׃
Translated: The sons of Bela: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri—five, chiefs of clans, men of substance, registered by genealogy—22,034.
Transliteration: uveney vela etsevvon veuziy veuziyel viyriymvot veiyriy chamishah rashey veyt avvot givvorey chayaliym vehiteyachesham esheriym ushenayiim elef usheloshiym vearevaah

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י בֶ֗כֶר זְמִירָ֡ה וְיוֹעָ֡שׁ וֶֽ֠אֱלִיעֶ֠זֶר וְאֶלְיוֹעֵינַ֤י וְעׇמְרִי֙ וִירֵמ֣וֹת וַאֲבִיָּ֔ה וַעֲנָת֖וֹת וְעָלָ֑מֶת כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵי־בָֽכֶר׃
Translated: The sons of Becher: Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Becher;
Transliteration: uveney vekher zemiyrah veyvoash veeliyezer veeleyvoeynay veׇmeriy viyremvot vaaviyah vaanatvot vealamet khׇl-eleh veney-vakher

Hebrew: וְהִתְיַחְשָׂ֣ם לְתֹלְדוֹתָ֗ם רָאשֵׁי֙ בֵּ֣ית אֲבוֹתָ֔ם גִּבּוֹרֵ֖י חָ֑יִל עֶשְׂרִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
Translated: and they were registered by genealogy according to their lines, as chiefs of their clans, men of substance—20,200.
Transliteration: vehiteyachesham letoledvotam rashey veyt avvotam givvorey chayiil esheriym elef umatayiim

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י יְדִיעֲאֵ֖ל בִּלְהָ֑ן וּבְנֵ֣י בִלְהָ֗ן (יעיש) [יְע֡וּשׁ] וּ֠בִנְיָמִ֠ן וְאֵה֤וּד וּֽכְנַעֲנָה֙ וְזֵיתָ֔ן וְתַרְשִׁ֖ישׁ וַאֲחִישָֽׁחַר׃
Translated: The sons of Jediael: Bilhan. And the sons of Bilhan: Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.
Transliteration: uveney yediyael vilehan uveney vilehan (yysh) [yeush] uvineyamin veehud ukhenaanah vezeytan vetareshiysh vaachiyshachar

Hebrew: כׇּל־אֵ֜לֶּה בְּנֵ֤י יְדִֽיעֲאֵל֙ לְרָאשֵׁ֣י הָאָב֔וֹת גִּבּוֹרֵ֖י חֲיָלִ֑ים שִׁבְעָֽה־עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֙לֶף֙ וּמָאתַ֔יִם יֹצְאֵ֥י צָבָ֖א לַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: All these were the sons of Jediael, chiefs of the clans, men of substance—17,200, who made up the fighting force.
Transliteration: khׇl-eleh veney yediyael lerashey haavvot givvorey chayaliym shiveah-ashar elef umatayiim yotseey tsava lamilechamah

Hebrew: וְשֻׁפִּ֤ם וְחֻפִּם֙ בְּנֵ֣י עִ֔יר חֻשִׁ֖ם בְּנֵ֥י אַחֵֽר׃
Translated: And Shuppim and Huppim were the sons of Ir; Hushim the sons of Aher.
Transliteration: veshufim vechufim veney iyr chushim veney acher

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י נַפְתָּלִ֗י יַחֲצִיאֵ֧ל וְגוּנִ֛י וְיֵ֥צֶר וְשַׁלּ֖וּם בְּנֵ֥י בִלְהָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum, the descendants of Bilhah.
Transliteration: veney nafetaliy yachatsiyel veguniy veeitser veshalum veney vilehah {f}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה אַשְׂרִיאֵ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָלָ֑דָה פִּֽילַגְשׁוֹ֙ הָֽאֲרַמִּיָּ֔ה יָלְדָ֕ה אֶת־מָכִ֖יר אֲבִ֥י גִלְעָֽד׃
Translated: The sons of Manasseh: Asriel, whom his Aramean concubine bore; she bore Machir the father of Gilead.
Transliteration: veney menasheh asheriyel asher yaladah fiylageshvo haaramiyah yaledah et-makhiyr aviy gilead

Hebrew: וּמָכִ֞יר לָקַ֤ח אִשָּׁה֙ לְחֻפִּ֣ים וּלְשֻׁפִּ֔ים וְשֵׁ֤ם אֲחֹתוֹ֙ מַֽעֲכָ֔ה וְשֵׁ֥ם הַשֵּׁנִ֖י צְלׇפְחָ֑ד וַתִּהְיֶ֥נָה לִצְלׇפְחָ֖ד בָּנֽוֹת׃
Translated: And Machir took wives for Huppim and for Shuppim. The name of his sister was Maacah. And the name of the second was Zelophehad; and Zelophehad had daughters.
Transliteration: umakhiyr lakach ishah lechufiym uleshufiym veshem achotvo maakhah veshem hasheniy tselׇfechad vatiheyenah litselׇfechad vanvot

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֨לֶד מַעֲכָ֤ה אֵֽשֶׁת־מָכִיר֙ בֵּ֔ן וַתִּקְרָ֤א שְׁמוֹ֙ פֶּ֔רֶשׁ וְשֵׁ֥ם אָחִ֖יו שָׁ֑רֶשׁ וּבָנָ֖יו אוּלָ֥ם וָרָֽקֶם׃
Translated: And Maacah the wife of Machir bore a son, and she named him Peresh; and the name of his brother was Sheresh; and his sons were Ulam and Rekem.
Transliteration: vateled maakhah eshet-makhiyr ven vatikera shemvo feresh veshem achiyv sharesh uvanayv ulam varakem

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י אוּלָ֖ם בְּדָ֑ן אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י גִלְעָ֔ד בֶּן־מָכִ֖יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּֽׁה׃
Translated: The sons of Ulam: Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh.
Transliteration: uveney ulam vedan eleh veney gilead ven-makhiyr ven-menasheh

Hebrew: וַאֲחֹת֖וֹ הַמֹּלֶ֑כֶת יָֽלְדָה֙ אֶת־אִ֣ישְׁה֔וֹד וְאֶת־אֲבִיעֶ֖זֶר וְאֶת־מַחְלָֽה׃
Translated: And his sister Hammolecheth bore Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
Transliteration: vaachotvo hamolekhet yaledah et-iyshehvod veet-aviyezer veet-machelah

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י שְׁמִידָ֑ע אַחְיָ֣ן וָשֶׁ֔כֶם וְלִקְחִ֖י וַאֲנִיעָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: The sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney shemiyda acheyan vashekhem velikechiy vaaniyam {f}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י אֶפְרַ֖יִם שׁוּתָ֑לַח וּבֶ֤רֶד בְּנוֹ֙ וְתַ֣חַת בְּנ֔וֹ וְאֶלְעָדָ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ וְתַ֥חַת בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: The sons of Ephraim: Shuthelah, his son Bered, his son Tahath, his son Eleadah, his son Tahath,
Transliteration: uveney eferayiim shutalach uvered venvo vetachat venvo veeleadah venvo vetachat venvo

Hebrew: וְזָבָ֥ד בְּנ֛וֹ וְשׁוּתֶ֥לַח בְּנ֖וֹ וְעֵ֣זֶר וְאֶלְעָ֑ד וַהֲרָג֗וּם אַנְשֵׁי־גַת֙ הַנּוֹלָדִ֣ים בָּאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֣י יָֽרְד֔וּ לָקַ֖חַת אֶת־מִקְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: his son Zabad, his son Shuthelah, also Ezer and Elead. The men of Gath, born in the land, killed them because they had gone down to take their cattle.
Transliteration: vezavad venvo veshutelach venvo veezer veelead vaharagum aneshey-gat hanvoladiym vaarets khiy yaredu lakachat et-mikeneyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּתְאַבֵּ֛ל אֶפְרַ֥יִם אֲבִיהֶ֖ם יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ אֶחָ֖יו לְנַחֲמֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brothers came to comfort him.
Transliteration: vayiteavel eferayiim aviyhem yamiym raviym vayavou echayv lenachamvo

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ אֶל־אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַתַּ֖הַר וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֑ן וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֶת־שְׁמוֹ֙ בְּרִיעָ֔ה כִּ֥י בְרָעָ֖ה הָיְתָ֥ה בְּבֵיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: He cohabited with his wife, who conceived and bore a son; and she named him Beriah, because it occurred when there was misfortune in his house.
Transliteration: vayavo el-ishetvo vatahar vateled ven vayikera et-shemvo veriyah khiy veraah hayetah veveytvo

Hebrew: וּבִתּ֣וֹ שֶֽׁאֱרָ֔ה וַתִּ֧בֶן אֶת־בֵּית־חוֹר֛וֹן הַתַּחְתּ֖וֹן וְאֶת־הָעֶלְי֑וֹן וְאֵ֖ת אֻזֵּ֥ן שֶׁאֱרָֽה׃
Translated: His daughter was Sheerah, who built both Lower and Upper Beth-horon, and Uzzen-sheerah.
Transliteration: uvitvo sheerah vativen et-veyt-chvorvon hatachetvon veet-haeleyvon veet uzen sheerah

Hebrew: וְרֶ֣פַח בְּנ֗וֹ וְרֶ֧שֶׁף וְתֶ֛לַח בְּנ֖וֹ וְתַ֥חַן בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: His son Rephah, his son Resheph, his son Telah, his son Tahan,
Transliteration: verefach venvo vereshef vetelach venvo vetachan venvo

Hebrew: לַעְדָּ֥ן בְּנ֛וֹ עַמִּיה֥וּד בְּנ֖וֹ אֱלִישָׁמָ֥ע בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Ladan, his son Ammihud, his son Elishama,
Transliteration: laedan venvo amiyhud venvo eliyshama venvo

Hebrew: נ֥וֹן בְּנ֖וֹ יְהוֹשֻׁ֥עַ בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: his son Non, his son Joshua.
Transliteration: nvon venvo yehvoshua venvo

Hebrew: וַֽאֲחֻזָּתָם֙ וּמֹ֣שְׁבוֹתָ֔ם בֵּֽית־אֵ֖ל וּבְנֹתֶ֑יהָ וְלַמִּזְרָ֣ח נַעֲרָ֔ן וְלַֽמַּעֲרָ֗ב גֶּ֤זֶר וּבְנֹתֶ֙יהָ֙ וּשְׁכֶ֣ם וּבְנֹתֶ֔יהָ עַד־עַיָּ֖ה וּבְנֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Their possessions and settlements were Bethel and its dependencies, and on the east Naaran, and on the west Gezer and its dependencies, Shechem and its dependencies, and Aiah and its dependencies;
Transliteration: vaachuzatam umoshevvotam veyt-el uvenoteyha velamizerach naaran velamaarav gezer uvenoteyha ushekhem uvenoteyha ad-ayah uvenoteyha

Hebrew: וְעַל־יְדֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה בֵּית־שְׁאָ֤ן וּבְנֹתֶ֙יהָ֙ תַּעְנַ֣ךְ וּבְנֹתֶ֔יהָ מְגִדּ֥וֹ וּבְנוֹתֶ֖יהָ דּ֣וֹר וּבְנוֹתֶ֑יהָ בְּאֵ֙לֶּה֙ יָֽשְׁב֔וּ בְּנֵ֥י יוֹסֵ֖ף בֶּן־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: also along the borders of the Manassites, Beth-shean and its dependencies, Taanach and its dependencies, Megiddo and its dependencies, Dor and its dependencies. In these dwelt the sons of Joseph son of Israel.
Transliteration: veal-yedey veney-menasheh veyt-shean uvenoteyha taenakhe uvenoteyha megidvo uvenvoteyha dvor uvenvoteyha veeleh yashevu veney yvosef ven-yisherael {f}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י אָשֵׁ֗ר יִמְנָ֧ה וְיִשְׁוָ֛ה וְיִשְׁוִ֥י וּבְרִיעָ֖ה וְשֶׂ֥רַח אֲחוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: The sons of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and their sister Serah.
Transliteration: veney asher yimenah veyishevah veyisheviy uveriyah vesherach achvotam

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י בְרִיעָ֔ה חֶ֖בֶר וּמַלְכִּיאֵ֑ל ה֖וּא אֲבִ֥י (ברזות) [בִרְזָֽיִת]׃
Translated: The sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
Transliteration: uveney veriyah chever umalekhiyel hu aviy (vrzvt) [virezayiit]

Hebrew: וְחֶ֙בֶר֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־יַפְלֵ֔ט וְאֶת־שׁוֹמֵ֖ר וְאֶת־חוֹתָ֑ם וְאֵ֖ת שׁוּעָ֥א אֲחוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Heber begot Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and their sister, Shua.
Transliteration: vechever hvoliyd et-yafelet veet-shvomer veet-chvotam veet shua achvotam

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יַפְלֵ֔ט פָּסַ֥ךְ וּבִמְהָ֖ל וְעַשְׁוָ֑ת אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י יַפְלֵֽט׃
Translated: The sons of Japhlet: Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These were the sons of Japhlet.
Transliteration: uveney yafelet fasakhe uvimehal veashevat eleh veney yafelet

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י שָׁ֑מֶר אֲחִ֥י (ורוהגה) [וְרׇהְגָּ֖ה] (יחבה) [וְחֻבָּ֥ה] וַאֲרָֽם׃
Translated: The sons of Shemer: Ahi, Rohgah, Hubbah, and Aram.
Transliteration: uveney shamer achiy (vrvhgh) [verׇhegah] (ychvh) [vechuvah] vaaram

Hebrew: וּבֶן־הֵ֖לֶם אָחִ֑יו צוֹפַ֥ח וְיִמְנָ֖ע וְשֵׁ֥לֶשׁ וְעָמָֽל׃
Translated: The sons of Helem his brother: Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
Transliteration: uven-helem achiyv tsvofach veyimena veshelesh veamal

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י צוֹפָ֑ח ס֧וּחַ וְחַרְנֶ֛פֶר וְשׁוּעָ֖ל וּבֵרִ֥י וְיִמְרָֽה׃
Translated: The sons of Zophah: Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
Transliteration: veney tsvofach sucha vecharenefer veshual uveriy veyimerah

Hebrew: בֶּ֣צֶר וָה֗וֹד וְשַׁמָּ֧א וְשִׁלְשָׁ֛ה וְיִתְרָ֖ן וּבְאֵרָֽא׃
Translated: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.
Transliteration: vetser vahvod veshama veshileshah veyiteran uveera

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י יֶ֑תֶר יְפֻנֶּ֥ה וּפִסְפָּ֖ה וַאְרָֽא׃
Translated: The sons of Jether: Jephunneh, Pispa, and Ara.
Transliteration: uveney yeter yefuneh ufisefah vaera

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י עֻלָּ֑א אָרַ֥ח וְחַנִּיאֵ֖ל וְרִצְיָֽא׃
Translated: The sons of Ulla: Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.
Transliteration: uveney ula arach vechaniyel veritseya

Hebrew: כׇּל־אֵ֣לֶּה בְנֵֽי־אָ֠שֵׁ֠ר רָאשֵׁ֨י בֵית־הָאָב֤וֹת בְּרוּרִים֙ גִּבּוֹרֵ֣י חֲיָלִ֔ים רָאשֵׁ֖י הַנְּשִׂיאִ֑ים וְהִתְיַחְשָׂ֤ם בַּצָּבָא֙ בַּמִּלְחָמָ֔ה מִסְפָּרָ֣ם אֲנָשִׁ֔ים עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְשִׁשָּׁ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: All of these men of Asher, chiefs of the clans, select men, men of substance, heads of the chieftains. And they were registered by genealogy according to fighting force; the number of the men was 26,000 men.
Transliteration: khׇl-eleh veney-asher rashey veyt-haavvot veruriym givvorey chayaliym rashey haneshiyiym vehiteyachesham vatsava vamilechamah misefaram anashiym esheriym veshishah alef {s}

Hebrew: וּבִ֨נְיָמִ֔ן הוֹלִ֖יד אֶת־בֶּ֣לַע בְּכֹר֑וֹ אַשְׁבֵּל֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י וְאַחְרַ֖ח הַשְּׁלִישִֽׁי׃
Translated: Benjamin begot Bela his first-born, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,
Transliteration: uvineyamin hvoliyd et-vela vekhorvo ashevel hasheniy veacherach hasheliyshiy

Hebrew: נוֹחָה֙ הָרְבִיעִ֔י וְרָפָ֖א הַחֲמִישִֽׁי׃
Translated: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
Transliteration: nvochah hareviyiy verafa hachamiyshiy

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ בָנִ֖ים לְבָ֑לַע אַדָּ֥ר וְגֵרָ֖א וַאֲבִיהֽוּד׃
Translated: And Bela had sons: Addar, Gera, Abihud,
Transliteration: vayiheyu vaniym levala adar vegera vaaviyhud

Hebrew: וַאֲבִישׁ֥וּעַ וְנַעֲמָ֖ן וַאֲחֽוֹחַ׃
Translated: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
Transliteration: vaaviyshua venaaman vaachvocha

Hebrew: וְגֵרָ֥א וּשְׁפוּפָ֖ן וְחוּרָֽם׃
Translated: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
Transliteration: vegera ushefufan vechuram

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י אֵח֑וּד אֵ֣לֶּה הֵ֞ם רָאשֵׁ֤י אָבוֹת֙ לְי֣וֹשְׁבֵי גֶ֔בַע וַיַּגְל֖וּם אֶל־מָנָֽחַת׃
Translated: These were the sons of Ehud—they were chiefs of clans of the inhabitants of Geba, and they were exiled to Manahath:
Transliteration: veeleh veney echud eleh hem rashey avvot leyvoshevey geva vayagelum el-manachat

Hebrew: וְנַעֲמָ֧ן וַאֲחִיָּ֛ה וְגֵרָ֖א ה֣וּא הֶגְלָ֑ם וְהוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־עֻזָּ֖א וְאֶת־אֲחִיחֻֽד׃
Translated: Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera—he exiled them and begot Uzza and Ahihud.
Transliteration: venaaman vaachiyah vegera hu hegelam vehvoliyd et-uza veet-achiychud

Hebrew: וְשַׁחֲרַ֗יִם הוֹלִיד֙ בִּשְׂדֵ֣ה מוֹאָ֔ב מִן־שִׁלְח֖וֹ אֹתָ֑ם חוּשִׁ֥ים וְאֶֽת־בַּעֲרָ֖א נָשָֽׁיו׃
Translated: And Shaharaim had sons in the country of Moab after he had sent away Hushim and Baara his wives.
Transliteration: veshacharayiim hvoliyd vishedeh mvoav min-shilechvo otam chushiym veet-vaara nashayv

Hebrew: וַיּ֖וֹלֶד מִן־חֹ֣דֶשׁ אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ אֶת־יוֹבָב֙ וְאֶת־צִבְיָ֔א וְאֶת־מֵישָׁ֖א וְאֶת־מַלְכָּֽם׃
Translated: He had sons by Hodesh his wife: Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam,
Transliteration: vayyvoled min-chodesh ishetvo et-yvovav veet-tsiveya veet-meysha veet-malekham

Hebrew: וְאֶת־יְע֥וּץ וְאֶת־שָֽׂכְיָ֖ה וְאֶת־מִרְמָ֑ה אֵ֥לֶּה בָנָ֖יו רָאשֵׁ֥י אָבֽוֹת׃
Translated: Jeuz, Sachiah, and Mirmah. These were his sons, chiefs of clans.
Transliteration: veet-yeuts veet-shakheyah veet-miremah eleh vanayv rashey avvot

Hebrew: וּמֵחֻשִׁ֛ים הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־אֲבִיט֖וּב וְאֶת־אֶלְפָּֽעַל׃
Translated: He also begot by Hushim: Abitub and Elpaal.
Transliteration: umechushiym hvoliyd et-aviytuv veet-elefaal

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י אֶלְפַּ֔עַל עֵ֥בֶר וּמִשְׁעָ֖ם וָשָׁ֑מֶד ה֚וּא בָּנָ֣ה אֶת־אוֹנ֔וֹ וְאֶת־לֹ֖ד וּבְנֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: The sons of Elpaal: Eber, Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod with its dependencies,
Transliteration: uveney elefaal ever umisheam vashamed hu vanah et-vonvo veet-lod uvenoteyha

Hebrew: וּבְרִעָ֣ה וָשֶׁ֔מַע הֵ֚מָּה רָאשֵׁ֣י הָאָב֔וֹת לְיוֹשְׁבֵ֖י אַיָּל֑וֹן הֵ֥מָּה הִבְרִ֖יחוּ אֶת־י֥וֹשְׁבֵי גַֽת׃
Translated: and Beriah and Shema—they were chiefs of clans of the inhabitants of Aijalon, who put to flight the inhabitants of Gath;
Transliteration: uveriah vashema hemah rashey haavvot leyvoshevey ayalvon hemah hiveriychu et-yvoshevey gat

Hebrew: וְאַחְי֥וֹ שָׁשָׁ֖ק וִירֵמֽוֹת׃
Translated: and Ahio, Shashak, and Jeremoth.
Transliteration: veacheyvo shashak viyremvot

Hebrew: וּזְבַדְיָ֥ה וַעֲרָ֖ד וָעָֽדֶר׃
Translated: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
Transliteration: uzevadeyah vaarad vaader

Hebrew: וּמִיכָאֵ֧ל וְיִשְׁפָּ֛ה וְיוֹחָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י בְרִיעָֽה׃
Translated: Michael, Ishpah, and Joha were sons of Beriah.
Transliteration: umiykhael veyishefah veyvocha veney veriyah

Hebrew: וּזְבַדְיָ֥ה וּמְשֻׁלָּ֖ם וְחִזְקִ֥י וָחָֽבֶר׃
Translated: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
Transliteration: uzevadeyah umeshulam vechizekiy vachaver

Hebrew: וְיִשְׁמְרַ֧י וְיִזְלִיאָ֛ה וְיוֹבָ֖ב בְּנֵ֥י אֶלְפָּֽעַל׃
Translated: Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
Transliteration: veyishemeray veyizeliyah veyvovav veney elefaal

Hebrew: וְיָקִ֥ים וְזִכְרִ֖י וְזַבְדִּֽי׃
Translated: Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi,
Transliteration: veyakiym vezikheriy vezavediy

Hebrew: וֶאֱלִיעֵינַ֥י וְצִלְּתַ֖י וֶאֱלִיאֵֽל׃
Translated: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
Transliteration: veeliyeynay vetsiletay veeliyel

Hebrew: וַעֲדָיָ֧ה וּבְרָאיָ֛ה וְשִׁמְרָ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י שִׁמְעִֽי׃
Translated: Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
Transliteration: vaadayah uverayah veshimerat veney shimeiy

Hebrew: וְיִשְׁפָּ֥ן וָעֵ֖בֶר וֶאֱלִיאֵֽל׃
Translated: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
Transliteration: veyishefan vaever veeliyel

Hebrew: וְעַבְדּ֥וֹן וְזִכְרִ֖י וְחָנָֽן׃
Translated: Abdon, Zichri, Hanan,
Transliteration: veavedvon vezikheriy vechanan

Hebrew: וַחֲנַנְיָ֥ה וְעֵילָ֖ם וְעַנְתֹתִיָּֽה׃
Translated: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothiah,
Transliteration: vachananeyah veeylam veanetotiyah

Hebrew: וְיִפְדְיָ֥ה (ופניאל) [וּפְנוּאֵ֖ל] בְּנֵ֥י שָׁשָֽׁק׃
Translated: Iphdeiah, and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
Transliteration: veyifedeyah (vfnyl) [ufenuel] veney shashak

Hebrew: וְשַׁמְשְׁרַ֥י וּשְׁחַרְיָ֖ה וַעֲתַלְיָֽה׃
Translated: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
Transliteration: veshamesheray ushechareyah vaataleyah

Hebrew: וְיַעֲרֶשְׁיָ֧ה וְאֵלִיָּ֛ה וְזִכְרִ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יְרֹחָֽם׃
Translated: Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zichri were the sons of Jeroham.
Transliteration: veyaaresheyah veeliyah vezikheriy veney yerocham

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה רָאשֵׁ֥י אָב֛וֹת לְתֹלְדוֹתָ֖ם רָאשִׁ֑ים אֵ֖לֶּה יָשְׁב֥וּ בִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: These were the chiefs of the clans, according to their lines. These chiefs dwelt in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: eleh rashey avvot letoledvotam rashiym eleh yashevu viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וּבְגִבְע֥וֹן יָשְׁב֖וּ אֲבִ֣י גִבְע֑וֹן וְשֵׁ֥ם אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ מַעֲכָֽה׃
Translated: The father of Gibeon dwelt in Gibeon, and the name of his wife was Maacah.
Transliteration: uvegivevon yashevu aviy givevon veshem ishetvo maakhah

Hebrew: וּבְנ֥וֹ הַבְּכ֖וֹר עַבְדּ֑וֹן וְצ֥וּר וְקִ֖ישׁ וּבַ֥עַל וְנָדָֽב׃
Translated: His first-born son: Abdon; then Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,
Transliteration: uvenvo havekhvor avedvon vetsur vekiysh uvaal venadav

Hebrew: וּגְד֥וֹר וְאַחְי֖וֹ וָזָֽכֶר׃
Translated: Gedor, Ahio, Zecher.
Transliteration: ugedvor veacheyvo vazakher

Hebrew: וּמִקְל֖וֹת הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־שִׁמְאָ֑ה וְאַף־הֵ֗מָּה נֶ֧גֶד אֲחֵיהֶ֛ם יָשְׁב֥וּ בִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם עִם־אֲחֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Mikloth begot Shimeah. And they dwelt in Jerusalem opposite their kinsmen, with their kinsmen.
Transliteration: umikelvot hvoliyd et-shimeah veaf-hemah neged acheyhem yashevu viyrushala͏im im-acheyhem {s}

Hebrew: וְנֵר֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־קִ֔ישׁ וְקִ֖ישׁ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־שָׁא֑וּל וְשָׁא֗וּל הוֹלִ֤יד אֶת־יְהֽוֹנָתָן֙ וְאֶת־מַלְכִּישׁ֔וּעַ וְאֶת־אֲבִינָדָ֖ב וְאֶת־אֶשְׁבָּֽעַל׃
Translated: Ner begot Kish, Kish begot Saul, Saul begot Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal;
Transliteration: vener hvoliyd et-kiysh vekiysh hvoliyd et-shaul veshaul hvoliyd et-yehvonatan veet-malekhiyshua veet-aviynadav veet-eshevaal

Hebrew: וּבֶן־יְהוֹנָתָ֖ן מְרִ֣יב בָּ֑עַל וּמְרִ֥יב בַּ֖עַל הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־מִיכָֽה׃
Translated: and the son of Jonathan was Merib-baal; and Merib-baal begot Micah.
Transliteration: uven-yehvonatan meriyv vaal umeriyv vaal hvoliyd et-miykhah

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י מִיכָ֑ה פִּית֥וֹן וָמֶ֖לֶךְ וְתַאְרֵ֥עַ וְאָחָֽז׃
Translated: The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Taarea, and Ahaz.
Transliteration: uveney miykhah fiytvon vamelekhe vetaerea veachaz

Hebrew: וְאָחָז֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־יְהוֹעַדָּ֔ה וִיהוֹעַדָּ֗ה הוֹלִ֛יד אֶת־עָלֶ֥מֶת וְאֶת־עַזְמָ֖וֶת וְאֶת־זִמְרִ֑י וְזִמְרִ֖י הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־מוֹצָֽא׃
Translated: Ahaz begot Jehoaddah; and Jehoaddah begot Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri; Zimri begot Moza.
Transliteration: veachaz hvoliyd et-yehvoadah viyhvoadah hvoliyd et-alemet veet-azemavet veet-zimeriy vezimeriy hvoliyd et-mvotsa

Hebrew: וּמוֹצָ֖א הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־בִּנְעָ֑א רָפָ֥ה בְנ֛וֹ אֶלְעָשָׂ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ אָצֵ֥ל בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: Moza begot Binea; his son Raphah; his son Eleasah, his son Azel.
Transliteration: umvotsa hvoliyd et-vinea rafah venvo eleashah venvo atsel venvo

Hebrew: וּלְאָצֵל֮ שִׁשָּׁ֣ה בָנִים֒ וְאֵ֣לֶּה שְׁמוֹתָ֗ם עַזְרִיקָ֥ם <small>׀</small> בֹּ֙כְרוּ֙ וְיִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל וּשְׁעַרְיָ֔ה וְעֹבַדְיָ֖ה וְחָנָ֑ן כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י אָצַֽל׃
Translated: Azel had six sons, and these are their names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
Transliteration: uleatsel shishah vaniym veeleh shemvotam azeriykam <small></small> vokheru veyishemael usheareyah veovadeyah vechanan khׇl-eleh veney atsal

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י עֵ֣שֶׁק אָחִ֑יו אוּלָ֣ם בְּכֹר֔וֹ יְעוּשׁ֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י וֶאֱלִיפֶ֖לֶט הַשְּׁלִשִֽׁי׃
Translated: The sons of Eshek his brother: Ulam his first-born, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.
Transliteration: uveney eshek achiyv ulam vekhorvo yeush hasheniy veeliyfelet hashelishiy

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ בְנֵֽי־א֠וּלָ֠ם אֲנָשִׁ֨ים גִּבּוֹרֵי־חַ֜יִל דֹּ֣רְכֵי קֶ֗שֶׁת וּמַרְבִּ֤ים בָּנִים֙ וּבְנֵ֣י בָנִ֔ים מֵאָ֖ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֑ים כׇּל־אֵ֖לֶּה מִבְּנֵ֥י בִנְיָמִֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: The descendants of Ulam—men of substance, who drew the bow, had many children and grandchildren—one hundred and fifty; all these were Benjaminites.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney-ulam anashiym givvorey-chayiil dorekhey keshet umareviym vaniym uveney vaniym meah vachamishiym khׇl-eleh miveney vineyamin {f}

Hebrew: וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ הִתְיַחְשׂ֔וּ וְהִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֔ים עַל־סֵ֖פֶר מַלְכֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וִיהוּדָ֛ה הׇגְל֥וּ לְבָבֶ֖ל בְּמַעֲלָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: All Israel was registered by genealogies; and these are in the book of the kings of Israel. And Judah was taken into exile in Babylon because of their trespass.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-yisherael hiteyacheshu vehinam khetuviym al-sefer malekhey yisherael viyhudah hׇgelu levavel vemaalam {s}

Hebrew: וְהַיּֽוֹשְׁבִים֙ הָרִ֣אשֹׁנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּאֲחֻזָּתָ֖ם בְּעָרֵיהֶ֑ם יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים הַלְוִיִּ֖ם וְהַנְּתִינִֽים׃
Translated: The first to settle in their towns, on their property, were Israelites, priests, Levites, and temple servants,
Transliteration: vehayyvosheviym harishoniym asher vaachuzatam veareyhem yisherael hakhohaniym haleviyim vehanetiyniym

Hebrew: וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ יָֽשְׁב֔וּ מִן־בְּנֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה וּמִן־בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ן וּמִן־בְּנֵ֥י אֶפְרַ֖יִם וּמְנַשֶּֽׁה׃
Translated: while some of the Judahites and some of the Benjaminites and some of the Ephraimites and Manassehites settled in Jerusalem;
Transliteration: uviyrushala͏im yashevu min-veney yehudah umin-veney vineyamin umin-veney eferayiim umenasheh

Hebrew: עוּתַ֨י בֶּן־עַמִּיה֤וּד בֶּן־עׇמְרִי֙ בֶּן־אִמְרִ֣י בֶן־(בנימן)־[בָּנִ֔י מִן־]בְּנֵי־פֶ֖רֶץ בֶּן־יְהוּדָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Uthai son of Ammihud son of Omri son of Imri son of Bani, from the sons of Perez son of Judah;
Transliteration: utay ven-amiyhud ven-ׇmeriy ven-imeriy ven-(vnymn)-[vaniy min-]veney-ferets ven-yehudah {s}

Hebrew: וּמִן־הַשִּׁ֣ילוֹנִ֔י עֲשָׂיָ֥ה הַבְּכ֖וֹר וּבָנָֽיו׃
Translated: and of the Shilonites: Asaiah the first-born and his sons.
Transliteration: umin-hashiylvoniy ashayah havekhvor uvanayv

Hebrew: וּמִן־בְּנֵי־זֶ֖רַח יְעוּאֵ֑ל וַאֲחֵיהֶ֖ם שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת וְתִשְׁעִֽים׃
Translated: Of the sons of Zerah: Jeuel and their kinsmen—690.
Transliteration: umin-veney-zerach yeuel vaacheyhem shesh-mevot vetisheiym

Hebrew: וּמִן־בְּנֵ֖י בִּנְיָמִ֑ן סַלּוּא֙ בֶּן־מְשֻׁלָּ֔ם בֶּן־הוֹדַוְיָ֖ה בֶּן־הַסְּנֻאָֽה׃
Translated: Of the Benjaminites: Sallu son of Meshullam son of Hodaviah son of Hassenuah,
Transliteration: umin-veney vineyamin salu ven-meshulam ven-hvodaveyah ven-hasenuah

Hebrew: וְיִבְנְיָה֙ בֶּן־יְרֹחָ֔ם וְאֵלָ֥ה בֶן־עֻזִּ֖י בֶּן־מִכְרִ֑י וּמְשֻׁלָּם֙ בֶּן־שְׁפַטְיָ֔ה בֶּן־רְעוּאֵ֖ל בֶּן־יִבְנִיָּֽה׃
Translated: Ibneiah son of Jeroham, Elah son of Uzzi son of Michri, and Meshullam son of Shephatiah son of Reuel son of Ibneiah;
Transliteration: veyiveneyah ven-yerocham veelah ven-uziy ven-mikheriy umeshulam ven-shefateyah ven-reuel ven-yiveniyah

Hebrew: וַֽאֲחֵיהֶם֙ לְתֹ֣לְדוֹתָ֔ם תְּשַׁ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וְשִׁשָּׁ֑ה כׇּל־אֵ֣לֶּה אֲנָשִׁ֔ים רָאשֵׁ֥י אָב֖וֹת לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: and their kinsmen, according to their lines—956. All these were chiefs of their ancestral clans.
Transliteration: vaacheyhem letoledvotam tesha mevot vachamishiym veshishah khׇl-eleh anashiym rashey avvot leveyt avoteyhem {s}

Hebrew: וּמִן־הַֽכֹּהֲנִ֑ים יְדַעְיָ֥ה וִיהוֹיָרִ֖יב וְיָכִֽין׃
Translated: Of the priests: Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jachin,
Transliteration: umin-hakhohaniym yedaeyah viyhvoyariyv veyakhiyn

Hebrew: וַעֲזַרְיָ֨ה בֶן־חִלְקִיָּ֜ה בֶּן־מְשֻׁלָּ֣ם בֶּן־צָד֗וֹק בֶּן־מְרָיוֹת֙ בֶּן־אֲחִיט֔וּב נְגִ֖יד בֵּ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: and Azariah son of Hilkiah son of Meshullam son of Zadok son of Meraioth son of Ahitub, chief officer of the House of God;
Transliteration: vaazareyah ven-chilekiyah ven-meshulam ven-tsadvok ven-merayvot ven-achiytuv negiyd veyt haElohim {s}

Hebrew: וַעֲדָיָה֙ בֶּן־יְרֹחָ֔ם בֶּן־פַּשְׁח֖וּר בֶּן־מַלְכִּיָּ֑ה וּמַעְשַׂ֨י בֶּן־עֲדִיאֵ֧ל בֶּן־יַחְזֵ֛רָה בֶּן־מְשֻׁלָּ֥ם בֶּן־מְשִׁלֵּמִ֖ית בֶּן־אִמֵּֽר׃
Translated: and Adaiah son of Jeroham son of Pashhur son of Malchijah, and Maasai son of Adiel son of Jahzerah son of Meshullam son of Meshillemith son of Immer,
Transliteration: vaadayah ven-yerocham ven-fashechur ven-malekhiyah umaeshay ven-adiyel ven-yachezerah ven-meshulam ven-meshilemiyt ven-imer

Hebrew: וַאֲחֵיהֶ֗ם רָאשִׁים֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֲבוֹתָ֔ם אֶ֕לֶף וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וְשִׁשִּׁ֑ים גִּבּ֣וֹרֵי חֵ֔יל מְלֶ֖אכֶת עֲבוֹדַ֥ת בֵּית־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: together with their kinsmen, chiefs of their clans—1,760, men of substance for the work of the service of the House of God.
Transliteration: vaacheyhem rashiym leveyt avvotam elef usheva mevot veshishiym givvorey cheyl melekhet avvodat veyt-haElohim

Hebrew: וּמִֽן־הַלְוִיִּ֑ם שְׁמַֽעְיָ֧ה בֶן־חַשּׁ֛וּב בֶּן־עַזְרִיקָ֥ם בֶּן־חֲשַׁבְיָ֖ה מִן־בְּנֵ֥י מְרָרִֽי׃
Translated: Of the Levites: Shemaiah son of Hasshub son of Azrikam son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;
Transliteration: umin-haleviyim shemaeyah ven-chashuv ven-azeriykam ven-chashaveyah min-veney merariy

Hebrew: וּבַקְבַּקַּ֥ר חֶ֖רֶשׁ וְגָלָ֑ל וּמַתַּנְיָה֙ בֶּן־מִיכָ֔א בֶּן־זִכְרִ֖י בֶּן־אָסָֽף׃
Translated: and Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah son of Mica son of Zichri son of Asaph;
Transliteration: uvakevakar cheresh vegalal umataneyah ven-miykha ven-zikheriy ven-asaf

Hebrew: וְעֹֽבַדְיָה֙ בֶּֽן־שְׁמַעְיָ֔ה בֶּן־גָּלָ֖ל בֶּן־יְדוּת֑וּן וּבֶרֶכְיָ֤ה בֶן־אָסָא֙ בֶּן־אֶלְקָנָ֔ה הַיּוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּחַצְרֵ֥י נְטוֹפָתִֽי׃
Translated: and Obadiah son of Shemaiah son of Galal son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah son of Asa son of Elkanah, who dwelt in the villages of the Netophathites.
Transliteration: veovadeyah ven-shemaeyah ven-galal ven-yedutun uverekheyah ven-asa ven-elekanah hayyvoshev vechatserey netvofatiy

Hebrew: וְהַשֹּֽׁעֲרִים֙ שַׁלּ֣וּם וְעַקּ֔וּב וְטַלְמֹ֖ן וַאֲחִימָ֑ן וַאֲחִיהֶ֥ם שַׁלּ֖וּם הָרֹֽאשׁ׃
Translated: The gatekeepers were: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman; and their kinsman Shallum was the chief
Transliteration: vehashoariym shalum veakuv vetalemon vaachiyman vaachiyhem shalum harosh

Hebrew: וְֽעַד־הֵ֔נָּה בְּשַׁ֥עַר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ מִזְרָ֑חָה הֵ֚מָּה הַשֹּׁ֣עֲרִ֔ים לְמַחֲנ֖וֹת בְּנֵ֥י לֵוִֽי׃
Translated: hitherto in the King’s Gate on the east. They were the keepers belonging to the Levite camp.
Transliteration: vead-henah veshaar hamelekhe mizerachah hemah hashoariym lemachanvot veney leviy

Hebrew: וְשַׁלּ֣וּם בֶּן־ק֠וֹרֵ֠א בֶּן־אֶבְיָסָ֨ף בֶּן־קֹ֜רַח וְֽאֶחָ֧יו לְבֵית־אָבִ֣יו הַקׇּרְחִ֗ים עַ֚ל מְלֶ֣אכֶת הָעֲבוֹדָ֔ה שֹׁמְרֵ֥י הַסִּפִּ֖ים לָאֹ֑הֶל וַאֲבֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ עַל־מַחֲנֵ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה שֹׁמְרֵ֖י הַמָּבֽוֹא׃
Translated: Shallum son of Kore son of Ebiasaph son of Korah, and his kinsmen of his clan, the Korahites, were in charge of the work of the service, guards of the threshold of the Tent; their fathers had been guards of the entrance to the camp of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: veshalum ven-kvore ven-eveyasaf ven-korach veechayv leveyt-aviyv hakׇrechiym al melekhet haavvodah shomerey hasifiym laohel vaavoteyhem al-machaneh yehovah shomerey hamavvo

Hebrew: וּפִֽינְחָ֣ס בֶּן־אֶלְעָזָ֗ר נָגִ֨יד הָיָ֧ה עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם לְפָנִ֖ים יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Phinehas son of Eleazar was the chief officer over them in time past; the L<small>ORD</small> was with him.
Transliteration: ufiynechas ven-eleazar nagiyd hayah aleyhem lefaniym yehovah <small></small> imvo

Hebrew: זְכַרְיָה֙ בֶּ֣ן מְשֶֽׁלֶמְיָ֔ה שֹׁעֵ֥ר פֶּ֖תַח לְאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was gatekeeper at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: zekhareyah ven meshelemeyah shoer fetach leohel mvoed

Hebrew: כֻּלָּ֤ם הַבְּרוּרִים֙ לְשֹׁעֲרִ֣ים בַּסִּפִּ֔ים מָאתַ֖יִם וּשְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂ֑ר הֵ֤מָּה בְחַצְרֵיהֶם֙ הִתְיַחְשָׂ֔ם הֵ֣מָּה יִסַּ֥ד דָּוִ֛יד וּשְׁמוּאֵ֥ל הָרֹאֶ֖ה בֶּאֱמוּנָתָֽם׃
Translated: All these, who were selected as gatekeepers at the thresholds, were 212. They were selected by genealogies in their villages. David and Samuel the seer established them in their office of trust.
Transliteration: khulam haveruriym leshoariym vasifiym matayiim usheneym ashar hemah vechatsereyhem hiteyachesham hemah yisad daviyd ushemuel haroeh veemunatam

Hebrew: וְהֵ֨ם וּבְנֵיהֶ֜ם עַל־הַשְּׁעָרִ֧ים לְבֵית־יְהֹוָ֛ה לְבֵ֥ית הָאֹ֖הֶל לְמִשְׁמָרֽוֹת׃
Translated: They and their descendants were in charge of the gates of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, that is, the House of the Tent, as guards.
Transliteration: vehem uveneyhem al-hasheariym leveyt-yehovah leveyt haohel lemishemarvot

Hebrew: לְאַרְבַּ֣ע רוּח֔וֹת יִהְי֖וּ הַשֹּׁעֲרִ֑ים מִזְרָ֥ח יָ֖מָּה צָפ֥וֹנָה וָנֶֽגְבָּה׃
Translated: The gatekeepers were on the four sides, east, west, north, and south;
Transliteration: leareva ruchvot yiheyu hashoariym mizerach yamah tsafvonah vanegevah

Hebrew: וַאֲחֵיהֶ֨ם בְּחַצְרֵיהֶ֜ם לָב֨וֹא לְשִׁבְעַ֧ת הַיָּמִ֛ים מֵעֵ֥ת אֶל־עֵ֖ת עִם־אֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: and their kinsmen in their villages were obliged to join them every seven days, according to a fixed schedule.
Transliteration: vaacheyhem vechatsereyhem lavvo leshiveat hayamiym meet el-et im-eleh

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בֶאֱמוּנָ֞ה הֵ֗מָּה אַרְבַּ֙עַת֙ גִּבֹּרֵ֣י הַשֹּׁעֲרִ֔ים הֵ֖ם הַלְוִיִּ֑ם וְהָיוּ֙ עַל־הַלְּשָׁכ֔וֹת וְעַ֥ל הָאֹצְר֖וֹת בֵּ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: The four chief gatekeepers, who were Levites, were entrusted to be over the chambers and the treasuries of the House of God.
Transliteration: khiy veemunah hemah arevaat givorey hashoariym hem haleviyim vehayu al-haleshakhvot veal haotservot veyt haElohim

Hebrew: וּסְבִיב֥וֹת בֵּית־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים יָלִ֑ינוּ כִּֽי־עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם מִשְׁמֶ֔רֶת וְהֵ֥ם עַל־הַמַּפְתֵּ֖חַ וְלַבֹּ֥קֶר לַבֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated: They spent the night near the House of God; for they had to do guard duty, and they were in charge of opening it every morning.
Transliteration: useviyvvot veyt-haElohim yaliynu khiy-aleyhem mishemeret vehem al-hamafetecha velavoker lavoker

Hebrew: וּמֵהֶ֖ם עַל־כְּלֵ֣י הָעֲבוֹדָ֑ה כִּֽי־בְמִסְפָּ֣ר יְבִיא֔וּם וּבְמִסְפָּ֖ר יוֹצִיאֽוּם׃
Translated: Some of them had charge of the service vessels, for they were counted when they were brought back and taken out.
Transliteration: umehem al-kheley haavvodah khiy-vemisefar yeviyum uvemisefar yvotsiyum

Hebrew: וּמֵהֶ֗ם מְמֻנִּים֙ עַל־הַכֵּלִ֔ים וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־כְּלֵ֣י הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וְעַל־הַסֹּ֙לֶת֙ וְהַיַּ֣יִן וְהַשֶּׁ֔מֶן וְהַלְּבוֹנָ֖ה וְהַבְּשָׂמִֽים׃
Translated: Some of them were in charge of the vessels and all the holy vessels, and of the flour, wine, oil, incense, and spices.
Transliteration: umehem memuniym al-hakheliym veal khׇl-kheley hakodesh veal-hasolet vehayayiin vehashemen vehalevvonah vehaveshamiym

Hebrew: וּמִן־בְּנֵי֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים רֹקְחֵ֥י הַמִּרְקַ֖חַת לַבְּשָׂמִֽים׃
Translated: Some of the priests blended the compound of spices.
Transliteration: umin-veney hakhohaniym rokechey hamirekachat laveshamiym

Hebrew: וּמַתִּתְיָה֙ מִן־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם ה֥וּא הַבְּכ֖וֹר לְשַׁלֻּ֣ם הַקׇּרְחִ֑י בֶּאֱמוּנָ֕ה עַ֖ל מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה הַחֲבִתִּֽים׃
Translated: Mattithiah, one of the Levites, the first-born of Shallum the Korahite, was entrusted with making the flat cakes.
Transliteration: umatiteyah min-haleviyim hu havekhvor leshalum hakׇrechiy veemunah al maasheh hachavitiym

Hebrew: וּמִן־בְּנֵ֧י הַקְּהָתִ֛י מִן־אֲחֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־לֶ֣חֶם הַֽמַּעֲרָ֑כֶת לְהָכִ֖ין שַׁבַּ֥ת שַׁבָּֽת׃
Translated: Also some of their Kohathite kinsmen had charge of the rows of bread, to prepare them for each sabbath.
Transliteration: umin-veney hakehatiy min-acheyhem al-lechem hamaarakhet lehakhiyn shavat shavat

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣לֶּה הַ֠מְשֹׁרְרִ֠ים רָאשֵׁ֨י אָב֧וֹת לַלְוִיִּ֛ם בַּלְּשָׁכֹ֖ת (פטירים) [פְּטוּרִ֑ים] כִּֽי־יוֹמָ֥ם וָלַ֛יְלָה עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם בַּמְּלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: Now these are the singers, the chiefs of Levitical clans who remained in the chambers free of other service, for they were on duty day and night.
Transliteration: veeleh hameshoreriym rashey avvot laleviyim valeshakhot (ftyrym) [feturiym] khiy-yvomam valayelah aleyhem vamelakhah

Hebrew: אֵ֩לֶּה֩ רָאשֵׁ֨י הָאָב֧וֹת לַלְוִיִּ֛ם לְתֹלְדוֹתָ֖ם רָאשִׁ֑ים אֵ֖לֶּה יָשְׁב֥וּ בִירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: These were chiefs of Levitical clans, according to their lines; these chiefs lived in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: eleh rashey haavvot laleviyim letoledvotam rashiym eleh yashevu viyrushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וּבְגִבְע֛וֹן יָשְׁב֥וּ אֲבִי־גִבְע֖וֹן (יעואל) [יְעִיאֵ֑ל] וְשֵׁ֥ם אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ מַעֲכָֽה׃
Translated: The father of Gibeon, Jeiel, lived in Gibeon, and the name of his wife was Maacah.
Transliteration: uvegivevon yashevu aviy-givevon (yvl) [yeiyel] veshem ishetvo maakhah

Hebrew: וּבְנ֥וֹ הַבְּכ֖וֹר עַבְדּ֑וֹן וְצ֣וּר וְקִ֔ישׁ וּבַ֥עַל וְנֵ֖ר וְנָדָֽב׃
Translated: His first-born son, Abdon; then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
Transliteration: uvenvo havekhvor avedvon vetsur vekiysh uvaal vener venadav

Hebrew: וּגְד֣וֹר וְאַחְי֔וֹ וּזְכַרְיָ֖ה וּמִקְלֽוֹת׃
Translated: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth;
Transliteration: ugedvor veacheyvo uzekhareyah umikelvot

Hebrew: וּמִקְל֖וֹת הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־שִׁמְאָ֑ם וְאַף־הֵ֗ם נֶ֧גֶד אֲחֵיהֶ֛ם יָשְׁב֥וּ בִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם עִם־אֲחֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Mikloth begot Shimeam; and they lived in Jerusalem opposite their kinsmen, with their kinsmen.
Transliteration: umikelvot hvoliyd et-shimeam veaf-hem neged acheyhem yashevu viyrushala͏im im-acheyhem {s}

Hebrew: וְנֵר֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־קִ֔ישׁ וְקִ֖ישׁ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־שָׁא֑וּל וְשָׁא֗וּל הוֹלִ֤יד אֶת־יְהֽוֹנָתָן֙ וְאֶת־מַלְכִּישׁ֔וּעַ וְאֶת־אֲבִינָדָ֖ב וְאֶת־אֶשְׁבָּֽעַל׃
Translated: Ner begot Kish, Kish begot Saul, Saul begot Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal;
Transliteration: vener hvoliyd et-kiysh vekiysh hvoliyd et-shaul veshaul hvoliyd et-yehvonatan veet-malekhiyshua veet-aviynadav veet-eshevaal

Hebrew: וּבֶן־יְהוֹנָתָ֖ן מְרִ֣יב בָּ֑עַל וּמְרִי־בַ֖עַל הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־מִיכָֽה׃
Translated: and the son of Jonathan was Merib-baal; and Merib-baal begot Micah.
Transliteration: uven-yehvonatan meriyv vaal umeriy-vaal hvoliyd et-miykhah

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֖י מִיכָ֑ה פִּיתֹ֥ן וָמֶ֖לֶךְ וְתַחְרֵֽעַ׃
Translated: The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Taharea;
Transliteration: uveney miykhah fiyton vamelekhe vetacherea

Hebrew: וְאָחָז֙ הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־יַעְרָ֔ה וְיַעְרָ֗ה הוֹלִ֛יד אֶת־עָלֶ֥מֶת וְאֶת־עַזְמָ֖וֶת וְאֶת־זִמְרִ֑י וְזִמְרִ֖י הוֹלִ֥יד אֶת־מוֹצָֽא׃
Translated: Ahaz begot Jarah, and Jarah begot Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri; Zimri begot Moza.
Transliteration: veachaz hvoliyd et-yaerah veyaerah hvoliyd et-alemet veet-azemavet veet-zimeriy vezimeriy hvoliyd et-mvotsa

Hebrew: וּמוֹצָ֖א הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־בִּנְעָ֑א וּרְפָיָ֥ה בְנ֛וֹ אֶלְעָשָׂ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ אָצֵ֥ל בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: Moza begot Binea; his son was Rephaiah, his son Eleasah, his son Azel.
Transliteration: umvotsa hvoliyd et-vinea urefayah venvo eleashah venvo atsel venvo

Hebrew: וּלְאָצֵל֮ שִׁשָּׁ֣ה בָנִים֒ וְאֵ֣לֶּה שְׁמוֹתָ֗ם עַזְרִיקָ֥ם ׀ בֹּ֙כְרוּ֙ וְיִשְׁמָעֵ֣אל וּשְׁעַרְיָ֔ה וְעֹבַדְיָ֖ה וְחָנָ֑ן אֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י אָצַֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Azel had six sons and these were their names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
Transliteration: uleatsel shishah vaniym veeleh shemvotam azeriykam vokheru veyishemael usheareyah veovadeyah vechanan eleh veney atsal {f}

Hebrew: וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים נִלְחֲמ֣וּ בְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיָּ֤נׇס אִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיִּפְּל֥וּ חֲלָלִ֖ים בְּהַ֥ר גִּלְבֹּֽעַ׃
Translated: The Philistines attacked Israel, and the men of Israel fled before the Philistines and [many] fell on Mount Gilboa.
Transliteration: ufelishetiym nilechamu veyisherael vayanׇs iysh-yisherael mifeney felishetiym vayifelu chalaliym vehar gilevoa

Hebrew: וַיַּדְבְּק֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים אַחֲרֵ֥י שָׁא֖וּל וְאַחֲרֵ֣י בָנָ֑יו וַיַּכּ֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים אֶת־יוֹנָתָ֧ן וְאֶת־אֲבִינָדָ֛ב וְאֶת־מַלְכִּישׁ֖וּעַ בְּנֵ֥י שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: The Philistines pursued Saul and his sons, and the Philistines struck down Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, sons of Saul.
Transliteration: vayadeveku felishetiym acharey shaul veacharey vanayv vayakhu felishetiym et-yvonatan veet-aviynadav veet-malekhiyshua veney shaul

Hebrew: וַתִּכְבַּ֤ד הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ עַל־שָׁא֔וּל וַיִּמְצָאֻ֖הוּ הַמּוֹרִ֣ים בַּקָּ֑שֶׁת וַיָּ֖חֶל מִן־הַיּוֹרִֽים׃
Translated: The battle raged around Saul, and the archers hit him, and he was wounded by the archers.
Transliteration: vatikhevad hamilechamah al-shaul vayimetsauhu hamvoriym vakashet vayachel min-hayyvoriym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר שָׁאוּל֩ אֶל־נֹשֵׂ֨א כֵלָ֜יו שְׁלֹ֥ף חַרְבְּךָ֣ ׀ וְדׇקְרֵ֣נִי בָ֗הּ פֶּן־יָבֹ֜אוּ הָעֲרֵלִ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ וְהִתְעַלְּלוּ־בִ֔י וְלֹ֤א אָבָה֙ נֹשֵׂ֣א כֵלָ֔יו כִּ֥י יָרֵ֖א מְאֹ֑ד {ס} וַיִּקַּ֤ח שָׁאוּל֙ אֶת־הַחֶ֔רֶב וַיִּפֹּ֖ל עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Saul said to his arms-bearer, “Draw your sword and run me through, so that these uncircumcised may not come and make sport of me.” But his arms-bearer, out of great awe, refused; whereupon Saul grasped the sword and fell upon it.
Transliteration: vayomer shaul el-noshe khelayv shelof charevekha vedׇkereniy vah fen-yavou haareliym haeleh vehitealelu-viy velo avah noshe khelayv khiy yare meod {s} vayikach shaul et-hacherev vayifol aleyha

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא נֹשֵֽׂא־כֵלָ֖יו כִּ֣י מֵ֣ת שָׁא֑וּל וַיִּפֹּ֥ל גַּם־ה֛וּא עַל־הַחֶ֖רֶב וַיָּמֹֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: When the arms-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his sword and died.
Transliteration: vayare noshe-khelayv khiy met shaul vayifol gam-hu al-hacherev vayamot {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤מׇת שָׁאוּל֙ וּשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת בָּנָ֔יו וְכׇל־בֵּית֖וֹ יַחְדָּ֥ו מֵֽתוּ׃
Translated: Thus Saul and his three sons and his entire house died together.
Transliteration: vayamׇt shaul usheloshet vanayv vekhׇl-veytvo yachedav metu

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּרְא֠וּ כׇּל־אִ֨ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־בָּעֵ֙מֶק֙ כִּ֣י נָ֔סוּ וְכִי־מֵ֖תוּ שָׁא֣וּל וּבָנָ֑יו וַיַּעַזְב֤וּ עָֽרֵיהֶם֙ וַיָּנֻ֔סוּ וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ בָּהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: And when all the men of Israel who were in the valley saw that they had fled and that Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their towns and fled; the Philistines then came and occupied them.
Transliteration: vayireu khׇl-iysh yisherael asher-vaemek khiy nasu vekhiy-metu shaul uvanayv vayaazevu areyhem vayanusu vayavou felishetiym vayeshevu vahem {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים לְפַשֵּׁ֖ט אֶת־הַחֲלָלִ֑ים וַֽיִּמְצְא֤וּ אֶת־שָׁאוּל֙ וְאֶת־בָּנָ֔יו נֹפְלִ֖ים בְּהַ֥ר גִּלְבֹּֽעַ׃
Translated: The next day the Philistines came to strip the slain, and they found Saul and his sons lying on Mount Gilboa.
Transliteration: vayehiy mimׇchorat vayavou felishetiym lefashet et-hachalaliym vayimetseu et-shaul veet-vanayv nofeliym vehar gilevoa

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨פְשִׁיטֻ֔הוּ וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֖וֹ וְאֶת־כֵּלָ֑יו וַיְשַׁלְּח֨וּ בְאֶרֶץ־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֜ים סָבִ֗יב לְבַשֵּׂ֛ר אֶת־עֲצַבֵּיהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: They stripped him, and carried off his head and his armor, and sent them throughout the land of the Philistines to spread the news to their idols and among the people.
Transliteration: vayafeshiytuhu vayisheu et-roshvo veet-khelayv vayeshalechu veerets-felishetiym saviyv levasher et-atsaveyhem veet-haam

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֙ימוּ֙ אֶת־כֵּלָ֔יו בֵּ֖ית אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם וְאֶת־גֻּלְגׇּלְתּ֥וֹ תָקְע֖וּ בֵּ֥ית דָּגֽוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated: They placed his armor in the temple of their god, and they impaled his head in the temple of Dagan.
Transliteration: vayashiymu et-khelayv veyt eloheyhem veet-gulegׇletvo takeu veyt dagvon {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֔וּ כֹּ֖ל יָבֵ֣ישׁ גִּלְעָ֑ד אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֥וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים לְשָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: When all Jabesh-gilead heard everything that the Philistines had done to Saul,
Transliteration: vayishemeu khol yaveysh gilead et khׇl-asher-ashu felishetiym leshaul

Hebrew: וַיָּק֘וּמוּ֮ כׇּל־אִ֣ישׁ חַ֒יִל֒ וַיִּשְׂא֞וּ אֶת־גּוּפַ֣ת שָׁא֗וּל וְאֵת֙ גּוּפֹ֣ת בָּנָ֔יו וַיְבִיא֖וּם יָבֵ֑ישָׁה וַיִּקְבְּר֨וּ אֶת־עַצְמוֹתֵיהֶ֜ם תַּ֤חַת הָֽאֵלָה֙ בְּיָבֵ֔שׁ וַיָּצ֖וּמוּ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: all their stalwart men set out, removed the bodies of Saul and his sons, and brought them to Jabesh. They buried the bones under the oak tree in Jabesh, and they fasted for seven days.
Transliteration: vayakumu khׇl-iysh chayiil vayisheu et-gufat shaul veet gufot vanayv vayeviyum yaveyshah vayikeveru et-atsemvoteyhem tachat haelah veyavesh vayatsumu shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇת שָׁא֗וּל בְּמַֽעֲלוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָעַ֣ל בַּיהֹוָ֔ה עַל־דְּבַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־שָׁמָ֑ר וְגַם־לִשְׁא֥וֹל בָּא֖וֹב לִדְרֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated: Saul died for the trespass that he had committed against the L<small>ORD</small> in not having fulfilled the command of the L<small>ORD</small>; moreover, he had consulted a ghost to seek advice,
Transliteration: vayamׇt shaul vemaalvo asher maal vayhovah al-devar yehovah asher lo-shamar vegam-lishevol vavov lidervosh

Hebrew: וְלֹא־דָרַ֥שׁ בַּיהֹוָ֖ה וַיְמִיתֵ֑הוּ וַיַּסֵּב֙ אֶת־הַמְּלוּכָ֔ה לְדָוִ֖יד בֶּן־יִשָֽׁי׃ {פ}
Translated: and did not seek advice of the L<small>ORD</small>; so He had him slain and the kingdom transferred to David son of Jesse.
Transliteration: velo-darash vayhovah vayemiytehu vayasev et-hamelukhah ledaviyd ven-yishay {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּבְצ֧וּ כׇֽל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶל־דָּוִ֖יד חֶבְר֣וֹנָה לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֛ה עַצְמְךָ֥ וּֽבְשָׂרְךָ֖ אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃
Translated: All Israel gathered to David at Hebron and said, “We are your own flesh and blood.
Transliteration: vayikavetsu khׇl-yisherael el-daviyd chevervonah lemor hineh atsemekha uvesharekha anachenu

Hebrew: גַּם־תְּמ֣וֹל גַּם־שִׁלְשׁ֗וֹם גַּ֚ם בִּֽהְי֣וֹת שָׁא֣וּל מֶ֔לֶךְ אַתָּ֛ה הַמּוֹצִ֥יא וְהַמֵּבִ֖יא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֶ֜יךָ לְךָ֗ אַתָּ֨ה תִרְעֶ֤ה אֶת־עַמִּי֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאַתָּה֙ תִּֽהְיֶ֣ה נָגִ֔יד עַ֖ל עַמִּ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Long before now, even when Saul was king, you were the leader of Israel; and the L<small>ORD</small> your God said to you: You shall shepherd My people Israel; you shall be ruler of My people Israel.”
Transliteration: gam-temvol gam-shileshvom gam viheyvot shaul melekhe atah hamvotsiy vehameviy et-yisherael vayomer yehovah eloheykha lekha atah tireeh et-amiy et-yisherael veatah tiheyeh nagiyd al amiy yisherael

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּבֹ֠אוּ כׇּל־זִקְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל אֶל־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ חֶבְר֔וֹנָה וַיִּכְרֹת֩ לָהֶ֨ם דָּוִ֥יד בְּרִ֛ית בְּחֶבְר֖וֹן לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּמְשְׁח֨וּ אֶת־דָּוִ֤יד לְמֶ֙לֶךְ֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַד־שְׁמוּאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: All the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and David made a pact with them in Hebron before the L<small>ORD</small>. And they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the L<small>ORD</small> through Samuel.
Transliteration: vayavou khׇl-zikeney yisherael el-hamelekhe chevervonah vayikherot lahem daviyd veriyt vechevervon lifeney yehovah vayimeshechu et-daviyd lemelekhe al-yisherael khidevar yehovah veyad-shemuel {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ דָּוִ֧יד וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם הִ֣יא יְב֑וּס וְשָׁם֙ הַיְבוּסִ֔י יֹשְׁבֵ֖י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: David and all Israel set out for Jerusalem, that is Jebus, where the Jebusite inhabitants of the land lived.
Transliteration: vayelekhe daviyd vekhׇl-yisherael yerushala͏im hiy yevus vesham hayevusiy yoshevey haarets

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ יֹשְׁבֵ֤י יְבוּס֙ לְדָוִ֔יד לֹ֥א תָב֖וֹא הֵ֑נָּה וַיִּלְכֹּ֤ד דָּוִיד֙ אֶת־מְצֻדַ֣ת צִיּ֔וֹן הִ֖יא עִ֥יר דָּוִֽיד׃
Translated: David was told by the inhabitants of Jebus, “You will never get in here!” But David captured the stronghold of Zion; it is now the City of David.
Transliteration: vayomeru yoshevey yevus ledaviyd lo tavvo henah vayilekhod daviyd et-metsudat tsiyyvon hiy iyr daviyd

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔יד כׇּל־מַכֵּ֤ה יְבוּסִי֙ בָּרִ֣אשׁוֹנָ֔ה יִהְיֶ֥ה לְרֹ֖אשׁ וּלְשָׂ֑ר וַיַּ֧עַל בָּרִאשׁוֹנָ֛ה יוֹאָ֥ב בֶּן־צְרוּיָ֖ה וַיְהִ֥י לְרֹֽאשׁ׃
Translated: David said, “Whoever attacks the Jebusites first will be the chief officer”; Joab son of Zeruiah attacked first, and became the chief.
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd khׇl-makheh yevusiy varishvonah yiheyeh lerosh uleshar vayaal varishvonah yvoav ven-tseruyah vayehiy lerosh

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב דָּוִ֖יד בַּמְצָ֑ד עַל־כֵּ֥ן קָרְאוּ־ל֖וֹ עִ֥יר דָּוִֽיד׃
Translated: David occupied the stronghold; therefore it was renamed the City of David.
Transliteration: vayeshev daviyd vametsad al-khen kareu-lvo iyr daviyd

Hebrew: וַיִּ֤בֶן הָעִיר֙ מִסָּבִ֔יב מִן־הַמִּלּ֖וֹא וְעַד־הַסָּבִ֑יב וְיוֹאָ֕ב יְחַיֶּ֖ה אֶת־שְׁאָ֥ר הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: David also fortified the surrounding area, from the Millo round about, and Joab rebuilt the rest of the city.
Transliteration: vayiven haiyr misaviyv min-hamilvo vead-hasaviyv veyvoav yechayeh et-shear haiyr

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ דָּוִ֖יד הָל֣וֹךְ וְגָד֑וֹל וַיהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֖וֹת עִמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: David kept growing stronger, for the L<small>ORD</small> of Hosts was with him.
Transliteration: vayelekhe daviyd halvokhe vegadvol vayhovah tsevavot imvo {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה רָאשֵׁ֤י הַגִּבֹּרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְדָוִ֔יד הַמִּתְחַזְּקִ֨ים עִמּ֧וֹ בְמַלְכוּת֛וֹ עִם־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְהַמְלִיכ֑וֹ כִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: And these were David’s chief warriors who strongly supported him in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, according to the word of the L<small>ORD</small> concerning Israel.
Transliteration: veeleh rashey hagivoriym asher ledaviyd hamitechazekiym imvo vemalekhutvo im-khׇl-yisherael lehameliykhvo khidevar yehovah al-yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה מִסְפַּ֥ר הַגִּבֹּרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְדָוִ֑יד יָֽשׇׁבְעָ֣ם בֶּן־חַכְמוֹנִ֗י רֹ֚אשׁ (השלושים) [הַשָּׁ֣לִישִׁ֔ים] הֽוּא־עוֹרֵ֧ר אֶת־חֲנִית֛וֹ עַל־שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת חָלָ֖ל בְּפַ֥עַם אֶחָֽת׃
Translated: This is the list of David’s warriors: Jashobeam son of Hachmoni, the chief officer; he wielded his spear against three hundred and slew them all on one occasion.
Transliteration: veeleh misefar hagivoriym asher ledaviyd yashׇveam ven-chakhemvoniy rosh (hshlvshym) [hashaliyshiym] hu-vorer et-chaniytvo al-shelosh-mevot chalal vefaam echat

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרָ֛יו אֶלְעָזָ֥ר בֶּן־דּוֹד֖וֹ הָאֲחוֹחִ֑י ה֖וּא בִּשְׁלוֹשָׁ֥ה הַגִּבֹּרִֽים׃
Translated: Next to him was Eleazar son of Dodo, the Ahohite; he was one of the three warriors.
Transliteration: veacharayv eleazar ven-dvodvo haachvochiy hu vishelvoshah hagivoriym

Hebrew: הֽוּא־הָיָ֨ה עִם־דָּוִ֜יד בַּפַּ֣ס דַּמִּ֗ים וְהַפְּלִשְׁתִּים֙ נֶאֶסְפוּ־שָׁ֣ם לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וַתְּהִ֛י חֶלְקַ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה מְלֵאָ֣ה שְׂעוֹרִ֑ים וְהָעָ֥ם נָ֖סוּ מִפְּנֵ֥י פְלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: He was with David at Pas Dammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. There was a plot of ground full of barley there; the troops had fled from the Philistines,
Transliteration: hu-hayah im-daviyd vafas damiym vehafelishetiym neesefu-sham lamilechamah vatehiy chelekat hashadeh meleah shevoriym vehaam nasu mifeney felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיִּֽתְיַצְּב֤וּ בְתוֹךְ־הַֽחֶלְקָה֙ וַיַּצִּיל֔וּהָ וַיַּכּ֖וּ אֶת־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיּ֥וֹשַׁע יְהֹוָ֖ה תְּשׁוּעָ֥ה גְדוֹלָֽה׃
Translated: but they took their stand in the middle of the plot and defended it, and they routed the Philistines. Thus the L<small>ORD</small> wrought a great victory.
Transliteration: vayiteyatsevu vetvokhe-hachelekah vayatsiyluha vayakhu et-felishetiym vayyvosha yehovah teshuah gedvolah

Hebrew: וַיֵּרְד֡וּ שְֽׁלוֹשָׁה֩ מִן־הַשְּׁלוֹשִׁ֨ים רֹ֤אשׁ עַל־הַצֻּר֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔יד אֶל־מְעָרַ֖ת עֲדֻלָּ֑ם וּמַחֲנֵ֣ה פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים חֹנָ֖ה בְּעֵ֥מֶק רְפָאִֽים׃
Translated: Three of the thirty chiefs went down to the rock to David, at the cave of Adullam, while a force of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.
Transliteration: vayeredu shelvoshah min-hashelvoshiym rosh al-hatsur el-daviyd el-mearat adulam umachaneh felishetiym chonah veemek refaiym

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֖יד אָ֣ז בַּמְּצוּדָ֑ה וּנְצִ֣יב פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים אָ֖ז בְּבֵ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: David was then in the stronghold, and a Philistine garrison was then at Bethlehem.
Transliteration: vedaviyd az vametsudah unetsiyv felishetiym az veveyt lachem

Hebrew: וַיִּתְאָ֥ו דָּוִ֖יד וַיֹּאמַ֑ר מִ֚י יַשְׁקֵ֣נִי מַ֔יִם מִבּ֥וֹר בֵּֽית־לֶ֖חֶם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּשָּֽׁעַר׃
Translated: David felt a craving and said, “If only I could get a drink of water from the cistern which is by the gate of Bethlehem!”
Transliteration: vayiteav daviyd vayomar miy yashekeniy mayiim mivvor veyt-lechem asher vashaar

Hebrew: וַיִּבְקְע֨וּ הַשְּׁלֹשָׁ֜ה בְּמַחֲנֵ֣ה פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים וַיִּֽשְׁאֲבוּ־מַ֙יִם֙ מִבּ֤וֹר בֵּֽית־לֶ֙חֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשַּׁ֔עַר וַיִּשְׂא֖וּ וַיָּבִ֣אוּ אֶל־דָּוִ֑יד וְלֹא־אָבָ֤ה דָוִיד֙ לִשְׁתּוֹתָ֔ם וַיְנַסֵּ֥ךְ אֹתָ֖ם לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: So the three got through the Philistine camp, and drew water from the cistern which is by the gate of Bethlehem, and they carried it back to David. But David would not drink it, and he poured it out as a libation to the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayivekeu hasheloshah vemachaneh felishetiym vayisheavu-mayiim mivvor veyt-lechem asher vashaar vayisheu vayaviu el-daviyd velo-avah daviyd lishetvotam vayenasekhe otam layhovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר חָלִ֩ילָה֩ לִּ֨י מֵאֱלֹהַ֜י מֵעֲשׂ֣וֹת זֹ֗את הֲדַ֣ם הָאֲנָשִׁים֩ הָאֵ֨לֶּה אֶשְׁתֶּ֤ה בְנַפְשׁוֹתָם֙ כִּ֣י בְנַפְשׁוֹתָ֣ם הֱבִיא֔וּם וְלֹ֥א אָבָ֖ה לִשְׁתּוֹתָ֑ם אֵ֣לֶּה עָשׂ֔וּ שְׁלֹ֖שֶׁת הַגִּבּוֹרִֽים׃
Translated: For he said, “God forbid that I should do this! Can I drink the blood of these men who risked their lives?”—for they had brought it at the risk of their lives, and he would not drink it. Such were the exploits of the three warriors.
Transliteration: vayomer chaliylah liy meelohay meashvot zot hadam haanashiym haeleh esheteh venafeshvotam khiy venafeshvotam heviyum velo avah lishetvotam eleh ashu sheloshet hagivvoriym

Hebrew: וְאַבְשַׁ֣י אֲחִֽי־יוֹאָ֗ב ה֤וּא הָיָה֙ רֹ֣אשׁ הַשְּׁלוֹשָׁ֔ה וְהוּא֙ עוֹרֵ֣ר אֶת־חֲנִית֔וֹ עַל־שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת חָלָ֑ל (ולא) [וְלוֹ־]שֵׁ֖ם בַּשְּׁלוֹשָֽׁה׃
Translated: Abshai, the brother of Joab, was head of another three. He once wielded his spear against three hundred and slew them. He won a name among the three;
Transliteration: veaveshay achiy-yvoav hu hayah rosh hashelvoshah vehu vorer et-chaniytvo al-shelosh mevot chalal (vl) [velvo-]shem vashelvoshah

Hebrew: מִן־הַשְּׁלוֹשָׁ֤ה בַשְּׁנַ֙יִם֙ נִכְבָּ֔ד וַיְהִ֥י לָהֶ֖ם לְשָׂ֑ר וְעַד־הַשְּׁלוֹשָׁ֖ה לֹא־בָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: among the three he was more highly regarded than the other two, and so he became their commander. However, he did not attain to the other three.
Transliteration: min-hashelvoshah vashenayiim nikhevad vayehiy lahem leshar vead-hashelvoshah lo-va {s}

Hebrew: בְּנָיָ֨ה בֶן־יְהוֹיָדָ֧ע בֶּן־אִֽישׁ־חַ֛יִל רַב־פְּעָלִ֖ים מִֽן־קַבְצְאֵ֑ל ה֣וּא הִכָּ֗ה אֵ֣ת שְׁנֵ֤י אֲרִיאֵל֙ מוֹאָ֔ב וְ֠ה֠וּא יָרַ֞ד וְהִכָּ֧ה אֶֽת־הָאֲרִ֛י בְּת֥וֹךְ הַבּ֖וֹר בְּי֥וֹם הַשָּֽׁלֶג׃
Translated: Benaiah son of Jehoiada from Kabzeel was a brave soldier who performed great deeds. He killed the two [sons] of Ariel of Moab. Once, on a snowy day, he went down into a pit and killed a lion.
Transliteration: venayah ven-yehvoyada ven-iysh-chayiil rav-fealiym min-kavetseel hu hikhah et sheney ariyel mvoav vehu yarad vehikhah et-haariy vetvokhe havvor veyvom hashaleg

Hebrew: וְהֽוּא־הִכָּה֩ אֶת־הָאִ֨ישׁ הַמִּצְרִ֜י אִ֥ישׁ מִדָּ֣ה ׀ חָמֵ֣שׁ בָּאַמָּ֗ה וּבְיַ֨ד הַמִּצְרִ֤י חֲנִית֙ כִּמְנ֣וֹר אֹֽרְגִ֔ים וַיֵּ֥רֶד אֵלָ֖יו בַּשָּׁ֑בֶט וַיִּגְזֹ֤ל אֶֽת־הַחֲנִית֙ מִיַּ֣ד הַמִּצְרִ֔י וַיַּהַרְגֵ֖הוּ בַּחֲנִיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: He also killed an Egyptian, a giant of a man five cubits tall. The Egyptian had a spear in his hand, like a weaver’s beam, yet [Benaiah] went down against him with a club, wrenched the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.
Transliteration: vehu-hikhah et-haiysh hamitseriy iysh midah chamesh vaamah uveyad hamitseriy chaniyt khimenvor oregiym vayered elayv vashavet vayigezol et-hachaniyt miyad hamitseriy vayaharegehu vachaniytvo

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה עָשָׂ֔ה בְּנָיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־יְהוֹיָדָ֑ע וְלוֹ־שֵׁ֖ם בִּשְׁלוֹשָׁ֥ה הַגִּבֹּרִֽים׃
Translated: Such were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada; and he won a name among the three warriors.
Transliteration: eleh ashah venayahu ven-yehvoyada velvo-shem vishelvoshah hagivoriym

Hebrew: מִן־הַשְּׁלוֹשִׁ֗ים הִנּ֤וֹ נִכְבָּד֙ ה֔וּא וְאֶל־הַשְּׁלֹשָׁ֖ה לֹא־בָ֑א וַיְשִׂימֵ֥הוּ דָוִ֖יד עַל־מִשְׁמַעְתּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: He was highly regarded among the thirty, but he did not attain to the three. David put him in charge of his bodyguard.
Transliteration: min-hashelvoshiym hinvo nikhevad hu veel-hasheloshah lo-va vayeshiymehu daviyd al-mishemaetvo {s}

Hebrew: וְגִבּוֹרֵ֖י הַחֲיָלִ֑ים עֲשָׂהאֵל֙ אֲחִ֣י יוֹאָ֔ב {ס} אֶלְחָנָ֥ן בֶּן־דּוֹד֖וֹ מִבֵּ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃ {ס}
Translated: The valiant warriors: Asahel brother of Joab, Elhanan son of Dodo from Bethlehem,
Transliteration: vegivvorey hachayaliym ashahel achiy yvoav {s} elechanan ven-dvodvo miveyt lachem {s}

Hebrew: שַׁמּוֹת֙ הַהֲרוֹרִ֔י {ס} חֶ֖לֶץ הַפְּלוֹנִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
Transliteration: shamvot haharvoriy {s} chelets hafelvoniy {s}

Hebrew: עִירָ֤א בֶן־עִקֵּשׁ֙ הַתְּקוֹעִ֔י {ס} אֲבִיעֶ֖זֶר הָעַנְּתוֹתִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Ira son of Ikkesh from Tekoa, Abiezer of Anathoth,
Transliteration: iyra ven-ikesh hatekvoiy {s} aviyezer haanetvotiy {s}

Hebrew: סִבְּכַי֙ הַחֻ֣שָׁתִ֔י {ס} עִילַ֖י הָאֲחוֹחִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
Transliteration: sivekhay hachushatiy {s} iylay haachvochiy {s}

Hebrew: מַהְרַי֙ הַנְּטֹ֣פָתִ֔י {ס} חֵ֥לֶד בֶּֽן־בַּעֲנָ֖ה הַנְּטוֹפָתִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Mahrai the Netophathite, Heled son of Baanah the Netophathite,
Transliteration: maheray hanetofatiy {s} cheled ven-vaanah hanetvofatiy {s}

Hebrew: אִיתַ֣י בֶּן־רִיבַ֗י מִגִּבְעַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֔ן {ס} בְּנָיָ֖ה הַפִּרְעָתֹנִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Ittai son of Ribai from Gibeah of the Benjaminites, Benaiah of Pirathon,
Transliteration: iytay ven-riyvay migiveat veney vineyamin {s} venayah hafireatoniy {s}

Hebrew: חוּרַי֙ מִנַּ֣חֲלֵי גָ֔עַשׁ {ס} אֲבִיאֵ֖ל הָעַרְבָתִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Hurai of Nahale-gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
Transliteration: churay minachaley gaash {s} aviyel haarevatiy {s}

Hebrew: עַזְמָ֙וֶת֙ הַבַּ֣חֲרוּמִ֔י {ס} אֶלְיַחְבָּ֖א הַשַּׁעַלְבֹנִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Azmaveth the Bahrumite, Eliahba of Shaalbon,
Transliteration: azemavet havacharumiy {s} eleyacheva hashaalevoniy {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֗י הָשֵׁם֙ הַגִּ֣זוֹנִ֔י {ס} יוֹנָתָ֥ן בֶּן־שָׁגֵ֖ה הַהֲרָרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan son of Shageh the Hararite,
Transliteration: veney hashem hagizvoniy {s} yvonatan ven-shageh haharariy {s}

Hebrew: אֲחִיאָ֧ם בֶּן־שָׂכָ֛ר הַהֲרָרִ֖י {ס} אֱלִיפַ֥ל בֶּן־אֽוּר׃ {ס}
Translated: Ahiam son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal son of Ur,
Transliteration: achiyam ven-shakhar haharariy {s} eliyfal ven-ur {s}

Hebrew: חֵ֚פֶר הַמְּכֵ֣רָתִ֔י אֲחִיָּ֖ה הַפְּלֹנִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
Transliteration: chefer hamekheratiy achiyah hafeloniy {s}

Hebrew: חֶצְרוֹ֙ הַֽכַּרְמְלִ֔י {ס} נַעֲרַ֖י בֶּן־אֶזְבָּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai son of Ezbai,
Transliteration: chetservo hakharemeliy {s} naaray ven-ezevay {s}

Hebrew: יוֹאֵל֙ אֲחִ֣י נָתָ֔ן {ס} מִבְחָ֖ר בֶּן־הַגְרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Joel brother of Nathan, Mibhar son of Hagri,
Transliteration: yvoel achiy natan {s} mivechar ven-hageriy {s}

Hebrew: צֶ֖לֶק הָעַמּוֹנִ֑י נַחְרַי֙ הַבֵּ֣רֹתִ֔י נֹשֵׂ֕א כְּלֵ֖י יוֹאָ֥ב בֶּן־צְרוּיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite—the arms-bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah—
Transliteration: tselek haamvoniy nacheray haverotiy noshe kheley yvoav ven-tseruyah {s}

Hebrew: עִירָא֙ הַיִּתְרִ֔י {ס} גָּרֵ֖ב הַיִּתְרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
Transliteration: iyra hayiteriy {s} garev hayiteriy {s}

Hebrew: אֽוּרִיָּה֙ הַחִתִּ֔י {ס} זָבָ֖ד בֶּן־אַחְלָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad son of Ahlai.
Transliteration: uriyah hachitiy {s} zavad ven-achelay {s}

Hebrew: עֲדִינָ֨א בֶן־שִׁיזָ֜א הָראוּבֵנִ֗י רֹ֛אשׁ לָראוּבֵנִ֖י וְעָלָ֥יו שְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃ {ס}
Translated: Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite, a chief of the Reubenites, and thirty with him;
Transliteration: adiyna ven-shiyza haruveniy rosh laruveniy vealayv sheloshiym {s}

Hebrew: חָנָן֙ בֶּֽן־מַעֲכָ֔ה וְיוֹשָׁפָ֖ט הַמִּתְנִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Hanan son of Maacah, and Joshaphat the Mithnite;
Transliteration: chanan ven-maakhah veyvoshafat hamiteniy {s}

Hebrew: עֻזִּיָּ֖א הָעַשְׁתְּרָתִ֑י {ס} שָׁמָע֙ (ויעואל) [וִיעִיאֵ֔ל] בְּנֵ֖י חוֹתָ֥ם הָעֲרֹעֵרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Uzziah the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel sons of Hotham the Aroerite;
Transliteration: uziya haasheteratiy {s} shama (vyvl) [viyiyel] veney chvotam haaroeriy {s}

Hebrew: יְדִֽיעֲאֵל֙ בֶּן־שִׁמְרִ֔י וְיֹחָ֥א אָחִ֖יו הַתִּיצִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Jedaiael son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite;
Transliteration: yediyael ven-shimeriy veyocha achiyv hatiytsiy {s}

Hebrew: אֱלִיאֵל֙ הַֽמַּחֲוִ֔ים וִירִיבַ֥י וְיוֹשַׁוְיָ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י אֶלְנָ֑עַם {ס} וְיִתְמָ֖ה הַמּוֹאָבִֽי׃
Translated: Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai and Joshaviah sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite;
Transliteration: eliyel hamachaviym viyriyvay veyvoshaveyah veney elenaam {s} veyitemah hamvoaviy

Hebrew: אֱלִיאֵ֣ל וְעוֹבֵ֔ד {ס} וְיַעֲשִׂיאֵ֖ל הַמְּצֹבָיָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Eliel, Obed, and Jaassiel the Mezobaite.
Transliteration: eliyel vevoved {s} veyaashiyel hametsovayah {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה הַבָּאִ֤ים אֶל־דָּוִיד֙ לְצִ֣יקְלַ֔ג ע֣וֹד עָצ֔וּר מִפְּנֵ֖י שָׁא֣וּל בֶּן־קִ֑ישׁ וְהֵ֙מָּה֙ בַּגִּבּוֹרִ֔ים עֹזְרֵ֖י הַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: The following joined David at Ziklag while he was still in hiding from Saul son of Kish; these were the warriors who gave support in battle;
Transliteration: veeleh havaiym el-daviyd letsiykelag vod atsur mifeney shaul ven-kiysh vehemah vagivvoriym ozerey hamilechamah

Hebrew: נֹ֣שְׁקֵי קֶ֗שֶׁת מַיְמִינִ֤ים וּמַשְׂמִאלִים֙ בָּאֲבָנִ֔ים וּבַחִצִּ֖ים בַּקָּ֑שֶׁת מֵאֲחֵ֥י שָׁא֖וּל מִבִּנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: they were armed with the bow and could use both right hand and left hand to sling stones or shoot arrows with the bow; they were kinsmen of Saul from Benjamin.
Transliteration: noshekey keshet mayemiyniym umashemiliym vaavaniym uvachitsiym vakashet meachey shaul mivineyamin

Hebrew: הָרֹ֨אשׁ אֲחִיעֶ֜זֶר וְיוֹאָ֗שׁ בְּנֵי֙ הַשְּׁמָעָ֣ה הַגִּבְעָתִ֔י (ויזואל) [וִיזִיאֵ֥ל] וָפֶ֖לֶט בְּנֵ֣י עַזְמָ֑וֶת וּבְרָכָ֕ה וְיֵה֖וּא הָעַנְּתֹתִֽי׃
Translated: At the head were Ahiezer and Joash, sons of Shemaah of Gibeah; and Jeziel and Pelet, sons of Azmaveth; and Beracah and Jehu of Anathoth;
Transliteration: harosh achiyezer veyvoash veney hashemaah hagiveatiy (vyzvl) [viyziyel] vafelet veney azemavet uverakhah veeihu haanetotiy

Hebrew: וְיִֽשְׁמַעְיָ֧ה הַגִּבְעוֹנִ֛י גִּבּ֥וֹר בַּשְּׁלֹשִׁ֖ים וְעַל־הַשְּׁלֹשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Ishmaiah of Gibeon, a warrior among the thirty, leading the thirty;
Transliteration: veyishemaeyah hagivevoniy givvor vasheloshiym veal-hasheloshiym

Hebrew: וְיִרְמְיָ֤ה וְיַחֲזִיאֵל֙ וְי֣וֹחָנָ֔ן וְיוֹזָבָ֖ד הַגְּדֵרָתִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, and Jozabad of Gederah;
Transliteration: veyiremeyah veyachaziyel veyvochanan veyvozavad hagederatiy {s}

Hebrew: אֶלְעוּזַ֤י וִֽירִימוֹת֙ וּבְעַלְיָ֣ה וּשְׁמַרְיָ֔הוּ וּשְׁפַטְיָ֖הוּ (החריפי) [הַחֲרוּפִֽי]׃
Translated: Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Hariphite;
Transliteration: eleuzay viyriymvot uvealeyah ushemareyahu ushefateyahu (hchryfy) [hacharufiy]

Hebrew: אֶלְקָנָ֡ה וְ֠יִשִּׁיָּ֠הוּ וַעֲזַרְאֵ֧ל וְיוֹעֶ֛זֶר וְיָשׇׁבְעָ֖ם הַקׇּרְחִֽים׃
Translated: Elkanah, Isshiah, Azarel, Joezer, and Jashobeam the Korahites;
Transliteration: elekanah veyiishiyahu vaazareel veyvoezer veyashׇveam hakׇrechiym

Hebrew: וְיוֹעֵאלָ֧ה וּזְבַדְיָ֛ה בְּנֵ֥י יְרֹחָ֖ם מִֽן־הַגְּדֽוֹר׃
Translated: Joelah and Zebadiah, sons of Jeroham of Gedor.
Transliteration: veyvoelah uzevadeyah veney yerocham min-hagedvor

Hebrew: וּמִן־הַגָּדִ֡י נִבְדְּל֣וּ אֶל־דָּוִיד֩ לַמְצַ֨ד מִדְבָּ֜רָה גִּבֹּרֵ֣י הַחַ֗יִל אַנְשֵׁ֤י צָבָא֙ לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה עֹרְכֵ֥י צִנָּ֖ה וָרֹ֑מַח וּפְנֵ֤י אַרְיֵה֙ פְּנֵיהֶ֔ם וְכִצְבָאיִ֥ם עַל־הֶהָרִ֖ים לְמַהֵֽר׃
Translated: Of the Gadites, there withdrew to follow David to the wilderness stronghold valiant men, fighters fit for battle, armed with shield and spear; they had the appearance of lions, and were as swift as gazelles upon the mountains:
Transliteration: umin-hagadiy nivedelu el-daviyd lametsad midevarah givorey hachayiil aneshey tsava lamilechamah orekhey tsinah varomach ufeney areeih feneyhem vekhitsevayim al-hehariym lemaher

Hebrew: עֵ֖זֶר הָרֹ֑אשׁ עֹֽבַדְיָה֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י אֱלִיאָ֖ב הַשְּׁלִשִֽׁי׃
Translated: Ezer the chief, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
Transliteration: ezer harosh ovadeyah hasheniy eliyav hashelishiy

Hebrew: מִשְׁמַנָּה֙ הָרְבִיעִ֔י יִרְמְיָ֖ה הַחֲמִשִֽׁי׃
Translated: Mashmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
Transliteration: mishemanah hareviyiy yiremeyah hachamishiy

Hebrew: עַתַּי֙ הַשִּׁשִּׁ֔י אֱלִיאֵ֖ל הַשְּׁבִעִֽי׃
Translated: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
Transliteration: atay hashishiy eliyel hasheviiy

Hebrew: יֽוֹחָנָן֙ הַשְּׁמִינִ֔י אֶלְזָבָ֖ד הַתְּשִׁיעִֽי׃
Translated: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
Transliteration: yvochanan hashemiyniy elezavad hateshiyiy

Hebrew: יִרְמְיָ֙הוּ֙ הָעֲשִׂירִ֔י מַכְבַּנַּ֖י עַשְׁתֵּ֥י עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: Jeremiah the tenth, Machbannai the eleventh.
Transliteration: yiremeyahu haashiyriy makhevanay ashetey ashar {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֥לֶּה מִבְּנֵי־גָ֖ד רָאשֵׁ֣י הַצָּבָ֑א אֶחָ֤ד לְמֵאָה֙ הַקָּטָ֔ן וְהַגָּד֖וֹל לְאָֽלֶף׃
Translated: Those were the Gadites, heads of the army. The least was equal to a hundred, the greatest to a thousand.
Transliteration: eleh miveney-gad rashey hatsava echad lemeah hakatan vehagadvol lealef

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הֵ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָבְר֤וּ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן וְה֥וּא מְמַלֵּ֖א עַל־כׇּל־[גְּדוֹתָ֑יו] (גדיתיו) וַיַּבְרִ֙יחוּ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָ֣עֲמָקִ֔ים לַמִּזְרָ֖ח וְלַֽמַּעֲרָֽב׃ {פ}
Translated: These were the ones who crossed the Jordan in the first month, when it was at its crest, and they put to flight all the lowlanders to the east and west.
Transliteration: eleh hem asher averu et-hayareden vachodesh harishvon vehu memale al-khׇl-[gedvotayv] (gdytyv) vayaveriychu et-khׇl-haamakiym lamizerach velamaarav {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֗אוּ מִן־בְּנֵ֤י בִנְיָמִן֙ וִֽיהוּדָ֔ה עַד־לַמְצָ֖ד לְדָוִֽיד׃
Translated: Some of the Benjaminites and Judahites came to the stronghold to David,
Transliteration: vayavou min-veney vineyamin viyhudah ad-lametsad ledaviyd

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֣א דָוִיד֮ לִפְנֵיהֶם֒ וַיַּ֙עַן֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ם אִם־לְשָׁל֞וֹם בָּאתֶ֤ם אֵלַי֙ לְעׇזְרֵ֔נִי יִֽהְיֶה־לִּ֧י עֲלֵיכֶ֛ם לֵבָ֖ב לְיָ֑חַד וְאִֽם־לְרַמּוֹתַ֣נִי לְצָרַ֗י בְּלֹ֤א חָמָס֙ בְּכַפַּ֔י יֵ֛רֶא אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבוֹתֵ֖ינוּ וְיוֹכַֽח׃ {ס}
Translated: and David went out to meet them, saying to them, “If you come on a peaceful errand, to support me, then I will make common cause with you, but if to betray me to my foes, for no injustice on my part, then let the God of our fathers take notice and give judgment.”
Transliteration: vayetse daviyd lifeneyhem vayaan vayomer lahem im-leshalvom vatem elay leׇzereniy yiheyeh-liy aleykhem levav leyachad veim-leramvotaniy letsaray velo chamas vekhafay eire elohey avvoteynu veyvokhach {s}

Hebrew: וְר֣וּחַ לָֽבְשָׁ֗ה אֶת־עֲמָשַׂי֮ רֹ֣אשׁ (השלושים) [הַשָּׁלִישִׁים֒] לְךָ֤ דָוִיד֙ וְעִמְּךָ֣ בֶן־יִשַׁ֔י שָׁל֨וֹם ׀ שָׁל֜וֹם לְךָ֗ וְשָׁלוֹם֙ לְעֹ֣זְרֶ֔ךָ כִּ֥י עֲזָֽרְךָ֖ אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וַיְקַבְּלֵ֣ם דָּוִ֔יד וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֖ם בְּרָאשֵׁ֥י הַגְּדֽוּד׃ {פ}
Translated:
Then the spirit seized Amasai, chief of the captains:
“We are yours, David,
On your side, son of Jesse;
At peace, at peace with you,
And at peace with him who supports you,
For your God supports you.”
So David accepted them, and placed them at the head of his band.
Transliteration: verucha laveshah et-amashay rosh (hshlvshym) [hashaliyshiym] lekha daviyd veimekha ven-yishay shalvom shalvom lekha veshalvom leozerekha khiy azarekha eloheykha vayekavelem daviyd vayitenem verashey hagedud {f}

Hebrew: וּמִֽמְּנַשֶּׁ֞ה נָפְל֣וּ עַל־דָּוִ֗יד בְּבֹא֨וֹ עִם־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֧ים עַל־שָׁא֛וּל לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א עֲזָרֻ֑ם כִּ֣י בְעֵצָ֗ה שִׁלְּחֻ֜הוּ סַרְנֵ֤י פְלִשְׁתִּים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בְּרָאשֵׁ֕ינוּ יִפּ֖וֹל אֶל־אֲדֹנָ֥יו שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: Some Manassites went over to David’s side when he came with the Philistines to make war against Saul, but they were of no help to them, because the lords of the Philistines in council dismissed him, saying, “He will go over to the side of his lord, Saul, and it will cost us our heads”;
Transliteration: umimenasheh nafelu al-daviyd vevovo im-felishetiym al-shaul lamilechamah velo azarum khiy veetsah shilechuhu sareney felishetiym lemor verasheynu yifvol el-adonayv shaul

Hebrew: בְּלֶכְתּ֣וֹ אֶל־צִֽיקְלַ֗ג נָפְל֣וּ עָלָ֣יו <small>׀</small> מִֽמְּנַשֶּׁ֡ה עַ֠דְנַ֠ח וְיוֹזָבָ֤ד וִידִֽיעֲאֵל֙ וּמִיכָאֵ֣ל וְיוֹזָבָ֔ד וֶאֱלִיה֖וּא וְצִלְּתָ֑י רָאשֵׁ֥י הָאֲלָפִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִמְנַשֶּֽׁה׃
Translated: when he went to Ziklag, these Manassites went over to his side—Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, chiefs of the clans of Manasseh.
Transliteration: velekhetvo el-tsiykelag nafelu alayv <small></small> mimenasheh adenach veyvozavad viydiyael umiykhael veyvozavad veeliyhu vetsiletay rashey haalafiym asher limenasheh

Hebrew: וְהֵ֗מָּה עָזְר֤וּ עִם־דָּוִיד֙ עַֽל־הַגְּד֔וּד כִּֽי־גִבּ֥וֹרֵי חַ֖יִל כֻּלָּ֑ם וַיִּהְי֥וּ שָׂרִ֖ים בַּצָּבָֽא׃
Translated: It was they who gave support to David against the band, for all were valiant men; and they were officers of the force.
Transliteration: vehemah azeru im-daviyd al-hagedud khiy-givvorey chayiil khulam vayiheyu shariym vatsava

Hebrew: כִּ֚י לְעֶת־י֣וֹם בְּי֔וֹם יָבֹ֥אוּ עַל־דָּוִ֖יד לְעׇזְר֑וֹ עַד־לְמַחֲנֶ֥ה גָד֖וֹל כְּמַחֲנֵ֥ה אֱלֹהִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Day in day out, people came to David to give him support, until there was an army as vast as the army of God.
Transliteration: khiy leet-yvom veyvom yavou al-daviyd leׇzervo ad-lemachaneh gadvol khemachaneh Elohim {f}

Hebrew: וְ֠אֵ֠לֶּה מִסְפְּרֵ֞י רָאשֵׁ֤י הֶחָלוּץ֙ לַצָּבָ֔א בָּ֥אוּ עַל־דָּוִ֖יד חֶבְר֑וֹנָה לְהָסֵ֞ב מַלְכ֥וּת שָׁא֛וּל אֵלָ֖יו כְּפִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: These are the numbers of the [men of the] armed bands who joined David at Hebron to transfer Saul’s kingdom to him, in accordance with the word of the L<small>ORD</small>:
Transliteration: veeleh miseferey rashey hechaluts latsava vau al-daviyd chevervonah lehasev malekhut shaul elayv khefiy yehovah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה נֹשְׂאֵ֥י צִנָּ֖ה וָרֹ֑מַח שֵׁ֧שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֛ים וּשְׁמוֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֖וֹת חֲלוּצֵ֥י צָבָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: Judahites, equipped with shield and spear—6,800 armed men;
Transliteration: veney yehudah nosheey tsinah varomach sheshet alafiym ushemvoneh mevot chalutsey tsava {s}

Hebrew: מִן־בְּנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֗וֹן גִּבּ֤וֹרֵֽי חַ֙יִל֙ לַצָּבָ֔א שִׁבְעַ֥ת אֲלָפִ֖ים וּמֵאָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Simeonites, valiant men, fighting troops—7,100;
Transliteration: min-veney shimevon givvorey chayiil latsava shiveat alafiym umeah {s}

Hebrew: מִן־בְּנֵי֙ הַלֵּוִ֔י אַרְבַּ֥עַת אֲלָפִ֖ים וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: of the Levites—4,600;
Transliteration: min-veney haleviy arevaat alafiym veshesh mevot {s}

Hebrew: וִיהוֹיָדָ֖ע הַנָּגִ֣יד לְאַהֲרֹ֑ן וְעִמּ֕וֹ שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: Jehoiada, chief officer of the Aaronides; with him, 3,700;
Transliteration: viyhvoyada hanagiyd leaharon veimvo sheloshet alafiym usheva mevot {s}

Hebrew: וְצָד֥וֹק נַ֖עַר גִּבּ֣וֹר חָ֑יִל וּבֵית־אָבִ֥יו שָׂרִ֖ים עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁנָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: Zadok, a young valiant man, with his clan—22 officers;
Transliteration: vetsadvok naar givvor chayiil uveyt-aviyv shariym esheriym ushenayiim {s}

Hebrew: וּמִן־בְּנֵ֧י בִנְיָמִ֛ן אֲחֵ֥י שָׁא֖וּל שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֑ים וְעַד־הֵ֙נָּה֙ מַרְבִּיתָ֔ם שֹׁמְרִ֕ים מִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת בֵּ֥ית שָׁאֽוּל׃ {ס}
Translated: of the Benjaminites, kinsmen of Saul, 3,000 in their great numbers, hitherto protecting the interests of the house of Saul;
Transliteration: umin-veney vineyamin achey shaul sheloshet alafiym vead-henah mareviytam shomeriym mishemeret veyt shaul {s}

Hebrew: וּמִן־בְּנֵ֣י אֶפְרַ֔יִם עֶשְׂרִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁמוֹנֶ֣ה מֵא֑וֹת גִּבּ֣וֹרֵי חַ֔יִל אַנְשֵׁ֥י שֵׁמ֖וֹת לְבֵ֥ית אֲבוֹתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: of the Ephraimites, 20,800 valiant men, famous in their clans;
Transliteration: umin-veney eferayiim esheriym elef ushemvoneh mevot givvorey chayiil aneshey shemvot leveyt avvotam {s}

Hebrew: וּמֵֽחֲצִי֙ מַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה שְׁמוֹנָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אָ֑לֶף אֲשֶׁ֤ר נִקְּבוּ֙ בְּשֵׁמ֔וֹת לָב֖וֹא לְהַמְלִ֥יךְ אֶת־דָּוִֽיד׃ {ס}
Translated: of the half-tribe of Manasseh, 18,000, who were designated by name to come and make David king;
Transliteration: umechatsiy mateh menasheh shemvonah ashar alef asher nikevu veshemvot lavvo lehameliykhe et-daviyd {s}

Hebrew: וּמִבְּנֵ֣י יִשָּׂשכָ֗ר יוֹדְעֵ֤י בִינָה֙ לַֽעִתִּ֔ים לָדַ֖עַת מַה־יַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל רָאשֵׁיהֶ֣ם מָאתַ֔יִם וְכׇל־אֲחֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־פִּיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: of the Issacharites, men who knew how to interpret the signs of the times, to determine how Israel should act; their chiefs were 200, and all their kinsmen followed them;
Transliteration: umiveney yishashkhar yvodeey viynah laitiym ladaat mah-yaasheh yisherael rasheyhem matayiim vekhׇl-acheyhem al-fiyhem {s}

Hebrew: מִזְּבֻל֞וּן יוֹצְאֵ֣י צָבָ֗א עֹרְכֵ֧י מִלְחָמָ֛ה בְּכׇל־כְּלֵ֥י מִלְחָמָ֖ה חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים אָ֑לֶף וְלַעֲדֹ֖ר בְּלֹא־לֵ֥ב וָלֵֽב׃ {ס}
Translated: of Zebulun, those ready for service, able to man a battle line with all kinds of weapons, 50,000, giving support wholeheartedly;
Transliteration: mizevulun yvotseey tsava orekhey milechamah vekhׇl-kheley milechamah chamishiym alef velaador velo-lev valev {s}

Hebrew: וּמִנַּפְתָּלִ֖י שָׂרִ֣ים אָ֑לֶף וְעִמָּהֶם֙ בְּצִנָּ֣ה וַחֲנִ֔ית שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וְשִׁבְעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: of Naphtali, 1,000 chieftains with their shields and lances—37,000;
Transliteration: uminafetaliy shariym alef veimahem vetsinah vachaniyt sheloshiym veshiveah alef {s}

Hebrew: וּמִן־הַדָּנִי֙ עֹרְכֵ֣י מִלְחָמָ֔ה עֶשְׂרִֽים־וּשְׁמוֹנָ֥ה אֶ֖לֶף וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: of the Danites, able to man the battle line—28,600;
Transliteration: umin-hadaniy orekhey milechamah esheriym-ushemvonah elef veshesh mevot {s}

Hebrew: וּמֵאָשֵׁ֗ר יוֹצְאֵ֥י צָבָ֛א לַעֲרֹ֥ךְ מִלְחָמָ֖ה אַרְבָּעִ֥ים אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: of Asher, those ready for service to man the battle line—40,000;
Transliteration: umeasher yvotseey tsava laarokhe milechamah arevaiym alef {s}

Hebrew: וּמֵעֵ֣בֶר לַ֠יַּרְדֵּ֠ן מִן־הָראוּבֵנִ֨י וְהַגָּדִ֜י וַחֲצִ֣י ׀ שֵׁ֣בֶט מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה בְּכֹל֙ כְּלֵי֙ צְבָ֣א מִלְחָמָ֔ה מֵאָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: from beyond the Jordan, of the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, together with all kinds of military weapons—120,000.
Transliteration: umeever layareden min-haruveniy vehagadiy vachatsiy shevet menasheh vekhol kheley tseva milechamah meah veesheriym alef {s}

Hebrew: כׇּל־אֵ֜לֶּה אַנְשֵׁ֣י מִלְחָמָה֮ עֹדְרֵ֣י מַעֲרָכָה֒ בְּלֵבָ֤ב שָׁלֵם֙ בָּ֣אוּ חֶבְר֔וֹנָה לְהַמְלִ֥יךְ אֶת־דָּוִ֖יד עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְ֠גַ֠ם כׇּל־שֵׁרִ֧ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל לֵ֥ב אֶחָ֖ד לְהַמְלִ֥יךְ אֶת־דָּוִֽיד׃
Translated: All these, fighting men, manning the battle line with whole heart, came to Hebron to make David king over all Israel. Likewise, all the rest of Israel was of one mind to make David king.
Transliteration: khׇl-eleh aneshey milechamah oderey maarakhah velevav shalem vau chevervonah lehameliykhe et-daviyd al-khׇl-yisherael vegam khׇl-sheriyt yisherael lev echad lehameliykhe et-daviyd

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ־שָׁ֤ם עִם־דָּוִיד֙ יָמִ֣ים שְׁלוֹשָׁ֔ה אֹכְלִ֖ים וְשׁוֹתִ֑ים כִּי־הֵכִ֥ינוּ לָהֶ֖ם אֲחֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: They were there with David three days, eating and drinking, for their kinsmen had provided for them.
Transliteration: vayiheyu-sham im-daviyd yamiym shelvoshah okheliym veshvotiym khiy-hekhiynu lahem acheyhem

Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם הַקְּרֽוֹבִים־אֲ֠לֵיהֶ֠ם עַד־יִשָּׂשכָ֨ר וּזְבֻל֜וּן וְנַפְתָּלִ֗י מְבִיאִ֣ים לֶ֡חֶם בַּחֲמוֹרִ֣ים וּבַגְּמַלִּ֣ים וּבַפְּרָדִ֣ים ׀ וּֽבַבָּקָ֡ר מַאֲכָ֡ל קֶ֠מַח דְּבֵלִ֨ים וְצִמּוּקִ֧ים וְיַיִן־וְשֶׁ֛מֶן וּבָקָ֥ר וְצֹ֖אן לָרֹ֑ב כִּ֥י שִׂמְחָ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: And also, their relatives as far away as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali brought food by ass, camel, mule, and ox—provisions of flour, cakes of figs, raisin cakes, wine, oil, cattle, and sheep in abundance, for there was joy in Israel.
Transliteration: vegam hakervoviym-aleyhem ad-yishashkhar uzevulun venafetaliy meviyiym lechem vachamvoriym uvagemaliym uvaferadiym uvavakar maakhal kemach develiym vetsimukiym veyayin-veshemen uvakar vetson larov khiy shimechah veyisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּעַ֣ץ דָּוִ֗יד עִם־שָׂרֵ֧י הָאֲלָפִ֛ים וְהַמֵּא֖וֹת לְכׇל־נָגִֽיד׃
Translated: Then David consulted with the officers of the thousands and the hundreds, with every chief officer.
Transliteration: vayivaats daviyd im-sharey haalafiym vehamevot lekhׇl-nagiyd

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜יד לְכֹ֣ל ׀ קְהַ֣ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אִם־עֲלֵיכֶ֨ם ט֜וֹב וּמִן־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ נִפְרְצָה֙ נִשְׁלְחָ֞ה עַל־אַחֵ֣ינוּ הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֗ים בְּכֹל֙ אַרְצ֣וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְעִמָּהֶ֛ם הַכֹּהֲנִ֥ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֖ם בְּעָרֵ֣י מִגְרְשֵׁיהֶ֑ם וְיִקָּבְצ֖וּ אֵלֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: David said to the entire assembly of Israel, “If you approve, and if the L<small>ORD</small> our God concurs, let us send far and wide to our remaining kinsmen throughout the territories of Israel, including the priests and Levites in the towns where they have pasturelands, that they should gather together to us
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd lekhol kehal yisherael im-aleykhem tvov umin-yehovah eloheynu niferetsah nishelechah al-acheynu hanisheariym vekhol aretsvot yisherael veimahem hakhohaniym vehaleviyim vearey migeresheyhem veyikavetsu eleynu

Hebrew: וְנָסֵ֛בָּה אֶת־אֲר֥וֹן אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ אֵלֵ֑ינוּ כִּֽי־לֹ֥א דְרַשְׁנֻ֖הוּ בִּימֵ֥י שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: in order to transfer the Ark of our God to us, for throughout the days of Saul we paid no regard to it.”
Transliteration: venasevah et-arvon eloheynu eleynu khiy-lo derashenuhu viymey shaul

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ כׇֽל־הַקָּהָ֖ל לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת כֵּ֑ן כִּֽי־יָשַׁ֥ר הַדָּבָ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֥י כׇל־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: The entire assembly agreed to do so, for the proposal pleased all the people.
Transliteration: vayomeru khׇl-hakahal laashvot khen khiy-yashar hadavar veeyney khׇl-haam

Hebrew: וַיַּקְהֵ֤ל דָּוִיד֙ אֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִן־שִׁיח֥וֹר מִצְרַ֖יִם וְעַד־לְב֣וֹא חֲמָ֑ת לְהָבִיא֙ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים מִקִּרְיַ֖ת יְעָרִֽים׃
Translated: David then assembled all Israel from Shihor of Egypt to Lebo-hamath, in order to bring the Ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.
Transliteration: vayakehel daviyd et-khׇl-yisherael min-shiychvor mitserayiim vead-levvo chamat lehaviy et-arvon haElohim mikireyat yeariym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַל דָּוִ֤יד וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בַּעֲלָ֔תָה אֶל־קִרְיַ֥ת יְעָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לִֽיהוּדָ֑ה לְהַעֲל֣וֹת מִשָּׁ֗ם אֵת֩ אֲר֨וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֧ים <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֛ה יוֹשֵׁ֥ב הַכְּרוּבִ֖ים אֲשֶׁר־נִקְרָ֥א שֵֽׁם׃
Translated: David and all Israel went up to Baalah, Kiriath-jearim of Judah, to bring up from there the Ark of God, the L<small>ORD</small>, Enthroned on the Cherubim, to which the Name was attached.
Transliteration: vayaal daviyd vekhׇl-yisherael vaalatah el-kireyat yeariym asher liyhudah lehaalvot misham et arvon haElohim <small></small> yehovah yvoshev hakheruviym asher-nikera shem

Hebrew: וַיַּרְכִּ֜יבוּ אֶת־אֲר֤וֹן הָאֱלֹהִים֙ עַל־עֲגָלָ֣ה חֲדָשָׁ֔ה מִבֵּ֖ית אֲבִינָדָ֑ב וְעֻזָּ֣א וְאַחְי֔וֹ נֹהֲגִ֖ים בָּעֲגָלָֽה׃
Translated: They transported the Ark of God on a new cart from the house of Abinadab; Uzza and Ahio guided the cart,
Transliteration: vayarekhiyvu et-arvon haElohim al-agalah chadashah miveyt aviynadav veuza veacheyvo nohagiym vaagalah

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֣יד וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מְשַׂחֲקִ֛ים לִפְנֵ֥י הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּכׇל־עֹ֑ז וּבְשִׁירִ֤ים וּבְכִנֹּרוֹת֙ וּבִנְבָלִ֣ים וּבְתֻפִּ֔ים וּבִמְצִלְתַּ֖יִם וּבַחֲצֹצְרֽוֹת׃
Translated: and David and all Israel danced before God with all their might—with songs, lyres, harps, timbrels, cymbals, and trumpets.
Transliteration: vedaviyd vekhׇl-yisherael meshachakiym lifeney haElohim vekhׇl-oz uveshiyriym uvekhinorvot uvinevaliym uvetufiym uvimetsiletayiim uvachatsotservot

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ עַד־גֹּ֣רֶן כִּידֹ֑ן וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח עֻזָּ֜א אֶת־יָד֗וֹ לֶֽאֱחֹז֙ אֶת־הָ֣אָר֔וֹן כִּ֥י שָֽׁמְט֖וּ הַבָּקָֽר׃
Translated: But when they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzza put out his hand to hold the Ark of God because the oxen had stumbled.
Transliteration: vayavou ad-goren khiydon vayishelach uza et-yadvo leechoz et-haarvon khiy shametu havakar

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ בְּעֻזָּ֔א וַיַּכֵּ֕הוּ עַ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח יָד֖וֹ עַל־הָאָר֑וֹן וַיָּ֥מׇת שָׁ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
