Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> was incensed at Uzza, and struck him down, because he laid a hand on the Ark; and so he died there before God.
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah veuza vayakhehu al asher-shalach yadvo al-haarvon vayamׇt sham lifeney Elohim

Hebrew: וַיִּ֣חַר לְדָוִ֔יד כִּֽי־פָרַ֧ץ יְהֹוָ֛ה פֶּ֖רֶץ בְּעֻזָּ֑א וַיִּקְרָ֞א לַמָּק֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ פֶּ֣רֶץ עֻזָּ֔א עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: David was distressed because the L<small>ORD</small> had burst out against Uzza; and that place was named Perez-uzza, as it is still called.
Transliteration: vayichar ledaviyd khiy-farats yehovah ferets veuza vayikera lamakvom hahu ferets uza ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַיִּירָ֤א דָוִיד֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא לֵאמֹ֑ר הֵ֚יךְ אָבִ֣יא אֵלַ֔י אֵ֖ת אֲר֥וֹן הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: David was afraid of God that day; he said, “How can I bring the Ark of God here?”
Transliteration: vayiyra daviyd et-haElohimm vayyvom hahu lemor heykhe aviy elay et arvon haElohim

Hebrew: וְלֹא־הֵסִ֨יר דָּוִ֧יד אֶת־הָאָר֛וֹן אֵלָ֖יו אֶל־עִ֣יר דָּוִ֑יד וַיַּטֵּ֕הוּ אֶל־בֵּ֥ית עֹבֵֽד־אֱדֹ֖ם הַגִּתִּֽי׃
Translated: So David did not remove the Ark to his place in the City of David; instead, he diverted it to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
Transliteration: velo-hesiyr daviyd et-haarvon elayv el-iyr daviyd vayatehu el-veyt oved-edom hagitiy

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֩שֶׁב֩ אֲר֨וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֜ים עִם־בֵּ֨ית עֹבֵ֥ד אֱדֹ֛ם בְּבֵית֖וֹ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה חֳדָשִׁ֑ים וַיְבָ֧רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־בֵּ֥ית עֹבֵֽד־אֱדֹ֖ם וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: The Ark of God remained in the house of Obed-edom, in its own abode, three months, and the L<small>ORD</small> blessed the house of Obed-edom and all he had.
Transliteration: vayeshev arvon haElohim im-veyt oved edom veveytvo sheloshah chodashiym vayevarekhe yehovah et-veyt oved-edom veet-khׇl-asher-lvo {s}

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּשְׁלַ֠ח (חירם) [חוּרָ֨ם] מֶלֶךְ־צֹ֥ר מַלְאָכִים֮ אֶל־דָּוִיד֒ וַעֲצֵ֣י אֲרָזִ֔ים וְחָרָשֵׁ֣י קִ֔יר וְחָרָשֵׁ֖י עֵצִ֑ים לִבְנ֥וֹת ל֖וֹ בָּֽיִת׃
Translated: King Hiram of Tyre sent envoys to David with cedar logs, stonemasons, and carpenters to build a palace for him.
Transliteration: vayishelach (chyrm) [churam] melekhe-tsor maleakhiym el-daviyd vaatsey araziym vecharashey kiyr vecharashey etsiym livenvot lvo vayiit

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣דַע דָּוִ֔יד כִּֽי־הֱכִינ֧וֹ יְהֹוָ֛ה לְמֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּֽי־נִשֵּׂ֤את לְמַ֙עְלָה֙ מַלְכוּת֔וֹ בַּעֲב֖וּר עַמּ֥וֹ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus David knew that the L<small>ORD</small> had established him as king over Israel, and that his kingship was highly exalted for the sake of His people Israel.
Transliteration: vayeda daviyd khiy-hekhiynvo yehovah lemelekhe al-yisherael khiy-nishet lemaelah malekhutvo vaavur amvo yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח דָּוִ֥יד ע֛וֹד נָשִׁ֖ים בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיּ֧וֹלֶד דָּוִ֛יד ע֖וֹד בָּנִ֥ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: David took more wives in Jerusalem, and David begot more sons and daughters.
Transliteration: vayikach daviyd vod nashiym viyrushala͏im vayyvoled daviyd vod vaniym uvanvot

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ שְׁמ֣וֹת הַיְלוּדִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיוּ־ל֖וֹ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם שַׁמּ֣וּעַ וְשׁוֹבָ֔ב נָתָ֖ן וּשְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon;
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot hayeludiym asher hayu-lvo viyrushala͏im shamua veshvovav natan ushelomoh

Hebrew: וְיִבְחָ֥ר וֶאֱלִישׁ֖וּעַ וְאֶלְפָּֽלֶט׃
Translated: Ibhar, Elishua, and Elpelet;
Transliteration: veyivechar veeliyshua veelefalet

Hebrew: וְנֹ֥גַהּ וְנֶ֖פֶג וְיָפִֽיעַ׃
Translated: Nogah, Nepheg, and Japhia;
Transliteration: venogah venefeg veyafiya

Hebrew: וֶאֱלִישָׁמָ֥ע וּבְעֶלְיָדָ֖ע וֶאֱלִיפָֽלֶט׃ {פ}
Translated: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
Transliteration: veeliyshama uveeleyada veeliyfalet {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְע֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים כִּי־נִמְשַׁ֨ח דָּוִ֤יד לְמֶ֙לֶךְ֙ עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיַּעֲל֥וּ כׇל־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים לְבַקֵּ֣שׁ אֶת־דָּוִ֑יד וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע דָּוִ֔יד וַיֵּצֵ֖א לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up in search of David; but David heard of it, and he went out to them.
Transliteration: vayishemeu felishetiym khiy-nimeshach daviyd lemelekhe al-khׇl-yisherael vayaalu khׇl-felishetiym levakesh et-daviyd vayishema daviyd vayetse lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים בָּ֑אוּ וַֽיִּפְשְׁט֖וּ בְּעֵ֥מֶק רְפָאִֽים׃
Translated: The Philistines came and raided the Valley of Rephaim.
Transliteration: ufelishetiym vau vayifeshetu veemek refaiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֨ל דָּוִ֤יד בֵּאלֹהִים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הַאֶֽעֱלֶה֙ עַל־[פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים] (פלשתיים) וּנְתַתָּ֖ם בְּיָדִ֑י וַיֹּ֨אמֶר ל֤וֹ יְהֹוָה֙ עֲלֵ֔ה וּנְתַתִּ֖ים בְּיָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: David inquired of God, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? Will You deliver them into my hands?” And the L<small>ORD</small> answered him, “Go up, and I will deliver them into your hands.”
Transliteration: vayisheal daviyd velohiym lemor haeeleh al-[felishetiym] (flshtyym) unetatam veyadiy vayomer lvo yehovah aleh unetatiym veyadekha

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֥וּ בְּבַֽעַל־פְּרָצִים֮ וַיַּכֵּ֣ם שָׁ֣ם דָּוִיד֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔יד פָּרַ֨ץ הָאֱלֹהִ֧ים אֶת־אוֹיְבַ֛י בְּיָדִ֖י כְּפֶ֣רֶץ מָ֑יִם עַל־כֵּ֗ן קָ֥רְא֛וּ שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא בַּ֥עַל פְּרָצִֽים׃
Translated: Thereupon David ascended Baal-perazim, and David defeated them there. David said, “God burst out against my enemies by my hands as waters burst out.” That is why that place was named Baal-perazim.
Transliteration: vayaalu vevaal-feratsiym vayakhem sham daviyd vayomer daviyd farats haElohim et-voyevay veyadiy kheferets mayiim al-khen kareu shem-hamakvom hahu vaal feratsiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַזְבוּ שָׁ֖ם אֶת־אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔יד וַיִּשָּׂרְפ֖וּ בָּאֵֽשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: They abandoned their gods there, and David ordered these to be burned.
Transliteration: vayaazevu sham et-eloheyhem vayomer daviyd vayisharefu vaesh {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּסִ֤יפוּ עוֹד֙ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וַֽיִּפְשְׁט֖וּ בָּעֵֽמֶק׃
Translated: Once again the Philistines raided the valley.
Transliteration: vayosiyfu vod felishetiym vayifeshetu vaemek

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֨ל ע֤וֹד דָּוִיד֙ בֵּאלֹהִ֔ים וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים לֹ֥א תַעֲלֶ֖ה אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם הָסֵב֙ מֵֽעֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וּבָ֥אתָ לָהֶ֖ם מִמּ֥וּל הַבְּכָאִֽים׃
Translated: David inquired of God once more, and God answered, “Do not go up after them, but circle around them and confront them at the baca trees.
Transliteration: vayisheal vod daviyd velohiym vayomer lvo haElohim lo taaleh achareyhem hasev mealeyhem uvata lahem mimul havekhaiym

Hebrew: וִ֠יהִ֠י כְּֽשׇׁמְעֲךָ֞ אֶת־ק֤וֹל הַצְּעָדָה֙ בְּרָאשֵׁ֣י הַבְּכָאִ֔ים אָ֖ז תֵּצֵ֣א בַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה כִּֽי־יָצָ֤א הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ לְהַכּ֖וֹת אֶת־מַחֲנֵ֥ה פְלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: And when you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the baca trees, then go out to battle, for God will be going in front of you to attack the Philistine forces.”
Transliteration: viyhiy kheshׇmeakha et-kvol hatseadah verashey havekhaiym az tetse vamilechamah khiy-yatsa haElohim lefaneykha lehakhvot et-machaneh felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ דָּוִ֔יד כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖הוּ הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיַּכּוּ֙ אֶת־מַחֲנֵ֣ה פְלִשְׁתִּ֔ים מִגִּבְע֖וֹן וְעַד־גָּֽזְרָה׃
Translated: David did as God had commanded him; and they routed the Philistines from Gibeon all the way to Gezer.
Transliteration: vayaash daviyd khaasher tsivahu haElohim vayakhu et-machaneh felishetiym migivevon vead-gazerah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א שֵׁם־דָּוִ֖יד בְּכׇל־הָאֲרָצ֑וֹת וַיהֹוָ֛ה נָתַ֥ן אֶת־פַּחְדּ֖וֹ עַל־כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: David became famous throughout the lands, and the L<small>ORD</small> put the fear of him in all the nations.
Transliteration: vayetse shem-daviyd vekhׇl-haaratsvot vayhovah natan et-fachedvo al-khׇl-hagvoyim

Hebrew: וַיַּעַשׂ־ל֥וֹ בָתִּ֖ים בְּעִ֣יר דָּוִ֑יד וַיָּ֤כֶן מָקוֹם֙ לַאֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיֶּט־ל֖וֹ אֹֽהֶל׃
Translated: He had houses made for himself in the City of David, and he prepared a place for the Ark of God, and pitched a tent for it.
Transliteration: vayaash-lvo vatiym veiyr daviyd vayakhen makvom laarvon haElohim vayet-lvo ohel

Hebrew: אָ֚ז אָמַ֣ר דָּוִ֔יד לֹ֤א לָשֵׂאת֙ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים כִּ֖י אִם־הַלְוִיִּ֑ם כִּֽי־בָ֣ם ׀ בָּחַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה לָשֵׂ֞את אֶת־אֲר֧וֹן יְהֹוָ֛ה וּֽלְשָׁרְת֖וֹ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Then David gave orders that none but the Levites were to carry the Ark of God, for the L<small>ORD</small> had chosen them to carry the Ark of the L<small>ORD</small> and to minister to Him forever.
Transliteration: az amar daviyd lo lashet et-arvon haElohim khiy im-haleviyim khiy-vam vachar yehovah lashet et-arvon yehovah ulesharetvo ad-volam {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּקְהֵ֥ל דָּוִ֛יד אֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לְהַֽעֲלוֹת֙ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־מְקוֹמ֖וֹ אֲשֶׁר־הֵכִ֥ין לֽוֹ׃
Translated: David assembled all Israel in Jerusalem to bring up the Ark of the L<small>ORD</small> to its place, which he had prepared for it.
Transliteration: vayakehel daviyd et-khׇl-yisherael el-yerushala͏im lehaalvot et-arvon yehovah el-mekvomvo asher-hekhiyn lvo

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ף דָּוִ֛יד אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְאֶת־הַלְוִיִּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Then David gathered together the Aaronides and the Levites:
Transliteration: vayeesof daviyd et-veney aharon veet-haleviyim {s}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֖י קְהָ֑ת אוּרִיאֵ֣ל הַשָּׂ֔ר וְאֶחָ֖יו מֵאָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Kohath: Uriel the officer and his kinsmen—120;
Transliteration: liveney kehat uriyel hashar veechayv meah veesheriym {s}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֖י מְרָרִ֑י עֲשָׂיָ֣ה הַשָּׂ֔ר וְאֶחָ֖יו מָאתַ֥יִם וְעֶשְׂרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Merari: Asaiah the officer and his kinsmen—220;
Transliteration: liveney merariy ashayah hashar veechayv matayiim veesheriym {s}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֖י גֵּרְשׁ֑וֹם יוֹאֵ֣ל הַשָּׂ֔ר וְאֶחָ֖יו מֵאָ֥ה וּשְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Gershom: Joel the officer and his kinsmen—130;
Transliteration: liveney gereshvom yvoel hashar veechayv meah usheloshiym {s}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֖י אֱלִיצָפָ֑ן שְׁמַֽעְיָ֥ה הַשָּׂ֖ר וְאֶחָ֥יו מָאתָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Elizaphan: Shemaiah the officer and his kinsmen—200;
Transliteration: liveney eliytsafan shemaeyah hashar veechayv matayiim {s}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֖י חֶבְר֑וֹן אֱלִיאֵ֥ל הַשָּׂ֖ר וְאֶחָ֥יו שְׁמוֹנִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Hebron: Eliel the officer and his kinsmen—80;
Transliteration: liveney chevervon eliyel hashar veechayv shemvoniym {s}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֖י עֻזִּיאֵ֑ל עַמִּינָדָ֣ב הַשָּׂ֔ר וְאֶחָ֕יו מֵאָ֖ה וּשְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {פ}
Translated: the sons of Uzziel: Amminadab the officer and his kinsmen—112.
Transliteration: liveney uziyel amiynadav hashar veechayv meah usheneym ashar {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א דָוִ֔יד לְצָד֥וֹק וּלְאֶבְיָתָ֖ר הַכֹּהֲנִ֑ים וְלַלְוִיִּ֗ם לְאוּרִיאֵ֤ל עֲשָׂיָה֙ וְיוֹאֵ֣ל שְׁמַֽעְיָ֔ה וֶאֱלִיאֵ֖ל וְעַמִּינָדָֽב׃ {ס}
Translated: David sent for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites: Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.
Transliteration: vayikera daviyd letsadvok uleeveyatar hakhohaniym velaleviyim leuriyel ashayah veyvoel shemaeyah veeliyel veamiynadav {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֔ם אַתֶּ֛ם רָאשֵׁ֥י הָאָב֖וֹת לַלְוִיִּ֑ם הִֽתְקַדְּשׁוּ֙ אַתֶּ֣ם וַאֲחֵיכֶ֔ם וְהַעֲלִיתֶ֗ם אֵ֣ת אֲר֤וֹן יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶל־הֲכִינ֖וֹתִי לֽוֹ׃
Translated: He said to them, “You are the heads of the clans of the Levites; sanctify yourselves, you and your kinsmen, and bring up the Ark of the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel to [the place] I have prepared for it.
Transliteration: vayomer lahem atem rashey haavvot laleviyim hitekadeshu atem vaacheykhem vehaaliytem et arvon yehovah elohey yisherael el-hakhiynvotiy lvo

Hebrew: כִּ֛י לְמַבָּרִ֥אשׁוֹנָ֖ה לֹ֣א אַתֶּ֑ם פָּרַ֨ץ יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ בָּ֔נוּ כִּֽי־לֹ֥א דְרַשְׁנֻ֖הוּ כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: Because you were not there the first time, the L<small>ORD</small> our God burst out against us, for we did not show due regard for Him.”
Transliteration: khiy lemavarishvonah lo atem farats yehovah eloheynu vanu khiy-lo derashenuhu khamishefat

Hebrew: וַיִּֽתְקַדְּשׁ֔וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֑ם לְהַעֲל֕וֹת אֶת־אֲר֥וֹן יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The priests and Levites sanctified themselves in order to bring up the Ark of the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel.
Transliteration: vayitekadeshu hakhohaniym vehaleviyim lehaalvot et-arvon yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂא֣וּ בְנֵֽי־הַלְוִיִּ֗ם אֵ֚ת אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה מֹשֶׁ֖ה כִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה בִּכְתֵפָ֥ם בַּמֹּט֖וֹת עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: The Levites carried the Ark of God by means of poles on their shoulders, as Moses had commanded in accordance with the word of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayisheu veney-haleviyim et arvon haElohim khaasher tsivah mosheh khidevar yehovah vikhetefam vamotvot aleyhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִיד֮ לְשָׂרֵ֣י הַלְוִיִּם֒ לְהַעֲמִ֗יד אֶת־אֲחֵיהֶם֙ הַמְשֹׁ֣רְרִ֔ים בִּכְלֵי־שִׁ֛יר נְבָלִ֥ים וְכִנֹּר֖וֹת וּמְצִלְתָּ֑יִם מַשְׁמִיעִ֥ים לְהָרִֽים־בְּק֖וֹל לְשִׂמְחָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: David ordered the officers of the Levites to install their kinsmen, the singers, with musical instruments, harps, lyres, and cymbals, joyfully making their voices heard.
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd lesharey haleviyim lehaamiyd et-acheyhem hameshoreriym vikheley-shiyr nevaliym vekhinorvot umetsiletayiim mashemiyiym lehariym-vekvol leshimechah {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמִ֣ידוּ הַלְוִיִּ֗ם אֵ֚ת הֵימָ֣ן בֶּן־יוֹאֵ֔ל וּמִ֨ן־אֶחָ֔יו אָסָ֖ף בֶּן־בֶּרֶכְיָ֑הוּ {ס} וּמִן־בְּנֵ֤י מְרָרִי֙ אֲחֵיהֶ֔ם אֵיתָ֖ן בֶּן־קוּשָׁיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: So the Levites installed Heman son of Joel and, of his kinsmen, Asaph son of Berechiah; and, of the sons of Merari their kinsmen, Ethan son of Kushaiah.
Transliteration: vayaamiydu haleviyim et heyman ven-yvoel umin-echayv asaf ven-verekheyahu {s} umin-veney merariy acheyhem eytan ven-kushayahu

Hebrew: וְעִמָּהֶ֖ם אֲחֵיהֶ֣ם הַמִּשְׁנִ֑ים זְכַרְיָ֡הוּ בֵּ֡ן וְיַעֲזִיאֵ֡ל וּשְׁמִירָמ֡וֹת וִיחִיאֵ֣ל <small>׀</small> וְעֻנִּ֡י אֱלִיאָ֡ב וּבְנָיָ֡הוּ וּמַעֲשֵׂיָ֡הוּ וּמַתִּתְיָ֩הוּ֩ וֶאֱלִ֨יפְלֵ֜הוּ וּמִקְנֵיָ֨הוּ וְעֹבֵ֥ד אֱדֹ֛ם וִיעִיאֵ֖ל הַשֹּׁעֲרִֽים׃
Translated: Together with them were their kinsmen of second rank, Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphalehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom and Jeiel the gatekeepers.
Transliteration: veimahem acheyhem hamisheniym zekhareyahu ven veyaaziyel ushemiyramvot viychiyel <small></small> veuniy eliyav uvenayahu umaasheyahu umatiteyahu veeliyfelehu umikeneyahu veoved edom viyiyel hashoariym

Hebrew: וְהַמְשֹׁ֣רְרִ֔ים הֵימָ֥ן אָסָ֖ף וְאֵיתָ֑ן בִּמְצִלְתַּ֥יִם נְחֹ֖שֶׁת לְהַשְׁמִֽיעַ׃
Translated: Also the singers Heman, Asaph, and Ethan to sound the bronze cymbals,
Transliteration: vehameshoreriym heyman asaf veeytan vimetsiletayiim nechoshet lehashemiya

Hebrew: וּזְכַרְיָ֨ה וַעֲזִיאֵ֜ל וּשְׁמִירָמ֤וֹת וִֽיחִיאֵל֙ וְעֻנִּ֣י וֶאֱלִיאָ֔ב וּמַעֲשֵׂיָ֖הוּ וּבְנָיָ֑הוּ בִּנְבָלִ֖ים עַל־עֲלָמֽוֹת׃
Translated: and Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah with harps on alamoth;
Transliteration: uzekhareyah vaaziyel ushemiyramvot viychiyel veuniy veeliyav umaasheyahu uvenayahu vinevaliym al-alamvot

Hebrew: וּמַתִּתְיָ֣הוּ וֶאֱלִֽיפְלֵ֗הוּ וּמִקְנֵיָ֙הוּ֙ וְעֹבֵ֣ד אֱדֹ֔ם וִיעִיאֵ֖ל וַעֲזַזְיָ֑הוּ בְּכִנֹּר֥וֹת עַל־הַשְּׁמִינִ֖ית לְנַצֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: also Mattithiah, Eliphalehu, Mikneiah, Obed-edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah, with lyres to lead on the sheminith;
Transliteration: umatiteyahu veeliyfelehu umikeneyahu veoved edom viyiyel vaazazeyahu vekhinorvot al-hashemiyniyt lenatsecha

Hebrew: וּכְנַנְיָ֥הוּ שַֽׂר־הַלְוִיִּ֖ם בְּמַשָּׂ֑א יָסֹר֙ בַּמַּשָּׂ֔א כִּ֥י מֵבִ֖ין הֽוּא׃
Translated: also Chenaniah, officer of the Levites in song; he was in charge of the song because he was a master.
Transliteration: ukhenaneyahu shar-haleviyim vemasha yasor vamasha khiy meviyn hu

Hebrew: וּבֶֽרֶכְיָה֙ וְאֶלְקָנָ֔ה שֹׁעֲרִ֖ים לָאָרֽוֹן׃
Translated: Berechiah and Elkanah were gatekeepers for the Ark.
Transliteration: uverekheyah veelekanah shoariym laarvon

Hebrew: וּשְׁבַנְיָ֡הוּ וְיוֹשָׁפָ֡ט וּנְתַנְאֵ֡ל וַעֲמָשַׂ֡י וּ֠זְכַרְיָ֠הוּ וּבְנָיָ֤הוּ וֶאֱלִיעֶ֙זֶר֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים (מחצצרים) [מַחְצְרִים֙] בַּחֲצֹ֣צְר֔וֹת לִפְנֵ֖י אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְעֹבֵ֤ד אֱדֹם֙ וִֽיחִיָּ֔ה שֹׁעֲרִ֖ים לָאָרֽוֹן׃
Translated: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer the priests sounded the trumpets before the Ark of God, and Obededom and Jehiah were gatekeepers for the Ark.
Transliteration: ushevaneyahu veyvoshafat unetaneel vaamashay uzekhareyahu uvenayahu veeliyezer hakhohaniym (mchtstsrym) [machetseriym] vachatsotservot lifeney arvon haElohim veoved edom viychiyah shoariym laarvon

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י דָוִ֛יד וְזִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְשָׂרֵ֣י הָאֲלָפִ֑ים הַהֹלְכִ֗ים לְֽהַעֲל֞וֹת אֶת־אֲר֧וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֛ה מִן־בֵּ֥ית עֹבֵֽד־אֱדֹ֖ם בְּשִׂמְחָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Then David and the elders of Israel and the officers of the thousands who were going to bring up the Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small> from the house of Obed-edom were joyful.
Transliteration: vayehiy daviyd vezikeney yisherael vesharey haalafiym haholekhiym lehaalvot et-arvon veriyt-yehovah min-veyt oved-edom veshimechah {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בֶּעְזֹ֣ר הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶ֨ת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם נֹשְׂאֵ֖י אֲר֣וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּזְבְּח֥וּ שִׁבְעָֽה־פָרִ֖ים וְשִׁבְעָ֥ה אֵילִֽים׃
Translated: Since God helped the Levites who were carrying the Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small>, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
Transliteration: vayehiy veezor haElohim et-haleviyim nosheey arvon veriyt-yehovah vayizevechu shiveah-fariym veshiveah eyliym

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֞יד מְכֻרְבָּ֣ל ׀ בִּמְעִ֣יל בּ֗וּץ וְכׇל־הַלְוִיִּם֙ הַנֹּשְׂאִ֣ים אֶת־הָאָר֔וֹן וְהַמְשֹׁ֣רְרִ֔ים וּכְנַנְיָ֛ה הַשַּׂ֥ר הַמַּשָּׂ֖א הַמְשֹׁרְרִ֑ים וְעַל־דָּוִ֖יד אֵפ֥וֹד בָּֽד׃
Translated: Now David and all the Levites who were carrying the Ark, and the singers and Chenaniah, officer of song of the singers, were wrapped in robes of fine linen, and David wore a linen ephod.
Transliteration: vedaviyd mekhureval vimeiyl vuts vekhׇl-haleviyim hanosheiym et-haarvon vehameshoreriym ukhenaneyah hashar hamasha hameshoreriym veal-daviyd efvod vad

Hebrew: וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מַֽעֲלִים֙ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֔ה בִּתְרוּעָה֙ וּבְק֣וֹל שׁוֹפָ֔ר וּבַחֲצֹצְר֖וֹת וּבִמְצִלְתָּ֑יִם מַשְׁמִעִ֕ים בִּנְבָלִ֖ים וְכִנֹּרֽוֹת׃
Translated: All Israel brought up the Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small> with shouts and with blasts of the horn, with trumpets and cymbals, playing on harps and lyres.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-yisherael maaliym et-arvon veriyt-yehovah viteruah uvekvol shvofar uvachatsotservot uvimetsiletayiim mashemiiym vinevaliym vekhinorvot

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אֲרוֹן֙ בְּרִ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה בָּ֖א עַד־עִ֣יר דָּוִ֑יד וּמִיכַ֨ל בַּת־שָׁא֜וּל נִשְׁקְפָ֣ה ׀ בְּעַ֣ד הַחַלּ֗וֹן וַתֵּ֨רֶא אֶת־הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ דָּוִיד֙ מְרַקֵּ֣ד וּמְשַׂחֵ֔ק וַתִּ֥בֶז ל֖וֹ בְּלִבָּֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: As the Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small> arrived at the City of David, Michal daughter of Saul looked out of the window and saw King David leaping and dancing, and she despised him for it.
Transliteration: vayehiy arvon veriyt yehovah va ad-iyr daviyd umiykhal vat-shaul nishekefah vead hachalvon vatere et-hamelekhe daviyd meraked umeshachek vativez lvo velivah {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֙יאוּ֙ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיַּצִּ֣יגוּ אֹת֔וֹ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָאֹ֔הֶל אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָטָה־ל֖וֹ דָּוִ֑יד וַיַּקְרִ֛יבוּ עֹל֥וֹת וּשְׁלָמִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֥י הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: They brought in the Ark of God and set it up inside the tent that David had pitched for it, and they sacrificed burnt offerings and offerings of well-being before God.
Transliteration: vayaviyu et-arvon haElohim vayatsiygu otvo vetvokhe haohel asher natah-lvo daviyd vayakeriyvu olvot ushelamiym lifeney haElohim

Hebrew: וַיְכַ֣ל דָּוִ֔יד מֵהַעֲל֥וֹת הָעֹלָ֖ה וְהַשְּׁלָמִ֑ים וַיְבָ֥רֶךְ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When David finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and the offerings of well-being, he blessed the people in the name of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayekhal daviyd mehaalvot haolah vehashelamiym vayevarekhe et-haam veshem yehovah

Hebrew: וַיְחַלֵּק֙ לְכׇל־אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מֵאִ֖ישׁ וְעַד־אִשָּׁ֑ה לְאִישׁ֙ כִּכַּר־לֶ֔חֶם וְאֶשְׁפָּ֖ר וַאֲשִׁישָֽׁה׃
Translated: And he distributed to every person in Israel—man and woman alike—to each a loaf of bread, a cake made in a pan, and a raisin cake.
Transliteration: vayechalek lekhׇl-iysh yisherael meiysh vead-ishah leiysh khikhar-lechem veeshefar vaashiyshah

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֞ן לִפְנֵ֨י אֲר֧וֹן יְהֹוָ֛ה מִן־הַלְוִיִּ֖ם מְשָֽׁרְתִ֑ים וּלְהַזְכִּיר֙ וּלְהוֹד֣וֹת וּלְהַלֵּ֔ל לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: He appointed Levites to minister before the Ark of the L<small>ORD</small>, to invoke, to praise, and to extol the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel:
Transliteration: vayiten lifeney arvon yehovah min-haleviyim mesharetiym ulehazekhiyr ulehvodvot ulehalel layhovah elohey yisherael {s}

Hebrew: אָסָ֥ף הָרֹ֖אשׁ וּמִשְׁנֵ֣הוּ זְכַרְיָ֑ה יְעִיאֵ֡ל וּשְׁמִירָמ֡וֹת וִיחִיאֵ֡ל וּמַתִּתְיָ֡ה וֶאֱלִיאָ֡ב וּבְנָיָ֩הוּ֩ וְעֹבֵ֨ד אֱדֹ֜ם וִיעִיאֵ֗ל בִּכְלֵ֤י נְבָלִים֙ וּבְכִנֹּר֔וֹת וְאָסָ֖ף בַּֽמְצִלְתַּ֥יִם מַשְׁמִֽיעַ׃
Translated: Asaph the chief, Zechariah second in rank, Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom, and Jeiel, with harps and lyres, and Asaph sounding the cymbals,
Transliteration: asaf harosh umishenehu zekhareyah yeiyel ushemiyramvot viychiyel umatiteyah veeliyav uvenayahu veoved edom viyiyel vikheley nevaliym uvekhinorvot veasaf vametsiletayiim mashemiya

Hebrew: וּבְנָיָ֥הוּ וְיַחֲזִיאֵ֖ל הַכֹּהֲנִ֑ים בַּחֲצֹצְר֣וֹת תָּמִ֔יד לִפְנֵ֖י אֲר֥וֹן בְּרִית־הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests, with trumpets, regularly before the Ark of the Covenant of God.
Transliteration: uvenayahu veyachaziyel hakhohaniym vachatsotservot tamiyd lifeney arvon veriyt-haElohim

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא אָ֣ז נָתַ֤ן דָּוִיד֙ בָּרֹ֔אשׁ לְהֹד֖וֹת לַיהֹוָ֑ה בְּיַד־אָסָ֖ף וְאֶחָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Then, on that day, David first commissioned Asaph and his kinsmen to give praise to the L<small>ORD</small>:
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu az natan daviyd varosh lehodvot layhovah veyad-asaf veechayv {f}

Hebrew: הוֹד֤וּ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ קִרְא֣וּ בִשְׁמ֔וֹ הוֹדִ֥יעוּ בָעַמִּ֖ים עֲלִילֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
“Praise the LORD;
call on His name;
proclaim His deeds among the peoples.
Transliteration: hvodu layhovah kireu vishemvo hvodiyu vaamiym aliylotayv

Hebrew: שִׁ֤ירוּ לוֹ֙ זַמְּרוּ־ל֔וֹ שִׂ֖יחוּ בְּכׇל־נִפְלְאֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Sing praises unto Him;
speak of all His wondrous acts.
Transliteration: shiyru lvo zameru-lvo shiychu vekhׇl-nifeleotayv

Hebrew: הִֽתְהַלְלוּ֙ בְּשֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשׁ֔וֹ יִשְׂמַ֕ח לֵ֖ב מְבַקְשֵׁ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Exult in His holy name;
let all who seek the LORD rejoice.
Transliteration: hitehalelu veshem kׇdeshvo yishemach lev mevakeshey yehovah

Hebrew: דִּרְשׁ֤וּ יְהֹוָה֙ וְעֻזּ֔וֹ בַּקְּשׁ֥וּ פָנָ֖יו תָּמִֽיד׃
Translated:
Turn to the LORD, to His might;
seek His presence constantly.
Transliteration: direshu yehovah veuzvo vakeshu fanayv tamiyd

Hebrew: זִכְר֗וּ נִפְלְאֹתָיו֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה מֹפְתָ֖יו וּמִשְׁפְּטֵי־פִֽיהוּ׃
Translated:
Remember the wonders He has done;
His portents and the judgments He has pronounced,
Transliteration: zikheru nifeleotayv asher ashah mofetayv umishefetey-fiyhu

Hebrew: זֶ֚רַע יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל עַבְדּ֔וֹ בְּנֵ֥י יַעֲקֹ֖ב בְּחִירָֽיו׃
Translated:
O offspring of Israel, His servant,
O descendants of Jacob, His chosen ones.
Transliteration: zera yisherael avedvo veney yaakov vechiyrayv

Hebrew: ה֚וּא יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ בְּכׇל־הָאָ֖רֶץ מִשְׁפָּטָֽיו׃
Translated:
He is the LORD our God;
His judgments are throughout the earth.
Transliteration: hu yehovah eloheynu vekhׇl-haarets mishefatayv

Hebrew: זִכְר֤וּ לְעוֹלָם֙ בְּרִית֔וֹ דָּבָ֥ר צִוָּ֖ה לְאֶ֥לֶף דּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Be ever mindful of His covenant,
the promise He gave for a thousand generations,
Transliteration: zikheru levolam veriytvo davar tsivah leelef dvor

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר כָּרַת֙ אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֔ם וּשְׁבוּעָת֖וֹ לְיִצְחָֽק׃
Translated:
that He made with Abraham,
swore to Isaac,
Transliteration: asher kharat et-averaham ushevuatvo leyitsechak

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמִידֶ֤הָ לְיַֽעֲקֹב֙ לְחֹ֔ק לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּרִ֥ית עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
and confirmed in a decree for Jacob,
for Israel, as an eternal covenant,
Transliteration: vayaamiydeha leyaakov lechok leyisherael veriyt volam

Hebrew: לֵאמֹ֗ר לְךָ֙ אֶתֵּ֣ן אֶֽרֶץ־כְּנָ֔עַן חֶ֖בֶל נַחֲלַתְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
saying, ‘To you I will give the land of Canaan
as your allotted heritage.’
Transliteration: lemor lekha eten erets-khenaan chevel nachalatekhem

Hebrew: בִּהְיֽוֹתְכֶם֙ מְתֵ֣י מִסְפָּ֔ר כִּמְעַ֖ט וְגָרִ֥ים בָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
You were then few in number,
a handful, merely sojourning there,
Transliteration: viheyvotekhem metey misefar khimeat vegariym vah

Hebrew: וַיִּֽתְהַלְּכוּ֙ מִגּ֣וֹי אֶל־גּ֔וֹי וּמִמַּמְלָכָ֖ה אֶל־עַ֥ם אַחֵֽר׃
Translated:
wandering from nation to nation,
from one kingdom to another.
Transliteration: vayitehalekhu migvoy el-gvoy umimamelakhah el-am acher

Hebrew: לֹֽא־הִנִּ֤יחַ לְאִישׁ֙ לְעׇשְׁקָ֔ם וַיּ֥וֹכַח עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מְלָכִֽים׃
Translated:
He allowed no one to oppress them;
He reproved kings on their account,
Transliteration: lo-hiniycha leiysh leׇshekam vayyvokhach aleyhem melakhiym

Hebrew: אַֽל־תִּגְּעוּ֙ בִּמְשִׁיחָ֔י וּבִנְבִיאַ֖י אַל־תָּרֵֽעוּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
‘Do not touch My anointed ones;
do not harm My prophets.’
Transliteration: al-tigeu vimeshiychay uvineviyay al-tareu {f}

Hebrew: שִׁ֤ירוּ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ כׇּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ בַּשְּׂר֥וּ מִיּֽוֹם־אֶל־י֖וֹם יְשׁוּעָתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
“Sing to the LORD, all the earth.
proclaim His victory day after day.
Transliteration: shiyru layhovah khׇl-haarets vasheru miyyvom-el-yvom yeshuatvo

Hebrew: סַפְּר֤וּ בַגּוֹיִם֙ אֶת־כְּבוֹד֔וֹ בְּכׇל־הָעַמִּ֖ים נִפְלְאֹתָֽיו׃
Translated:
Tell of His glory among the nations,
His wondrous deeds among all peoples.
Transliteration: saferu vagvoyim et-khevvodvo vekhׇl-haamiym nifeleotayv

Hebrew: כִּי֩ גָד֨וֹל יְהֹוָ֤ה וּמְהֻלָּל֙ מְאֹ֔ד וְנוֹרָ֥א ה֖וּא עַל־כׇּל־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
For the LORD is great and much acclaimed,
He is held in awe by all divine beings.
Transliteration: khiy gadvol yehovah umehulal meod venvora hu al-khׇl-Elohim

Hebrew: כִּ֠י כׇּל־אֱלֹהֵ֤י הָֽעַמִּים֙ אֱלִילִ֔ים וַיהֹוָ֖ה שָׁמַ֥יִם עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated:
All the gods of the peoples are mere idols,
but the LORD made the heavens.
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-elohey haamiym eliyliym vayhovah shamayiim ashah

Hebrew: ה֤וֹד וְהָדָר֙ לְפָנָ֔יו עֹ֥ז וְחֶדְוָ֖ה בִּמְקֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Glory and majesty are before Him;
strength and joy are in His place.
Transliteration: hvod vehadar lefanayv oz vechedevah vimekomvo

Hebrew: הָב֤וּ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ מִשְׁפְּח֣וֹת עַמִּ֔ים הָב֥וּ לַיהֹוָ֖ה כָּב֥וֹד וָעֹֽז׃
Translated:
“Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the peoples,
ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
Transliteration: havu layhovah mishefechvot amiym havu layhovah khavvod vaoz

Hebrew: הָב֥וּ לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה כְּב֣וֹד שְׁמ֑וֹ שְׂא֤וּ מִנְחָה֙ וּבֹ֣אוּ לְפָנָ֔יו הִשְׁתַּחֲו֥וּ לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה בְּהַדְרַת־קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated:
Ascribe to the LORD the glory of His name,
bring tribute and enter before Him,
bow down to the LORD majestic in holiness.
Transliteration: havu layhovah khevvod shemvo sheu minechah uvou lefanayv hishetachavu layhovah vehaderat-kodesh

Hebrew: חִ֤ילוּ מִלְּפָנָיו֙ כׇּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אַף־תִּכּ֥וֹן תֵּבֵ֖ל בַּל־תִּמּֽוֹט׃
Translated:
Tremble in His presence, all the earth!
The world stands firm; it cannot be shaken.
Transliteration: chiylu milefanayv khׇl-haarets af-tikhvon tevel val-timvot

Hebrew: יִשְׂמְח֤וּ הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ וְתָגֵ֣ל הָאָ֔רֶץ וְיֹאמְר֥וּ בַגּוֹיִ֖ם יְהֹוָ֥ה מָלָֽךְ׃
Translated:
Let the heavens rejoice and the earth exult;
let them declare among the nations, “The LORD is King!”
Transliteration: yishemechu hashamayiim vetagel haarets veyomeru vagvoyim yehovah malakhe

Hebrew: יִרְעַ֤ם הַיָּם֙ וּמְלוֹא֔וֹ יַעֲלֹ֥ץ הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Let the sea and all within it thunder,
the fields and everything in them exult;
Transliteration: yiream hayam umelvovo yaalots hashadeh vekhׇl-asher-vvo

Hebrew: אָ֥ז יְרַנְּנ֖וּ עֲצֵ֣י הַיָּ֑עַר מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּי־בָ֖א לִשְׁפּ֥וֹט אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
then shall all the trees of the forest shout for joy
at the presence of the LORD,
for He is coming to rule the earth.
Transliteration: az yeranenu atsey hayaar milifeney yehovah khiy-va lishefvot et-haarets

Hebrew: הוֹד֤וּ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ כִּ֣י ט֔וֹב כִּ֥י לְעוֹלָ֖ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Praise the LORD for He is good;
His steadfast love is eternal.
Transliteration: hvodu layhovah khiy tvov khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: וְאִמְר֕וּ הוֹשִׁיעֵ֙נוּ֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׁעֵ֔נוּ וְקַבְּצֵ֥נוּ וְהַצִּילֵ֖נוּ מִן־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם לְהֹדוֹת֙ לְשֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשֶׁ֔ךָ לְהִשְׁתַּבֵּ֖חַ בִּתְהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Declare:
Deliver us, O God, our deliverer,
and gather us and save us from the nations,
to acclaim Your holy name,
to glory in Your praise.
Transliteration: veimeru hvoshiyenu elohey yisheenu vekavetsenu vehatsiylenu min-hagvoyim lehodvot leshem kׇdeshekha lehishetavecha vitehilatekha

Hebrew: בָּר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִן־הָעוֹלָ֖ם וְעַ֣ד הָעֹלָ֑ם וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ כׇל־הָעָם֙ אָמֵ֔ן וְהַלֵּ֖ל לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Blessed is the L<small>ORD</small>, God of Israel, from eternity to eternity.” And all the people said, “Amen” and “Praise the L<small>ORD</small>.”
Transliteration: varukhe yehovah elohey yisherael min-havolam vead haolam vayomeru khׇl-haam amen vehalel layhovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲזׇב־שָׁ֗ם לִפְנֵי֙ אֲר֣וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֔ה לְאָסָ֖ף וּלְאֶחָ֑יו לְשָׁרֵ֞ת לִפְנֵ֧י הָאָר֛וֹן תָּמִ֖יד לִדְבַר־י֥וֹם בְּיוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: He left Asaph and his kinsmen there before the Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small> to minister before the Ark regularly as each day required,
Transliteration: vayaazׇv-sham lifeney arvon veriyt-yehovah leasaf uleechayv lesharet lifeney haarvon tamiyd lidevar-yvom veyvomvo

Hebrew: וְעֹבֵ֥ד אֱדֹ֛ם וַאֲחֵיהֶ֖ם שִׁשִּׁ֣ים וּשְׁמוֹנָ֑ה {ס} וְעֹבֵ֨ד אֱדֹ֧ם בֶּן־יְדִית֛וּן וְחֹסָ֖ה לְשֹׁעֲרִֽים׃
Translated: as well as Obed-edom with their kinsmen—68; also Obed-edom son of Jedithun and Hosah as gatekeepers;
Transliteration: veoved edom vaacheyhem shishiym ushemvonah {s} veoved edom ven-yediytun vechosah leshoariym

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת ׀ צָד֣וֹק הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְאֶחָיו֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים לִפְנֵ֖י מִשְׁכַּ֣ן יְהֹוָ֑ה בַּבָּמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּגִבְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: also Zadok the priest and his fellow priests before the Tabernacle of the L<small>ORD</small> at the shrine which was in Gibeon;
Transliteration: veet tsadvok hakhohen veechayv hakhohaniym lifeney mishekhan yehovah vavamah asher vegivevon

Hebrew: לְֽהַעֲלוֹת֩ עֹל֨וֹת לַיהֹוָ֜ה עַל־מִזְבַּ֧ח הָעֹלָ֛ה תָּמִ֖יד לַבֹּ֣קֶר וְלָעָ֑רֶב וּלְכׇל־הַכָּתוּב֙ בְּתוֹרַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖ה עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: to sacrifice burnt offerings to the L<small>ORD</small> on the altar of the burnt offering regularly, morning and evening, in accordance with what was prescribed in the Teaching of the L<small>ORD</small> with which He charged Israel.
Transliteration: lehaalvot olvot layhovah al-mizevach haolah tamiyd lavoker velaarev ulekhׇl-hakhatuv vetvorat yehovah asher tsivah al-yisherael

Hebrew: וְעִמָּהֶם֙ הֵימָ֣ן וִידוּת֔וּן וּשְׁאָר֙ הַבְּרוּרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִקְּב֖וּ בְּשֵׁמ֑וֹת לְהֹדוֹת֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י לְעוֹלָ֖ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: With them were Heman and Jeduthun and the other selected men designated by name to give praise to the L<small>ORD</small>, “For His steadfast love is eternal.”
Transliteration: veimahem heyman viydutun ushear haveruriym asher nikevu veshemvot lehodvot layhovah khiy levolam chasedvo

Hebrew: וְעִמָּהֶם֩ הֵימָ֨ן וִידוּת֜וּן חֲצֹצְר֤וֹת וּמְצִלְתַּ֙יִם֙ לְמַשְׁמִיעִ֔ים וּכְלֵ֖י שִׁ֣יר הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וּבְנֵ֥י יְדוּת֖וּן לַשָּֽׁעַר׃
Translated: Heman and Jeduthun had with them trumpets and cymbals to sound, and instruments for the songs of God; and the sons of Jeduthun were to be at the gate.
Transliteration: veimahem heyman viydutun chatsotservot umetsiletayiim lemashemiyiym ukheley shiyr haElohim uveney yedutun lashaar

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ כׇל־הָעָ֖ם אִ֣ישׁ לְבֵית֑וֹ וַיִּסֹּ֥ב דָּוִ֖יד לְבָרֵ֥ךְ אֶת־בֵּיתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Then all the people went every one to his home, and David returned to greet his household.
Transliteration: vayelekhu khׇl-haam iysh leveytvo vayisov daviyd levarekhe et-veytvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יָשַׁ֥ב דָּוִ֖יד בְּבֵית֑וֹ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜יד אֶל־נָתָ֣ן הַנָּבִ֗יא הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֤י יוֹשֵׁב֙ בְּבֵ֣ית הָאֲרָזִ֔ים וַאֲר֥וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֖ה תַּ֥חַת יְרִיעֽוֹת׃
Translated: When David settled in his palace, David said to the prophet Nathan, “Here I am dwelling in a house of cedar, while the Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small> is under tent-cloths.”
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher yashav daviyd veveytvo vayomer daviyd el-natan hanaviy hineh anokhiy yvoshev veveyt haaraziym vaarvon veriyt-yehovah tachat yeriyvot

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר נָתָן֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔יד כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּֽלְבָבְךָ֖ עֲשֵׂ֑ה כִּ֥י הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים עִמָּֽךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Nathan said to David, “Do whatever you have in mind, for God is with you.”
Transliteration: vayomer natan el-daviyd khol asher vilevavekha asheh khiy haElohim imakhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֑וּא וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־אֱלֹהִ֔ים אֶל־נָתָ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: But that same night the word of God came to Nathan:
Transliteration: vayehiy valayelah hahu vayehiy devar-Elohim el-natan lemor

Hebrew: לֵ֤ךְ וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֣יד עַבְדִּ֔י כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹ֥א אַתָּ֛ה תִּבְנֶה־לִּ֥י הַבַּ֖יִת לָשָֽׁבֶת׃
Translated: “Go and say to My servant David: Thus said the L<small>ORD</small>: You are not the one to build a house for Me to dwell in.
Transliteration: lekhe veamareta el-daviyd avediy khoh amar yehovah lo atah tiveneh-liy havayiit lashavet

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָשַׁ֙בְתִּי֙ בְּבַ֔יִת מִן־הַיּ֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֶעֱלֵ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וָאֶהְיֶ֛ה מֵאֹ֥הֶל אֶל־אֹ֖הֶל וּמִמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: From the day that I brought out Israel to this day, I have not dwelt in a house, but have [gone] from tent to tent and from one Tabernacle [to another].
Transliteration: khiy lo yashavetiy vevayiit min-hayyvom asher heeleytiy et-yisherael ad hayyvom hazeh vaeheyeh meohel el-ohel umimishekhan

Hebrew: בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶֽׁר־הִתְהַלַּ֘כְתִּי֮ בְּכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ הֲדָבָ֣ר דִּבַּ֗רְתִּי אֶת־אַחַד֙ שֹׁפְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּ֛יתִי לִרְע֥וֹת אֶת־עַמִּ֖י לֵאמֹ֑ר לָ֛מָּה לֹא־בְנִיתֶ֥ם לִ֖י בֵּ֥ית אֲרָזִֽים׃
Translated: As I moved about wherever Israel went, did I ever reproach any of the judges of Israel whom I appointed to care for My people Israel: Why have you not built Me a house of cedar?
Transliteration: vekhol asher-hitehalakhetiy vekhׇl-yisherael hadavar divaretiy et-achad shofetey yisherael asher tsiviytiy lirevot et-amiy lemor lamah lo-veniytem liy veyt araziym

Hebrew: וְ֠עַתָּ֠ה כֹּֽה־תֹאמַ֞ר לְעַבְדִּ֣י לְדָוִ֗יד {ס} כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת אֲנִ֤י לְקַחְתִּ֙יךָ֙ מִן־הַנָּוֶ֔ה מִֽן־אַחֲרֵ֖י הַצֹּ֑אן לִֽהְי֣וֹת נָגִ֔יד עַ֖ל עַמִּ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: “Further, say thus to My servant David: Thus said the L<small>ORD</small> of Hosts: I took you from the pasture, from following the flock, to be ruler of My people Israel,
Transliteration: veatah khoh-tomar leavediy ledaviyd {s} khoh amar yehovah tsevavot aniy lekachetiykha min-hanaveh min-acharey hatson liheyvot nagiyd al amiy yisherael

Hebrew: וָאֶהְיֶ֣ה עִמְּךָ֗ בְּכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָלַ֔כְתָּ וָאַכְרִ֥ית אֶת־כׇּל־אוֹיְבֶ֖יךָ מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ וְעָשִׂ֤יתִֽי לְךָ֙ שֵׁ֔ם כְּשֵׁ֥ם הַגְּדוֹלִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: and I have been with you wherever you went, and have cut down all your enemies before you. Moreover, I will give you renown like that of the greatest men on earth.
Transliteration: vaeheyeh imekha vekhol asher halakheta vaakheriyt et-khׇl-voyeveykha mifaneykha veashiytiy lekha shem kheshem hagedvoliym asher vaarets

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֣י מָ֠ק֠וֹם לְעַמִּ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל וּנְטַעְתִּ֙יהוּ֙ וְשָׁכַ֣ן תַּחְתָּ֔יו וְלֹ֥א יִרְגַּ֖ז ע֑וֹד וְלֹֽא־יוֹסִ֤יפוּ בְנֵֽי־עַוְלָה֙ לְבַלֹּת֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר בָּרִאשׁוֹנָֽה׃
Translated: I will establish a home for My people Israel and will plant them firm, so that they shall dwell secure and shall tremble no more. Evil men shall not wear them down anymore as in the past,
Transliteration: veshametiy makvom leamiy yisherael unetaetiyhu veshakhan tachetayv velo yiregaz vod velo-yvosiyfu veney-avelah levalotvo khaasher varishvonah

Hebrew: וּלְמִיָּמִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוִּ֤יתִי שֹֽׁפְטִים֙ עַל־עַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְהִכְנַ֖עְתִּי אֶת־כׇּל־אוֹיְבֶ֑יךָ וָאַגִּ֣ד לָ֔ךְ וּבַ֖יִת יִֽבְנֶה־לְּךָ֥ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
ever since I appointed judges over My people Israel. I will subdue all your enemies.
And I declare to you: The LORD will build a house for you.
Transliteration: ulemiyamiym asher tsiviytiy shofetiym al-amiy yisherael vehikhenaetiy et-khׇl-voyeveykha vaagid lakhe uvayiit yiveneh-lekha yehovah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כִּֽי־מָלְא֤וּ יָמֶ֙יךָ֙ לָלֶ֣כֶת עִם־אֲבֹתֶ֔יךָ וַהֲקִימוֹתִ֤י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ אַחֲרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִהְיֶ֖ה מִבָּנֶ֑יךָ וַהֲכִינוֹתִ֖י אֶת־מַלְכוּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: When your days are done and you follow your fathers, I will raise up your offspring after you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingship.
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-maleu yameykha lalekhet im-avoteykha vahakiymvotiy et-zareakha achareykha asher yiheyeh mivaneykha vahakhiynvotiy et-malekhutvo

Hebrew: ה֥וּא יִבְנֶה־לִּ֖י בָּ֑יִת וְכֹנַנְתִּ֥י אֶת־כִּסְא֖וֹ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: He shall build a house for Me, and I will establish his throne forever.
Transliteration: hu yiveneh-liy vayiit vekhonanetiy et-khisevo ad-volam

Hebrew: אֲנִי֙ אֶֽהְיֶה־לּ֣וֹ לְאָ֔ב וְה֖וּא יִֽהְיֶה־לִּ֣י לְבֵ֑ן וְחַסְדִּי֙ לֹא־אָסִ֣יר מֵעִמּ֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר הֲסִיר֔וֹתִי מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: I will be a father to him, and he shall be a son to Me, but I will never withdraw My favor from him as I withdrew it from your predecessor.
Transliteration: aniy eheyeh-lvo leav vehu yiheyeh-liy leven vechasediy lo-asiyr meimvo khaasher hasiyrvotiy measher hayah lefaneykha

Hebrew: וְהַעֲמַדְתִּ֛יהוּ בְּבֵיתִ֥י וּבְמַלְכוּתִ֖י עַד־הָעוֹלָ֑ם וְכִסְא֕וֹ יִהְיֶ֥ה נָכ֖וֹן עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: I will install him in My house and in My kingship forever, and his throne shall be established forever.”
Transliteration: vehaamadetiyhu veveytiy uvemalekhutiy ad-havolam vekhisevo yiheyeh nakhvon ad-volam

Hebrew: כְּכֹל֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וּכְכֹ֖ל הֶחָז֣וֹן הַזֶּ֑ה כֵּ֛ן דִּבֶּ֥ר נָתָ֖ן אֶל־דָּוִֽיד׃ {פ}
Translated: Nathan spoke to David in accordance with all these words and all this prophecy.
Transliteration: khekhol hadevariym haeleh ukhekhol hechazvon hazeh khen diver natan el-daviyd {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֔יד וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מִֽי־אֲנִ֞י יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ וּמִ֣י בֵיתִ֔י כִּ֥י הֲבִיאֹתַ֖נִי עַד־הֲלֹֽם׃
Translated: Then King David came and sat before the L<small>ORD</small>, and he said, “What am I, O L<small>ORD</small> God, and what is my family, that You have brought me thus far?
Transliteration: vayavo hamelekhe daviyd vayeshev lifeney yehovah vayomer miy-aniy yehovah Elohim umiy veytiy khiy haviyotaniy ad-halom

Hebrew: וַתִּקְטַ֨ן זֹ֤את בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ אֱלֹהִ֔ים וַתְּדַבֵּ֥ר עַל־בֵּֽית־עַבְדְּךָ֖ לְמֵרָח֑וֹק וּרְאִיתַ֗נִי כְּת֧וֹר הָאָדָ֛ם הַֽמַּעֲלָ֖ה יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Yet even this, O God, has seemed too little to You; for You have spoken of Your servant’s house for the future. You regard me as a man of distinction, O L<small>ORD</small> God.
Transliteration: vatiketan zot veeyneykha Elohim vatedaver al-veyt-avedekha lemerachvok ureiytaniy khetvor haadam hamaalah yehovah Elohim

Hebrew: מַה־יּוֹסִ֨יף ע֥וֹד דָּוִ֛יד אֵלֶ֖יךָ לְכָב֣וֹד אֶת־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וְאַתָּ֖ה אֶֽת־עַבְדְּךָ֥ יָדָֽעְתָּ׃
Translated: What more can David add regarding the honoring of Your servant? You know Your servant.
Transliteration: mah-yyvosiyf vod daviyd eleykha lekhavvod et-avedekha veatah et-avedekha yadaeta

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֕ה בַּעֲב֤וּר עַבְדְּךָ֙ וּֽכְלִבְּךָ֔ עָשִׂ֕יתָ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַגְּדוּלָּ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את לְהֹדִ֖יעַ אֶת־כׇּל־הַגְּדֻלּֽוֹת׃
Translated: O L<small>ORD</small>, for Your servant’s sake, and of Your own accord, You have wrought this great thing, and made known all these great things.
Transliteration: yehovah vaavur avedekha ukhelivekha ashiyta et khׇl-hagedulah hazot lehodiya et-khׇl-hagedulvot

Hebrew: יְהֹוָה֙ אֵ֣ין כָּמ֔וֹךָ וְאֵ֥ין אֱלֹהִ֖ים זוּלָתֶ֑ךָ בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁמַ֖עְנוּ בְּאׇזְנֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: O L<small>ORD</small>, there is none like You, and there is no other God but You, as we have always heard.
Transliteration: yehovah eyn khamvokha veeyn Elohim zulatekha vekhol asher-shamaenu veׇzeneynu

Hebrew: וּמִי֙ כְּעַמְּךָ֣ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל גּ֥וֹי אֶחָ֖ד בָּאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֩ הָלַ֨ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֜ים לִפְדּ֧וֹת ל֣וֹ עָ֗ם לָשׂ֤וּם לְךָ֙ שֵׁ֚ם גְּדֻלּ֣וֹת וְנֹרָא֔וֹת לְגָרֵ֗שׁ מִפְּנֵ֧י עַמְּךָ֛ אֲשֶׁר־פָּדִ֥יתָ מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם גּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated: And who is like Your people Israel, a unique nation on earth, whom God went and redeemed as His people, winning renown for Yourself for great and marvelous deeds, driving out nations before Your people whom You redeemed from Egypt.
Transliteration: umiy kheamekha yisherael gvoy echad vaarets asher halakhe haElohim lifedvot lvo am lashum lekha shem gedulvot venoravot legaresh mifeney amekha asher-fadiyta mimitserayiim gvoyim

Hebrew: וַ֠תִּתֵּ֠ן אֶת־עַמְּךָ֨ יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל <small>׀</small> לְךָ֛ לְעָ֖ם עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם וְאַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה הָיִ֥יתָ לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: You have established Your people Israel as Your very own people forever; and You, O L<small>ORD</small>, have become their God.
Transliteration: vatiten et-amekha yisherael <small></small> lekha leam ad-volam veatah yehovah hayiyta lahem lelohiym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבַּ֤רְתָּ עַֽל־עַבְדְּךָ֙ וְעַל־בֵּית֔וֹ יֵאָמֵ֖ן עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם וַעֲשֵׂ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתָּ׃
Translated: “And now, O L<small>ORD</small>, let Your promise concerning Your servant and his house be fulfilled forever; and do as You have promised.
Transliteration: veatah yehovah hadavar asher divareta al-avedekha veal-veytvo eiamen ad-volam vaasheh khaasher divareta

Hebrew: וְ֠יֵאָמֵ֠ן וְיִגְדַּ֨ל שִׁמְךָ֤ עַד־עוֹלָם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יְהֹוָ֤ה צְבָאוֹת֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֱלֹהִ֖ים לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּבֵית־דָּוִ֥יד עַבְדְּךָ֖ נָכ֥וֹן לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Let it be fulfilled that Your name be glorified forever, in that men will say,‘The L<small>ORD</small> of Hosts, God of Israel, is Israel’s God’; and may the house of Your servant David be established before You.
Transliteration: veeieamen veyigedal shimekha ad-volam lemor yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael Elohim leyisherael uveyt-daviyd avedekha nakhvon lefaneykha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ אַתָּ֣ה אֱלֹהַ֗י גָּלִ֙יתָ֙ אֶת־אֹ֣זֶן עַבְדְּךָ֔ לִבְנ֥וֹת ל֖וֹ בָּ֑יִת עַל־כֵּן֙ מָצָ֣א עַבְדְּךָ֔ לְהִתְפַּלֵּ֖ל לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Because You, my God, have revealed to Your servant that You will build a house for him, Your servant has ventured to pray to You.
Transliteration: khiy atah elohay galiyta et-ozen avedekha livenvot lvo vayiit al-khen matsa avedekha lehitefalel lefaneykha

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה אַתָּה־ה֖וּא הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַתְּדַבֵּר֙ עַֽל־עַבְדְּךָ֔ הַטּוֹבָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: And now, O L<small>ORD</small>, You are God and You have made this gracious promise to Your servant.
Transliteration: veatah yehovah atah-hu haElohim vatedaver al-avedekha hatvovah hazot

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הוֹאַ֙לְתָּ֙ לְבָרֵךְ֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית עַבְדְּךָ֔ לִֽהְי֥וֹת לְעוֹלָ֖ם לְפָנֶ֑יךָ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ בֵּרַ֔כְתָּ וּמְבֹרָ֖ךְ לְעוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Now, it has pleased You to bless Your servant’s house, that it abide before You forever; for You, O L<small>ORD</small>, have blessed and are blessed forever.”
Transliteration: veatah hvoaleta levarekhe et-veyt avedekha liheyvot levolam lefaneykha khiy-atah yehovah verakheta umevorakhe levolam {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֔ן וַיַּ֥ךְ דָּוִ֛יד אֶת־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים וַיַּכְנִיעֵ֑ם וַיִּקַּ֛ח אֶת־גַּ֥ת וּבְנֹתֶ֖יהָ מִיַּ֥ד פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: Sometime afterward, David attacked the Philistines and subdued them; and David took Gath and its dependencies from the Philistines.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen vayakhe daviyd et-felishetiym vayakheniyem vayikach et-gat uvenoteyha miyad felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖ךְ אֶת־מוֹאָ֑ב וַיִּהְי֤וּ מוֹאָב֙ עֲבָדִ֣ים לְדָוִ֔יד נֹשְׂאֵ֖י מִנְחָֽה׃
Translated: He also defeated the Moabites; the Moabites became tributary vassals of David.
Transliteration: vayakhe et-mvoav vayiheyu mvoav avadiym ledaviyd nosheey minechah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥ךְ דָּוִ֛יד אֶת־הֲדַדְעֶ֥זֶר מֶלֶךְ־צוֹבָ֖ה חֲמָ֑תָה בְּלֶכְתּ֕וֹ לְהַצִּ֥יב יָד֖וֹ בִּֽנְהַר־פְּרָֽת׃
Translated: David defeated Hadadezer, king of Zobah-hamath, who was on his way to set up his monument at the Euphrates River.
Transliteration: vayakhe daviyd et-hadadeezer melekhe-tsvovah chamatah velekhetvo lehatsiyv yadvo vinehar-ferat

Hebrew: וַיִּלְכֹּד֩ דָּוִ֨יד מִמֶּ֜נּוּ אֶ֣לֶף רֶ֗כֶב וְשִׁבְעַ֤ת אֲלָפִים֙ פָּרָשִׁ֔ים וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף אִ֣ישׁ רַגְלִ֑י וַיְעַקֵּ֤ר דָּוִיד֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָרֶ֔כֶב וַיּוֹתֵ֥ר מִמֶּ֖נּוּ מֵ֥אָה רָֽכֶב׃
Translated: David captured 1,000 chariots and 7,000 horsemen and 20,000 foot soldiers of his force; and David hamstrung all the chariot horses except for 100, which he retained.
Transliteration: vayilekhod daviyd mimenu elef rekhev veshiveat alafiym farashiym veesheriym elef iysh rageliy vayeaker daviyd et-khׇl-harekhev vayyvoter mimenu meah rakhev

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ אֲרַ֣ם דַּרְמֶ֔שֶׂק לַעְז֕וֹר לַהֲדַדְעֶ֖זֶר מֶ֣לֶךְ צוֹבָ֑ה וַיַּ֤ךְ דָּוִיד֙ בַּאֲרָ֔ם עֶשְׂרִֽים־וּשְׁנַ֥יִם אֶ֖לֶף אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: And when the Arameans of Damascus came to the aid of King Hadadezer of Zobah-hamath, David struck down 22,000 of the Arameans.
Transliteration: vayavo aram daremeshek laezvor lahadadeezer melekhe tsvovah vayakhe daviyd vaaram esheriym-ushenayiim elef iysh

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שֶׂם דָּוִיד֙ בַּאֲרַ֣ם דַּרְמֶ֔שֶׂק וַיְהִ֤י אֲרָם֙ לְדָוִ֔יד עֲבָדִ֖ים נֹשְׂאֵ֣י מִנְחָ֑ה וַיּ֤וֹשַׁע יְהֹוָה֙ לְדָוִ֔יד בְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלָֽךְ׃
Translated: David stationed [garrisons] in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans became tributary vassals of David. The L<small>ORD</small> gave David victory wherever he went.
Transliteration: vayashem daviyd vaaram daremeshek vayehiy aram ledaviyd avadiym nosheey minechah vayyvosha yehovah ledaviyd vekhol asher halakhe

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח דָּוִ֗יד אֵ֚ת שִׁלְטֵ֣י הַזָּהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָי֔וּ עַ֖ל עַבְדֵ֣י הֲדַדְעָ֑זֶר וַיְבִיאֵ֖ם יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: David took the gold shields carried by Hadadezer’s retinue and brought them to Jerusalem;
Transliteration: vayikach daviyd et shiletey hazahav asher hayu al avedey hadadeazer vayeviyem yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וּמִטִּבְחַ֤ת וּמִכּוּן֙ עָרֵ֣י הֲדַדְעֶ֔זֶר לָקַ֥ח דָּוִ֛יד נְחֹ֖שֶׁת רַבָּ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד בָּ֣הּ ׀ עָשָׂ֣ה שְׁלֹמֹ֗ה אֶת־יָ֤ם הַנְּחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ וְאֶת־הָֽעַמּוּדִ֔ים וְאֵ֖ת כְּלֵ֥י הַנְּחֹֽשֶׁת׃ {פ}
Translated: and from Tibbath and Cun, towns of Hadadezer, David took a vast amount of copper, from which Solomon made the bronze tank, the columns, and the bronze vessels.
Transliteration: umitivechat umikhun arey hadadeezer lakach daviyd nechoshet ravah meod vah ashah shelomoh et-yam hanechoshet veet-haamudiym veet kheley hanechoshet {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֕ע תֹּ֖עוּ מֶ֣לֶךְ חֲמָ֑ת כִּ֚י הִכָּ֣ה דָוִ֔יד אֶת־כׇּל־חֵ֖יל הֲדַדְעֶ֥זֶר מֶלֶךְ־צוֹבָֽה׃
Translated: When King Tou of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of King Hadadezer of Zobah,
Transliteration: vayishema tou melekhe chamat khiy hikhah daviyd et-khׇl-cheyl hadadeezer melekhe-tsvovah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח אֶת־הֲדֽוֹרָם־בְּנ֣וֹ אֶל־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ־דָּ֠וִ֠יד (לשאול) [לִשְׁאׇל־]ל֨וֹ לְשָׁל֜וֹם וּֽלְבָרְכ֗וֹ עַל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִלְחַ֤ם בַּהֲדַדְעֶ֙זֶר֙ וַיַּכֵּ֔הוּ כִּי־אִ֛ישׁ מִלְחֲמ֥וֹת תֹּ֖עוּ הָיָ֣ה הֲדַדְעָ֑זֶר וְכֹ֗ל כְּלֵ֛י זָהָ֥ב וָכֶ֖סֶף וּנְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: he sent his son Hadoram to King David to greet him and to congratulate him on his military victory over Hadadezer—for Hadadezer had been at war with Tou; [he brought with him] all manner of gold, silver, and copper objects.
Transliteration: vayishelach et-hadvoram-venvo el-hamelekhe-daviyd (lshvl) [lisheׇl-]lvo leshalvom ulevarekhvo al asher nilecham vahadadeezer vayakhehu khiy-iysh milechamvot tou hayah hadadeazer vekhol kheley zahav vakhesef unechoshet

Hebrew: גַּם־אֹתָ֗ם הִקְדִּ֞ישׁ הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ דָּוִיד֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה עִם־הַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ וְהַזָּהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָשָׂ֖א מִכׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם מֵאֱד֤וֹם וּמִמּוֹאָב֙ וּמִבְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן וּמִפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים וּמֵעֲמָלֵֽק׃
Translated: King David dedicated these to the L<small>ORD</small>, along with the other silver and gold that he had taken from all the nations: from Edom, Moab, and Ammon; from the Philistines and the Amalekites.
Transliteration: gam-otam hikediysh hamelekhe daviyd layhovah im-hakhesef vehazahav asher nasha mikhׇl-hagvoyim meedvom umimvoav umiveney amvon umifelishetiym umeamalek

Hebrew: וְאַבְשַׁ֣י בֶּן־צְרוּיָ֗ה הִכָּ֤ה אֶת־אֱדוֹם֙ בְּגֵ֣יא הַמֶּ֔לַח שְׁמוֹנָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: Abshai son of Zeruiah struck down Edom in the Valley of Salt, 18,000 in all.
Transliteration: veaveshay ven-tseruyah hikhah et-edvom vegey hamelach shemvonah ashar alef

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שֶׂם בֶּאֱדוֹם֙ נְצִיבִ֔ים וַיִּהְי֥וּ כׇל־אֱד֖וֹם עֲבָדִ֣ים לְדָוִ֑יד וַיּ֤וֹשַׁע יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־דָּוִ֔יד בְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלָֽךְ׃
Translated: He stationed garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became vassals of David. The L<small>ORD</small> gave David victory wherever he went.
Transliteration: vayashem veedvom netsiyviym vayiheyu khׇl-edvom avadiym ledaviyd vayyvosha yehovah et-daviyd vekhol asher halakhe

Hebrew: וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ דָּוִ֖יד עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיְהִ֗י עֹשֶׂ֛ה מִשְׁפָּ֥ט וּצְדָקָ֖ה לְכׇל־עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: David reigned over all Israel, and David executed true justice among all his people.
Transliteration: vayimelokhe daviyd al-khׇl-yisherael vayehiy osheh mishefat utsedakah lekhׇl-amvo

Hebrew: וְיוֹאָ֥ב בֶּן־צְרוּיָ֖ה עַל־הַצָּבָ֑א וִיהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט בֶּן־אֲחִיל֖וּד מַזְכִּֽיר׃
Translated: Joab son of Zeruiah was commander of the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;
Transliteration: veyvoav ven-tseruyah al-hatsava viyhvoshafat ven-achiylud mazekhiyr

Hebrew: וְצָד֧וֹק בֶּן־אֲחִיט֛וּב וַאֲבִימֶ֥לֶךְ בֶּן־אֶבְיָתָ֖ר כֹּהֲנִ֑ים וְשַׁוְשָׁ֖א סוֹפֵֽר׃
Translated: Zadok son of Ahitub and Abimelech son of Abiathar were priests; Shavsha was scribe;
Transliteration: vetsadvok ven-achiytuv vaaviymelekhe ven-eveyatar khohaniym veshavesha svofer

Hebrew: וּבְנָיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־יְה֣וֹיָדָ֔ע עַל־הַכְּרֵתִ֖י וְהַפְּלֵתִ֑י וּבְנֵי־דָוִ֥יד הָרִֽאשֹׁנִ֖ים לְיַ֥ד הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {פ}
Translated: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was commander of the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David’s sons were first ministers of the king.
Transliteration: uvenayahu ven-yehvoyada al-hakheretiy vehafeletiy uveney-daviyd harishoniym leyad hamelekhe {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֔ן וַיָּ֕מׇת נָחָ֖שׁ מֶ֣לֶךְ בְּנֵֽי־עַמּ֑וֹן וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: Sometime afterward, Nahash the king of the Ammonites died, and his son succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen vayamׇt nachash melekhe veney-amvon vayimelokhe venvo tachetayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜יד אֶעֱשֶׂה־חֶ֣סֶד ׀ עִם־חָנ֣וּן בֶּן־נָחָ֗שׁ כִּֽי־עָשָׂ֨ה אָבִ֤יו עִמִּי֙ חֶ֔סֶד וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח דָּוִ֛יד מַלְאָכִ֖ים לְנַחֲמ֣וֹ עַל־אָבִ֑יו וַיָּבֹ֩אוּ֩ עַבְדֵ֨י דָוִ֜יד אֶל־אֶ֧רֶץ בְּנֵֽי־עַמּ֛וֹן אֶל־חָנ֖וּן לְנַחֲמֽוֹ׃
Translated: David said, “I will keep faith with Hanun son of Nahash, since his father kept faith with me.” David sent messengers with condolences to him over his father. But when David’s courtiers came to the land of Ammon to Hanun, with condolences,
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd eesheh-chesed im-chanun ven-nachash khiy-ashah aviyv imiy chesed vayishelach daviyd maleakhiym lenachamvo al-aviyv vayavou avedey daviyd el-erets veney-amvon el-chanun lenachamvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֩ שָׂרֵ֨י בְנֵי־עַמּ֜וֹן לְחָנ֗וּן הַֽמְכַבֵּ֨ד דָּוִ֤יד אֶת־אָבִ֙יךָ֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ כִּֽי־שָׁלַ֥ח לְךָ֖ מְנַחֲמִ֑ים הֲלֹ֡א בַּ֠עֲב֠וּר לַחְקֹ֨ר וְלַהֲפֹ֤ךְ וּלְרַגֵּל֙ הָאָ֔רֶץ בָּ֥אוּ עֲבָדָ֖יו אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: the Ammonite officials said to Hanun, “Do you think David is really honoring your father just because he sent you men with condolences? Why, it is to explore, to subvert, and to spy out the land that his courtiers have come to you.”
Transliteration: vayomeru sharey veney-amvon lechanun hamekhaved daviyd et-aviykha veeyneykha khiy-shalach lekha menachamiym halo vaavur lachekor velahafokhe uleragel haarets vau avadayv eleykha

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח חָנ֜וּן אֶת־עַבְדֵ֤י דָוִיד֙ וַֽיְגַלְּחֵ֔ם וַיִּכְרֹ֧ת אֶת־מַדְוֵיהֶ֛ם בַּחֵ֖צִי עַד־הַמִּפְשָׂעָ֑ה וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵֽם׃
Translated: So Hanun seized David’s courtiers, shaved them, and cut away half of their garments up to the buttocks, and sent them off.
Transliteration: vayikach chanun et-avedey daviyd vayegalechem vayikherot et-madeveyhem vachetsiy ad-hamifeshaah vayeshalechem

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכוּ֩ וַיַּגִּ֨ידוּ לְדָוִ֤יד עַל־הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח לִקְרָאתָ֔ם כִּֽי־הָי֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים נִכְלָמִ֣ים מְאֹ֑ד וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ שְׁב֣וּ בִֽירֵח֔וֹ עַ֛ד אֲשֶׁר־יְצַמַּ֥ח זְקַנְכֶ֖ם וְשַׁבְתֶּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: When David was told about the men, he dispatched others to meet them, for the men were greatly embarrassed. And the king gave orders, “Stay in Jericho until your beards grow back; then you can return.”
Transliteration: vayelekhu vayagiydu ledaviyd al-haanashiym vayishelach likeratam khiy-hayu haanashiym nikhelamiym meod vayomer hamelekhe shevu viyrechvo ad asher-yetsamach zekanekhem veshavetem {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּרְאוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן כִּ֥י הִֽתְבָּאֲשׁ֖וּ עִם־דָּוִ֑יד וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח חָ֠נ֠וּן וּבְנֵ֨י עַמּ֜וֹן אֶ֣לֶף כִּכַּר־כֶּ֗סֶף לִשְׂכֹּ֣ר לָ֠הֶ֠ם מִן־אֲרַ֨ם נַהֲרַ֜יִם וּמִן־אֲרַ֤ם מַֽעֲכָה֙ וּמִצּוֹבָ֔ה רֶ֖כֶב וּפָרָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: The Ammonites realized that they had incurred the wrath of David; so Hanun and the Ammonites sent 1,000 silver talents to hire chariots and horsemen from Aram-naharaim, Aram-maacah, and Zobah.
Transliteration: vayireu veney amvon khiy hitevaashu im-daviyd vayishelach chanun uveney amvon elef khikhar-khesef lishekhor lahem min-aram naharayiim umin-aram maakhah umitsvovah rekhev ufarashiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂכְּר֣וּ לָהֶ֡ם שְׁנַ֩יִם֩ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים אֶ֜לֶף רֶ֗כֶב וְאֶת־מֶ֤לֶךְ מַֽעֲכָה֙ וְאֶת־עַמּ֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֕אוּ וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ לִפְנֵ֣י מֵֽידְבָ֑א {ס} וּבְנֵ֣י עַמּ֗וֹן נֶֽאֶסְפוּ֙ מֵעָ֣רֵיהֶ֔ם וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ לַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: They hired 32,000 chariots, the king of Maacah, and his army, who came and encamped before Medeba. The Ammonites were mobilized from their cities and came to do battle.
Transliteration: vayishekheru lahem shenayiim usheloshiym elef rekhev veet-melekhe maakhah veet-amvo vayavou vayachanu lifeney meydeva {s} uveney amvon neesefu meareyhem vayavou lamilechamah {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֖ע דָּוִ֑יד וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ אֶת־יוֹאָ֔ב וְאֵ֥ת כׇּל־צָבָ֖א הַגִּבּוֹרִֽים׃
Translated: On learning this, David sent out Joab and the whole army, [including] the professional fighters.
Transliteration: vayishema daviyd vayishelach et-yvoav veet khׇl-tsava hagivvoriym

Hebrew: וַיֵּֽצְאוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן וַיַּעַרְכ֥וּ מִלְחָמָ֖ה פֶּ֣תַח הָעִ֑יר וְהַמְּלָכִ֣ים אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֔אוּ לְבַדָּ֖ם בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: The Ammonites marched out and took up their battle position at the entrance of the city, while the kings who came [took their stand] separately in the open.
Transliteration: vayetseu veney amvon vayaarekhu milechamah fetach haiyr vehamelakhiym asher-vau levadam vashadeh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא יוֹאָ֗ב כִּֽי־הָיְתָ֧ה פְנֵֽי־הַמִּלְחָמָ֛ה אֵלָ֖יו פָּנִ֣ים וְאָח֑וֹר וַיִּבְחַ֗ר מִכׇּל־בָּחוּר֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַֽיַּעֲרֹ֖ךְ לִקְרַ֥את אֲרָֽם׃
Translated: Joab saw that there was a battle line against him both front and rear. So he made a selection from all the picked men of Israel and arrayed them against the Arameans,
Transliteration: vayare yvoav khiy-hayetah feney-hamilechamah elayv faniym veachvor vayivechar mikhׇl-vachur veyisherael vayaarokhe likerat aram

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ יֶ֣תֶר הָעָ֔ם נָתַ֕ן בְּיַ֖ד אַבְשַׁ֣י אָחִ֑יו וַיַּ֣עַרְכ֔וּ לִקְרַ֖את בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: and the rest of the troops he put under the command of his brother Abishai and arrayed them against the Ammonites.
Transliteration: veet yeter haam natan veyad aveshay achiyv vayaarekhu likerat veney amvon

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אִם־תֶּחֱזַ֤ק מִמֶּ֙נִּי֙ אֲרָ֔ם וְהָיִ֥יתָ לִּ֖י לִתְשׁוּעָ֑ה {ס} וְאִם־בְּנֵ֥י עַמּ֛וֹן יֶחֶזְק֥וּ מִמְּךָ֖ וְהוֹשַׁעְתִּֽיךָ׃
Translated: Joab said, “If the Arameans prove too strong for me, you come to my aid; and if the Ammonites prove too strong for you, I will come to your aid.
Transliteration: vayomer im-techezak mimeniy aram vehayiyta liy liteshuah {s} veim-veney amvon yechezeku mimekha vehvoshaetiykha

Hebrew: חֲזַ֤ק וְנִֽתְחַזְּקָה֙ בְּעַד־עַמֵּ֔נוּ וּבְעַ֖ד עָרֵ֣י אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וַֽיהֹוָ֔ה הַטּ֥וֹב בְּעֵינָ֖יו יַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: Let us be strong and resolute for the sake of our people and the towns of our God; and the L<small>ORD</small> will do what He deems right.”
Transliteration: chazak venitechazekah vead-amenu uvead arey eloheynu vayhovah hatvov veeynayv yaasheh

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֨שׁ יוֹאָ֜ב וְהָעָ֧ם אֲשֶׁר־עִמּ֛וֹ לִפְנֵ֥י אֲרָ֖ם לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וַיָּנ֖וּסוּ מִפָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: Joab and the troops with him marched into battle against the Arameans, who fled before him.
Transliteration: vayigash yvoav vehaam asher-imvo lifeney aram lamilechamah vayanusu mifanayv

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֨י עַמּ֤וֹן רָאוּ֙ כִּֽי־נָ֣ס אֲרָ֔ם וַיָּנ֣וּסוּ גַם־הֵ֗ם מִפְּנֵי֙ אַבְשַׁ֣י אָחִ֔יו וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ הָעִ֑ירָה וַיָּבֹ֥א יוֹאָ֖ב יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: And when the Ammonites saw that the Arameans had fled, they too fled before his brother Abishai, and withdrew into the city. So Joab went to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: uveney amvon rau khiy-nas aram vayanusu gam-hem mifeney aveshay achiyv vayavou haiyrah vayavo yvoav yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא אֲרָ֗ם כִּ֣י נִגְּפוּ֮ לִפְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַֽיִּשְׁלְחוּ֙ מַלְאָכִ֔ים וַיּוֹצִ֣יאוּ אֶת־אֲרָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר מֵעֵ֣בֶר הַנָּהָ֑ר וְשׁוֹפַ֛ךְ שַׂר־צְבָ֥א הֲדַדְעֶ֖זֶר לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: When the Arameans saw that they had been routed by Israel, they sent messengers to bring out the Arameans from across the Euphrates; Shophach, Hadadezer’s army commander, led them.
Transliteration: vayare aram khiy nigefu lifeney yisherael vayishelechu maleakhiym vayyvotsiyu et-aram asher meever hanahar veshvofakhe shar-tseva hadadeezer lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֣ד לְדָוִ֗יד וַיֶּאֱסֹ֤ף אֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וַיָּבֹ֣א אֲלֵהֶ֔ם וַֽיַּעֲרֹ֖ךְ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם וַיַּעֲרֹ֨ךְ דָּוִ֜יד לִקְרַ֤את אֲרָם֙ מִלְחָמָ֔ה וַיִּֽלָּחֲמ֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: David was informed of it; he assembled all Israel, crossed the Jordan, and came and took up positions against them. David drew up his forces against Aram; and they fought with him.
Transliteration: vayugad ledaviyd vayeesof et-khׇl-yisherael vayaavor hayareden vayavo alehem vayaarokhe alehem vayaarokhe daviyd likerat aram milechamah vayilachamu imvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣נׇס אֲרָם֮ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַיַּהֲרֹ֨ג דָּוִ֜יד מֵאֲרָ֗ם שִׁבְעַ֤ת אֲלָפִים֙ רֶ֔כֶב וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף אִ֣ישׁ רַגְלִ֑י וְאֵ֛ת שׁוֹפַ֥ךְ שַֽׂר־הַצָּבָ֖א הֵמִֽית׃
Translated: But the Arameans were put to flight by Israel. David killed 7,000 Aramean charioteers and 40,000 footmen; he also killed Shophach, the army commander.
Transliteration: vayanׇs aram milifeney yisherael vayaharog daviyd mearam shiveat alafiym rekhev vearevaiym elef iysh rageliy veet shvofakhe shar-hatsava hemiyt

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֞וּ עַבְדֵ֣י הֲדַדְעֶ֗זֶר כִּ֤י נִגְּפוּ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיַּשְׁלִ֥ימוּ עִם־דָּוִ֖יד וַיַּעַבְדֻ֑הוּ וְלֹֽא־אָבָ֣ה אֲרָ֔ם לְהוֹשִׁ֥יעַ אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־עַמּ֖וֹן עֽוֹד׃ {ס}
Translated: And when all the vassals of Hadadezer saw that they had been routed by Israel, they submitted to David and became his vassals. And the Arameans would not help the Ammonites anymore.
Transliteration: vayireu avedey hadadeezer khiy nigefu lifeney yisherael vayasheliymu im-daviyd vayaaveduhu velo-avah aram lehvoshiya et-veney-amvon vod {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י לְעֵת֩ תְּשׁוּבַ֨ת הַשָּׁנָ֜ה לְעֵ֣ת ׀ צֵ֣את הַמְּלָכִ֗ים וַיִּנְהַ֣ג יוֹאָב֩ אֶת־חֵ֨יל הַצָּבָ֜א וַיַּשְׁחֵ֣ת ׀ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ בְּנֵי־עַמּ֗וֹן וַיָּבֹא֙ וַיָּ֣צַר אֶת־רַבָּ֔ה וְדָוִ֖יד יֹשֵׁ֣ב בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיַּ֥ךְ יוֹאָ֛ב אֶת־רַבָּ֖ה וַיֶּהֶרְסֶֽהָ׃
Translated: At the turn of the year, the season when kings go out [to battle], Joab led out the army force and devastated the land of Ammon, and then besieged Rabbah, while David remained in Jerusalem; Joab reduced Rabbah and left it in ruins.
Transliteration: vayehiy leet teshuvat hashanah leet tset hamelakhiym vayinehag yvoav et-cheyl hatsava vayashechet et-erets veney-amvon vayavo vayatsar et-ravah vedaviyd yoshev viyrushala͏im vayakhe yvoav et-ravah vayehereseha

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח דָּוִ֣יד אֶת־עֲטֶֽרֶת־מַלְכָּם֩ מֵעַ֨ל רֹאשׁ֜וֹ וַֽיִּמְצָאָ֣הּ ׀ מִשְׁקַ֣ל כִּכַּר־זָהָ֗ב וּבָהּ֙ אֶ֣בֶן יְקָרָ֔ה וַתְּהִ֖י עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ דָּוִ֑יד וּשְׁלַ֥ל הָעִ֛יר הוֹצִ֖יא הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: David took the crown from the head of their king; he found that it weighed a talent of gold, and in it were precious stones. It was placed on David’s head. He also carried off a vast amount of booty from the city.
Transliteration: vayikach daviyd et-ateret-malekham meal roshvo vayimetsaah mishekal khikhar-zahav uvah even yekarah vatehiy al-rosh daviyd ushelal haiyr hvotsiy hareveh meod

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָעָ֨ם אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֜הּ הוֹצִ֗יא וַיָּ֨שַׂר בַּמְּגֵרָ֜ה וּבַחֲרִיצֵ֤י הַבַּרְזֶל֙ וּבַמְּגֵר֔וֹת וְכֵן֙ יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה דָוִ֔יד לְכֹ֖ל עָרֵ֣י בְנֵי־עַמּ֑וֹן וַיָּ֧שׇׁב דָּוִ֛יד וְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: He led out the people who lived there and he hacked them with saws and iron threshing boards and axes; David did thus to all the towns of Ammon. Then David and all the troops returned to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: veet-haam asher-vah hvotsiy vayashar vamegerah uvachariytsey havarezel uvamegervot vekhen yaasheh daviyd lekhol arey veney-amvon vayashׇv daviyd vekhׇl-haam yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֔ן וַתַּעֲמֹ֧ד מִלְחָמָ֛ה בְּגֶ֖זֶר עִם־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים אָ֣ז הִכָּ֞ה סִבְּכַ֣י הַחֻשָׁתִ֗י אֶת־סִפַּ֛י מִילִידֵ֥י הָרְפָאִ֖ים וַיִּכָּנֵֽעוּ׃
Translated: After this, fighting broke out with the Philistines at Gezer; that was when Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Sippai, a descendant of the Rephaim, and they were humbled.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen vataamod milechamah vegezer im-felishetiym az hikhah sivekhay hachushatiy et-sifay miyliydey harefaiym vayikhaneu

Hebrew: וַתְּהִי־ע֥וֹד מִלְחָמָ֖ה אֶת־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיַּ֞ךְ אֶלְחָנָ֣ן בֶּן־[יָעִ֗יר] (יעור) אֶת־לַחְמִי֙ אֲחִי֙ גׇּלְיָ֣ת הַגִּתִּ֔י וְעֵ֣ץ חֲנִית֔וֹ כִּמְנ֖וֹר אֹרְגִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Again there was fighting with the Philistines, and Elhanan son of Jair killed Lahmi, the brother of Goliath the Gittite; his spear had a shaft like a weaver’s beam.
Transliteration: vatehiy-vod milechamah et-felishetiym vayakhe elechanan ven-[yaiyr] (yvr) et-lachemiy achiy gׇleyat hagitiy veets chaniytvo khimenvor oregiym {s}

Hebrew: וַתְּהִי־ע֥וֹד מִלְחָמָ֖ה בְּגַ֑ת וַיְהִ֣י ׀ אִ֣ישׁ מִדָּ֗ה וְאֶצְבְּעֹתָ֤יו שֵׁשׁ־וָשֵׁשׁ֙ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים וְאַרְבַּ֔ע וְגַם־ה֖וּא נוֹלַ֥ד לְהָרָפָֽא׃
Translated: Once again there was fighting at Gath. There was a giant of a man who had twenty-four fingers [and toes], six [on each hand] and six [on each foot]; he too was descended from the Raphah.
Transliteration: vatehiy-vod milechamah vegat vayehiy iysh midah veetseveotayv shesh-vashesh esheriym veareva vegam-hu nvolad leharafa

Hebrew: וַיְחָרֵ֖ף אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּכֵּ֙הוּ֙ יְה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן בֶּן־שִׁמְעָ֖א אֲחִ֥י דָוִֽיד׃
Translated: When he taunted Israel, Jonathan son of David’s brother Shimea killed him.
Transliteration: vayecharef et-yisherael vayakhehu yehvonatan ven-shimea achiy daviyd

Hebrew: אֵ֛ל נוּלְּד֥וּ לְהָרָפָ֖א בְּגַ֑ת וַיִּפְּל֥וּ בְיַד־דָּוִ֖יד וּבְיַד־עֲבָדָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: These were descended from the Raphah in Gath, and they fell by the hands of David and his men.
Transliteration: el nuledu leharafa vegat vayifelu veyad-daviyd uveyad-avadayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֥ד שָׂטָ֖ן עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיָּ֙סֶת֙ אֶת־דָּוִ֔יד לִמְנ֖וֹת אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Satan arose against Israel and incited David to number Israel.
Transliteration: vayaamod shatan al-yisherael vayaset et-daviyd limenvot et-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֤יד אֶל־יוֹאָב֙ וְאֶל־שָׂרֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם לְכ֗וּ סִפְרוּ֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִבְּאֵ֥ר שֶׁ֖בַע וְעַד־דָּ֑ן וְהָבִ֣יאוּ אֵלַ֔י וְאֵדְעָ֖ה אֶת־מִסְפָּרָֽם׃
Translated: David said to Joab and to the commanders of the army, “Go and count Israel from Beer-sheba to Dan and bring me information as to their number.”
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd el-yvoav veel-sharey haam lekhu siferu et-yisherael miveer sheva vead-dan vehaviyu elay veedeah et-misefaram

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יוֹאָ֗ב יוֹסֵף֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה עַל־עַמּ֤וֹ <small>׀</small> כָּהֵם֙ מֵאָ֣ה פְעָמִ֔ים הֲלֹא֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כֻּלָּ֥ם לַאדֹנִ֖י לַעֲבָדִ֑ים לָ֣מָּה יְבַקֵּ֥שׁ זֹאת֙ אֲדֹנִ֔י לָ֛מָּה יִֽהְיֶ֥ה לְאַשְׁמָ֖ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Joab answered, “May the L<small>ORD</small> increase His people a hundredfold; my lord king, are they not all subjects of my lord? Why should my lord require this? Why should it be a cause of guilt for Israel?”
Transliteration: vayomer yvoav yvosef yehovah al-amvo <small></small> khahem meah feamiym halo adoniy hamelekhe khulam ladoniy laavadiym lamah yevakesh zot adoniy lamah yiheyeh leashemah leyisherael

Hebrew: וּדְבַר־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ חָזַ֣ק עַל־יוֹאָ֑ב וַיֵּצֵ֣א יוֹאָ֗ב וַיִּתְהַלֵּךְ֙ בְּכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיָּבֹ֖א יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: However, the king’s command to Joab remained firm, so Joab set out and traversed all Israel; he then came to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: udevar-hamelekhe chazak al-yvoav vayetse yvoav vayitehalekhe vekhׇl-yisherael vayavo yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֥ן יוֹאָ֛ב אֶת־מִסְפַּ֥ר מִפְקַד־הָעָ֖ם אֶל־דָּוִ֑יד וַיְהִ֣י כׇֽל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל אֶ֣לֶף אֲלָפִים֩ וּמֵאָ֨ה אֶ֤לֶף אִישׁ֙ שֹׁ֣לֵֽף חֶ֔רֶב וִיהוּדָ֕ה אַרְבַּע֩ מֵא֨וֹת וְשִׁבְעִ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף אִ֖ישׁ שֹׁ֥לֵֽף־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Joab reported to David the number of the people that had been recorded. All Israel comprised 1,100,000 ready to draw the sword, while in Judah there were 470,000 men ready to draw the sword.
Transliteration: vayiten yvoav et-misefar mifekad-haam el-daviyd vayehiy khׇl-yisherael elef alafiym umeah elef iysh sholef cherev viyhudah areva mevot veshiveiym elef iysh sholef-charev

Hebrew: וְלֵוִי֙ וּבִנְיָמִ֔ן לֹ֥א פָקַ֖ד בְּתוֹכָ֑ם כִּֽי־נִתְעַ֥ב דְּבַר־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶת־יוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: He did not record among them Levi and Benjamin, because the king’s command had become repugnant to Joab.
Transliteration: veleviy uvineyamin lo fakad vetvokham khiy-niteav devar-hamelekhe et-yvoav

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֙רַע֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים עַל־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַיַּ֖ךְ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: God was displeased about this matter and He struck Israel.
Transliteration: vayera veeyney haElohim al-hadavar hazeh vayakhe et-yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִיד֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלֹהִ֔ים חָטָ֣אתִֽי מְאֹ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתִי אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וְעַתָּ֗ה הַֽעֲבֶר־נָא֙ אֶת־עֲו֣וֹן עַבְדְּךָ֔ כִּ֥י נִסְכַּ֖לְתִּי מְאֹֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: David said to God, “I have sinned grievously in having done this thing; please remit the guilt of Your servant, for I have acted foolishly.”
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd el-haElohimm chatatiy meod asher ashiytiy et-hadavar hazeh veatah haaver-na et-avvon avedekha khiy nisekhaletiy meod {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־גָּ֔ד חֹזֵ֥ה דָוִ֖יד לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> ordered Gad, David’s seer:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-gad chozeh daviyd lemor

Hebrew: לֵךְ֩ וְדִבַּרְתָּ֨ אֶל־דָּוִ֜יד לֵאמֹ֗ר כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה שָׁל֕וֹשׁ אֲנִ֖י נֹטֶ֣ה עָלֶ֑יךָ בְּחַר־לְךָ֛ אַחַ֥ת מֵהֵ֖נָּה וְאֶעֱשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: “Go and tell David: Thus said the L<small>ORD</small>: I offer you three things; choose one of them and I will bring it upon you.”
Transliteration: lekhe vedivareta el-daviyd lemor khoh amar yehovah shalvosh aniy noteh aleykha vechar-lekha achat mehenah veeesheh-lakhe

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥בֹא גָ֖ד אֶל־דָּוִ֑יד וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֛וֹ כֹּה־אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה קַבֶּל־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: Gad came to David and told him, “Thus said the L<small>ORD</small>: Select for yourself
Transliteration: vayavo gad el-daviyd vayomer lvo khoh-amar yehovah kavel-lakhe

Hebrew: אִם־שָׁל֨וֹשׁ שָׁנִ֜ים רָעָ֗ב וְאִם־שְׁלֹשָׁ֨ה חֳדָשִׁ֜ים נִסְפֶּ֥ה מִפְּנֵֽי־צָרֶ֘יךָ֮ וְחֶ֣רֶב אוֹיְבֶ֣יךָ ׀ לְמַשֶּׂ֒גֶת֒ וְאִם־שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָ֠מִ֠ים חֶ֣רֶב יְהֹוָ֤ה וְדֶ֙בֶר֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ וּמַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה מַשְׁחִ֖ית בְּכׇל־גְּב֣וּל יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְעַתָּ֣ה רְאֵ֔ה מָה־אָשִׁ֥יב אֶת־שֹׁלְחִ֖י דָּבָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: a three-year famine; or that you be swept away three months before your adversaries with the sword of your enemies overtaking you; or three days of the sword of the L<small>ORD</small>, pestilence in the land, the angel of the L<small>ORD</small> wreaking destruction throughout the territory of Israel. Now consider what reply I shall take back to Him who sent me.”
Transliteration: im-shalvosh shaniym raav veim-sheloshah chodashiym nisefeh mifeney-tsareykha vecherev voyeveykha lemasheget veim-sheloshet yamiym cherev yehovah vedever vaarets umaleakhe yehovah mashechiyt vekhׇl-gevul yisherael veatah reeh mah-ashiyv et-sholechiy davar {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר דָּוִ֛יד אֶל־גָּ֖ד צַר־לִ֣י מְאֹ֑ד אֶפְּלָה־נָּ֣א בְיַד־יְהֹוָ֗ה כִּֽי־רַבִּ֤ים רַחֲמָיו֙ מְאֹ֔ד וּבְיַד־אָדָ֖ם אַל־אֶפֹּֽל׃
Translated: David said to Gad, “I am in great distress. Let me fall into the hands of the L<small>ORD</small>, for His compassion is very great; and let me not fall into the hands of men.”
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd el-gad tsar-liy meod efelah-na veyad-yehovah khiy-raviym rachamayv meod uveyad-adam al-efol

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה דֶּ֖בֶר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּפֹּל֙ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שִׁבְעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> sent a pestilence upon Israel, and 70,000 men fell in Israel.
Transliteration: vayiten yehovah dever veyisherael vayifol miyisherael shiveiym elef iysh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ הָאֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ מַלְאָ֥ךְ ׀ לִֽירוּשָׁלַ֘͏ִם֮ לְהַשְׁחִיתָהּ֒ וּכְהַשְׁחִ֗ית רָאָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ וַיִּנָּ֣חֶם עַל־הָרָעָ֔ה וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לַמַּלְאָ֤ךְ הַמַּשְׁחִית֙ רַ֔ב עַתָּ֖ה הֶ֣רֶף יָדֶ֑ךָ וּמַלְאַ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ עֹמֵ֔ד עִם־גֹּ֖רֶן אׇרְנָ֥ן הַיְבוּסִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it, but as he was about to wreak destruction, the L<small>ORD</small> saw and renounced further punishment and said to the destroying angel, “Enough! Stay your hand!” The angel of the L<small>ORD</small> was then standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
Transliteration: vayishelach haElohim maleakhe liyrushala͏im lehashechiytah ukhehashechiyt raah yehovah vayinachem al-haraah vayomer lamaleakhe hamashechiyt rav atah heref yadekha umaleakhe yehovah omed im-goren ׇrenan hayevusiy {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א דָוִ֜יד אֶת־עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּ֞רְא אֶת־מַלְאַ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ עֹמֵ֗ד בֵּ֤ין הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ וּבֵ֣ין הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְחַרְבּ֤וֹ שְׁלוּפָה֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ נְטוּיָ֖ה עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיִּפֹּ֨ל דָּוִ֧יד וְהַזְּקֵנִ֛ים מְכֻסִּ֥ים בַּשַּׂקִּ֖ים עַל־פְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: David looked up and saw the angel of the L<small>ORD</small> standing between heaven and earth, with a drawn sword in his hand directed against Jerusalem. David and the elders, covered in sackcloth, threw themselves on their faces.
Transliteration: vayisha daviyd et-eynayv vayare et-maleakhe yehovah omed veyn haarets uveyn hashamayiim vecharevvo shelufah veyadvo netuyah al-yerushala͏im vayifol daviyd vehazekeniym mekhusiym vashakiym al-feneyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֣יד אֶֽל־הָאֱלֹהִ֡ים הֲלֹא֩ אֲנִ֨י אָמַ֜רְתִּי לִמְנ֣וֹת בָּעָ֗ם וַאֲנִי־ה֤וּא אֲשֶׁר־חָטָ֙אתִי֙ וְהָרֵ֣עַ הֲרֵע֔וֹתִי וְאֵ֥לֶּה הַצֹּ֖אן מֶ֣ה עָשׂ֑וּ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהַ֗י תְּהִ֨י נָ֤א יָֽדְךָ֙ בִּ֚י וּבְבֵ֣ית אָבִ֔י וּֽבְעַמְּךָ֖ לֹ֥א לְמַגֵּפָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: David said to God, “Was it not I alone who ordered the numbering of the people? I alone am guilty, and have caused severe harm; but these sheep, what have they done? O L<small>ORD</small> my God, let Your hand fall upon me and my father’s house, and let not Your people be plagued!”
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd el-haElohim halo aniy amaretiy limenvot vaam vaaniy-hu asher-chatatiy veharea harevotiy veeleh hatson meh ashu yehovah elohay tehiy na yadekha viy uveveyt aviy uveamekha lo lemagefah {s}

Hebrew: וּמַלְאַ֧ךְ יְהֹוָ֛ה אָמַ֥ר אֶל־גָּ֖ד לֵאמֹ֣ר לְדָוִ֑יד כִּ֣י ׀ יַעֲלֶ֣ה דָוִ֗יד לְהָקִ֤ים מִזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה בְּגֹ֖רֶן אׇרְנָ֥ן הַיְבֻסִֽי׃
Translated: The angel of the L<small>ORD</small> told Gad to inform David that David should go and set up an altar to the L<small>ORD</small> on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
Transliteration: umaleakhe yehovah amar el-gad lemor ledaviyd khiy yaaleh daviyd lehakiym mizevecha layhovah vegoren ׇrenan hayevusiy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַל דָּוִיד֙ בִּדְבַר־גָּ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: David went up, following Gad’s instructions, which he had delivered in the name of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaal daviyd videvar-gad asher diver veshem yehovah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣שׇׁב אׇרְנָ֗ן וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־הַמַּלְאָ֔ךְ וְאַרְבַּ֧עַת בָּנָ֛יו עִמּ֖וֹ מִֽתְחַבְּאִ֑ים וְאׇרְנָ֖ן דָּ֥שׁ חִטִּֽים׃
Translated: Ornan too saw the angel; his four sons who were with him hid themselves while Ornan kept on threshing wheat.
Transliteration: vayashׇv ׇrenan vayare et-hamaleakhe vearevaat vanayv imvo mitechaveiym veׇrenan dash chitiym

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א דָוִ֖יד עַד־אׇרְנָ֑ן וַיַּבֵּ֤ט אׇרְנָן֙ וַיַּ֣רְא אֶת־דָּוִ֔יד וַיֵּצֵא֙ מִן־הַגֹּ֔רֶן וַיִּשְׁתַּ֧חוּ לְדָוִ֛יד אַפַּ֖יִם אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: David came to Ornan; when Ornan looked up, he saw David and came off the threshing floor and bowed low to David, with his face to the ground.
Transliteration: vayavo daviyd ad-ׇrenan vayavet ׇrenan vayare et-daviyd vayetse min-hagoren vayishetachu ledaviyd afayiim aretsah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜יד אֶל־אׇרְנָ֗ן תְּנָה־לִּי֙ מְק֣וֹם הַגֹּ֔רֶן וְאֶבְנֶה־בּ֥וֹ מִזְבֵּ֖חַ לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה בְּכֶ֤סֶף מָלֵא֙ תְּנֵ֣הוּ לִ֔י וְתֵעָצַ֥ר הַמַּגֵּפָ֖ה מֵעַ֥ל הָעָֽם׃
Translated: David said to Ornan, “Sell me the site of the threshing floor, that I may build on it an altar to the L<small>ORD</small>. Sell it to me at the full price, that the plague against the people will be checked.”
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd el-ׇrenan tenah-liy mekvom hagoren veeveneh-vvo mizevecha layhovah vekhesef male tenehu liy veteatsar hamagefah meal haam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אׇרְנָ֤ן אֶל־דָּוִיד֙ קַֽח־לָ֔ךְ וְיַ֛עַשׂ אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ הַטּ֣וֹב בְּעֵינָ֑יו רְאֵה֩ נָתַ֨תִּי הַבָּקָ֜ר לָעֹל֗וֹת וְהַמּוֹרִגִּ֧ים לָעֵצִ֛ים וְהַחִטִּ֥ים לַמִּנְחָ֖ה הַכֹּ֥ל נָתָֽתִּי׃
Translated: Ornan said to David, “Take it and let my lord the king do whatever he sees fit. See, I donate oxen for burnt offerings, and the threshing boards for wood, as well as wheat for a meal offering—I donate all of it.”
Transliteration: vayomer ׇrenan el-daviyd kach-lakhe veyaash adoniy hamelekhe hatvov veeynayv reeh natatiy havakar laolvot vehamvorigiym laetsiym vehachitiym laminechah hakhol natatiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ דָּוִיד֙ לְאׇרְנָ֔ן לֹ֕א כִּֽי־קָנֹ֥ה אֶקְנֶ֖ה בְּכֶ֣סֶף מָלֵ֑א כִּ֠י לֹא־אֶשָּׂ֤א אֲשֶׁר־לְךָ֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה וְהַעֲל֥וֹת עוֹלָ֖ה חִנָּֽם׃
Translated: But King David replied to Ornan, “No, I will buy them at the full price. I cannot make a present to the L<small>ORD</small> of what belongs to you, or sacrifice a burnt offering that has cost me nothing.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe daviyd leׇrenan lo khiy-kanoh ekeneh vekhesef male khiy lo-esha asher-lekha layhovah vehaalvot volah chinam

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֥ן דָּוִ֛יד לְאׇרְנָ֖ן בַּמָּק֑וֹם שִׁקְלֵ֣י זָהָ֔ב מִשְׁקָ֖ל שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: So David paid Ornan for the site 600 shekels’ worth of gold.
Transliteration: vayiten daviyd leׇrenan vamakvom shikeley zahav mishekal shesh mevot

Hebrew: וַיִּ֩בֶן֩ שָׁ֨ם דָּוִ֤יד מִזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וַיַּ֥עַל עֹל֖וֹת וּשְׁלָמִ֑ים וַיִּקְרָא֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַֽיַּעֲנֵ֤הוּ בָאֵשׁ֙ מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם עַ֖ל מִזְבַּ֥ח הָעֹלָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And David built there an altar to the L<small>ORD</small> and sacrificed burnt offerings and offerings of well-being. He invoked the L<small>ORD</small>, who answered him with fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offerings.
Transliteration: vayiven sham daviyd mizevecha layhovah vayaal olvot ushelamiym vayikera el-yehovah vayaanehu vaesh min-hashamayiim al mizevach haolah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ לַמַּלְאָ֔ךְ וַיָּ֥שֶׁב חַרְבּ֖וֹ אֶל־נְדָנָֽהּ׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> ordered the angel to return his sword to its sheath.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah lamaleakhe vayashev charevvo el-nedanah

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֔יא בִּרְא֤וֹת דָּוִיד֙ כִּֽי־עָנָ֣הוּ יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּגֹ֖רֶן אׇרְנָ֣ן הַיְבוּסִ֑י וַיִּזְבַּ֖ח שָֽׁם׃
Translated: At that time, when David saw that the L<small>ORD</small> answered him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there—
Transliteration: vaet hahiy virevot daviyd khiy-anahu yehovah vegoren ׇrenan hayevusiy vayizevach sham

Hebrew: וּמִשְׁכַּ֣ן יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֨ה מֹשֶׁ֧ה בַמִּדְבָּ֛ר וּמִזְבַּ֥ח הָעוֹלָ֖ה בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֑יא בַּבָּמָ֖ה בְּגִבְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: for the Tabernacle of the L<small>ORD</small>, which Moses had made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt offerings, were at that time in the shrine at Gibeon,
Transliteration: umishekhan yehovah asher-ashah mosheh vamidevar umizevach havolah vaet hahiy vavamah vegivevon

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יָכֹ֥ל דָּוִ֛יד לָלֶ֥כֶת לְפָנָ֖יו לִדְרֹ֣שׁ אֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּ֣י נִבְעַ֔ת מִפְּנֵ֕י חֶ֖רֶב מַלְאַ֥ךְ יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: and David was unable to go to it to worship God because he was terrified by the sword of the angel of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: velo-yakhol daviyd lalekhet lefanayv liderosh Elohim khiy niveat mifeney cherev maleakhe yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔יד זֶ֣ה ה֔וּא בֵּ֖ית יְהֹוָ֣ה הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְזֶה־מִּזְבֵּ֥חַ לְעֹלָ֖ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: David said, “Here will be the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and here the altar of burnt offerings for Israel.”
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd zeh hu veyt yehovah haElohim vezeh-mizevecha leolah leyisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔יד לִכְנוֹס֙ אֶת־הַגֵּרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּאֶ֣רֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּעֲמֵ֣ד חֹצְבִ֗ים לַחְצוֹב֙ אַבְנֵ֣י גָזִ֔ית לִבְנ֖וֹת בֵּ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: David gave orders to assemble the aliens living in the land of Israel, and assigned them to be hewers, to quarry and dress stones for building the House of God.
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd likhenvos et-hageriym asher veerets yisherael vayaamed chotseviym lachetsvov aveney gaziyt livenvot veyt haElohim

Hebrew: וּבַרְזֶ֣ל <small>׀</small> לָ֠רֹ֠ב לַֽמִּסְמְרִ֞ים לְדַלְת֧וֹת הַשְּׁעָרִ֛ים וְלַֽמְחַבְּר֖וֹת הֵכִ֣ין דָּוִ֑יד וּנְחֹ֥שֶׁת לָרֹ֖ב אֵ֥ין מִשְׁקָֽל׃
Translated: Much iron for nails for the doors of the gates and for clasps did David lay aside, and so much copper it could not be weighed,
Transliteration: uvarezel <small></small> larov lamisemeriym ledaletvot hasheariym velamechavervot hekhiyn daviyd unechoshet larov eyn mishekal

Hebrew: וַעֲצֵ֥י אֲרָזִ֖ים לְאֵ֣ין מִסְפָּ֑ר כִּֽי־הֵ֠בִ֠יאוּ הַצִּידֹנִ֨ים וְהַצֹּרִ֜ים עֲצֵ֧י אֲרָזִ֛ים לָרֹ֖ב לְדָוִֽיד׃ {פ}
Translated: and cedar logs without number—for the Sidonians and the Tyrians brought many cedar logs to David.
Transliteration: vaatsey araziym leeyn misefar khiy-heviyu hatsiydoniym vehatsoriym atsey araziym larov ledaviyd {f}
