Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֗יד שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בְנִי֮ נַ֣עַר וָרָךְ֒ וְהַבַּ֜יִת לִבְנ֣וֹת לַֽיהֹוָ֗ה לְהַגְדִּ֨יל <small>׀</small> לְמַ֜עְלָה לְשֵׁ֤ם וּלְתִפְאֶ֙רֶת֙ לְכׇל־הָ֣אֲרָצ֔וֹת אָכִ֥ינָה נָּ֖א ל֑וֹ וַיָּ֧כֶן דָּוִ֛יד לָרֹ֖ב לִפְנֵ֥י מוֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: For David thought, “My son Solomon is an untried youth, and the House to be built for the L<small>ORD</small> is to be made exceedingly great to win fame and glory throughout all the lands; let me then lay aside material for him.” So David laid aside much material before he died.
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd shelomoh veniy naar varakhe vehavayiit livenvot layhovah lehagediyl <small></small> lemaelah leshem uletifeeret lekhׇl-haaratsvot akhiynah na lvo vayakhen daviyd larov lifeney mvotvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֖א לִשְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בְנ֑וֹ וַיְצַוֵּ֙הוּ֙ לִבְנ֣וֹת בַּ֔יִת לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Then he summoned his son Solomon and charged him with building the House for the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel.
Transliteration: vayikera lishelomoh venvo vayetsavehu livenvot vayiit layhovah elohey yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר דָּוִ֖יד לִשְׁלֹמֹ֑ה (בנו) [בְּנִ֕י] אֲנִי֙ הָיָ֣ה עִם־לְבָבִ֔י לִבְנ֣וֹת בַּ֔יִת לְשֵׁ֖ם יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated: David said to Solomon, “My son, I wanted to build a House for the name of the L<small>ORD</small> my God.
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd lishelomoh (vnv) [veniy] aniy hayah im-levaviy livenvot vayiit leshem yehovah elohay

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י עָלַ֤י דְּבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר דָּ֤ם לָרֹב֙ שָׁפַ֔כְתָּ וּמִלְחָמ֥וֹת גְּדֹל֖וֹת עָשִׂ֑יתָ לֹא־תִבְנֶ֥ה בַ֙יִת֙ לִשְׁמִ֔י כִּ֚י דָּמִ֣ים רַבִּ֔ים שָׁפַ֥כְתָּ אַ֖רְצָה לְפָנָֽי׃
Translated: But the word of the L<small>ORD</small> came to me, saying,‘You have shed much blood and fought great battles; you shall not build a House for My name, for you have shed much blood on the earth in My sight.
Transliteration: vayehiy alay devar-yehovah lemor dam larov shafakheta umilechamvot gedolvot ashiyta lo-tiveneh vayiit lishemiy khiy damiym raviym shafakheta aretsah lefanay

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־בֵ֞ן נוֹלָ֣ד לָ֗ךְ ה֤וּא יִֽהְיֶה֙ אִ֣ישׁ מְנוּחָ֔ה וַהֲנִיח֥וֹתִי ל֛וֹ מִכׇּל־אוֹיְבָ֖יו מִסָּבִ֑יב כִּ֤י שְׁלֹמֹה֙ יִֽהְיֶ֣ה שְׁמ֔וֹ וְשָׁל֥וֹם וָשֶׁ֛קֶט אֶתֵּ֥ן עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּיָמָֽיו׃
Translated: But you will have a son who will be a man at rest, for I will give him rest from all his enemies on all sides; Solomon will be his name and I shall confer peace and quiet on Israel in his time.
Transliteration: hineh-ven nvolad lakhe hu yiheyeh iysh menuchah vahaniychvotiy lvo mikhׇl-voyevayv misaviyv khiy shelomoh yiheyeh shemvo veshalvom vasheket eten al-yisherael veyamayv

Hebrew: הֽוּא־יִבְנֶ֥ה בַ֙יִת֙ לִשְׁמִ֔י וְהוּא֙ יִֽהְיֶה־לִּ֣י לְבֵ֔ן וַאֲנִי־ל֖וֹ לְאָ֑ב וַהֲכִ֨ינוֹתִ֜י כִּסֵּ֧א מַלְכוּת֛וֹ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: He will build a House for My name; he shall be a son to Me and I to him a father, and I will establish his throne of kingship over Israel forever.’
Transliteration: hu-yiveneh vayiit lishemiy vehu yiheyeh-liy leven vaaniy-lvo leav vahakhiynvotiy khise malekhutvo al-yisherael ad-volam

Hebrew: עַתָּ֣ה בְנִ֔י יְהִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה עִמָּ֑ךְ וְהִצְלַחְתָּ֗ וּבָנִ֙יתָ֙ בֵּ֚ית יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר עָלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Now, my son, may the L<small>ORD</small> be with you, and may you succeed in building the House of the L<small>ORD</small> your God as He promised you would.
Transliteration: atah veniy yehiy yehovah imakhe vehitselacheta uvaniyta veyt yehovah eloheykha khaasher diver aleykha

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ יִֽתֶּן־לְךָ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ שֵׂ֣כֶל וּבִינָ֔ה וִֽיצַוְּךָ֖ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלִשְׁמ֕וֹר אֶת־תּוֹרַ֖ת יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: Only let God give you sense and understanding and put you in charge of Israel and the observance of the Teaching of the L<small>ORD</small> your God.
Transliteration: akhe yiten-lekha yehovah shekhel uviynah viytsavekha al-yisherael velishemvor et-tvorat yehovah eloheykha

Hebrew: אָ֣ז תַּצְלִ֔יחַ אִם־תִּשְׁמ֗וֹר לַֽעֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־הַחֻקִּ֣ים וְאֶת־הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל חֲזַ֣ק וֶאֱמָ֔ץ אַל־תִּירָ֖א וְאַל־תֵּחָֽת׃
Translated: Then you shall succeed, if you observantly carry out the laws and the rules that the L<small>ORD</small> charged Moses to lay upon Israel. Be strong and of good courage; do not be afraid or dismayed.
Transliteration: az tatseliycha im-tishemvor laashvot et-hachukiym veet-hamishefatiym asher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh al-yisherael chazak veemats al-tiyra veal-techat

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה בְעׇנְיִ֜י הֲכִינ֣וֹתִי לְבֵית־יְהֹוָ֗ה זָהָ֞ב כִּכָּרִ֤ים מֵֽאָה־אֶ֙לֶף֙ וְכֶ֗סֶף אֶ֤לֶף אֲלָפִים֙ כִּכָּרִ֔ים וְלַנְּחֹ֤שֶׁת וְלַבַּרְזֶל֙ אֵ֣ין מִשְׁקָ֔ל כִּ֥י לָרֹ֖ב הָיָ֑ה וְעֵצִ֤ים וַֽאֲבָנִים֙ הֲכִינ֔וֹתִי וַעֲלֵיהֶ֖ם תּוֹסִֽיף׃
Translated: See, by denying myself, I have laid aside for the House of the L<small>ORD</small> one hundred thousand talents of gold and one million talents of silver, and so much copper and iron it cannot be weighed; I have also laid aside wood and stone, and you shall add to them.
Transliteration: vehineh veׇneyiy hakhiynvotiy leveyt-yehovah zahav khikhariym meah-elef vekhesef elef alafiym khikhariym velanechoshet velavarezel eyn mishekal khiy larov hayah veetsiym vaavaniym hakhiynvotiy vaaleyhem tvosiyf

Hebrew: וְעִמְּךָ֤ לָרֹב֙ עֹשֵׂ֣י מְלָאכָ֔ה חֹצְבִ֕ים וְחָרָשֵׁ֥י אֶ֖בֶן וָעֵ֑ץ וְכׇל־חָכָ֖ם בְּכׇל־מְלָאכָֽה׃
Translated: An abundance of workmen is at your disposal—hewers, workers in stone and wood, and every kind of craftsman in every kind of material—
Transliteration: veimekha larov oshey melakhah chotseviym vecharashey even vaets vekhׇl-chakham vekhׇl-melakhah

Hebrew: לַזָּהָ֥ב לַכֶּ֛סֶף וְלַנְּחֹ֥שֶׁת וְלַבַּרְזֶ֖ל אֵ֣ין מִסְפָּ֑ר ק֣וּם וַעֲשֵׂ֔ה וִיהִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: gold, silver, copper, and iron without limit. Go and do it, and may the L<small>ORD</small> be with you.”
Transliteration: lazahav lakhesef velanechoshet velavarezel eyn misefar kum vaasheh viyhiy yehovah imakhe

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו דָּוִיד֙ לְכׇל־שָׂרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לַעְזֹ֖ר לִשְׁלֹמֹ֥ה בְנֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: David charged all the officers of Israel to support his son Solomon,
Transliteration: vayetsav daviyd lekhׇl-sharey yisherael laezor lishelomoh venvo {s}

Hebrew: הֲלֹ֨א יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם וְהֵנִ֥יחַ לָכֶ֖ם מִסָּבִ֑יב כִּ֣י ׀ נָתַ֣ן בְּיָדִ֗י אֵ֚ת יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ וְנִכְבְּשָׁ֥ה הָאָ֛רֶץ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלִפְנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: “See, the L<small>ORD</small> your God is with you, and He will give you rest on every side, for He delivered the inhabitants of the land into my hand so that the land lies conquered before the L<small>ORD</small> and before His people.
Transliteration: halo yehovah eloheykhem imakhem veheniycha lakhem misaviyv khiy natan veyadiy et yoshevey haarets venikheveshah haarets lifeney yehovah velifeney amvo

Hebrew: עַתָּ֗ה תְּנ֤וּ לְבַבְכֶם֙ וְנַפְשְׁכֶ֔ם לִדְר֖וֹשׁ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם וְק֗וּמוּ וּבְנוּ֙ אֶת־מִקְדַּשׁ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים לְהָבִ֞יא אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֗ה וּכְלֵי֙ קֹ֣דֶשׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים לַבַּ֖יִת הַנִּבְנֶ֥ה לְשֵׁם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Now, set your minds and hearts on worshiping the L<small>ORD</small> your God, and go build the Sanctuary of the L<small>ORD</small> your God so that you may bring the Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small> and the holy vessels of God to the house that is built for the name of the L<small>ORD</small>.”
Transliteration: atah tenu levavekhem venafeshekhem lidervosh layhovah eloheykhem vekumu uvenu et-mikedash yehovah haElohim lehaviy et-arvon veriyt-yehovah ukheley kodesh haElohim lavayiit haniveneh leshem-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֥יד זָקֵ֖ן וְשָׂבַ֣ע יָמִ֑ים וַיַּמְלֵ֛ךְ אֶת־שְׁלֹמֹ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: When David reached a ripe old age, he made his son Solomon king over Israel.
Transliteration: vedaviyd zaken veshava yamiym vayamelekhe et-shelomoh venvo al-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֶּֽאֱסֹף֙ אֶת־כׇּל־שָׂרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְהַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: Then David assembled all the officers of Israel and the priests and the Levites.
Transliteration: vayeesof et-khׇl-sharey yisherael vehakhohaniym vehaleviyim

Hebrew: וַיִּסָּֽפְרוּ֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם מִבֶּ֛ן שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וָמָ֑עְלָה וַיְהִ֨י מִסְפָּרָ֤ם לְגֻלְגְּלֹתָם֙ לִגְבָרִ֔ים שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וּשְׁמוֹנָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: The Levites, from the age of thirty and upward, were counted; the head-count of their males was 38,000:
Transliteration: vayisaferu haleviyim miven sheloshiym shanah vamaelah vayehiy misefaram legulegelotam ligevariym sheloshiym ushemvonah alef

Hebrew: מֵאֵ֗לֶּה לְנַצֵּ֙חַ֙ עַל־מְלֶ֣אכֶת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֔ה עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָ֑לֶף וְשֹׁטְרִ֥ים וְשֹׁפְטִ֖ים שֵׁ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִֽים׃
Translated: of these there were 24,000 in charge of the work of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, 6,000 officers and magistrates,
Transliteration: meeleh lenatsecha al-melekhet veyt-yehovah esheriym vearevaah alef veshoteriym veshofetiym sheshet alafiym

Hebrew: וְאַרְבַּ֥עַת אֲלָפִ֖ים שֹׁעֲרִ֑ים וְאַרְבַּ֤עַת אֲלָפִים֙ מְהַֽלְלִ֣ים לַיהֹוָ֔ה בַּכֵּלִ֕ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתִי לְהַלֵּֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: 4,000 gatekeepers, and 4,000 for praising the L<small>ORD</small> “with instruments I devised for singing praises.”
Transliteration: vearevaat alafiym shoariym vearevaat alafiym mehaleliym layhovah vakheliym asher ashiytiy lehalel {s}

Hebrew: וַיֶּחָלְקֵ֥ם דָּוִ֖יד מַחְלְק֑וֹת {ס} לִבְנֵ֣י לֵוִ֔י לְגֵרְשׁ֖וֹן קְהָ֥ת וּמְרָרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated:
David formed them into divisions:
The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
Transliteration: vayechalekem daviyd machelekvot {s} liveney leviy legereshvon kehat umerariy {s}

Hebrew: לַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֖י לַעְדָּ֥ן וְשִׁמְעִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: The Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei.
Transliteration: lagereshuniy laedan veshimeiy {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י לַעְדָּ֗ן הָרֹ֧אשׁ יְחִיאֵ֛ל וְזֵתָ֥ם וְיוֹאֵ֖ל שְׁלֹשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the chief, Zetham, and Joel—3.
Transliteration: veney laedan harosh yechiyel vezetam veyvoel sheloshah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י שִׁמְעִ֗י (שלמות) [שְׁלֹמִ֧ית] וַחֲזִיאֵ֛ל וְהָרָ֖ן שְׁלֹשָׁ֑ה אֵ֛לֶּה רָאשֵׁ֥י הָאָב֖וֹת לְלַעְדָּֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Shimei: Shelomith, Haziel, and Haran—3. These were the chiefs of the clans of the Ladanites.
Transliteration: veney shimeiy (shlmvt) [shelomiyt] vachaziyel veharan sheloshah eleh rashey haavvot lelaedan {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י שִׁמְעִ֔י יַ֣חַת זִינָ֔א וִיע֖וּשׁ וּבְרִיעָ֑ה אֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵֽי־שִׁמְעִ֖י אַרְבָּעָֽה׃
Translated: And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah; these were the sons of Shimei—4.
Transliteration: uveney shimeiy yachat ziyna viyush uveriyah eleh veney-shimeiy arevaah

Hebrew: וַיְהִי־יַ֣חַת הָרֹ֔אשׁ וְזִיזָ֖ה הַשֵּׁנִ֑י וִיע֤וּשׁ וּבְרִיעָה֙ לֹא־הִרְבּ֣וּ בָנִ֔ים וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ לְבֵ֣ית אָ֔ב לִפְקֻדָּ֖ה אֶחָֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: Jahath was the chief and Zizah the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many children, so they were enrolled together as a single clan.
Transliteration: vayehiy-yachat harosh veziyzah hasheniy viyush uveriyah lo-hirevu vaniym vayiheyu leveyt av lifekudah echat {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י קְהָ֗ת עַמְרָ֥ם יִצְהָ֛ר חֶבְר֥וֹן וְעֻזִּיאֵ֖ל אַרְבָּעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel—4.
Transliteration: veney kehat ameram yitsehar chevervon veuziyel arevaah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י עַמְרָ֖ם אַהֲרֹ֣ן וּמֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיִּבָּדֵ֣ל אַהֲרֹ֡ן לְֽהַקְדִּישׁוֹ֩ קֹ֨דֶשׁ קׇדָשִׁ֤ים הֽוּא־וּבָנָיו֙ עַד־עוֹלָ֔ם לְהַקְטִיר֩ לִפְנֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֧ה לְשָׁרְת֛וֹ וּלְבָרֵ֥ךְ בִּשְׁמ֖וֹ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses. Aaron was set apart, he and his sons, forever, to be consecrated as most holy, to make burnt offerings to the L<small>ORD</small> and serve Him and pronounce blessings in His name forever.
Transliteration: veney ameram aharon umosheh vayivadel aharon lehakediyshvo kodesh kׇdashiym hu-uvanayv ad-volam lehaketiyr lifeney yehovah lesharetvo ulevarekhe vishemvo ad-volam

Hebrew: וּמֹשֶׁ֖ה אִ֣ישׁ הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים בָּנָ֕יו יִקָּרְא֖וּ עַל־שֵׁ֥בֶט הַלֵּוִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: As for Moses, the man of God, his sons were named after the tribe of Levi.
Transliteration: umosheh iysh haElohim vanayv yikareu al-shevet haleviy {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה גֵּרְשׁ֖וֹם וֶאֱלִיעֶֽזֶר׃
Translated: The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.
Transliteration: veney mosheh gereshvom veeliyezer

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י גֵרְשׁ֖וֹם שְׁבוּאֵ֥ל הָרֹֽאשׁ׃
Translated: The sons of Gershom: Shebuel the chief.
Transliteration: veney gereshvom shevuel harosh

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ בְנֵֽי־אֱלִיעֶ֖זֶר רְחַבְיָ֣ה הָרֹ֑אשׁ וְלֹא־הָיָ֤ה לֶאֱלִיעֶ֙זֶר֙ בָּנִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וּבְנֵ֥י רְחַבְיָ֖ה רָב֥וּ לְמָֽעְלָה׃ {ס}
Translated: And the sons of Eliezer were: Rehabiah the chief. Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very numerous.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney-eliyezer rechaveyah harosh velo-hayah leeliyezer vaniym acheriym uveney rechaveyah ravu lemaelah {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י יִצְהָ֖ר שְׁלֹמִ֥ית הָרֹֽאשׁ׃
Translated: The sons of Izhar: Shelomith the chief.
Transliteration: veney yitsehar shelomiyt harosh

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י חֶבְר֑וֹן יְרִיָּ֤הוּ הָרֹאשׁ֙ אֲמַרְיָ֣ה הַשֵּׁנִ֔י יַֽחֲזִיאֵל֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י וִֽיקַמְעָ֖ם הָרְבִיעִֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
Transliteration: veney chevervon yeriyahu harosh amareyah hasheniy yachaziyel hasheliyshiy viykameam hareviyiy

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י עֻזִּיאֵ֑ל מִיכָ֣ה הָרֹ֔אשׁ וְיִשִּׁיָּ֖ה הַשֵּׁנִֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Uzziel: Micah the chief and Isshiah the second.
Transliteration: veney uziyel miykhah harosh veyishiyah hasheniy

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י מְרָרִי֙ מַחְלִ֣י וּמוּשִׁ֔י בְּנֵ֥י מַחְלִ֖י אֶלְעָזָ֥ר וְקִֽישׁ׃
Translated: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.
Transliteration: veney merariy macheliy umushiy veney macheliy eleazar vekiysh

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙מׇת֙ אֶלְעָזָ֔ר וְלֹא־הָ֥יוּ ל֛וֹ בָּנִ֖ים כִּ֣י אִם־בָּנ֑וֹת וַיִּשָּׂא֥וּם בְּנֵי־קִ֖ישׁ אֲחֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Eleazar died having no sons but only daughters; the sons of Kish, their kinsmen, married them.
Transliteration: vayamׇt eleazar velo-hayu lvo vaniym khiy im-vanvot vayishaum veney-kiysh acheyhem

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י מוּשִׁ֗י מַחְלִ֥י וְעֵ֛דֶר וִירֵמ֖וֹת שְׁלוֹשָֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jeremoth—3.
Transliteration: veney mushiy macheliy veeder viyremvot shelvoshah {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה בְנֵֽי־לֵוִי֩ לְבֵ֨ית אֲבוֹתֵיהֶ֜ם רָאשֵׁ֧י הָאָב֣וֹת לִפְקוּדֵיהֶ֗ם בְּמִסְפַּ֤ר שֵׁמוֹת֙ לְגֻלְגְּלֹתָ֔ם עֹשֵׂה֙ הַמְּלָאכָ֔ה לַעֲבֹדַ֖ת בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה מִבֶּ֛ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וָמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: These are the sons of Levi by clans, with their clan chiefs as they were enrolled, with a list of their names by heads, who did the work of the service of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> from the age of twenty and upward.
Transliteration: eleh veney-leviy leveyt avvoteyhem rashey haavvot lifekudeyhem vemisefar shemvot legulegelotam osheh hamelakhah laavodat veyt yehovah miven esheriym shanah vamaelah

Hebrew: כִּ֚י אָמַ֣ר דָּוִ֔יד הֵנִ֛יחַ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְעַמּ֑וֹ וַיִּשְׁכֹּ֥ן בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם עַד־לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: For David said, “The L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel has given rest to His people and made His dwelling in Jerusalem forever.
Transliteration: khiy amar daviyd heniycha yehovah elohey-yisherael leamvo vayishekhon viyrushala͏im ad-levolam

Hebrew: וְגַ֖ם לַלְוִיִּ֑ם אֵין־לָשֵׂ֧את אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֖יו לַעֲבֹדָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Therefore the Levites need not carry the Tabernacle and all its various service vessels.”
Transliteration: vegam laleviyim eyn-lashet et-hamishekhan veet-khׇl-khelayv laavodatvo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בְדִבְרֵ֤י דָוִיד֙ הָאַ֣חֲרוֹנִ֔ים הֵ֖מָּה מִסְפַּ֣ר בְּנֵֽי־לֵוִ֑י מִבֶּ֛ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וּלְמָֽעְלָה׃
Translated: Among the last acts of David was the counting of the Levites from the age of twenty and upward.
Transliteration: khiy vediverey daviyd haacharvoniym hemah misefar veney-leviy miven esheriym shanah ulemaelah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י מַעֲמָדָ֞ם לְיַד־בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֗ן לַֽעֲבֹדַת֙ בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־הַֽחֲצֵרוֹת֙ וְעַל־הַלְּשָׁכ֔וֹת וְעַֽל־טׇהֳרַ֖ת לְכׇל־קֹ֑דֶשׁ וּמַֽעֲשֵׂ֔ה עֲבֹדַ֖ת בֵּ֥ית הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: For their appointment was alongside the Aaronites for the service of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, to look after the courts and the chambers, and the purity of all the holy things, and the performance of the service of the House of God,
Transliteration: khiy maamadam leyad-veney aharon laavodat veyt yehovah al-hachatservot veal-haleshakhvot veal-tׇhorat lekhׇl-kodesh umaasheh avodat veyt haElohim

Hebrew: וּלְלֶ֨חֶם הַֽמַּעֲרֶ֜כֶת וּלְסֹ֤לֶת לְמִנְחָה֙ וְלִרְקִיקֵ֣י הַמַּצּ֔וֹת וְלַֽמַּחֲבַ֖ת וְלַמֻּרְבָּ֑כֶת וּלְכׇל־מְשׂוּרָ֖ה וּמִדָּֽה׃
Translated: and the rows of bread, and the fine flour for the meal offering, and the unleavened wafers, and the cakes made on the griddle and soaked, and every measure of capacity and length;
Transliteration: ulelechem hamaarekhet ulesolet leminechah velirekiykey hamatsvot velamachavat velamurevakhet ulekhׇl-meshurah umidah

Hebrew: וְלַֽעֲמֹד֙ בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֔קֶר לְהֹד֥וֹת וּלְהַלֵּ֖ל לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וְכֵ֖ן לָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: and to be present every morning to praise and extol the L<small>ORD</small>, and at evening too,
Transliteration: velaamod vavoker vavoker lehodvot ulehalel layhovah vekhen laarev

Hebrew: וּלְכֹ֨ל הַעֲל֤וֹת עֹלוֹת֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה לַשַּׁ֨בָּת֔וֹת לֶחֳדָשִׁ֖ים וְלַמֹּעֲדִ֑ים בְּמִסְפָּ֨ר כְּמִשְׁפָּ֧ט עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם תָּמִ֖יד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and whenever offerings were made to the L<small>ORD</small>, according to the quantities prescribed for them, on sabbaths, new moons and holidays, regularly, before the L<small>ORD</small>;
Transliteration: ulekhol haalvot olvot layhovah lashavatvot lechodashiym velamoadiym vemisefar khemishefat aleyhem tamiyd lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְשָׁמְר֞וּ אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֗ד וְאֵת֙ מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וּמִשְׁמֶ֕רֶת בְּנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹ֖ן אֲחֵיהֶ֑ם לַעֲבֹדַ֖ת בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: and so to keep watch over the Tent of Meeting, over the holy things, and over the Aaronites their kinsmen, for the service of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: veshameru et-mishemeret ohel-mvoed veet mishemeret hakodesh umishemeret veney aharon acheyhem laavodat veyt yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹ֖ן מַחְלְקוֹתָ֑ם בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן נָדָב֙ וַאֲבִיה֔וּא אֶלְעָזָ֖ר וְאִיתָמָֽר׃
Translated:
The divisions of the Aaronites were:
The sons of Aaron: Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
Transliteration: veliveney aharon machelekvotam veney aharon nadav vaaviyhu eleazar veiytamar

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨מׇת נָדָ֤ב וַֽאֲבִיהוּא֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אֲבִיהֶ֔ם וּבָנִ֖ים לֹא־הָי֣וּ לָהֶ֑ם וַֽיְכַהֲנ֔וּ אֶלְעָזָ֖ר וְאִיתָמָֽר׃
Translated: Nadab and Abihu died in the lifetime of their father, and they had no children, so Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.
Transliteration: vayamׇt nadav vaaviyhu lifeney aviyhem uvaniym lo-hayu lahem vayekhahanu eleazar veiytamar

Hebrew: וַיֶּחָלְקֵ֣ם דָּוִ֔יד וְצָדוֹק֙ מִן־בְּנֵ֣י אֶלְעָזָ֔ר וַאֲחִימֶ֖לֶךְ מִן־בְּנֵ֣י אִיתָמָ֑ר לִפְקֻדָּתָ֖ם בַּעֲבֹדָתָֽם׃
Translated: David, Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar divided them into offices by their tasks.
Transliteration: vayechalekem daviyd vetsadvok min-veney eleazar vaachiymelekhe min-veney iytamar lifekudatam vaavodatam

Hebrew: וַיִּמָּצְא֣וּ בְֽנֵי־אֶלְעָזָ֡ר רַבִּ֞ים לְרָאשֵׁ֧י הַגְּבָרִ֛ים מִן־בְּנֵ֥י אִיתָמָ֖ר וַֽיַּחְלְק֑וּם לִבְנֵ֨י אֶלְעָזָ֜ר רָאשִׁ֤ים לְבֵית־אָבוֹת֙ שִׁשָּׁ֣ה עָשָׂ֔ר וְלִבְנֵ֧י אִיתָמָ֛ר לְבֵ֥ית אֲבוֹתָ֖ם שְׁמוֹנָֽה׃
Translated: The sons of Eleazar turned out to be more numerous by male heads than the sons of Ithamar, so they divided the sons of Eleazar into sixteen chiefs of clans and the sons of Ithamar into eight clans.
Transliteration: vayimatseu veney-eleazar raviym lerashey hagevariym min-veney iytamar vayachelekum liveney eleazar rashiym leveyt-avvot shishah ashar veliveney iytamar leveyt avvotam shemvonah

Hebrew: וַיַּחְלְק֥וּם בְּגוֹרָל֖וֹת אֵ֣לֶּה עִם־אֵ֑לֶּה כִּֽי־הָי֤וּ שָׂרֵי־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ וְשָׂרֵ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים מִבְּנֵ֥י אֶלְעָזָ֖ר וּבִבְנֵ֥י אִיתָמָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: They divided them by lot, both on an equal footing, since they were all sanctuary officers and officers of God—the sons of Eleazar and the sons of Ithamar.
Transliteration: vayachelekum vegvoralvot eleh im-eleh khiy-hayu sharey-kodesh vesharey haElohim miveney eleazar uviveney iytamar {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּכְתְּבֵ֡ם שְֽׁמַעְיָה֩ בֶן־נְתַנְאֵ֨ל הַסּוֹפֵ֜ר מִן־הַלֵּוִ֗י לִפְנֵ֨י הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ וְהַשָּׂרִים֙ וְצָד֣וֹק הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וַאֲחִימֶ֙לֶךְ֙ בֶּן־אֶבְיָתָ֔ר וְרָאשֵׁי֙ הָאָב֔וֹת לַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְלַלְוִיִּ֑ם בֵּֽית־אָ֣ב אֶחָ֗ד אָחֻז֙ לְאֶלְעָזָ֔ר וְאָחֻ֥ז ׀ אָחֻ֖ז לְאִיתָמָֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: Shemaiah son of Nathanel, the scribe, who was of the Levites, registered them under the eye of the king, the officers, and Zadok the priest, and Ahimelech son of Abiathar, and the chiefs of clans of the priests and Levites—one clan more taken for Eleazar for each one taken of Ithamar.
Transliteration: vayikhetevem shemaeyah ven-netaneel hasvofer min-haleviy lifeney hamelekhe vehashariym vetsadvok hakhohen vaachiymelekhe ven-eveyatar verashey haavvot lakhohaniym velaleviyim veyt-av echad achuz leeleazar veachuz achuz leiytamar {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֞א הַגּוֹרָ֤ל הָֽרִאשׁוֹן֙ לִיה֣וֹיָרִ֔יב {ס} לִידַֽעְיָ֖ה הַשֵּׁנִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: The first lot fell on Jehoiarib; the second on Jedaiah;
Transliteration: vayetse hagvoral harishvon liyhvoyariyv {s} liydaeyah hasheniy {s}

Hebrew: לְחָרִם֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י {ס} לִשְׂעֹרִ֖ים הָרְבִעִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: the third on Harim; the fourth on Seorim;
Transliteration: lecharim hasheliyshiy {s} lisheoriym hareviiy {s}

Hebrew: לְמַלְכִּיָּה֙ הַחֲמִישִׁ֔י {ס} לְמִיָּמִ֖ן הַשִּׁשִּֽׁי׃ {ס}
Translated: the fifth on Malchijah; the sixth on Mijamin;
Transliteration: lemalekhiyah hachamiyshiy {s} lemiyamin hashishiy {s}

Hebrew: לְהַקּוֹץ֙ הַשְּׁבִעִ֔י {ס} לַאֲבִיָּ֖ה הַשְּׁמִינִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: the seventh on Hakkoz; the eighth on Abijah;
Transliteration: lehakvots hasheviiy {s} laaviyah hashemiyniy {s}

Hebrew: לְיֵשׁ֙וּעַ֙ הַתְּשִׁעִ֔י {ס} לִשְׁכַנְיָ֖הוּ הָעֲשִׂרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: the ninth on Jeshua; the tenth on Shecaniah;
Transliteration: leeishua hateshiiy {s} lishekhaneyahu haashiriy {s}

Hebrew: לְאֶלְיָשִׁיב֙ עַשְׁתֵּ֣י עָשָׂ֔ר {ס} לְיָקִ֖ים שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the eleventh on Eliashib; the twelfth on Jakim;
Transliteration: leeleyashiyv ashetey ashar {s} leyakiym sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לְחֻפָּה֙ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה עָשָׂ֔ר {ס} לְיֶשֶׁבְאָ֖ב אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the thirteenth on Huppah; the fourteenth on Jeshebeab;
Transliteration: lechufah sheloshah ashar {s} leyesheveav arevaah ashar {s}

Hebrew: לְבִלְגָּה֙ חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה עָשָׂ֔ר {ס} לְאִמֵּ֖ר שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the fifteenth on Bilgah; the sixteenth on Immer;
Transliteration: levilegah chamishah ashar {s} leimer shishah ashar {s}

Hebrew: לְחֵזִיר֙ שִׁבְעָ֣ה עָשָׂ֔ר {ס} לְהַפִּצֵּ֖ץ שְׁמוֹנָ֥ה עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the seventeenth on Hezir; the eighteenth on Happizzez;
Transliteration: lecheziyr shiveah ashar {s} lehafitsets shemvonah ashar {s}

Hebrew: לִֽפְתַחְיָה֙ תִּשְׁעָ֣ה עָשָׂ֔ר {ס} לִֽיחֶזְקֵ֖אל הָעֶשְׂרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: the nineteenth on Pethahiah; the twentieth on Jehezkel;
Transliteration: lifetacheyah tisheah ashar {s} liychezekel haesheriym {s}

Hebrew: לְיָכִין֙ אֶחָ֣ד וְעֶשְׂרִ֔ים {ס} לְגָמ֖וּל שְׁנַ֥יִם וְעֶשְׂרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: the twenty-first on Jachin; the twenty-second on Gamul;
Transliteration: leyakhiyn echad veesheriym {s} legamul shenayiim veesheriym {s}

Hebrew: לִדְלָיָ֙הוּ֙ שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֔ים {ס} לְמַעַזְיָ֖הוּ אַרְבָּעָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: the twenty-third on Delaiah; the twenty-fourth on Maaziah.
Transliteration: lidelayahu sheloshah veesheriym {s} lemaazeyahu arevaah veesheriym {f}

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה פְקֻדָּתָ֞ם לַעֲבֹדָתָ֗ם לָב֤וֹא לְבֵית־יְהֹוָה֙ כְּמִשְׁפָּטָ֔ם בְּיַ֖ד אַהֲרֹ֣ן אֲבִיהֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֔הוּ יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: According to this allocation of offices by tasks, they were to enter the House of the L<small>ORD</small> as was laid down for them by Aaron their father, as the L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel had commanded him.
Transliteration: eleh fekudatam laavodatam lavvo leveyt-yehovah khemishefatam veyad aharon aviyhem khaasher tsivahu yehovah elohey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֥י לֵוִ֖י הַנּוֹתָרִ֑ים לִבְנֵ֤י עַמְרָם֙ שֽׁוּבָאֵ֔ל לִבְנֵ֥י שׁוּבָאֵ֖ל יֶחְדְּיָֽהוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: The remaining Levites: the sons of Amram: Shubael; the sons of Shubael: Jehdeiah;
Transliteration: veliveney leviy hanvotariym liveney ameram shuvael liveney shuvael yechedeyahu {s}

Hebrew: לִרְחַבְיָ֑הוּ לִבְנֵ֣י רְחַבְיָ֔הוּ הָרֹ֖אשׁ יִשִּׁיָּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Rehabiah. The sons of Rehabiah: Isshiah, the chief.
Transliteration: lirechaveyahu liveney rechaveyahu harosh yishiyah {s}

Hebrew: לַיִּצְהָרִ֣י שְׁלֹמ֔וֹת לִבְנֵ֥י שְׁלֹמ֖וֹת יָֽחַת׃ {ס}
Translated: Izharites: Shelomoth. The sons of Shelomoth: Jahath
Transliteration: layitsehariy shelomvot liveney shelomvot yachat {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנָ֖י יְרִיָּ֑הוּ אֲמַרְיָ֙הוּ֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י יַחֲזִיאֵל֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י יְקַמְעָ֖ם הָרְבִיעִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: and Benai, Jeriah; the second, Amariah; the third, Jahaziel; the fourth, Jekameam.
Transliteration: uvenay yeriyahu amareyahu hasheniy yachaziyel hasheliyshiy yekameam hareviyiy {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י עֻזִּיאֵל֙ מִיכָ֔ה לִבְנֵ֥י מִיכָ֖ה (שמור) [שָׁמִֽיר]׃
Translated: The sons of Uzziel: Micah. The sons of Micah: Shamir.
Transliteration: veney uziyel miykhah liveney miykhah (shmvr) [shamiyr]

Hebrew: אֲחִ֤י מִיכָה֙ יִשִּׁיָּ֔ה {ס} לִבְנֵ֥י יִשִּׁיָּ֖ה זְכַרְיָֽהוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: The brother of Micah: Isshiah. The sons of Isshiah: Zechariah.
Transliteration: achiy miykhah yishiyah {s} liveney yishiyah zekhareyahu {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י מְרָרִי֙ מַחְלִ֣י וּמוּשִׁ֔י {ס} בְּנֵ֖י יַעֲזִיָּ֥הוּ בְנֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Jaazaiah, his son—
Transliteration: veney merariy macheliy umushiy {s} veney yaaziyahu venvo {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י מְרָרִ֑י לְיַעֲזִיָּ֣הוּ בְנ֔וֹ וְשֹׁ֥הַם וְזַכּ֖וּר וְעִבְרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: the sons of Merari by Jaazaiah his son: Shoham, Zakkur, and Ibri.
Transliteration: veney merariy leyaaziyahu venvo veshoham vezakhur veiveriy {s}

Hebrew: לְמַחְלִי֙ אֶלְעָזָ֔ר וְלֹא־הָ֥יָה ל֖וֹ בָּנִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Mahli: Eleazar; he had no sons.
Transliteration: lemacheliy eleazar velo-hayah lvo vaniym {s}

Hebrew: לְקִ֖ישׁ בְּנֵי־קִ֥ישׁ יְרַחְמְאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Kish: the sons of Kish: Jerahmeel.
Transliteration: lekiysh veney-kiysh yerachemeel {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י מוּשִׁ֔י מַחְלִ֥י וְעֵ֖דֶר וִירִימ֑וֹת אֵ֛לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י הַלְוִיִּ֖ם לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites by their clans.
Transliteration: uveney mushiy macheliy veeder viyriymvot eleh veney haleviyim leveyt avoteyhem

Hebrew: וַיַּפִּ֩ילוּ֩ גַם־הֵ֨ם גּוֹרָל֜וֹת לְעֻמַּ֣ת ׀ אֲחֵיהֶ֣ם בְּנֵי־אַהֲרֹ֗ן לִפְנֵ֨י דָוִ֤יד הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וְצָד֣וֹק וַאֲחִימֶ֔לֶךְ וְרָאשֵׁי֙ הָאָב֔וֹת לַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים וְלַלְוִיִּ֑ם אָב֣וֹת הָרֹ֔אשׁ לְעֻמַּ֖ת אָחִ֥יו הַקָּטָֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: These too cast lots corresponding to their kinsmen, the sons of Aaron, under the eye of King David and Zadok and Ahimelech and the chiefs of the clans of the priests and Levites, on the principle of “chief and youngest brother alike.”
Transliteration: vayafiylu gam-hem gvoralvot leumat acheyhem veney-aharon lifeney daviyd hamelekhe vetsadvok vaachiymelekhe verashey haavvot lakhohaniym velaleviyim avvot harosh leumat achiyv hakatan {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּבְדֵּ֣ל דָּוִיד֩ וְשָׂרֵ֨י הַצָּבָ֜א לַעֲבֹדָ֗ה לִבְנֵ֤י אָסָף֙ וְהֵימָ֣ן וִידוּת֔וּן (הנביאים) [הַֽנִּבְּאִ֛ים] בְּכִנֹּר֥וֹת בִּנְבָלִ֖ים וּבִמְצִלְתָּ֑יִם וַֽיְהִי֙ מִסְפָּרָ֔ם אַנְשֵׁ֥י מְלָאכָ֖ה לַעֲבֹדָתָֽם׃
Translated: David and the officers of the army set apart for service the sons of Asaph, of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who prophesied to the accompaniment of lyres, harps, and cymbals. The list of men who performed this work, according to their service, was:
Transliteration: vayavedel daviyd vesharey hatsava laavodah liveney asaf veheyman viydutun (hnvyym) [haniveiym] vekhinorvot vinevaliym uvimetsiletayiim vayehiy misefaram aneshey melakhah laavodatam

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י אָסָ֗ף זַכּ֧וּר וְיוֹסֵ֛ף וּנְתַנְיָ֥ה וַאֲשַׂרְאֵ֖לָה בְּנֵ֣י אָסָ֑ף עַ֚ל יַד־אָסָ֔ף הַנִּבָּ֖א עַל־יְדֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Sons of Asaph: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah—sons of Asaph under the charge of Asaph, who prophesied by order of the king.
Transliteration: liveney asaf zakhur veyvosef unetaneyah vaashareelah veney asaf al yad-asaf haniva al-yedey hamelekhe

Hebrew: לִידוּת֑וּן בְּנֵ֣י יְדוּת֡וּן גְּדַלְיָ֡הוּ וּצְרִ֡י וִ֠ישַׁעְיָ֠הוּ חֲשַׁבְיָ֨הוּ וּמַתִּתְיָ֜הוּ שִׁשָּׁ֗ה עַל֩ יְדֵ֨י אֲבִיהֶ֤ם יְדוּתוּן֙ בַּכִּנּ֔וֹר הַנִּבָּ֕א עַל־הֹד֥וֹת וְהַלֵּ֖ל לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Jeduthun—the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, Mattithiah—6, under the charge of their father Jeduthun, who, accompanied on the harp, prophesied, praising and extolling the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: liydutun veney yedutun gedaleyahu utseriy viyshaeyahu chashaveyahu umatiteyahu shishah al yedey aviyhem yedutun vakhinvor haniva al-hodvot vehalel layhovah {s}

Hebrew: לְהֵימָ֑ן בְּנֵ֣י הֵימָ֡ן בֻּקִּיָּ֡הוּ מַתַּנְיָ֡הוּ עֻ֠זִּיאֵ֠ל שְׁבוּאֵ֨ל וִירִימ֜וֹת חֲנַנְיָ֣ה חֲנָ֗נִי אֱלִיאָ֤תָה גִדַּ֙לְתִּי֙ וְרֹמַ֣מְתִּי עֶ֔זֶר יׇשְׁבְּקָ֣שָׁה מַלּ֔וֹתִי הוֹתִ֖יר מַחֲזִיאֹֽת׃
Translated: Heman—the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth;
Transliteration: leheyman veney heyman vukiyahu mataneyahu uziyel shevuel viyriymvot chananeyah chananiy eliyatah gidaletiy veromametiy ezer yׇshevekashah malvotiy hvotiyr machaziyot

Hebrew: כׇּל־אֵ֨לֶּה בָנִ֜ים לְהֵימָ֗ן חֹזֵ֥ה הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ בְּדִבְרֵ֥י הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים לְהָרִ֣ים קָ֑רֶן וַיִּתֵּ֨ן הָאֱלֹהִ֜ים לְהֵימָ֗ן בָּנִ֛ים אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר וּבָנ֥וֹת שָׁלֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated: all these were sons of Heman, the seer of the king, [who uttered] prophecies of God for His greater glory. God gave Heman fourteen sons and three daughters;
Transliteration: khׇl-eleh vaniym leheyman chozeh hamelekhe vediverey haElohim lehariym karen vayiten haElohim leheyman vaniym arevaah ashar uvanvot shalvosh

Hebrew: כׇּל־אֵ֣לֶּה עַל־יְדֵי֩ אֲבִיהֶ֨ם בַּשִּׁ֜יר בֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֗ה בִּמְצִלְתַּ֙יִם֙ נְבָלִ֣ים וְכִנֹּר֔וֹת לַעֲבֹדַ֖ת בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים עַ֚ל יְדֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אָסָ֥ף וִידוּת֖וּן וְהֵימָֽן׃
Translated: all these were under the charge of their father for the singing in the House of the L<small>ORD</small>, to the accompaniment of cymbals, harps, and lyres, for the service of the House of God by order of the king. Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman—
Transliteration: khׇl-eleh al-yedey aviyhem vashiyr veyt yehovah vimetsiletayiim nevaliym vekhinorvot laavodat veyt haElohim al yedey hamelekhe asaf viydutun veheyman

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י מִסְפָּרָם֙ עִם־אֲחֵיהֶ֔ם מְלֻמְּדֵי־שִׁ֖יר לַיהֹוָ֑ה כׇּ֨ל־הַמֵּבִ֔ין מָאתַ֖יִם שְׁמוֹנִ֥ים וּשְׁמוֹנָֽה׃
Translated: their total number with their kinsmen, trained singers of the L<small>ORD</small>—all the masters, 288.
Transliteration: vayehiy misefaram im-acheyhem melumedey-shiyr layhovah khׇl-hameviyn matayiim shemvoniym ushemvonah

Hebrew: וַיַּפִּ֜ילוּ גּוֹרָל֣וֹת מִשְׁמֶ֗רֶת לְעֻמַּת֙ כַּקָּטֹ֣ן כַּגָּד֔וֹל מֵבִ֖ין עִם־תַּלְמִֽיד׃ {פ}
Translated: They cast lots for shifts on the principle of “small and great alike, like master like apprentice.”
Transliteration: vayafiylu gvoralvot mishemeret leumat khakaton khagadvol meviyn im-talemiyd {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֞א הַגּוֹרָ֧ל הָרִאשׁ֛וֹן לְאָסָ֖ף לְיוֹסֵ֑ף {ס} גְּדַלְיָ֙הוּ֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י הֽוּא־וְאֶחָ֥יו וּבָנָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: The first lot fell to Asaph—to Joseph; the second, to Gedaliah, he and his brothers and his sons—12;
Transliteration: vayetse hagvoral harishvon leasaf leyvosef {s} gedaleyahu hasheniy hu-veechayv uvanayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֣י זַכּ֔וּר בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the third, to Zaccur: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: hashelishiy zakhur vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: הָֽרְבִיעִי֙ לַיִּצְרִ֔י בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the fourth, to Izri: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: hareviyiy layitseriy vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: הַחֲמִישִׁ֣י נְתַנְיָ֔הוּ בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the fifth, to Nethaniah: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: hachamiyshiy netaneyahu vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: הַשִּׁשִּׁ֣י בֻקִּיָּ֔הוּ בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the sixth, to Bukkiah: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: hashishiy vukiyahu vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: הַשְּׁבִעִ֣י יְשַׂרְאֵ֔לָה בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the seventh, to Jesarelah: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: hasheviiy yeshareelah vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: הַשְּׁמִינִ֣י יְשַֽׁעְיָ֔הוּ בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the eighth, to Jeshaiah: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: hashemiyniy yeshaeyahu vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: הַתְּשִׁיעִ֣י מַתַּנְיָ֔הוּ בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the ninth, to Mattaniah: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: hateshiyiy mataneyahu vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: הָעֲשִׂירִ֣י שִׁמְעִ֔י בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the tenth, to Shimei: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: haashiyriy shimeiy vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: עַשְׁתֵּי־עָשָׂ֣ר עֲזַרְאֵ֔ל בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the eleventh to Azarel: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: ashetey-ashar azareel vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: הַשְּׁנֵ֤ים עָשָׂר֙ לַֽחֲשַׁבְיָ֔ה בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the twelfth, to Hashabiah: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: hasheneym ashar lachashaveyah vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לִשְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ שֽׁוּבָאֵ֔ל בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the thirteenth, to Shubael: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: lisheloshah ashar shuvael vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לְאַרְבָּעָ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ מַתִּתְיָ֔הוּ בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the fourteenth, to Mattithiah: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: learevaah ashar matiteyahu vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לַחֲמִשָּׁ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ לִירֵמ֔וֹת בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the fifteenth, to Jeremoth: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: lachamishah ashar liyremvot vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לְשִׁשָּׁ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ לַחֲנַנְיָ֔הוּ בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the sixteenth, to Hananiah: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: leshishah ashar lachananeyahu vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לְשִׁבְעָ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ לְיׇשְׁבְּקָ֔שָׁה בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the seventeenth, to Joshbekashah: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: leshiveah ashar leyׇshevekashah vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לִשְׁמוֹנָ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ לַחֲנָ֔נִי בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the eighteenth, to Hanani: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: lishemvonah ashar lachananiy vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לְתִשְׁעָ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ לְמַלּ֔וֹתִי בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the nineteenth, to Mallothi: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: letisheah ashar lemalvotiy vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לְעֶשְׂרִים֙ לֶאֱלִיָּ֔תָה בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the twentieth, to Eliathah: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: leesheriym leeliyatah vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לְאֶחָ֤ד וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ לְהוֹתִ֔יר בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the twenty-first, to Hothir: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: leechad veesheriym lehvotiyr vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לִשְׁנַ֤יִם וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ לְגִדַּ֔לְתִּי בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the twenty-second, to Giddalti: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: lishenayiim veesheriym legidaletiy vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לִשְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ לְמַ֣חֲזִיא֔וֹת בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: the twenty-third, to Mahazioth: his sons and his brothers—12;
Transliteration: lisheloshah veesheriym lemachaziyvot vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {s}

Hebrew: לְאַרְבָּעָ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ לְרוֹמַ֣מְתִּי עָ֔זֶר בָּנָ֥יו וְאֶחָ֖יו שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָֽׂר׃ {פ}
Translated: the twenty-fourth, to Romamti-ezer: his sons and his brothers—12.
Transliteration: learevaah veesheriym lervomametiy azer vanayv veechayv sheneym ashar {f}

Hebrew: לְמַחְלְק֖וֹת לְשֹׁעֲרִ֑ים לַקׇּרְחִ֕ים מְשֶׁלֶמְיָ֥הוּ בֶן־קֹרֵ֖א מִן־בְּנֵ֥י אָסָֽף׃
Translated: The divisions of the gatekeepers: Korahites: Meshelemiah son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
Transliteration: lemachelekvot leshoariym lakׇrechiym meshelemeyahu ven-kore min-veney asaf

Hebrew: וְלִמְשֶׁלֶמְיָ֖הוּ בָּנִ֑ים זְכַרְיָ֤הוּ הַבְּכוֹר֙ יְדִיעֲאֵ֣ל הַשֵּׁנִ֔י זְבַדְיָ֙הוּ֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י יַתְנִיאֵ֖ל הָרְבִיעִֽי׃
Translated: Sons of Meshelemiah: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
Transliteration: velimeshelemeyahu vaniym zekhareyahu havekhvor yediyael hasheniy zevadeyahu hasheliyshiy yateniyel hareviyiy

Hebrew: עֵילָ֤ם הַחֲמִישִׁי֙ יְהוֹחָנָ֣ן הַשִּׁשִּׁ֔י אֶלְיְהוֹעֵינַ֖י הַשְּׁבִיעִֽי׃
Translated: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.
Transliteration: eylam hachamiyshiy yehvochanan hashishiy eleyehvoeynay hasheviyiy

Hebrew: וּלְעֹבֵ֥ד אֱדֹ֖ם בָּנִ֑ים שְׁמַעְיָ֤ה הַבְּכוֹר֙ יְהוֹזָבָ֣ד הַשֵּׁנִ֔י יוֹאָ֤ח הַשְּׁלִשִׁי֙ וְשָׂכָ֣ר הָרְבִיעִ֔י וּנְתַנְאֵ֖ל הַחֲמִישִֽׁי׃
Translated: Sons of Obed-edom: Shemaiah the first-born, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,
Transliteration: uleoved edom vaniym shemaeyah havekhvor yehvozavad hasheniy yvoach hashelishiy veshakhar hareviyiy unetaneel hachamiyshiy

Hebrew: עַמִּיאֵ֤ל הַשִּׁשִּׁי֙ יִשָּׂשכָ֣ר הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י פְּעֻלְּתַ֖י הַשְּׁמִינִ֑י כִּ֥י בֵרְכ֖וֹ אֱלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peullethai the eighth—for God had blessed him.
Transliteration: amiyel hashishiy yishashkhar hasheviyiy feuletay hashemiyniy khiy verekhvo Elohim {s}

Hebrew: וְלִֽשְׁמַעְיָ֤ה בְנוֹ֙ נוֹלַ֣ד בָּנִ֔ים הַמִּמְשָׁלִ֖ים לְבֵ֣ית אֲבִיהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־גִבּ֥וֹרֵי חַ֖יִל הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: To his son Shemaiah were born sons who exercised authority in their clans because they were men of substance.
Transliteration: velishemaeyah venvo nvolad vaniym hamimeshaliym leveyt aviyhem khiy-givvorey chayiil hemah

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י שְׁמַֽעְיָ֗ה עׇ֠תְנִ֠י וּרְפָאֵ֨ל וְעוֹבֵ֧ד אֶלְזָבָ֛ד אֶחָ֖יו בְּנֵי־חָ֑יִל אֱלִיה֖וּ וּסְמַכְיָֽהוּ׃
Translated: The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, Rephael, Obed, Elzabad—his brothers, men of ability, were Elihu and Semachiah.
Transliteration: veney shemaeyah ׇteniy urefael vevoved elezavad echayv veney-chayiil eliyhu usemakheyahu

Hebrew: כׇּל־אֵ֜לֶּה מִבְּנֵ֣י ׀ עֹבֵ֣ד אֱדֹ֗ם הֵ֤מָּה וּבְנֵיהֶם֙ וַאֲחֵיהֶ֔ם אִֽישׁ־חַ֥יִל בַּכֹּ֖חַ לַעֲבֹדָ֑ה שִׁשִּׁ֥ים וּשְׁנַ֖יִם לְעֹבֵ֥ד אֱדֹֽם׃
Translated: All these, sons of Obed-edom; they and their sons and brothers, strong and able men for the service—62 of Obed-edom.
Transliteration: khׇl-eleh miveney oved edom hemah uveneyhem vaacheyhem iysh-chayiil vakhocha laavodah shishiym ushenayiim leoved edom

Hebrew: וְלִמְשֶׁלֶמְיָ֗הוּ בָּנִ֧ים וְאַחִ֛ים בְּנֵי־חָ֖יִל שְׁמוֹנָ֥ה עָשָֽׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, able men—18.
Transliteration: velimeshelemeyahu vaniym veachiym veney-chayiil shemvonah ashar {s}

Hebrew: וּלְחֹסָ֥ה מִן־בְּנֵי־מְרָרִ֖י בָּנִ֑ים שִׁמְרִ֤י הָרֹאשׁ֙ כִּ֣י לֹֽא־הָיָ֣ה בְכ֔וֹר וַיְשִׂימֵ֥הוּ אָבִ֖יהוּ לְרֹֽאשׁ׃
Translated: Hosah of the Merarites had sons: Shimri the chief (he was not the first-born, but his father designated him chief),
Transliteration: ulechosah min-veney-merariy vaniym shimeriy harosh khiy lo-hayah vekhvor vayeshiymehu aviyhu lerosh

Hebrew: חִלְקִיָּ֤הוּ הַשֵּׁנִי֙ טְבַלְיָ֣הוּ הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֔י זְכַרְיָ֖הוּ הָרְבִעִ֑י כׇּל־בָּנִ֧ים וְאַחִ֛ים לְחֹסָ֖ה שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה עָשָֽׂר׃
Translated: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth. All the sons and brothers of Hosah—13.
Transliteration: chilekiyahu hasheniy tevaleyahu hashelishiy zekhareyahu hareviiy khׇl-vaniym veachiym lechosah sheloshah ashar

Hebrew: לְ֠אֵ֠לֶּה מַחְלְק֨וֹת הַשֹּׁעֲרִ֜ים לְרָאשֵׁ֧י הַגְּבָרִ֛ים מִשְׁמָר֖וֹת לְעֻמַּ֣ת אֲחֵיהֶ֑ם לְשָׁרֵ֖ת בְּבֵ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: These are the divisions of the gatekeepers, by their chief men, [who worked in] shifts corresponding to their kinsmen, ministering in the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: leeleh machelekvot hashoariym lerashey hagevariym mishemarvot leumat acheyhem lesharet veveyt yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּפִּ֨ילוּ גוֹרָל֜וֹת כַּקָּטֹ֧ן כַּגָּד֛וֹל לְבֵ֥ית אֲבוֹתָ֖ם לְשַׁ֥עַר וָשָֽׁעַר׃ {פ}
Translated: They cast lots, small and great alike, by clans, for each gate.
Transliteration: vayafiylu gvoralvot khakaton khagadvol leveyt avvotam leshaar vashaar {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֧ל הַגּוֹרָ֛ל מִזְרָ֖חָה לְשֶׁלֶמְיָ֑הוּ וּזְכַרְיָ֨הוּ בְנ֜וֹ יוֹעֵ֣ץ ׀ בְּשֶׂ֗כֶל הִפִּ֙ילוּ֙ גּֽוֹרָל֔וֹת וַיֵּצֵ֥א גוֹרָל֖וֹ צָפֽוֹנָה׃
Translated: The lot for the east [gate] fell to Shelemiah. Then they cast lots [for] Zechariah his son, a prudent counselor, and his lot came out to be the north [gate].
Transliteration: vayifol hagvoral mizerachah leshelemeyahu uzekhareyahu venvo yvoets veshekhel hifiylu gvoralvot vayetse gvoralvo tsafvonah

Hebrew: לְעֹבֵ֥ד אֱדֹ֖ם נֶ֑גְבָּה וּלְבָנָ֖יו בֵּ֥ית הָאֲסֻפִּֽים׃
Translated: For Obed-edom, the south [gate], and for his sons, the vestibule.
Transliteration: leoved edom negevah ulevanayv veyt haasufiym

Hebrew: לְשֻׁפִּ֤ים וּלְחֹסָה֙ לַֽמַּעֲרָ֔ב עִ֚ם שַׁ֣עַר שַׁלֶּ֔כֶת בַּֽמְסִלָּ֖ה הָעוֹלָ֑ה מִשְׁמָ֖ר לְעֻמַּ֥ת מִשְׁמָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: For Shuppim and for Hosah, the west [gate], with the Shallecheth gate on the ascending highway. Watch corresponded to watch:
Transliteration: leshufiym ulechosah lamaarav im shaar shalekhet vamesilah havolah mishemar leumat mishemar {s}

Hebrew: לַמִּזְרָח֮ הַלְוִיִּ֣ם שִׁשָּׁה֒ לַצָּפ֤וֹנָה לַיּוֹם֙ אַרְבָּעָ֔ה לַנֶּ֥גְבָּה לַיּ֖וֹם אַרְבָּעָ֑ה {ס} וְלָאֲסֻפִּ֖ים שְׁנַ֥יִם שְׁנָֽיִם׃
Translated: At the east—six Levites; at the north—four daily; at the south—four daily; at the vestibule—two by two;
Transliteration: lamizerach haleviyim shishah latsafvonah layyvom arevaah lanegevah layyvom arevaah {s} velaasufiym shenayiim shenayiim

Hebrew: לַפַּרְבָּ֖ר לַֽמַּעֲרָ֑ב אַרְבָּעָה֙ לַֽמְסִלָּ֔ה שְׁנַ֖יִם לַפַּרְבָּֽר׃
Translated: at the colonnade on the west—four at the causeway and two at the colonnade.
Transliteration: lafarevar lamaarav arevaah lamesilah shenayiim lafarevar

Hebrew: אֵ֗לֶּה מַחְלְקוֹת֙ הַשֹּׁ֣עֲרִ֔ים לִבְנֵ֥י הַקׇּרְחִ֖י וְלִבְנֵ֥י מְרָרִֽי׃
Translated: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers of the sons of Korah and the sons of Merari.
Transliteration: eleh machelekvot hashoariym liveney hakׇrechiy veliveney merariy

Hebrew: וְֽהַלְוִיִּ֑ם אֲחִיָּ֗ה עַל־אֽוֹצְרוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וּלְאֹצְר֖וֹת הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃ {ס}
Translated: And the Levites: Ahijah over the treasuries of the House of God and the treasuries of the dedicated things.
Transliteration: vehaleviyim achiyah al-votservot veyt haElohim uleotservot hakodashiym {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י לַ֠עְדָּ֠ן בְּנֵ֨י הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֜י לְלַעְדָּ֗ן רָאשֵׁ֧י הָאָב֛וֹת לְלַעְדָּ֥ן הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֖י יְחִיאֵלִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Ladan: the sons of the Gershonites belonging to Ladan; the chiefs of the clans of Ladan, the Gershonite—Jehieli.
Transliteration: veney laedan veney hagereshuniy lelaedan rashey haavvot lelaedan hagereshuniy yechiyeliy {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י יְחִיאֵלִ֑י זֵתָם֙ וְיוֹאֵ֣ל אָחִ֔יו עַל־אֹצְר֖וֹת בֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Jehieli: Zetham and Joel; his brother was over the treasuries of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: veney yechiyeliy zetam veyvoel achiyv al-otservot veyt yehovah {s}

Hebrew: לַֽעַמְרָמִי֙ לַיִּצְהָרִ֔י לַחֶבְרוֹנִ֖י לָעׇזִּיאֵלִֽי׃
Translated: Of the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, the Uzzielites:
Transliteration: laameramiy layitsehariy lachevervoniy laׇziyeliy

Hebrew: וּשְׁבֻאֵל֙ בֶּן־גֵּרְשׁ֣וֹם בֶּן־מֹשֶׁ֔ה נָגִ֖יד עַל־הָאֹצָרֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: Shebuel son of Gershom son of Moses was the chief officer over the treasuries.
Transliteration: ushevuel ven-gereshvom ven-mosheh nagiyd al-haotsarvot {s}

Hebrew: וְאֶחָ֖יו לֶאֱלִיעֶ֑זֶר רְחַבְיָ֨הוּ בְנ֜וֹ וִישַׁעְיָ֤הֽוּ בְנוֹ֙ וְיֹרָ֣ם בְּנ֔וֹ וְזִכְרִ֥י בְנ֖וֹ (ושלמות) [וּשְׁלֹמִ֥ית] בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: And his brothers: Eliezer, his son Rehabiah, his son Jeshaiah, his son Joram, his son Zichri, his son Shelomith—
Transliteration: veechayv leeliyezer rechaveyahu venvo viyshaeyahu venvo veyoram venvo vezikheriy venvo (vshlmvt) [ushelomiyt] venvo

Hebrew: ה֧וּא שְׁלֹמ֣וֹת וְאֶחָ֗יו עַ֣ל כׇּל־אֹצְר֤וֹת הַקֳּדָשִׁים֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִקְדִּ֜ישׁ דָּוִ֣יד הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וְרָאשֵׁ֧י הָאָב֛וֹת לְשָׂרֵֽי־הָאֲלָפִ֥ים וְהַמֵּא֖וֹת וְשָׂרֵ֥י הַצָּבָֽא׃
Translated: that Shelomith and his brothers were over all the treasuries of dedicated things that were dedicated by King David and the chiefs of the clans, and the officers of thousands and hundreds and the other army officers;
Transliteration: hu shelomvot veechayv al khׇl-otservot hakodashiym asher hikediysh daviyd hamelekhe verashey haavvot lesharey-haalafiym vehamevot vesharey hatsava

Hebrew: מִן־הַמִּלְחָמ֥וֹת וּמִן־הַשָּׁלָ֖ל הִקְדִּ֑ישׁוּ לְחַזֵּ֖ק לְבֵ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: they dedicated some of the booty of the wars to maintain the House of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: min-hamilechamvot umin-hashalal hikediyshu lechazek leveyt yehovah

Hebrew: וְכֹ֨ל הַהִקְדִּ֜ישׁ שְׁמוּאֵ֤ל הָרֹאֶה֙ וְשָׁא֣וּל בֶּן־קִ֔ישׁ וְאַבְנֵ֣ר בֶּן־נֵ֔ר וְיוֹאָ֖ב בֶּן־צְרוּיָ֑ה כֹּ֚ל הַמַּקְדִּ֔ישׁ עַ֥ל יַד־שְׁלֹמִ֖ית וְאֶחָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: All that Samuel the seer had dedicated, and Saul son of Kish, and Abner son of Ner, and Joab son of Zeruiah—or [what] any other man had dedicated, was under the charge of Shelomith and his brothers.
Transliteration: vekhol hahikediysh shemuel haroeh veshaul ven-kiysh veavener ven-ner veyvoav ven-tseruyah khol hamakediysh al yad-shelomiyt veechayv {f}

Hebrew: לַיִּצְהָרִ֞י כְּנַנְיָ֣הוּ וּבָנָ֗יו לַמְּלָאכָ֤ה הַחִֽיצוֹנָה֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְשֹׁטְרִ֖ים וּלְשֹׁפְטִֽים׃
Translated: The Izharites: Chenaniah and his sons were over Israel as clerks and magistrates for affairs outside [the sanctuary].
Transliteration: layitsehariy khenaneyahu uvanayv lamelakhah hachiytsvonah al-yisherael leshoteriym uleshofetiym

Hebrew: לַחֶבְרוֹנִ֡י חֲשַׁבְיָ֩הוּ֩ וְאֶחָ֨יו בְּנֵי־חַ֜יִל אֶ֣לֶף וּשְׁבַע־מֵא֗וֹת עַ֚ל פְּקֻדַּ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מֵעֵ֥בֶר לַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן מַעְרָ֑בָה לְכֹל֙ מְלֶ֣אכֶת יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלַעֲבֹדַ֖ת הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The Hebronites: Hashabiah and his brothers, capable men, 1,700, supervising Israel on the west side of the Jordan in all matters of the L<small>ORD</small> and the service of the king.
Transliteration: lachevervoniy chashaveyahu veechayv veney-chayiil elef usheva-mevot al fekudat yisherael meever layareden maeravah lekhol melekhet yehovah velaavodat hamelekhe

Hebrew: לַֽחֶבְרוֹנִי֙ יְרִיָּ֣ה הָרֹ֔אשׁ לַֽחֶבְרוֹנִ֥י לְתֹלְדֹתָ֖יו לְאָב֑וֹת בִּשְׁנַ֨ת הָאַרְבָּעִ֜ים לְמַלְכ֤וּת דָּוִיד֙ נִדְרָ֔שׁוּ וַיִּמָּצֵ֥א בָהֶ֛ם גִּבּ֥וֹרֵי חַ֖יִל בְּיַעְזֵ֥יר גִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: The Hebronites: Jeriah, the chief of the Hebronites—they were investigated in the fortieth year of David’s reign by clans of all their lines, and men of substance were found among them in Jazer-gilead.
Transliteration: lachevervoniy yeriyah harosh lachevervoniy letoledotayv leavvot vishenat haarevaiym lemalekhut daviyd niderashu vayimatse vahem givvorey chayiil veyaezeyr gilead

Hebrew: וְאֶחָ֣יו בְּנֵי־חַ֗יִל אַלְפַּ֛יִם וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת רָאשֵׁ֣י הָאָב֑וֹת וַֽיַּפְקִידֵ֞ם דָּוִ֣יד הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ עַל־הָראוּבֵנִ֤י וְהַגָּדִי֙ וַחֲצִי֙ שֵׁ֣בֶט הַֽמְנַשִּׁ֔י לְכׇל־דְּבַ֥ר הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים וּדְבַ֥ר הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {פ}
Translated: His brothers, able men, 2,700, chiefs of clans—David put them in charge of the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in all matters of God and matters of the king.
Transliteration: veechayv veney-chayiil alefayiim usheva mevot rashey haavvot vayafekiydem daviyd hamelekhe al-haruveniy vehagadiy vachatsiy shevet hamenashiy lekhׇl-devar haElohim udevar hamelekhe {f}

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל ׀ לְֽמִסְפָּרָ֡ם רָאשֵׁ֣י הָאָב֣וֹת וְשָׂרֵ֣י הָאֲלָפִ֣ים ׀ וְהַמֵּא֡וֹת וְשֹׁטְרֵיהֶם֩ הַמְשָׁרְתִ֨ים אֶת־הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ לְכֹ֣ל ׀ דְּבַ֣ר הַֽמַּחְלְק֗וֹת הַבָּאָ֤ה וְהַיֹּצֵאת֙ חֹ֣דֶשׁ בְּחֹ֔דֶשׁ לְכֹ֖ל חׇדְשֵׁ֣י הַשָּׁנָ֑ה הַֽמַּחֲלֹ֙קֶת֙ הָאַחַ֔ת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {פ}
Translated: The number of Israelites—chiefs of clans, officers of thousands and hundreds and their clerks, who served the king in all matters of the divisions, who worked in monthly shifts during all the months of the year—each division, 24,000.
Transliteration: uveney yisherael lemisefaram rashey haavvot vesharey haalafiym vehamevot veshotereyhem hamesharetiym et-hamelekhe lekhol devar hamachelekvot havaah vehayotset chodesh vechodesh lekhol chׇdeshey hashanah hamachaloket haachat esheriym vearevaah alef {f}

Hebrew: עַ֞ל הַמַּחֲלֹ֤קֶת הָרִֽאשׁוֹנָה֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן יָשׇׁבְעָ֖ם בֶּן־זַבְדִּיאֵ֑ל וְעַל֙ מַחֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: Over the first division for the first month—Jashobeam son of Zabdiel; his division had 24,000.
Transliteration: al hamachaloket harishvonah lachodesh harishvon yashׇveam ven-zavediyel veal machaluketvo esheriym vearevaah alef {s}

Hebrew: מִן־בְּנֵי־פֶ֗רֶץ הָרֹ֛אשׁ לְכׇל־שָׂרֵ֥י הַצְּבָא֖וֹת לַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הָרִאשֽׁוֹן׃ {ס}
Translated: Of the sons of Perez, he, the chief of all the officers of the army, [served] for the first month.
Transliteration: min-veney-ferets harosh lekhׇl-sharey hatsevavot lachodesh harishvon {s}

Hebrew: וְעַ֞ל מַחֲלֹ֣קֶת ׀ הַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֗י דּוֹדַ֤י הָֽאֲחוֹחִי֙ וּמַ֣חֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ וּמִקְל֖וֹת הַנָּגִ֑יד וְעַל֙ מַחֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: Over the division of the second month—Dodai the Ahohite; Mikloth was chief officer of his division; his division had 24,000.
Transliteration: veal machaloket hachodesh hasheniy dvoday haachvochiy umachaluketvo umikelvot hanagiyd veal machaluketvo esheriym vearevaah alef {s}

Hebrew: שַׂ֣ר הַצָּבָ֤א הַשְּׁלִישִׁי֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י בְּנָיָ֧הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹיָדָ֛ע הַכֹּהֵ֖ן רֹ֑אשׁ וְעַל֙ מַחֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: The third army officer for the third month—Benaiah son of Jehoiada, the chief priest; his division had 24,000.
Transliteration: shar hatsava hasheliyshiy lachodesh hasheliyshiy venayahu ven-yehvoyada hakhohen rosh veal machaluketvo esheriym vearevaah alef

Hebrew: ה֧וּא בְנָיָ֛הוּ גִּבּ֥וֹר הַשְּׁלֹשִׁ֖ים וְעַל־הַשְּׁלֹשִׁ֑ים וּמַ֣חֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עַמִּיזָבָ֖ד בְּנֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: That was Benaiah, one of the warriors of the thirty and over the thirty; and [over] his division was Ammizabad his son.
Transliteration: hu venayahu givvor hasheloshiym veal-hasheloshiym umachaluketvo amiyzavad venvo {s}

Hebrew: הָרְבִיעִ֞י לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרְבִיעִ֗י עֲשָׂהאֵל֙ אֲחִ֣י יוֹאָ֔ב וּזְבַדְיָ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ אַחֲרָ֑יו וְעַל֙ מַחֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: The fourth, for the fourth month, Asahel brother of Joab, and his son Zebadiah after him; his division had 24,000.
Transliteration: hareviyiy lachodesh hareviyiy ashahel achiy yvoav uzevadeyah venvo acharayv veal machaluketvo esheriym vearevaah alef {s}

Hebrew: הַחֲמִישִׁי֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁ֔י הַשַּׂ֖ר שַׁמְה֣וּת הַיִּזְרָ֑ח וְעַל֙ מַחֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: The fifth, for the fifth month, the officer Shamhut the Izrahite; his division had 24,000.
Transliteration: hachamiyshiy lachodesh hachamiyshiy hashar shamehut hayizerach veal machaluketvo esheriym vearevaah alef {s}

Hebrew: הַשִּׁשִּׁי֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשִּׁשִּׁ֔י עִירָ֥א בֶן־עִקֵּ֖שׁ הַתְּקוֹעִ֑י וְעַל֙ מַחֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: The sixth, for the sixth month, Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite; his division had 24,000.
Transliteration: hashishiy lachodesh hashishiy iyra ven-ikesh hatekvoiy veal machaluketvo esheriym vearevaah alef {s}

Hebrew: הַשְּׁבִיעִי֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י חֶ֥לֶץ הַפְּלוֹנִ֖י מִן־בְּנֵ֣י אֶפְרָ֑יִם וְעַל֙ מַחֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: The seventh, for the seventh month, Helez the Pelonite, of the Ephraimites; his division had 24,000.
Transliteration: hasheviyiy lachodesh hasheviyiy chelets hafelvoniy min-veney eferayiim veal machaluketvo esheriym vearevaah alef {s}

Hebrew: הַשְּׁמִינִי֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁמִינִ֔י סִבְּכַ֥י הַחֻשָׁתִ֖י לַזַּרְחִ֑י וְעַל֙ מַחֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: The eighth, for the eighth month, Sibbecai the Hushathite, of Zerah; his division had 24,000.
Transliteration: hashemiyniy lachodesh hashemiyniy sivekhay hachushatiy lazarechiy veal machaluketvo esheriym vearevaah alef {s}

Hebrew: הַתְּשִׁיעִי֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַתְּשִׁיעִ֔י אֲבִיעֶ֥זֶר הָעַנְּתוֹתִ֖י (לבנימיני) [לַבֵּ֣ן ׀ יְמִינִ֑י] וְעַל֙ מַחֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: The ninth, for the ninth month, Abiezer the Anathothite, of Benjamin; his division had 24,000.
Transliteration: hateshiyiy lachodesh hateshiyiy aviyezer haanetvotiy (lvnymyny) [laven yemiyniy] veal machaluketvo esheriym vearevaah alef {s}

Hebrew: הָעֲשִׂירִי֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָעֲשִׂירִ֔י מַהְרַ֥י הַנְּטוֹפָתִ֖י לַזַּרְחִ֑י וְעַל֙ מַחֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: The tenth, for the tenth month, Mahrai the Netophathite, of Zerah; his division had 24,000.
Transliteration: haashiyriy lachodesh haashiyriy maheray hanetvofatiy lazarechiy veal machaluketvo esheriym vearevaah alef {s}

Hebrew: עַשְׁתֵּֽי־עָשָׂר֙ לְעַשְׁתֵּ֣י עָשָׂ֣ר הַחֹ֔דֶשׁ בְּנָיָ֥ה הַפִּרְעָתוֹנִ֖י מִן־בְּנֵ֣י אֶפְרָ֑יִם וְעַל֙ מַחֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: The eleventh, for the eleventh month, Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the Ephraimites; his division had 24,000.
Transliteration: ashetey-ashar leashetey ashar hachodesh venayah hafireatvoniy min-veney eferayiim veal machaluketvo esheriym vearevaah alef {s}

Hebrew: הַשְּׁנֵ֤ים עָשָׂר֙ לִשְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂ֣ר הַחֹ֔דֶשׁ חֶלְדַּ֥י הַנְּטוֹפָתִ֖י לְעׇתְנִיאֵ֑ל וְעַל֙ מַחֲלֻקְתּ֔וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וְאַרְבָּעָ֖ה אָֽלֶף׃ {פ}
Translated: The twelfth, for the twelfth month, Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel; his division had 24,000.
Transliteration: hasheneym ashar lisheneym ashar hachodesh cheleday hanetvofatiy leׇteniyel veal machaluketvo esheriym vearevaah alef {f}

Hebrew: וְעַל֙ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לָראוּבֵנִ֣י נָגִ֔יד אֱלִיעֶ֖זֶר בֶּן־זִכְרִ֑י {ס} לַשִּׁ֨מְעוֹנִ֔י שְׁפַטְיָ֖הוּ בֶּֽן־מַעֲכָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Over the tribes of Israel: Reuben: the chief officer, Eliezer son of Zichri. Simeon: Shephatiah son of Maaca.
Transliteration: veal shivetey yisherael laruveniy nagiyd eliyezer ven-zikheriy {s} lashimevoniy shefateyahu ven-maakhah {s}

Hebrew: לְלֵוִ֛י חֲשַׁבְיָ֥ה בֶן־קְמוּאֵ֖ל לְאַהֲרֹ֥ן צָדֽוֹק׃ {ס}
Translated: Levi: Hashabiah son of Kemuel. Aaron: Zadok.
Transliteration: leleviy chashaveyah ven-kemuel leaharon tsadvok {s}

Hebrew: לִיהוּדָ֕ה אֱלִיה֖וּ מֵאֲחֵ֣י דָוִ֑יד {ס} לְיִ֨שָּׂשכָ֔ר עׇמְרִ֖י בֶּן־מִיכָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Judah: Elihu, of the brothers of David. Issachar: Omri son of Michael.
Transliteration: liyhudah eliyhu meachey daviyd {s} leyishashkhar ׇmeriy ven-miykhael {s}

Hebrew: לִזְבוּלֻ֕ן יִֽשְׁמַעְיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־עֹבַדְיָ֑הוּ {ס} לְנַ֨פְתָּלִ֔י יְרִימ֖וֹת בֶּן־עַזְרִיאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Zebulun: Ishmaiah son of Obadiah. Naphtali: Jerimoth son of Azriel.
Transliteration: lizevulun yishemaeyahu ven-ovadeyahu {s} lenafetaliy yeriymvot ven-azeriyel {s}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י אֶפְרַ֔יִם הוֹשֵׁ֖עַ בֶּן־עֲזַזְיָ֑הוּ לַֽחֲצִי֙ שֵׁ֣בֶט מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה יוֹאֵ֖ל בֶּן־פְּדָיָֽהוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Ephraimites: Hoshea son of Azaziah. The half-tribe of Manasseh: Joel son of Pedaiah.
Transliteration: liveney eferayiim hvoshea ven-azazeyahu lachatsiy shevet menasheh yvoel ven-fedayahu {s}

Hebrew: לַֽחֲצִ֤י הַֽמְנַשֶּׁה֙ גִּלְעָ֔דָה יִדּ֖וֹ בֶּן־זְכַרְיָ֑הוּ {ס} לְבִ֨נְיָמִ֔ן יַעֲשִׂיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־אַבְנֵֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: Half Manasseh in Gilead: Iddo son of Zechariah. Benjamin: Jaasiel son of Abner.
Transliteration: lachatsiy hamenasheh gileadah yidvo ven-zekhareyahu {s} levineyamin yaashiyel ven-avener {s}

Hebrew: לְדָ֕ן עֲזַרְאֵ֖ל בֶּן־יְרֹחָ֑ם אֵ֕לֶּה שָׂרֵ֖י שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Dan: Azarel son of Jeroham. These were the officers of the tribes of Israel.
Transliteration: ledan azareel ven-yerocham eleh sharey shivetey yisherael

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־נָשָׂ֤א דָוִיד֙ מִסְפָּרָ֔ם לְמִבֶּ֛ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וּלְמָ֑טָּה כִּ֚י אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה לְהַרְבּ֥וֹת אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כְּכוֹכְבֵ֥י הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
Translated: David did not take a census of those under twenty years of age, for the L<small>ORD</small> had promised to make Israel as numerous as the stars of heaven.
Transliteration: velo-nasha daviyd misefaram lemiven esheriym shanah ulematah khiy amar yehovah leharevvot et-yisherael khekhvokhevey hashamayiim

Hebrew: יוֹאָ֨ב בֶּן־צְרוּיָ֜ה הֵחֵ֤ל לִמְנוֹת֙ וְלֹ֣א כִלָּ֔ה וַיְהִ֥י בָזֹ֛את קֶ֖צֶף עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹ֤א עָלָה֙ הַמִּסְפָּ֔ר בְּמִסְפַּ֥ר דִּבְרֵֽי־הַיָּמִ֖ים לַמֶּ֥לֶךְ דָּוִֽיד׃ {ס}
Translated: Joab son of Zeruiah did begin to count them, but he did not finish; wrath struck Israel on account of this, and the census was not entered into the account of the chronicles of King David.
Transliteration: yvoav ven-tseruyah hechel limenvot velo khilah vayehiy vazot ketsef al-yisherael velo alah hamisefar vemisefar diverey-hayamiym lamelekhe daviyd {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל֙ אֹצְר֣וֹת הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ עַזְמָ֖וֶת בֶּן־עֲדִיאֵ֑ל {ס} וְעַ֣ל הָאֹצָר֡וֹת בַּשָּׂדֶ֞ה בֶּֽעָרִ֤ים וּבַכְּפָרִים֙ וּבַמִּגְדָּל֔וֹת יְהוֹנָתָ֖ן בֶּן־עֻזִּיָּֽהוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Over the royal treasuries: Azmaveth son of Adiel. Over the treasuries in the country—in the towns, the hamlets, and the citadels: Jonathan son of Uzziah.
Transliteration: veal otservot hamelekhe azemavet ven-adiyel {s} veal haotsarvot vashadeh veariym uvakhefariym uvamigedalvot yehvonatan ven-uziyahu {s}

Hebrew: וְעַ֗ל עֹשֵׂי֙ מְלֶ֣אכֶת הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה לַעֲבֹדַ֖ת הָאֲדָמָ֑ה עֶזְרִ֖י בֶּן־כְּלֽוּב׃ {ס}
Translated: Over the field laborers in agricultural work: Ezri son of Chelub.
Transliteration: veal oshey melekhet hashadeh laavodat haadamah ezeriy ven-kheluv {s}

Hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־הַכְּרָמִ֔ים שִׁמְעִ֖י הָרָמָתִ֑י {ס} וְעַ֤ל שֶׁבַּכְּרָמִים֙ לְאֹצְר֣וֹת הַיַּ֔יִן זַבְדִּ֖י הַשִּׁפְמִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Over the vineyards: Shimei the Ramathite. And over the produce in the vineyards for wine cellars: Zabdi the Shiphmite.
Transliteration: veal-hakheramiym shimeiy haramatiy {s} veal shevakheramiym leotservot hayayiin zavediy hashifemiy {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־הַזֵּיתִ֤ים וְהַשִּׁקְמִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשְּׁפֵלָ֔ה בַּ֥עַל חָנָ֖ן הַגְּדֵרִ֑י {ס} וְעַל־אֹצְר֥וֹת הַשֶּׁ֖מֶן יוֹעָֽשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: Over the olive trees and the sycamores in the Shephelah: Baal-hanan the Gederite. Over the oil-stores: Joash.
Transliteration: veal-hazeytiym vehashikemiym asher vashefelah vaal chanan hagederiy {s} veal-otservot hashemen yvoash {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־הַבָּקָר֙ הָרֹעִ֣ים בַּשָּׁר֔וֹן (שטרי) [שִׁרְטַ֖י] הַשָּׁרוֹנִ֑י {ס} וְעַל־הַבָּקָר֙ בָּעֲמָקִ֔ים שָׁפָ֖ט בֶּן־עַדְלָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Over the cattle pasturing in Sharon: Shirtai the Sharonite. And over the cattle in the valleys: Shaphat son of Adlai.
Transliteration: veal-havakar haroiym vasharvon (shtry) [shiretay] hasharvoniy {s} veal-havakar vaamakiym shafat ven-adelay {s}

Hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־הַגְּמַלִּ֔ים אוֹבִ֖יל הַיִּשְׁמְעֵלִ֑י {ס} וְעַל־הָ֣אֲתֹנ֔וֹת יֶחְדְּיָ֖הוּ הַמֵּרֹנֹתִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Over the camels: Obil the Ishmaelite. And over the she-asses: Jehdeiah the Meronothite.
Transliteration: veal-hagemaliym voviyl hayishemeeliy {s} veal-haatonvot yechedeyahu hameronotiy {s}

Hebrew: וְעַל־הַצֹּ֖אן יָזִ֣יז הַהַגְרִ֑י כׇּל־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ שָׂרֵ֣י הָרְכ֔וּשׁ אֲשֶׁ֖ר לַמֶּ֥לֶךְ דָּוִֽיד׃ {ס}
Translated: Over the flocks: Jaziz the Hagrite. All these were stewards of the property of King David.
Transliteration: veal-hatson yaziyz hahageriy khׇl-eleh sharey harekhush asher lamelekhe daviyd {s}

Hebrew: וִיהוֹנָתָ֤ן דּוֹד־דָּוִיד֙ יוֹעֵ֔ץ אִישׁ־מֵבִ֥ין וְסוֹפֵ֖ר ה֑וּא וִיחִיאֵ֥ל בֶּן־חַכְמוֹנִ֖י עִם־בְּנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Jonathan, David’s uncle, was a counselor, a master, and a scribe: Jehiel son of Hachmoni was with the king’s sons.
Transliteration: viyhvonatan dvod-daviyd yvoets iysh-meviyn vesvofer hu viychiyel ven-chakhemvoniy im-veney hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַאֲחִיתֹ֖פֶל יוֹעֵ֣ץ לַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְחוּשַׁ֥י הָאַרְכִּ֖י רֵ֥עַ הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Ahitophel was a counselor to the king. Hushai the Archite was the king’s friend.
Transliteration: vaachiytofel yvoets lamelekhe vechushay haarekhiy rea hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵ֣י אֲחִיתֹ֗פֶל יְהוֹיָדָ֤ע בֶּן־בְּנָיָ֙הוּ֙ וְאֶבְיָתָ֔ר וְשַׂר־צָבָ֥א לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ יוֹאָֽב׃ {פ}
Translated: After Ahitophel were Jehoiada son of Benaiah and Abiathar. The commander of the king’s army was Joab.
Transliteration: veacharey achiytofel yehvoyada ven-venayahu veeveyatar veshar-tsava lamelekhe yvoav {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּקְהֵ֣ל דָּוִ֣יד אֶת־כׇּל־שָׂרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל שָׂרֵ֣י הַשְּׁבָטִ֣ים וְשָׂרֵ֣י הַמַּחְלְק֣וֹת הַמְשָׁרְתִ֪ים אֶת־הַמֶּ֟לֶךְ וְשָׂרֵ֣י הָאֲלָפִ֣ים וְשָׂרֵ֣י הַמֵּא֡וֹת וְשָׂרֵ֣י כׇל־רְכוּשׁ־וּמִקְנֶה֩ <small>׀</small> לַמֶּ֨לֶךְ וּלְבָנָ֜יו עִם־הַסָּרִיסִ֧ים וְהַגִּבּוֹרִ֛ים וּֽלְכׇל־גִּבּ֥וֹר חָ֖יִל אֶל־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: David assembled all the officers of Israel—the tribal officers, the divisional officers who served the king, the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds, and the stewards of all the property and cattle of the king and his sons, with the eunuchs and the warriors, all the men of substance—to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayakehel daviyd et-khׇl-sharey yisherael sharey hashevatiym vesharey hamachelekvot hamesharetiym et-hamelekhe vesharey haalafiym vesharey hamevot vesharey khׇl-rekhush-umikeneh <small></small> lamelekhe ulevanayv im-hasariysiym vehagivvoriym ulekhׇl-givvor chayiil el-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קׇם דָּוִ֤יד הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ עַל־רַגְלָ֔יו וַיֹּ֕אמֶר שְׁמָע֖וּנִי אַחַ֣י וְעַמִּ֑י אֲנִ֣י עִם־לְבָבִ֡י לִבְנוֹת֩ בֵּ֨ית מְנוּחָ֜ה לַאֲר֣וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֗ה וְלַֽהֲדֹם֙ רַגְלֵ֣י אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ וַהֲכִינ֖וֹתִי לִבְנֽוֹת׃
Translated: King David rose to his feet and said, “Hear me, my brothers, my people! I wanted to build a resting-place for the Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small>, for the footstool of our God, and I laid aside material for building.
Transliteration: vayakׇm daviyd hamelekhe al-ragelayv vayomer shemauniy achay veamiy aniy im-levaviy livenvot veyt menuchah laarvon veriyt-yehovah velahadom rageley eloheynu vahakhiynvotiy livenvot

Hebrew: וְהָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ אָ֣מַר לִ֔י לֹא־תִבְנֶ֥ה בַ֖יִת לִשְׁמִ֑י כִּ֣י אִ֧ישׁ מִלְחָמ֛וֹת אַ֖תָּה וְדָמִ֥ים שָׁפָֽכְתָּ׃
Translated: But God said to me,‘You will not build a house for My name, for you are a man of battles and have shed blood.’
Transliteration: vehaElohim amar liy lo-tiveneh vayiit lishemiy khiy iysh milechamvot atah vedamiym shafakheta

Hebrew: וַיִּבְחַ֡ר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵי֩ יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל בִּ֜י מִכֹּ֣ל בֵּית־אָבִ֗י לִהְי֨וֹת לְמֶ֤לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לְעוֹלָ֔ם כִּ֤י בִֽיהוּדָה֙ בָּחַ֣ר לְנָגִ֔יד וּבְבֵ֥ית יְהוּדָ֖ה בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑י וּבִבְנֵ֣י אָבִ֔י בִּ֣י רָצָ֔ה לְהַמְלִ֖יךְ עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> God of Israel chose me of all my father’s house to be king over Israel forever. For He chose Judah to be ruler, and of the family of Judah, my father’s house; and of my father’s sons, He preferred to make me king over all Israel;
Transliteration: vayivechar yehovah elohey yisherael viy mikhol veyt-aviy liheyvot lemelekhe al-yisherael levolam khiy viyhudah vachar lenagiyd uveveyt yehudah veyt aviy uviveney aviy viy ratsah lehameliykhe al-khׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: וּמִ֨כׇּל־בָּנַ֔י כִּ֚י רַבִּ֣ים בָּנִ֔ים נָ֥תַן לִ֖י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּבְחַר֙ בִּשְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בְנִ֔י לָשֶׁ֗בֶת עַל־כִּסֵּ֛א מַלְכ֥וּת יְהֹוָ֖ה עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and of all my sons—for many are the sons the L<small>ORD</small> gave me—He chose my son Solomon to sit on the throne of the kingdom of the L<small>ORD</small> over Israel.
Transliteration: umikhׇl-vanay khiy raviym vaniym natan liy yehovah vayivechar vishelomoh veniy lashevet al-khise malekhut yehovah al-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לִ֔י שְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בִנְךָ֔ הוּא־יִבְנֶ֥ה בֵיתִ֖י וַחֲצֵרוֹתָ֑י כִּֽי־בָחַ֨רְתִּי ב֥וֹ לִי֙ לְבֵ֔ן וַאֲנִ֖י אֶהְיֶה־לּ֥וֹ לְאָֽב׃
Translated: He said to me,‘It will be your son Solomon who will build My House and My courts, for I have chosen him to be a son to Me, and I will be a father to him.
Transliteration: vayomer liy shelomoh vinekha hu-yiveneh veytiy vachatservotay khiy-vacharetiy vvo liy leven vaaniy eheyeh-lvo leav

Hebrew: וַהֲכִינוֹתִ֥י אֶת־מַלְכוּת֖וֹ עַד־לְעוֹלָ֑ם אִם־יֶחֱזַ֗ק לַעֲשׂ֛וֹת מִצְוֺתַ֥י וּמִשְׁפָּטַ֖י כַּיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: I will establish his kingdom forever, if he keeps firmly to the observance of My commandments and rules as he does now.’
Transliteration: vahakhiynvotiy et-malekhutvo ad-levolam im-yechezak laashvot mitsevotay umishefatay khayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְ֠עַתָּ֠ה לְעֵינֵ֨י כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל קְהַל־יְהֹוָה֙ וּבְאׇזְנֵ֣י אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ שִׁמְר֣וּ וְדִרְשׁ֔וּ כׇּל־מִצְוֺ֖ת יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם לְמַ֤עַן תִּֽירְשׁוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַטּוֹבָ֔ה וְהִנְחַלְתֶּ֛ם לִבְנֵיכֶ֥ם אַחֲרֵיכֶ֖ם עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: And now, in the sight of all Israel, the congregation of the L<small>ORD</small>, and in the hearing of our God, [I say:] Observe and apply yourselves to all the commandments of the L<small>ORD</small> your God in order that you may possess this good land and bequeath it to your children after you forever.
Transliteration: veatah leeyney khׇl-yisherael kehal-yehovah uveׇzeney eloheynu shimeru vedireshu khׇl-mitsevot yehovah eloheykhem lemaan tiyreshu et-haarets hatvovah vehinechaletem liveneykhem achareykhem ad-volam

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה שְׁלֹמֹֽה־בְנִ֡י דַּע֩ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֨י אָבִ֜יךָ וְעׇבְדֵ֗הוּ בְּלֵ֤ב שָׁלֵם֙ וּבְנֶ֣פֶשׁ חֲפֵצָ֔ה כִּ֤י כׇל־לְבָבוֹת֙ דּוֹרֵ֣שׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה וְכׇל־יֵ֥צֶר מַחֲשָׁב֖וֹת מֵבִ֑ין אִֽם־תִּדְרְשֶׁ֙נּוּ֙ יִמָּ֣צֵא לָ֔ךְ וְאִם־תַּעַזְבֶ֖נּוּ יַזְנִיחֲךָ֥ לָעַֽד׃
Translated: “And you, my son Solomon, know the God of your father, and serve Him with single mind and fervent heart, for the L<small>ORD</small> searches all minds and discerns the design of every thought; if you seek Him He will be available to you, but if you forsake Him He will abandon you forever.
Transliteration: veatah shelomoh-veniy da et-elohey aviykha veׇvedehu velev shalem uvenefesh chafetsah khiy khׇl-levavvot dvoresh yehovah vekhׇl-eitser machashavvot meviyn im-tidereshenu yimatse lakhe veim-taazevenu yazeniychakha laad

Hebrew: רְאֵ֣ה ׀ עַתָּ֗ה כִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֛ה בָּ֧חַר בְּךָ֛ לִבְנֽוֹת־בַּ֥יִת לַמִּקְדָּ֖שׁ חֲזַ֥ק וַעֲשֵֽׂה׃ {פ}
Translated: See then, the L<small>ORD</small> chose you to build a house as the sanctuary; be strong and do it.”
Transliteration: reeh atah khiy-yehovah vachar vekha livenvot-vayiit lamikedash chazak vaasheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן דָּוִ֣יד לִשְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בְנ֡וֹ אֶת־תַּבְנִ֣ית הָאוּלָם֩ וְֽאֶת־בָּ֨תָּ֜יו וְגַנְזַכָּ֧יו וַעֲלִיֹּתָ֛יו וַחֲדָרָ֥יו הַפְּנִימִ֖ים וּבֵ֥ית הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
Translated: David gave his son Solomon the plan of the porch and its houses, its storerooms and its upper chambers and inner chambers; and of the place of the Ark-cover;
Transliteration: vayiten daviyd lishelomoh venvo et-taveniyt haulam veet-vatayv veganezakhayv vaaliyotayv vachadarayv hafeniymiym uveyt hakhaforet

Hebrew: וְתַבְנִ֗ית כֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָיָ֤ה בָר֙וּחַ֙ עִמּ֔וֹ לְחַצְר֧וֹת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֛ה וּלְכׇל־הַלְּשָׁכ֖וֹת סָבִ֑יב לְאֹֽצְרוֹת֙ בֵּ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וּלְאֹצְר֖וֹת הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: and the plan of all that he had by the spirit: of the courts of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and all its surrounding chambers, and of the treasuries of the House of God and of the treasuries of the holy things;
Transliteration: vetaveniyt khol asher hayah varucha imvo lechatservot veyt-yehovah ulekhׇl-haleshakhvot saviyv leotservot veyt haElohim uleotservot hakodashiym

Hebrew: וּֽלְמַחְלְקוֹת֙ הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֔ם וּֽלְכׇל־מְלֶ֖אכֶת עֲבוֹדַ֣ת בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֑ה וּֽלְכׇל־כְּלֵ֖י עֲבוֹדַ֥ת בֵּית־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: the divisions of priests and Levites for all the work of the service of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> and all the vessels of the service of the House of the L<small>ORD</small>;
Transliteration: ulemachelekvot hakhohaniym vehaleviyim ulekhׇl-melekhet avvodat veyt-yehovah ulekhׇl-kheley avvodat veyt-yehovah

Hebrew: לַזָּהָ֤ב בַּמִּשְׁקָל֙ לַזָּהָ֔ב לְכׇל־כְּלֵ֖י עֲבוֹדָ֣ה וַעֲבוֹדָ֑ה לְכֹ֨ל כְּלֵ֤י הַכֶּ֙סֶף֙ בְּמִשְׁקָ֔ל לְכׇל־כְּלֵ֖י עֲבוֹדָ֥ה וַעֲבוֹדָֽה׃
Translated: and gold, the weight of gold for vessels of every sort of use; silver for all the vessels of silver by weight, for all the vessels of every kind of service;
Transliteration: lazahav vamishekal lazahav lekhׇl-kheley avvodah vaavvodah lekhol kheley hakhesef vemishekal lekhׇl-kheley avvodah vaavvodah

Hebrew: וּמִשְׁקָ֞ל לִמְנֹר֣וֹת הַזָּהָ֗ב וְנֵרֹֽתֵיהֶם֙ זָהָ֔ב בְּמִשְׁקַל־מְנוֹרָ֥ה וּמְנוֹרָ֖ה וְנֵרֹתֶ֑יהָ וְלִמְנֹר֨וֹת הַכֶּ֤סֶף בְּמִשְׁקָל֙ לִמְנוֹרָ֣ה וְנֵרֹתֶ֔יהָ כַּעֲבוֹדַ֖ת מְנוֹרָ֥ה וּמְנוֹרָֽה׃
Translated: the weight of the gold lampstands and their gold lamps, and the weight of the silver lampstands, each lampstand and its silver lamps, according to the use of every lampstand;
Transliteration: umishekal limenorvot hazahav veneroteyhem zahav vemishekal-menvorah umenvorah veneroteyha velimenorvot hakhesef vemishekal limenvorah veneroteyha khaavvodat menvorah umenvorah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַזָּהָ֥ב מִשְׁקָ֛ל לְשֻׁלְחֲנ֥וֹת הַֽמַּעֲרֶ֖כֶת לְשֻׁלְחַ֣ן וְשֻׁלְחָ֑ן וְכֶ֖סֶף לְשֻׁלְחֲנ֥וֹת הַכָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: and the weight of gold for the tables of the rows of bread, for each table, and of silver for the silver tables;
Transliteration: veet-hazahav mishekal leshulechanvot hamaarekhet leshulechan veshulechan vekhesef leshulechanvot hakhasef

Hebrew: וְהַמִּזְלָג֧וֹת וְהַמִּזְרָק֛וֹת וְהַקְּשָׂוֺ֖ת זָהָ֣ב טָה֑וֹר וְלִכְפוֹרֵ֨י הַזָּהָ֤ב בְּמִשְׁקָל֙ לִכְפ֣וֹר וּכְפ֔וֹר וְלִכְפוֹרֵ֥י הַכֶּ֛סֶף בְּמִשְׁקָ֖ל לִכְפ֥וֹר וּכְפֽוֹר׃
Translated: and of the pure gold for the forks and the basins and the jars; and the weight of the gold bowls, every bowl; and the weight of the silver bowls, each and every bowl;
Transliteration: vehamizelagvot vehamizerakvot vehakeshavot zahav tahvor velikhefvorey hazahav vemishekal likhefvor ukhefvor velikhefvorey hakhesef vemishekal likhefvor ukhefvor

Hebrew: וּלְמִזְבַּ֧ח הַקְּטֹ֛רֶת זָהָ֥ב מְזֻקָּ֖ק בַּמִּשְׁקָ֑ל וּלְתַבְנִ֣ית הַמֶּרְכָּבָ֗ה הַכְּרוּבִ֤ים זָהָב֙ לְפֹ֣רְשִׂ֔ים וְסֹכְכִ֖ים עַל־אֲר֥וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: the weight of refined gold for the incense altar and the gold for the figure of the chariot—the cherubim—those with outspread wings screening the Ark of the Covenant of the L<small>ORD</small>.
Transliteration: ulemizevach haketoret zahav mezukak vamishekal uletaveniyt hamerekhavah hakheruviym zahav leforeshiym vesokhekhiym al-arvon veriyt-yehovah

Hebrew: הַכֹּ֥ל בִּכְתָ֛ב מִיַּ֥ד יְהֹוָ֖ה עָלַ֣י הִשְׂכִּ֑יל כֹּ֖ל מַלְאֲכ֥וֹת הַתַּבְנִֽית׃ {פ}
Translated: “All this that the L<small>ORD</small> made me understand by His hand on me, I give you in writing—the plan of all the works.”
Transliteration: hakhol vikhetav miyad yehovah alay hishekhiyl khol maleakhvot hataveniyt {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜יד לִשְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בְנ֗וֹ חֲזַ֤ק וֶֽאֱמַץ֙ וַעֲשֵׂ֔ה אַל־תִּירָ֖א וְאַל־תֵּחָ֑ת כִּי֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהִ֤ים אֱלֹהַי֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ לֹ֤א יַרְפְּךָ֙ וְלֹ֣א יַעַזְבֶ֔ךָּ עַד־לִכְל֕וֹת כׇּל־מְלֶ֖אכֶת עֲבוֹדַ֥ת בֵּית־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: David said to his son Solomon, “Be strong and of good courage and do it; do not be afraid or dismayed, for the L<small>ORD</small> God my God is with you; He will not fail you or forsake you till all the work on the House of the L<small>ORD</small> is done.
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd lishelomoh venvo chazak veemats vaasheh al-tiyra veal-techat khiy yehovah Elohim elohay imakhe lo yarefekha velo yaazevekha ad-likhelvot khׇl-melekhet avvodat veyt-yehovah

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֗ה מַחְלְקוֹת֙ הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים וְהַלְוִיִּ֔ם לְכׇל־עֲבוֹדַ֖ת בֵּ֣ית הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְעִמְּךָ֨ בְכׇל־מְלָאכָ֜ה לְכׇל־נָדִ֤יב בַּֽחׇכְמָה֙ לְכׇל־עֲבוֹדָ֔ה וְהַשָּׂרִ֥ים וְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם לְכׇל־דְּבָרֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Here are the divisions of the priests and Levites for all kinds of service of the House of God, and with you in all the work are willing men, skilled in all sorts of tasks; also the officers and all the people are at your command.”
Transliteration: vehineh machelekvot hakhohaniym vehaleviyim lekhׇl-avvodat veyt haElohimm veimekha vekhׇl-melakhah lekhׇl-nadiyv vachׇkhemah lekhׇl-avvodah vehashariym vekhׇl-haam lekhׇl-devareykha {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֤יד הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ לְכׇל־הַקָּהָ֔ל שְׁלֹמֹ֨ה בְנִ֥י אֶחָ֛ד בָּחַר־בּ֥וֹ אֱלֹהִ֖ים נַ֣עַר וָרָ֑ךְ וְהַמְּלָאכָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֔ה כִּ֣י לֹ֤א לְאָדָם֙ הַבִּירָ֔ה כִּ֖י לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: King David said to the entire assemblage, “God has chosen my son Solomon alone, an untried lad, although the work to be done is vast—for the temple is not for a man but for the L<small>ORD</small> God.
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd hamelekhe lekhׇl-hakahal shelomoh veniy echad vachar-vvo Elohim naar varakhe vehamelakhah gedvolah khiy lo leadam haviyrah khiy layhovah Elohim

Hebrew: וּֽכְכׇל־כֹּחִ֞י הֲכִינ֣וֹתִי לְבֵית־אֱלֹהַ֗י הַזָּהָ֣ב <small>׀</small> לַ֠זָּהָ֠ב וְהַכֶּ֨סֶף לַכֶּ֜סֶף וְהַנְּחֹ֣שֶׁת לַנְּחֹ֗שֶׁת הַבַּרְזֶל֙ לַבַּרְזֶ֔ל וְהָעֵצִ֖ים לָעֵצִ֑ים אַבְנֵי־שֹׁ֨הַם וּמִלּוּאִ֜ים אַבְנֵי־פ֣וּךְ וְרִקְמָ֗ה וְכֹ֨ל אֶ֧בֶן יְקָרָ֛ה וְאַבְנֵי־שַׁ֖יִשׁ לָרֹֽב׃
Translated: I have spared no effort to lay up for the House of my God gold for golden objects, silver for silver, copper for copper, iron for iron, wood for wooden, onyx-stone and inlay-stone, stone of antimony and variegated colors—every kind of precious stone and much marble.
Transliteration: ukhekhׇl-khochiy hakhiynvotiy leveyt-elohay hazahav <small></small> lazahav vehakhesef lakhesef vehanechoshet lanechoshet havarezel lavarezel vehaetsiym laetsiym aveney-shoham umiluiym aveney-fukhe verikemah vekhol even yekarah veaveney-shayiish larov

Hebrew: וְע֗וֹד בִּרְצוֹתִי֙ בְּבֵ֣ית אֱלֹהַ֔י יֶשׁ־לִ֥י סְגֻלָּ֖ה זָהָ֣ב וָכָ֑סֶף נָתַ֤תִּי לְבֵית־אֱלֹהַי֙ לְמַ֔עְלָה מִכׇּל־הֲכִינ֖וֹתִי לְבֵ֥ית הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: Besides, out of my solicitude for the House of my God, I gave over my private hoard of gold and silver to the House of my God—in addition to all that I laid aside for the holy House:
Transliteration: vevod viretsvotiy veveyt elohay yesh-liy segulah zahav vakhasef natatiy leveyt-elohay lemaelah mikhׇl-hakhiynvotiy leveyt hakodesh

Hebrew: שְׁלֹ֧שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֛ים כִּכְּרֵ֥י זָהָ֖ב מִזְּהַ֣ב אוֹפִ֑יר וְשִׁבְעַ֨ת אֲלָפִ֤ים כִּכַּר־כֶּ֙סֶף֙ מְזֻקָּ֔ק לָט֖וּחַ קִיר֥וֹת הַבָּתִּֽים׃
Translated: 3,000 gold talents of Ophir gold, and 7,000 talents of refined silver for covering the walls of the houses
Transliteration: sheloshet alafiym khikherey zahav mizehav vofiyr veshiveat alafiym khikhar-khesef mezukak latucha kiyrvot havatiym

Hebrew: לַזָּהָ֤ב לַזָּהָב֙ וְלַכֶּ֣סֶף לַכֶּ֔סֶף וּלְכׇל־מְלָאכָ֖ה בְּיַ֣ד חָרָשִׁ֑ים וּמִ֣י מִתְנַדֵּ֔ב לְמַלֹּ֥אות יָד֛וֹ הַיּ֖וֹם לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: (gold for golden objects, silver for silver for all the work)—into the hands of craftsmen. Now who is going to make a freewill offering and devote himself today to the L<small>ORD</small>?”
Transliteration: lazahav lazahav velakhesef lakhesef ulekhׇl-melakhah veyad charashiym umiy mitenadev lemalovt yadvo hayyvom layhovah

Hebrew: וַיִּֽתְנַדְּבוּ֩ שָׂרֵ֨י הָאָב֜וֹת וְשָׂרֵ֣י ׀ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְשָׂרֵ֤י הָאֲלָפִים֙ וְהַמֵּא֔וֹת וּלְשָׂרֵ֖י מְלֶ֥אכֶת הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The officers of the clans and the officers of the tribes of Israel and the captains of thousands and hundreds and the supervisors of the king’s work made freewill offerings,
Transliteration: vayitenadevu sharey haavvot vesharey shivetey yisherael vesharey haalafiym vehamevot ulesharey melekhet hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנ֞וּ לַעֲבוֹדַ֣ת בֵּית־הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים זָהָ֞ב כִּכָּרִ֣ים חֲמֵשֶׁת־אֲלָפִים֮ וַאֲדַרְכֹנִ֣ים רִבּוֹ֒ וְכֶ֗סֶף כִּכָּרִים֙ עֲשֶׂ֣רֶת אֲלָפִ֔ים וּנְחֹ֕שֶׁת רִבּ֛וֹ וּשְׁמוֹנַ֥ת אֲלָפִ֖ים כִּכָּרִ֑ים וּבַרְזֶ֖ל מֵאָה־אֶ֥לֶף כִּכָּרִֽים׃
Translated: giving for the work of the House of God: 5,000 talents of gold, 10,000 darics, 10,000 talents of silver, 18,000 talents of copper, 100,000 talents of iron.
Transliteration: vayitenu laavvodat veyt-haElohim zahav khikhariym chameshet-alafiym vaadarekhoniym rivvo vekhesef khikhariym asheret alafiym unechoshet rivvo ushemvonat alafiym khikhariym uvarezel meah-elef khikhariym

Hebrew: וְהַנִּמְצָ֤א אִתּוֹ֙ אֲבָנִ֔ים נָתְנ֖וּ לְאוֹצַ֣ר בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֑ה עַ֥ל יַד־יְחִיאֵ֖ל הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּֽי׃
Translated: Whoever had stones in his possession gave them to the treasury of the House of the L<small>ORD</small> in the charge of Jehiel the Gershonite.
Transliteration: vehanimetsa itvo avaniym natenu levotsar veyt-yehovah al yad-yechiyel hagereshuniy

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂמְח֤וּ הָעָם֙ עַל־הִֽתְנַדְּבָ֔ם כִּ֚י בְּלֵ֣ב שָׁלֵ֔ם הִֽתְנַדְּב֖וּ לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וְגַם֙ דָּוִ֣יד הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ שָׂמַ֖ח שִׂמְחָ֥ה גְדוֹלָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The people rejoiced over the freewill offerings they made, for with a whole heart they made freewill offerings to the L<small>ORD</small>; King David also rejoiced very much.
Transliteration: vayishemechu haam al-hitenadevam khiy velev shalem hitenadevu layhovah vegam daviyd hamelekhe shamach shimechah gedvolah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְבָ֤רֶךְ דָּוִיד֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה לְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־הַקָּהָ֑ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֗יד בָּר֨וּךְ אַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵי֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל אָבִ֔ינוּ מֵעוֹלָ֖ם וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: David blessed the L<small>ORD</small> in front of all the assemblage; David said, “Blessed are You, L<small>ORD</small>, God of Israel our father, from eternity to eternity.
Transliteration: vayevarekhe daviyd et-yehovah leeyney khׇl-hakahal vayomer daviyd varukhe atah yehovah elohey yisherael aviynu mevolam vead-volam

Hebrew: לְךָ֣ יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה הַגְּדֻלָּ֨ה וְהַגְּבוּרָ֤ה וְהַתִּפְאֶ֙רֶת֙ וְהַנֵּ֣צַח וְהַה֔וֹד כִּי־כֹ֖ל בַּשָּׁמַ֣יִם וּבָאָ֑רֶץ לְךָ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ הַמַּמְלָכָ֔ה וְהַמִּתְנַשֵּׂ֖א לְכֹ֥ל <small>׀</small> לְרֹֽאשׁ׃
Translated: Yours, L<small>ORD</small>, are greatness, might, splendor, triumph, and majesty—yes, all that is in heaven and on earth; to You, L<small>ORD</small>, belong kingship and preeminence above all.
Transliteration: lekha yehovah hagedulah vehagevurah vehatifeeret vehanetsach vehahvod khiy-khol vashamayiim uvaarets lekha yehovah hamamelakhah vehamitenashe lekhol <small></small> lerosh

Hebrew: וְהָעֹ֤שֶׁר וְהַכָּבוֹד֙ מִלְּפָנֶ֔יךָ וְאַתָּה֙ מוֹשֵׁ֣ל בַּכֹּ֔ל וּבְיָדְךָ֖ כֹּ֣חַ וּגְבוּרָ֑ה וּבְיָ֣דְךָ֔ לְגַדֵּ֥ל וּלְחַזֵּ֖ק לַכֹּֽל׃
Translated: Riches and honor are Yours to dispense; You have dominion over all; with You are strength and might, and it is in Your power to make anyone great and strong.
Transliteration: vehaosher vehakhavvod milefaneykha veatah mvoshel vakhol uveyadekha khocha ugevurah uveyadekha legadel ulechazek lakhol

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ מוֹדִ֥ים אֲנַ֖חְנוּ לָ֑ךְ וּֽמְהַלְלִ֖ים לְשֵׁ֥ם תִּפְאַרְתֶּֽךָ׃
