Translated: Now, God, we praise You and extol Your glorious name.
Transliteration: veatah eloheynu mvodiym anachenu lakhe umehaleliym leshem tifearetekha

Hebrew: וְכִ֨י מִ֤י אֲנִי֙ וּמִ֣י עַמִּ֔י כִּי־נַעְצֹ֣ר כֹּ֔חַ לְהִתְנַדֵּ֖ב כָּזֹ֑את כִּי־מִמְּךָ֣ הַכֹּ֔ל וּמִיָּדְךָ֖ נָתַ֥נּוּ לָֽךְ׃
Translated: Who am I and who are my people, that we should have the means to make such a freewill offering; but all is from You, and it is Your gift that we have given to You.
Transliteration: vekhiy miy aniy umiy amiy khiy-naetsor khocha lehitenadev khazot khiy-mimekha hakhol umiyadekha natanu lakhe

Hebrew: כִּֽי־גֵרִ֨ים אֲנַ֧חְנוּ לְפָנֶ֛יךָ וְתוֹשָׁבִ֖ים כְּכׇל־אֲבֹתֵ֑ינוּ כַּצֵּ֧ל <small>׀</small> יָמֵ֛ינוּ עַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְאֵ֥ין מִקְוֶֽה׃
Translated: For we are sojourners with You, mere transients like our fathers; our days on earth are like a shadow, with nothing in prospect.
Transliteration: khiy-geriym anachenu lefaneykha vetvoshaviym khekhׇl-avoteynu khatsel <small></small> yameynu al-haarets veeyn mikeveh

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ כֹּ֣ל הֶהָמ֤וֹן הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֲכִינֹ֔נוּ לִבְנֽוֹת־לְךָ֥ בַ֖יִת לְשֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשֶׁ֑ךָ מִיָּדְךָ֥ (היא) [ה֖וּא] וּלְךָ֥ הַכֹּֽל׃
Translated: O L<small>ORD</small> our God, all this great mass that we have laid aside to build You a House for Your holy name is from You, and it is all Yours.
Transliteration: yehovah eloheynu khol hehamvon hazeh asher hakhiynonu livenvot-lekha vayiit leshem kׇdeshekha miyadekha (hy) [hu] ulekha hakhol

Hebrew: וְיָדַ֣עְתִּי אֱלֹהַ֔י כִּ֤י אַתָּה֙ בֹּחֵ֣ן לֵבָ֔ב וּמֵישָׁרִ֖ים תִּרְצֶ֑ה אֲנִ֗י בְּיֹ֤שֶׁר לְבָבִי֙ הִתְנַדַּ֣בְתִּי כׇל־אֵ֔לֶּה וְעַתָּ֗ה עַמְּךָ֙ הַנִּמְצְאוּ־פֹ֔ה רָאִ֥יתִי בְשִׂמְחָ֖ה לְהִֽתְנַדֶּב־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: I know, God, that You search the heart and desire uprightness; I, with upright heart, freely offered all these things; now Your people, who are present here—I saw them joyously making freewill offerings.
Transliteration: veyadaetiy elohay khiy atah vochen levav umeyshariym tiretseh aniy veyosher levaviy hitenadavetiy khׇl-eleh veatah amekha hanimetseu-foh raiytiy veshimechah lehitenadev-lakhe

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֗ה אֱ֠לֹהֵ֠י אַבְרָהָ֞ם יִצְחָ֤ק וְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֲבֹתֵ֔ינוּ שׇׁמְרָה־זֹּ֣את לְעוֹלָ֔ם לְיֵ֥צֶר מַחְשְׁב֖וֹת לְבַ֣ב עַמֶּ֑ךָ וְהָכֵ֥ן לְבָבָ֖ם אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: O L<small>ORD</small> God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our fathers, remember this to the eternal credit of the thoughts of Your people’s hearts, and make their hearts constant toward You.
Transliteration: yehovah elohey averaham yitsechak veyisherael avoteynu shׇmerah-zot levolam leeitser macheshevvot levav amekha vehakhen levavam eleykha

Hebrew: וְלִשְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בְנִ֗י תֵּ֚ן לֵבָ֣ב שָׁלֵ֔ם לִשְׁמוֹר֙ מִצְוֺתֶ֔יךָ עֵדְוֺתֶ֖יךָ וְחֻקֶּ֑יךָ וְלַעֲשׂ֣וֹת הַכֹּ֔ל וְלִבְנ֖וֹת הַבִּירָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־הֲכִינֽוֹתִי׃ {פ}
Translated: As to my son Solomon, give him a whole heart to observe Your commandments, Your admonitions, and Your laws, and to fulfill them all, and to build this temple for which I have made provision.”
Transliteration: velishelomoh veniy ten levav shalem lishemvor mitsevoteykha edevoteykha vechukeykha velaashvot hakhol velivenvot haviyrah asher-hakhiynvotiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִיד֙ לְכׇל־הַקָּהָ֔ל בָּ֥רְכוּ נָ֖א אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֑ם וַיְבָרְכ֣וּ כׇֽל־הַקָּהָ֗ל לַֽיהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י אֲבֹתֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּקְּד֧וּ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֛וּ לַיהֹוָ֖ה וְלַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: David said to the whole assemblage, “Now bless the L<small>ORD</small> your God.” All the assemblage blessed the L<small>ORD</small> God of their fathers, and bowed their heads low to the L<small>ORD</small> and the king.
Transliteration: vayomer daviyd lekhׇl-hakahal varekhu na et-yehovah eloheykhem vayevarekhu khׇl-hakahal layhovah elohey avoteyhem vayikedu vayishetachavu layhovah velamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּזְבְּח֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה <small>׀</small> זְ֠בָחִ֠ים וַיַּעֲל֨וּ עֹל֜וֹת לַיהֹוָ֗ה לְֽמׇחֳרַת֮ הַיּ֣וֹם הַהוּא֒ פָּרִ֨ים אֶ֜לֶף אֵלִ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף כְּבָשִׂ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֑ם וּזְבָחִ֥ים לָרֹ֖ב לְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: They offered sacrifices to the L<small>ORD</small> and made burnt offerings to the L<small>ORD</small> on the morrow of that day: 1,000 bulls, 1,000 rams, 1,000 lambs, with their libations; [they made] sacrifices in great number for all Israel,
Transliteration: vayizevechu layhovah <small></small> zevachiym vayaalu olvot layhovah lemׇchorat hayyvom hahu fariym elef eliym elef khevashiym elef venisekheyhem uzevachiym larov lekhׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּאכְל֨וּ וַיִּשְׁתּ֜וּ לִפְנֵ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא בְּשִׂמְחָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֑ה וַיַּמְלִ֤יכוּ שֵׁנִית֙ לִשְׁלֹמֹ֣ה בֶן־דָּוִ֔יד וַיִּמְשְׁח֧וּ לַיהֹוָ֛ה לְנָגִ֖יד וּלְצָד֥וֹק לְכֹהֵֽן׃
Translated: and they ate and drank in the presence of the L<small>ORD</small> on that day with great joy. They again proclaimed Solomon son of David king, and they anointed him as ruler before the L<small>ORD</small>, and Zadok as high priest.
Transliteration: vayokhelu vayishetu lifeney yehovah vayyvom hahu veshimechah gedvolah vayameliykhu sheniyt lishelomoh ven-daviyd vayimeshechu layhovah lenagiyd uletsadvok lekhohen

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב שְׁ֠לֹמֹ֠ה עַל־כִּסֵּ֨א יְהֹוָ֧ה <small>׀</small> לְמֶ֛לֶךְ תַּחַת־דָּוִ֥יד אָבִ֖יו וַיַּצְלַ֑ח וַיִּשְׁמְע֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Solomon successfully took over the throne of the L<small>ORD</small> as king instead of his father David, and all went well with him. All Israel accepted him;
Transliteration: vayeshev shelomoh al-khise yehovah <small></small> lemelekhe tachat-daviyd aviyv vayatselach vayishemeu elayv khׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַשָּׂרִים֙ וְהַגִּבֹּרִ֔ים וְגַ֕ם כׇּל־בְּנֵ֖י הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֑יד נָ֣תְנוּ יָ֔ד תַּ֖חַת שְׁלֹמֹ֥ה הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: all the officials and the warriors, and the sons of King David as well, gave their hand in support of King Solomon.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hashariym vehagivoriym vegam khׇl-veney hamelekhe daviyd natenu yad tachat shelomoh hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיְגַדֵּ֨ל יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־שְׁלֹמֹה֙ לְמַ֔עְלָה לְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּתֵּ֤ן עָלָיו֙ ה֣וֹד מַלְכ֔וּת אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹא־הָיָ֧ה עַל־כׇּל־מֶ֛לֶךְ לְפָנָ֖יו עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: The L<small>ORD</small> made Solomon exceedingly great in the eyes of all Israel, and endowed him with a regal majesty that no king of Israel before him ever had.
Transliteration: vayegadel yehovah et-shelomoh lemaelah leeyney khׇl-yisherael vayiten alayv hvod malekhut asher lo-hayah al-khׇl-melekhe lefanayv al-yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וְדָוִיד֙ בֶּן־יִשָׁ֔י מָלַ֖ךְ עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Thus David son of Jesse reigned over all Israel;
Transliteration: vedaviyd ven-yishay malakhe al-khׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: וְהַיָּמִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר מָלַךְ֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַרְבָּעִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה בְּחֶבְר֤וֹן מָלַךְ֙ שֶׁ֣בַע שָׁנִ֔ים וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֥͏ִם מָלַ֖ךְ שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וְשָׁלֽוֹשׁ׃
Translated: the length of his reign over Israel was forty years: he reigned seven years in Hebron and thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vehayamiym asher malakhe al-yisherael arevaiym shanah vechevervon malakhe sheva shaniym uviyrushala͏im malakhe sheloshiym veshalvosh

Hebrew: וַיָּ֙מׇת֙ בְּשֵׂיבָ֣ה טוֹבָ֔ה שְׂבַ֥ע יָמִ֖ים עֹ֣שֶׁר וְכָב֑וֹד וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ שְׁלֹמֹ֥ה בְנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: He died at a ripe old age, having enjoyed long life, riches and honor, and his son Solomon reigned in his stead.
Transliteration: vayamׇt vesheyvah tvovah sheva yamiym osher vekhavvod vayimelokhe shelomoh venvo tachetayv

Hebrew: וְדִבְרֵי֙ דָּוִ֣יד הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ הָרִאשֹׁנִ֖ים וְהָאַחֲרֹנִ֑ים הִנָּ֣ם כְּתוּבִ֗ים עַל־דִּבְרֵי֙ שְׁמוּאֵ֣ל הָרֹאֶ֔ה וְעַל־דִּבְרֵי֙ נָתָ֣ן הַנָּבִ֔יא וְעַל־דִּבְרֵ֖י גָּ֥ד הַחֹזֶֽה׃
Translated: The acts of King David, early and late, are recorded in the history of Samuel the seer, the history of Nathan the prophet, and the history of Gad the seer,
Transliteration: vediverey daviyd hamelekhe harishoniym vehaacharoniym hinam khetuviym al-diverey shemuel haroeh veal-diverey natan hanaviy veal-diverey gad hachozeh

Hebrew: עִ֥ם כׇּל־מַלְכוּת֖וֹ וּגְבוּרָת֑וֹ וְהָעִתִּ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָבְר֤וּ עָלָיו֙ וְעַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־מַמְלְכ֥וֹת הָאֲרָצֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: together with all the mighty deeds of his kingship and the events that befell him and Israel and all the kingdoms of the earth.
Transliteration: im khׇl-malekhutvo ugevuratvo vehaitiym asher averu alayv veal-yisherael veal khׇl-mamelekhvot haaratsvot {f}
